description:
Although The Lytton is undeniably a business hotel, the management has succeeded in bringing to it a definite warmth and ambience. 

Perhaps the atmosphere is due to its colourful history. The building was originally used as a nursing home during the Second World War before it was converted into a hotel by a Briton whose name the hotel still bears. 

Today, there are charming rooms of yellow and white, specialty restaurants, and a chic red and black bar.

WebWriteUp1:
Located on Sudder Street in the heart of Kolkata, Lytton Hotel is one the best mid-range hotels in the city. 

The rooms are all comfortably furnished with carpets, televisions and telephones. The Gaylord restaurant has retained its popularity over the decades and is an extremely attractive place to eat.

Although the hotel is rather large, with around 80 rooms, past guests have spoken of the cordiality of the staff and a feeling of being at home. The large rooms offer the usual amenities of city hotels but the wood panelled floors and bright rooms lend a homely feel that is surprising but very welcome. 

The stained glass panels in the corridors confirm that this hotel strives to be more than just another city hotel. Their oriental restaurant Dynasty is most inviting with its modern decor and Chinese and Thai dishes. The Sunset Bar is another attractive venue.
Metatype: Although The Lytton is undeniably a business hotel, the management has succeeded in bringing to it a definite warmth and ambience.
Descr: Lytton Hotel in Kolkata - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
An award winning moderate hotel close to the old city. The hotel has a long verandah which overlooks a green lawn and flowering trees. 

The 93 rooms at Hotel Aya Niwas are spotlessly clean, the restaurant serves delicious vegetarian food at very reasonable prices. There is a small shop which stocks interesting handicrafts and books. Arya Niwas also has an internet centre, a reading lounge, and an excellent laundry service.
advantage: Downtown yet very quiet. Main Shopping Area, Tourist Office, General Post Office all in walking access
roomfacility: EPABX, H/C Running Water, CTV in A.C. Room
otherfacility: Conference Facilities, Shopping Arcade, Reading Room, Lending Library

creditcards: AMEX, CAN, BOB, VISA, Master, Andhra
WebWriteUp1:
A perennial favourite of travelers, Arya Niwas has a special place in our hearts. Soon after the hotel opened with just a handful of rooms, our guests were the very first to inaugurate Arya Niwas. Over the years, we have seen the hotel grow from a mere 15 rooms to a much larger property, with 93 guest rooms today. The service remains personalized and the exceptional quality of the food is still as high as ever. This makes Arya Niwas a firm favourite, despite growing competition. 

Although the hotel houses 93 guest room, its fa�ade is low, like a colonial bungalow. A long verandah facing the lawn is an irresistible feature. The cafeteria has self service with food made fresh in an open kitchen. There is a small shop which stocks reasonably priced handicrafts and books. Arya Niwas also has an internet centre, a reading lounge, and an excellent laundry service.  

The central part of Arya Niwas is the old haveli. You will find Shekhawati style frescoes and gracious arches here. This room doubles up as a reading lounge and you will find a large collection of books here. 

The rooms are in the wings built around the central courtyard. There are several categories of rooms, of which we recommend the deluxe rooms, as these are the most spacious and well furnished. With the attention to detail and the emphasis on giving guests excellent value for money, Arya Niwas remains a favourite to date.
Metatype: An award winning moderate hotel close to the old city. The hotel has a long verandah which overlooks a green lawn and flowering trees.
Descr: Hotel Arya Niwas in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel arya niwas, jaipur, rajasthan, heritage, special places

Mandir Palace has recently been extensively renovated and is now a comfortable heritage hotel with modern rooms, a pleasant swimming pool, and a fabulous location close to the Old City of Jaisalmer.

Constructed of yellow sandstone, it has an imposing entrance, a fully carved Durbar Hall with coloured tiles, and a terrace Badal Mahal which has canopies where one can take the air. description:
Ajit Bhawan is a lovely resort set in fabulous gardens with a spectacular swimming pool. 

Winding stone paths lead to the attractive rooms, many in cottage style with private sit-outs. All 6 suites, 10 luxury tents and 58 stylish rooms are air-conditioned and imaginatively furnished, mixing Raj splendour with a contemporary twist. 

There is a garden restaurant and a lounge bar with a historic atmosphere, and a large collection of vintage cars, many of which are still in use.
roomfacility: Direct Dialing Phones
otherfacility: Swimming Pool, Shopping Arcade, Folk Dances everyday during season, Health Club

WebWriteUp1:
This is possibly the most creative place to stay in Rajasthan. Located in the vast grounds of the Ajit Bhawan palace building, the rooms are spread out in a very attractive garden, home to many birds. The rooms are mostly in stand alone cottages, or in small clusters 

The rooms are veritable museums and guests will enjoy discovering the many nooks and crannies as well as the collection of artifacts in the room. The colours and the overall d�cor are chic and contemporary in a rural Rajasthani style and the combination is truly remarkable. An amazing swimming pool, seemingly hewn out of a rock lies on a higher platform. 

The large garden is where most meals are served; with tables lit from underneath, and festive lamps strung from the trees that surround the area. There are live folk dancers, and the whole ambience has to be experienced to be believed. It is nothing short of magical. Breakfast is served in a circular restaurant just above the pool. 

The village style arrangement of the cottages is charming, and yet most modern amenities are available. This is definitely a resort with a difference!
Metatype: A lovely resort set in fabulous gardens with a spectacular swimming pool.
Descr: Ajit Bhawan in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A charming building right on the banks of the holy Pushkar lake. The former palace of the Maharaja of Kishangarh has green gardens and the verandahs of the upper floors overlook the lake, the temples and the ghats. 

The hotel's owner, Jagat Singh, is a great collector of antique furniture and all rooms have hand-picked features and fittings. Large armoires with cut glass handles, carved mirror frames, poster or canopy beds, and other smaller pieces of colonial or Rajasthani furniture are a delight.
advantage: Situated on the Banks of the Holy Lake at Pushkar
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attached Bath with Running Hot & Cold Water
otherfacility: Camel, Jeep and Horse Safari, Travel Desk, Garden Restaurant on the Lake Side
services: Room Service, Laundry, Doctor on Call, Car Rental
WebWriteUp1:
Pushkar is one of the holiest places of pilgrimage for Hindus. The lake here, around which the whole town revolves, is considered to ne extremely holy and a bath here is second only to one in the Ganges at Varanasi. Hundreds of small temples are built on the periphery of the lake. Well designed, wide stone steps lead down to the lake. These are called the `ghats'. Devotees come to worship at the temples and on the ghats early every morning and at sunset too. Prayers and chanted, hymns are sung, and devotional music is played at the temples.

Pushkar is also known for its annual "Camel Fair". Traditionally, when devotees would come on a pilgrimage at the time of the first full moon of the Hindu year, they would bring along their cattle, camels and brisk trade would take place. It is now one of the largest fairs of its kind and attracts thousands of people. This is a fantastic opportunity to see people in traditional, ceremonial attire, entire families having travelled considerable distance to attend the fair. The various animals are displayed in their finery and there are competitions and races too. 

Pushkar Palace is one of the oldest hotels in Pushkar and is located right on the banks of the lake. Until recently, the hotel had a fabulous sunset terrace with well tended palm trees and other mature trees. A zealous town council decreed that the garden was violating the public space and tore it down. Minus the terrace, the Pushkar Palace still has lovely views from the suites which are right next to the lake and from the upper floors of the main wing. A small garden is in the centre and this is a delightful place to sit and relax. 

The hotel's owner, Mr Jagat Singh is a great collector of antique furniture and all rooms have hand-picked features and fittings. Large armoires with cut glass handles, carved mirror frames, poster or canopy beds and other smaller pieces of colonial or Rajasthani furniture are a delight. 

Being a place of pilgrimage, only vegetarian food is served in Pushkar, and alcohol is not available.
Metatype: A charming building right on the banks of the holy Pushkar lake. The former palace of the Maharaja of Kishangarh has green gardens and the verandahs of the upper floors overlook the lake, the temples and the ghats.
Descr: Pushkar Palace in Pushkar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: pushkar palace, rajasthan, heritage hotel, camel fair, lake, special places

description:
Declared by many to be the finest house in Shimla, Chapslee was once the summer residence of the Raja of Kapurthala. Now it is the home of his grandson who has generously opened the doors of this historic house to guests. 

Chapslee only has 6 rooms and staying here feels much like being special invitee in a royal home.

This pretty, single storeyed, ivy covered bungalow is always suffused with sunlight that spills onto the blue Persian rugs, the elegant wooden staircase lined with hunting trophies and the vast collection of Victoriana.
advantage: A Grand manor House with Superb Views and Excellent Period Furniture
roomfacility: Beautifully appointed Suites with Priceless Artefacts, Rare Textiles, Taperstries & Persian Carpets
otherfacility: Library and Card room, Tennis court and Croquet lawn.
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
Each bedroom is decorated around a colour - cheery yellow, fresh pink and royal blue. Flowers climb the walls on delicate, yellowing wallpaper and decorate the duvets. Most of the beds are white painted, brass ones, and inkeeping with Raj-era norms most of the beds are singles, 2 being placed close to each other in double rooms. There are wildflowers in Peshwa vases, oil paintings in heavy gold frames and an owl lamp or two. The bric-a-brac has obviously been passed down the generations and is a large part of Chapslee's charm. 
 
There are some exquisite common areas at Chapslee. A sunny corner is decorated with potted plants and cane armchairs and is the more casual 'Morning Room'. There is also a library filled with wooden bookcases and reclining leather armchairs and even some period card tables. A long room with large windows furnished in creams and golds is the formal drawing room.
 
The dining area is a formal space as well. A crystal chandelier shines above the single table that gleams with age and polish. The meals served at Chapslee are based on recipes from royal kitchens and Anglo-Indian cuisine to complete the Raj-era experience that Chapslee provides. 
 
Given that Chapslee is a home stay, the hosts request details of personal information before confirming the reservation. It is advisable, therefore, to book well in advance.
Metatype: Declared by many to be the finest house in Shimla, Chapslee was once the summer residence of the Raja of Kapurthala. Now it is the home of his grandson who has generously opened the doors of this historic house to guests.
Descr: Chapslee House in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A long term favourite, Ideal Beach Resort is situated right on the beach, a few km north of Mamallapuram village. 

The resort is designed as a series of cottages, all with their own balcony and verandah. There is also a large swimming pool surrounded by water gardens and flowering shrubs. 

The Sri Lankan owner runs an excellent restaurant with sea food specialties.
cuisine: Multi-cuisine Restuarant, well-known for its Sri Lankan, Indian & Continental food and especially Sea-food
advantage: Located Right on the Beach of Mamallapuram

WebWriteUp1:
Ideal Beach Resort was set up by a retired prize winning tea planter and hotelier from Sri Lanka, Mr. Dharmalingam, nowadays enthusiastically supported by his son Mr. Bose Dharmalingam and his family.

The accommodation is in spacious and air-conditioned cottages, with private balconies or verandahs equipped with chairs or loungers. The rooms are large and are kept cool by the sea breeze. The colours of the beach are brought indoors with the use of deep blues, warm browns and summery whites. 

Gazebos and garden benches dot the large garden and flowers such as orchids, birds of paradise and red ixoras, are abundant. 

Naturally, the restaurant specialises in sea food straight from the nets of the local fishermen. The staff is happy to set up a table on the lawns so that you can sit in the shade of the trees with cool grass beneath your feet while you enjoy freshly caught crabs and lobsters. 

Ideal Beach Resort has its own orchid farm at Poonjeri Village, 3 km from the resort, where 30 different types of orchids are grown.
Metatype: A long term favourite, Ideal Beach Resort is situated right on the beach, a few km north of Mamallapuram village.

description:
A lovingly restored palace at the edge of town, originally built for Mysore's royal princesses, the old Chittaranjan Palace is now a lovely heritage hotel set in beautiful gardens. 

There are some fabulous suites in the main building, all with period furniture, and more moderate rooms in the garden annexe. 

There is also a well stocked library and guests can play chess or carrom in the main hall.
advantage: Graceful Old Palace Close to Down town Mysore. Run As an Example of Sustainable Low Impact Tourism
roomfacility: All Rooms with En-suite Facilities, Many Rooms with Sit-outs
otherfacility: Extensive Award Winning Gardens, Atmospheric Sitting Rooms & Verandahs, Croquet, In-door Games
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
A stately white manor, the Green Hotel was built at the turn of the century by the Maharaja of Mysore for his unmarried sisters. Now taken over by a charitable organization, the hotel has theme based rooms that are sweetly eccentric and furnished with antique dark wood cabinets, beds and rocking chairs. True to its name there is a large award winning ornamental garden encircling the hotel and potted plants dot its interiors. Green Hotel is warm, appealing and completely adorable.   

The rooms in the main house include the Bollywood rooms with mounted panels of old movie posters, the flower patterned Marigold room, and the Maharani suite with a large four poster bed. The bed covers are crisp and feature Indian prints. Books line the shelves in the rooms and the bathrooms are clean, modern and even feature a traditional Indian bucket in sparkling steel. While the best rooms are in the main house their popularity ensures that they are quite often unavailable.

The more modern rooms in the annexe are less imaginatively decorated but are still large and cool, with large beds covered in hand block printed quilts, with creamy walls, chintz covered sofas and leafy plants. There are also paintings of flowers and peacocks on the doors and cupboards.   

There is no air conditioning in the rooms (this is an environmentally friendly hotel after all) but the overhead fans circulate the breeze that comes in through the large windows. There is a charming blue floored library in the main building, with a cushioned window seat to curl up in, a dozen lounge chairs, and cane chairs in the garden.

Indian, Continental and Chinese food is served on candlelit tables in the outdoor garden. The hotel is a 20 minute drive from the city centre.
Metatype: A lovingly restored palace at the edge of town. Originally built for Mysore's royal princesses, the old Chittaranjan Palace is now a lovely heritage hotel set in beautiful gardens.
Descr: The Green Hotel in Mysore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: green hotel, mysore, heritage, Karnataka, special places, responsible travel

description:
A charming small hotel, Ideal River View Resort is located in a secluded spot along the banks of a river about 3 km from Thanjavur. 

The Ideal River View Resort has 20 air-conditioned rooms in two storeyed cottages and a swimming pool. The rooms are kept cool by the smooth stone floors. Chunky legged beds are comfortable and the chairs are often quaintly cane backed. All rooms have a small balcony overlooking the gardens and river beyond.
advantage: Located on a Riverbank
roomfacility: Rooms With Private Balconies offering Good Views of the Garden & River, Private Facilities
otherfacility: Taxis & Travel Agency, Money Changing, Safe Deposit
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Swimming pool
WebWriteUp1:
Ideal River View Resort is situated on the banks of the sacred Cauvery River, a short drive away from the hot and dusty temple city of Thanjavur 

The hotel is reached by a red mud road, past paddy fields with kingfishers and ponds with lilies. The staff is warm, and attentive, and you are quickly made to feel at home.

The resort consists of a small and tranquil group of two storey villas. Wide, cool white corridors lead past waterfalls and ponds with plump fish, to large airy rooms. A refreshing breeze comes in over the river, and there are hammocks under palm trees in which to relax.  

Dinner is often served on the deck looking over the waters of the Cauvery and is sometimes accompanied by live local music. The chefs are proficient in Indian, Continental and even Sri Lankan cuisine. 

Only a few kilometers away from the busy market town of Tanjore, Ideal River View Resort offers a relaxing hideaway in idyllic surroundings.
Metatype: A charming small hotel, located in a secluded spot along the banks of a river. 3 km from Thanjavur.
Descr: Ideal River View Resort in Thanjavur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ideal river view resort, hotel, thanjavur, tamil nadu, special places

description: Located on the outskirts of Mandawa and overlooking fields and sand dunes, the unique and atmospheric Desert Resort is a truly original and memorable place to stay. It resembles a purpose built village, with streets leading to the clusters of huts and thatched pavilions from which to enjoy the surroundings. The delightful "mud huts" are surprisingly cool and comfortable, with large modern bathrooms, and are brightly decorated with local textiles and craftwork. There is an azure blue swimming pool overlooking the rolling sand dunes of Mandawa. Elaborate buffet meals are served in the cool dining room which is decorated with shells.
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, T.V.
otherfacility: Swimming Pool, Tennis, Camel - Horse - Chariot - Jeep Ride, Folk Dances- Puppet Show
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Fax
WebWriteUp1:
A charming village of a cluster of mud huts, complete with all modern conveniences, the Desert Resort at Mandawa is a unique experience. Its location on sand dunes offers fantastic views of the surrounding desert. 

The entrance is grand - as if you are visiting a village preparing for a festival. High walls are hand plastered in mud and festive colours. Colourful flags fly in the brisk desert winds. The charming lounge resembles a village get-together place. The seating is created out of mud-plaster and is tucked away along the walls. Vivid coloured fabrics cover the cushions and mattresses.

The little `village' has streets, little hamlets and thatched pavilions. The huts are plastered with mud and decorated with traditional designs in lime paste. The huts are separated from each other by low walls created by heaped clay pots covered and held together by mud plaster. 

The interiors of the mud huts are extremely charming. The beds are covered in patchwork quilts from the neighbouring state of Gujarat. The niches in the mud walls hold attractive artefacts or simple oil lamps. Small mirrors studded on the walls create a magical effect. 

Towards the end of the property is an azure blue swimming pool, ideal for cooling down in the hot afternoons. Meals are served either in the indoor hall or in a vast open courtyard. The buffet spread is impressive and is accompanied by live music performers.
Metatype: Located on the outskirts of Mandawa and overlooking fields and sand dunes, the Desert Resort is a purpose built village. It has streets, little hamlets and thatched pavilions from which to enjoy the surroundings.
Descr: Desert Resort in Mandawa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: desert resort, mandawa, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village, havelis

description: The oldest, and still the most desirable, jungle lodge in Kaziranga, Wild Grass is located in a picturesque village close to the main entrance to the National Park. The 18 rooms in 2 tall blocks have plenty of charm, with cane chairs and wooden furniture. There is a large dining room, with an inviting terrace overlooking the gardens. Wild Grass has its own dedicated team of knowledgeable and enthusiastic naturalists who accompany all excursions into the National Park.
WebWriteUp1:
Wild Grass has the stamp of being the very first resort to be established in Kaziranga and till date, remains the most charming one. Its creator, Manju Barua, a big bear of a man is a true character with a vast repertoire of local knowledge. The naturalists at Wild Grass are decidedly the best and a true wildlife enthusiast is well advised to make this a base in Kaziranga. 

The resort is located on a large piece of land, shaded by old trees and flowering vines. The central building is vibrantly brick red coloured, and has a large dining area, which forms the main hub for gathering. There is a cozy sit-out here, a perfect spot for relaxing and post lunch or dinner tea/coffee. 

The rooms are located in two separate blocks of 9 each. Although the blocks are tall, they are well concealed under the trees. The rooms, although certainly not luxurious are charming. They all have hardwood floors, an armchair or two and comfortable beds. The bathrooms, which were possibly very modern when the resort was built, are adequate now. The management informs that they will be re-doing them soon.   

At Wild Grass the emphasis is very much on the environment and wildlife, and that is reflected in the high quality naturalists. The staff of Wild Grass all hail from Kaziranga, and the surrounding villages and this gives them an excellent combination of local knowledge and academic expertise.

Even within the compound, trees are well signposted with their botanical and common names for identification. Over two hundred species of birds have been recorded in the vicinity of the lodge. During our stay at Kaziranga, we regularly saw a pair of Scops Owl, Red Vented Bulbuls and many other birds. 

The kitchen staff at Wild Grass comes up with an amazing variety of food. In the few days that we stayed, we had Chinese, Continental, North Indian and Assamese food!
Metatype: The Wild Grass Resort is the oldest jungle lodge in Kaziranga. The architecture and landscaping of the property makes you feel a part of the forest even though you are in the villages surrounding the reserve.
Descr: Wild Grass Resort in Kaziranga - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: wild grass, kaziranga, assam, rhinos, elephant, safaris, tours

Descr: President Park in Aurangabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Located just off a busy street near the old walled city, Alsisar Haveli offers peace and serenity once you step through the arched gateway. Most of the aristocratic families, loyal to the royal house of Jaipur, maintained lavish town-houses in Jaipur. Alsisar Haveli is one such property. The current head of the family has restored the old haveli and added new, sympathetic features in a way that seamlessly blends the old with the new. There is a lovely swimming pool set in a large peaceful garden.
advantage: Close to the Pink City but with its Own Peaceful Gardens
roomfacility: All Rooms With Attached Bath, with Running Hot & Cold Water, Furnished in Rajasthani Fabrics and Frescoes
otherfacility: Jeep Safaris & Camel Rides
services: Laundry, Room Service, Safe Deposit, Doctor on Call, Car Rental, Swimming Pool
WebWriteUp1:
A large stone-paved terrace at the entrance welcomes guests. The facade of the building is interesting with delicately arched cupolas and balconies in the Rajasthani style. A family lounge gives way to an inner courtyard with a fragrant champa tree in bloom. There is an aviary here and the birdsong provides a pleasant background chorus. 

The main building of the Haveli is flanked by two wings. One wing has the swimming pool - screened by lattice work stone walls and presided over by fine pavilions. 

The other wing has the impressive Dining Hall with its high ceilings and frescoes, a few of which feature real gold leaf painting. This is now the restaurant, serving a choice of buffet or a-la-carte meals, and has a bar too.
 
The 36 rooms and suites are spread throughout the rambling building. Most are spacious and some have the use of private or shared terraces.
Metatype: Located just off a busy street near the old walled city, Alsisar Haveli offers peace and serenity once you step into the arched gateway.
Descr: Alsisar Haveli in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: alsisar haveli, jaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

WebWriteUp1:
A hotel of rare elegance and opulence, the Rambagh Palace in Jaipur was the residence of the Jaipur Royal family for almost two centuries. In its long history, Rambagh Palace has hosted just about every dignitary ever to visit India 

Set in vast lawns and superbly maintained gardens, the Rambagh offers both indoor and outdoor swimming pools. The Polo Bar is a historic place where many a royal entertaining moments took place. 

The 78 rooms and suites are immaculate. Curtains of yards of heavy handmade silks, exquisite four poster beds and marble bathrooms offer opulent luxury. 

The various restaurants, and the legendary Polo Bar, offer dining and drinking in great style and d�cor. The large airy verandah is an ideal venue for afternoon tea (with Champagne!).

This remarkable palace is justly known as "The Jewel in the Crown" of the Taj group of hotels.
Metatype: One of the most celebrated palace hotels. The Rambagh is a fabulous building with wide corridors with arches, courtyards and shaded verandahs overlooking the immaculate gardens.
Descr: Rambagh Palace  in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

WebWriteUp1:
Sprawling over acres of beautifully landscaped gardens, the Taj Holiday Village in north Goa resembles a picturesque Goan village in itself. 

The rooms are in colourful Goan style cottages with small entrance porches, and large verandahs or terraces overlooking the gardens. Recently renovated, the rooms are decorated in a rustic style, but still offer luxurious linens, marble bathrooms and flat screen televisions. 

There are many restaurants including the famed Caravela and Beach House and also a Thai specialty restaurant, the Banyan Tree. The large swimming pool is a palm grove and has an island bar which serves delicious cocktails. 

A wonderful spa in a separate, peaceful area offers the best of treatments. There is a gym and also tennis courts. With wide open lawns, carefully tended gardens, the adjacent beach and a delightful children's activity centre, this is an ideal resort for families.
Metatype: One of Goa's nicest hotels, the Taj Holiday Village has terracotta roofed cottages, scattered under palm trees amidst acres of landscaped gardens.

WebWriteUp1:
A very upmarket and discreet place set in lush gardens. There are comfortable, spacious air conditioned rooms with terrace, and private garden cottages. There is a delightful `Raj' style open restaurant - all white cane, blue and white linen, hanging plants and a good menu. The hotel has a swimming pool and a semi-private clean beach.

The Deluxe Cottages are large with lots of dark wood, long divans and dusky rose and cool green furnishings, with either a private garden or a verandah and folding doors that lead onto them. Subdued Indian art prints and sea shore motifs decorate the walls. Flowery curtains and kashmiri carpets complete the rooms. 

There is a small massage centre offering both Eastern and Western forms of massage therapy, and a pool bar. The Aquarium is an indoor restaurant that specialises in sea food, or you may prefer the more casual outdoor dining in The Verandah. 

The private beach may not always be safe for swimming (strong currents on the east coast of India frustrate swimmers for much of the year), but it will be deserted, so you can enjoy unrestricted views from under the thatched sun umbrellas.
Metatype: Red roofed cottages with greenery that climbs towards the very threshold are situated a short walk away from a private beach, a swimming pool and some very inviting lounge areas with white wickerwork chairs.

A delightful colonial hotel right in the centre of New Delhi. Set in tree lined gardens with swimming pool, the Imperial has an air of serenity and understated luxury. 

The high ceilinged rooms are furnished with classic pieces and the flooring is either wooden or marble. A fine collection of Raj era paintings and pencil drawings lines the corridors. 

In addition, The Imperial offers a choice of three excellent restaurants, and a large historic bar.

WebWriteUp1:
The exquisite Imperial hotel is among the `Four Maidens of the East' - four legendary hotels; the Strand in Rangoon, Raffles in Singapore and the Great Eastern & Oriental in Calcutta.

Walking through the historical pillared verandahs, dining rooms, tea lounges, the Royal Ballroom, and the cool and spacious gardens is a pleasure. These are the very places where many celebrated encounters between the British and Indian aristocracy took place. 

The stately row of Royal Palms leads to the deceptively simple fa�ade of the Imperial. Built in 1931 by Bromfield, an associate of Lutyen, the Hotel is built in Colonial style with touches of Art Deco. 

An impressive collection of art from the British Raj times adorns the walls of the many restaurants and corridors, making a stroll through the hotel a great treat. The various categories of rooms are all beautifully detailed with period furniture, sumptuous fabrics and possess a rare blend of luxury and modern conveniences.
Metatype: A delightful colonial hotel right in the centre of New Delhi. Set in tree lined gardens with swimming pool, the Imperial has an air of serenity and understated luxury.
Descr: The Imperial in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the imperial, hotel, delhi, golden triangle, india, tours, rajasthan

description:
The most romantic palace in the world. Set on an island in Lake Pichola, the dazzling white building can only be reached by boat from a jetty below the City Palace. 

The interiors are delightful with a lotus pond filled courtyard, flaming bougainvillea, and constant glimpses of the lake and the magnificent City Palace. 

An absolutely spectacular hotel, the Lake Palace Hotel is truly one of the worlds best hotels.
advantage: Located in the middle of a Lake

WebWriteUp1:
This white marble floating palace is what dreams are made of. Built initially as a summer retreat for the Udaipur royal family, the palace has been run as a hotel by the Taj group for more than 3 decades now. 

There are 83 rooms including Palace Rooms, Luxury Rooms and Suites. If you can afford to stay at the Lake Palace, then ideally choose one of the suites, in order to enjoy the ethereal beauty of the Palace. 

The lounges, restaurants, bars and the rooms are all opulently decorated with authentic furniture, gold-leafed frescoes, deep window seats with sumptuous cushions, swings, small marble fountains, and much more. The pool is set in a separate wing which offers a sense of peace, and has fabulous views over the City Palace complex. 

If the monsoons have been kind and the water levels in the lake are high enough, a cruise on Lake Pichola on one of the hotel's historic boats is highly recommended.
Metatype: The most romantic palace in the world. Set on an island in Lake Pichola, the dazzling white building can only be reached by boat from a jetty below the City Palace.

WebWriteUp1:
Most of the cottages have a cool, stone floor and large beds with covered in indian printed sheets. 

The inside of the cottages are decorated with the white clay and mirror work that is integral to the houses of the Rabari sheep and goat herders that live in the area. The furniture is sturdy and intricately carved, polished wood in the Rajasthani style. The all white bathrooms are modern with hot and cold showers. 

Each cottage also has a sit out area and lounge chairs from where one can enjoy the shifting colours of the evening sky. 

The reservoir, the only source of water for many kilometers in this desertlike landscape of Kutch, attracts not only birdlife but also small fresh water crocodiles which can be seen when they come out onto the banks to warm their reptilian bodies.
Metatype: A short drive outside of Bhuj, the Garha Safari Lodge offers a peaceful respite from the bustle of the city.
Descr: The Kutch Safari Lodge in Bhuj - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Welcome to the true Kutch experience - at this simple ethnic resort run by Dhanraj Malik - descendant of an erstwhile local ruler. 

The experience of sleeping under thatch roofs and on local "charpoi" beds along with the visits to different tribes of the region will give you real insights into the daily life of the locals.

Dhanraj's knowledge of the 5000 square kilometers of the Rann of Kutch wildlife sanctuary and its unique fauna is unparalleled.
advantage: On the outskirts of Runn of Kutchh, near a Lake
roomfacility: All Rooms in Environment Friendly Koobas (Traditional Mud-huts), All With Attached Bath, H/C Running Water
otherfacility: Exciting Safaris in the Runn to watch the Asiatic Wild-Ass, Birdlife
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
The somewhat basic rooms are nevertheless imaginatively and authentically designed. The mud huts or bhungas are built by locals and decorated simply, with mirrors and by pressing dry leaves into the mud. The koobas are the more modern tiled cottages whose walls are painted cheerful yellow and pink and bright pieces of local embroidery hang under the eaves. The bathrooms have western toilets and hot and cold showers. 

Local food specialties are served on low tables surrounded by comfortable mud sofas with the same mirror and leaf patterns. 

But most of the life at Desert Coursers is lived outdoors, on jeep safaris following the Indian Wild Ass (found only here), and flamingoes in the wintertime as they seek warmer weather for breeding. Dhanraj's wildlife expertise is well known and has been solicited by the likes of the BBC and the National Geographic Society. 

Keeping up the tradition of their royal ancestors, the Malik family is also actively involved in providing the Kutch people with basic education, water and medical facilities.
Metatype: A simple ethnic resort run by Dhanraj Malik - descendant of an erstwhile local ruler. Dhanraj's knowledge of the 5000 square kilometers of the Rann of Kutch wildlife sanctuary and its unique fauna is unparalleled.
Descr: Desert Coursers in Dasada - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: desert  coursers, dasada, gujarat, wild ass, birds, flamingos, rann of kutch

description:
Castle Mandawa is literally a castle in the centre of Mandawa, made up of a maze of terraces and courtyards, narrow staircases and other intriguing elements. 

Sword-bearing guards welcome you at the gate; inside, the walls display 16th-century portraits of the Mandawa family. The seventy odd rooms have period furniture, murals and alcoved sitting areas and the fabrics are in bold colours. The dinners in the central courtyards or garden are dramatic with dancers with lit torches.
advantage: Centre of Town
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone
otherfacility: Business Centre, Camel Ride, Horse Ride, Jeep Safari
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Fax
WebWriteUp1:
The Castle Mandawa, home to one of the major ruling families of this region, has been converted into an impressive hotel. The first impression is grand - with the castle's magnificent facade decorated with pillars, arches and carved windows. There is an entrance courtyard, large enough for camels and elephants carrying royal guests. 

The reception and bar are in the front verandah, bathed in a delicate glow from the bright coloured chic blinds. Well padded cane chairs around marble tables make a good vantage point to watch the activity. Inside is a handsome, high ceilinged family drawing room with an impressive collection of armour and portraits of family members. Do not miss the frescoes and other Raj memorabilia.

The castle with its outlying wings offers many rooms. There are some in the main castle building while others are in the new wings which blend harmoniously with the old structure. All rooms are spacious and have excellent en-suite facilities with grand old style furniture. The fabrics used are of good quality cotton with hand-block print from Rajasthan. Most rooms have a cosy seating area and also access to a verandah.

Castle Mandawa has a lovely swimming pool and also offers spa facilities, a pool and billiards table, and a table tennis table. 

Breakfast and lunch is generally served in the indoor dining room which is decorated with richly painted frescoes. The grand dinners are served in the large gardens, and are preceeded by a dancer carrying lit torches, followed by a procession of musicians carrying gongs, pipes and stringed instruments.
Metatype: A castle in the centre of Mandawa, made up of a maze of terraces and courtyards, narrow staircases and other intriguing elements.
Descr: Castle Mandawa in Mandawa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: castle mandawa, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village, havelis, frescoes

description: A fairytale palace nestled picturesquely amid rugged hills, this superb 19th century palace has public areas of immense beauty such as the Sultan Mahal, the Sheesh Mahal and, grandest of all, the Durbar Hall, acknowledged to have the finest examples of Shekhavati style frescoes. The exclusive rooms have an old world charm replete with antique furniture, and fabulous modern bathrooms. There are two delightful swimming pools, and several atmospheric dining areas.
advantage: Offers a unique experience of traditional Royal Rajasthan
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone with STD/ISD, Fax, T.V., Mini Bar
otherfacility: Parking, Lawns Garden, Restaurant, Bar, Cultural Programme
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
A small road branches off the national highway 30 km from Jaipur, and passes through farmland en-route to Samode. The final stretch leads through the cobbled stone streets of the Samode village to an enormous arched gateway. Then you come face to face with the Palace. 

The first sight of the palace is spectacular. Climbing the impressive flight of steps gives you enough time to admire the building. An amazing number of windows and carved friezes face you. From inside another pair of gates, the inner courtyards unfold. 

Samode Palace consists of a succession of courtyards, each with a different mood. Note the flowering creepers, flaming bougainvillea, stately palms, brass pots holding smaller palms, and large marble tubs decorated with floating petals. The overall impression is of contained luxury and sophistication. 

The rooms at Samode Palace are in wings accessed via the various courtyards. They are all decorated in a style that can be described as Royal Rajput meets western sophistication. Paisley prints, re-interpreted motifs in smooth cottons, tasteful durries on the floors, colourful bed covers and curtains, and extremely comfortable mattresses. The spacious bathrooms are some of the best in India with premium quality fixtures and fittings, and even have separate shower cubicles.

The suites, and in particular the Royal suites, are extraordinarily beautiful. The Royal Suites have private terraces overlooking the hillside and an oudoor Jacuzzi to enjoy the views. If there is one place where you should splurge, this is it. 

There are also public areas of immense beauty such as the Sultan Mahal, the Sheesh Mahal and the grandest one of them all, the Durbar Hall, acknowledged to have the finest examples of Shekhavati style frescoes.  The Durbar Hall is literally painted all the way to its lofty ceilings. High fanlights let in natural light giving the room a glow that is unparalleled. 

The artistically designed pool is to one side, as is an air-conditioned restaurant. Food can be served in the main dining hall, around the pool deck, or in the central courtyard.  Romantic dinners can be arranged at many of the secluded locations and terraces.

In keeping with the beautiful natural surroundings, recreational and leisure facilities include a health complex by the pool comprising a fully equipped fitness centre, sauna, steam and changing rooms. The emphasis has been placed on creating a quiet and relaxed atmosphere. There is also a Kerala Ayurvedic Centre (famous world over for the herbal oil massages). 

A note of caution would be that if you have mobility problems or are disabled, then this palace is probably not for you as there are no lifts and no wheelchair ramps due to the historical nature of the building.
Metatype: A fairytale palace nestled picturesquely amid rugged hills. This superb restored eighteenth-century palace was the location for the movie, `The Far Pavilions'.
Descr: Samode Palace in Samode - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: samode palace, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Coconut Lagoon is a delightful top end resort, adjacent to the Vembanad Lake bird sanctuary. The resort can only be reached by a short boat ride. 

The air-conditioned cottages incorporate elements of traditional wooden houses and have an outdoor bathroom in a private courtyard. The resort has a large swimming pool and it also offers village expeditions, bird watching and backwater cruises.
accessbus: 14 kms. from Kottayam, Accessbile only by boat
advantage: On the Banks of Lake Vembanad
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V.
otherfacility: Shopping Arcade, Health Club, Swimming Pool, Water Sports, Ayurveda Treatment Centre, Country Canol Expeditions, Bird Watching, Fishing Expedition, Sunset Cruise, Cultural Programme, Village Expeditions
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
Coconut Lagoon was one of the first places which employed the idea of transporting entire wooden tharavads (cottages) by dismantling them and re-constructing them in a different location. This trend has turned out to be the saviour of many old houses which would otherwise have been condemned to the scrapyard to make way for modern concrete houses. 

The charm of the resort is obvious immediately on arrival by boat, pulling up right in front of the reception. The reception itself is a small wooden pavilion with a small open courtyard in the centre. The resort spreads over a large area, surrounded by all sides by water - lake Vembanad on one side, and canals feeding it on the others. Small canals also  run through the property and are crossed by pretty bridges. 

The guest rooms are all in cottages, either individual or in clusters. Each one has a different charm but all have common features such as wooden walls, terracotta flooring, antique furniture, and modern open-to-the sky bathrooms. Each room has a sit-out to enjoy the peaceful, verdant surroundings.  

The meals are served buffet-style and are sumptuous. Most dishes are prepared with organic produce and there are always several authentic Kerala delicacies to sample. 

The commitment of the hotel group which owns the property (CGH Earth) to the environment is deep and is obvious in many aspects of their resorts, especially at the Coconut Lagoon.
Metatype: A delightful top end resort, adjacent to the Vembanad Lake bird sanctuary. The resort can only be reached by a short boat ride.
Descr: Coconut Lagoon in Kumarakom - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: coconut lagoon,heritage, hotel, kumarakom, kerala, vembanad lake

description: A delightful 17th century haveli right on the banks of Lake Pichola, Jagat Niwas Palace Hotel is reached through a narrow alley in the heart of the Old City. The whitewashed walls and plants create an atmosphere of pure relaxation and tranquility in this otherwise busy area. The hotel has 30 rooms which differ in size and decor, but are all attractively furnished with local fabrics and antique furniture. Most do not have lake views, but the many terraces and the restaurant with its scalloped arches all have excellent views of Lake Pichola and the famous Lake Palace.

WebWriteUp1:
A delightful 17th century haveli right on the banks of the Lake Pichola, The Jagat Niwas Palace Hotel has to be entered via a narrow alley off the city's bazaar. If you want to be close to Lake Pichola, but cannot afford the Lake Palace, Jagat Niwas is ideal.

A small winding street leads through the old city to Jagat Niwas Palace. A small reception area opens onto a larger lounge with many interesting artefacts. A small open to sky courtyard then has open staircases that lead to the upper floors, the rooms and the terrace restaurant.

The rooms are not large, but are charmingly decorated with local fabrics and antique furniture. They feature attached bathrooms that are well designed and modern. All rooms have delightful features such as niches with silk cushions and mattresses from which to enjoy the views. 

Jagat Niwas is a blinding white washed haveli complete with arched windows, many overlooking the lake, and a profusion of potted plants. The roof top restaurant with its scalloped arches serves excellent meals, and is popular with non-residents also for the superb views of the lake and of the city palace.
Metatype: A delightful 17th century haveli right on the banks of the Lake Pichola, entered via a narrow alley off the city's bazaar.
Descr: Jagat Niwas Palace Hotel in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: jagat niwas palace, udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake, special places

WebWriteUp1:
Hotel Dynasty is located  in the centre of town. The pastry shop is the first thing you see! There is a coffee shop with buffet meals on the ground floor, a much more upmarket restaurant on the 1st floor with distinctive low seating, plus a dark bar and surprisingly well equipped gym and spa in a separate wing. There are 80 rooms. The base category "Excellency" rooms have been recently refurbished and are indeed excellent. The more expensive suites are older, dark, and not nearly as nice. It is very professionally run.

The location of Dynasty in the busy part of the local market makes it interesting. You can step out and be right in the thick of things. Shops selling everything under the sun, roadside hawkers selling fresh fruit, flowers and just about everything required in an Indian household. Bang opposite the Dynasty is the large Minaret of a mosque, an impressive sight.
Metatype: A comfortable 4 star hotel, right in the heart of the market area. The Dynasty's classy foyer and wonderful restaurants seem discordantly civilized amid the melee of Fancy Bazaar.

description:
An elegant, old-fashioned 1930s mansion on the peaceful western side of Shimla, with huge rooms, period furniture, lawns and a badminton court.

The Woodville Palace is full of character with beautiful wood paneled walls, sweeping staircases, and portraits of Maharajas, weapons and hunting trophies. The gardens are also very pleasant. 

It is a fairly flat 20 minutes walk to the Mall, which is the heart of Shimla - watch out for monkeys on the way!
advantage: In between C.M. House and Raj Bhawan
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Tea/Coffee maker
otherfacility: Executive Lounge, Billiards, Table Tennis, Badminton and Specious Lawns
WebWriteUp1:
Having been a host to everyone from a viceroy or two during the British Raj, Hollywood stars of the 1930's and Bollywood actors of more recent times, the Woodville Palace is the place to stay for the discerning visitor to Shimla. 

The rooms tend to be of the gleaming, dark wood furniture and chintzy curtains variety. They are very generously sized, with large, king sized beds, rich upholstery on period chairs and reddish brown wood floors. 

Some rooms are housed in yellow cottages separate from the main building. Although younger in age, the rooms here continue with the English country cottage theme - peach and pistachio green walls, and metal canopy beds. The overall effect is regal, yet still very warm and inviting.

There are a number of common areas and restaurants to choose from. The Tiger Lounge is really a stylish boys' den. Tiger trophies from various erstwhile princely states adorn the walls. The glassed multi-cuisine restaurant has been designed to take full advantage of the views over the bamboos and tall deodar trees that surround it. The more formal dining room area, the Imperial Banquet Room, is presided over by a buffalo head trophy and serves special Himachali cuisine on request.  

The atmospheric Hollywood Bar has black and white chequered floors and rows of autographed monochromatic photographs of Hollywood stars.

Situated at one end of the long, traffic free, Mall road, there are pleasant walks along tree shaded paths to the market areas with their local and international shops.
Metatype: An elegant, old-fashioned 1930s mansion on the peaceful western side of Shimla, with huge rooms, period furniture, lawns and a badminton court.
Descr: Woodville Palace in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: woodville palace, shimla, heritage, hotel, himachal pradesh, special places

description:
A handsome stone building with picturesque dormer windows, Banon Resorts spreads over 2 acres of land close to the busy town centre of Manali. 

The hotel is named after the owner's forefather an Irish Captain Banon who is said to have planted the first apple orchard here. 

An upmarket hotel, it features large  rooms, many of which have balconies from which one can admire the hilly surroundings of Manali. 
There are lawns on all sides dotted with flowers, a hip indoor pub and an outdoor restaurant.
advantage: 10 minutes walk from main town

WebWriteUp1:
Wide carpeted stairs lead up from the broad lobby and common area to the substantial rooms clad in forest colours of wood brown and green are located on different floors. 

The rooms have large windows and an outdoors sit out overlooking the quiet road that leads towards the two main temples of Manali. The bathrooms have been recently renovated and are modern. Aside from the balcony there are also comfortable sofas to lounge in in the rooms. Wooden floors add some Manali charm to the rooms. 

The rooms are centrally heated required especially during the winters when temperatures can drop to below zero here. There are some nice lawns to relax in after a busy day taking in Manali's sights and it's many culinary offerings.  

You'll notice that the rooms are actually in the newer buildings. The older, past and current home of the Banons is a pretty wooden balconied structure attached to the more recent construction.

Eat indoors in their formal dining area or in the outdoor section (in summers!). The bar is an interesting mix of the old fashioned - dark wooden floors and the modern - all smooth leather chairs and mirrors. Manali has a variety of drinks and fruit cocktails to offer so make sure you dont miss out.
Metatype: A handsome stone building with picturesque dormer windows, Banon Resorts spreads over 2 acres of land close to the busy town centre of Manali.
Descr: Banon Resorts in Manali - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: A royal style tented resort, Samode Bagh is set in a wonderful orchard-like garden. The spacious air conditioned tents are furnished in the Raj Shikar style with attached marble bathrooms. There are dhurries on the floors and bright textiles make up the inner panelling of the tent walls. Each tent has easy chairs outside, from where you can enjoy the beautiful gardens and the bird-life. A long line of fountains in the formal Mughal style lead to the swimming pool.
advantage: Located in Large Mughal Style Gardens with Fountains
roomfacility: Luxuriously Furnished Tents with Carpets and Excellent Furniture. Attached Bath Facilities, Running Hot & Cold Water. Private Sit-outs
otherfacility: Croquet & Tennis Courts, Rambling Gardens With Flowering Trees
services: Swimming Pool, Elegantly Furnished Durbar Tent for Dining in
WebWriteUp1:
A stylish garden retreat complete with air-conditioned deluxe tents, Samode Bagh is the sister hotel of the famous Samode Palace, 3 km away. 

The facade of the entrance building is enchanting with canopied balconies and pavilions. The arched entrance leads to a long, formal channel of fountains fed by natural springs. The fountains fill the air with the soothing sound of cascading water. As a matter of fact, the effect of the symmetry and formally laid out gardens is reminiscent of Mughal gardens. 

The en-suite tents are pitched on the sprawling lawns in a large semi-circle. They are air-conditioned, so remain comfortable even during the hottest days. Colourful fabrics, with artistic shapes of arches and windows, line the tents and Rajasthani durries cover the floors. The beds, side tables and lamps are all traditional with a contemporary touch. The en-suite bathrooms have marble floors and shower areas, with premium quality fittings. Each tent has easy chairs outside from where you can enjoy the beautiful gardens and the bird-life.

Lawns cover the entire compound area and the many fruit and flower trees are home to several birds. For dining, there is a large decorated tent, which can seat up to a few hundred people. The buffet dinners are served here, accompanied by live music. It is also possible to have a quiet dinner for two either on the terrace or at the poolside with prior notice. 

The retreat also has a swimming pool and tennis court. It is worthwhile to visit the nearby Samode palace, which has several frescoes - original and also newly painted - throughout its public areas. The Durbar Hall here is of special note, with its wall to ceiling frescoes and mirror work. Even if you are staying at Samode Bagh, do have at least one dinner at the Palace.
WebWriteUp2:
Samode Palace

Samode is located among a hill range and even a small trek in the outlying countryside will reward you with panoramic views. You can also see the old and now crumbling stone wall, which may have been the outer fortifications of Samode Palace.
Metatype: A tented resort in royal style, set in a wonderful orchard-like garden. The spacious tents are furnished in the Raj Shikar style with attached marble bathrooms.
Descr: Samode Bagh in Samode - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: samode bagh, rajasthan, luxury tents, palace, special places

description: Staying at Bhanwar Vilas Palace feels like stepping back in time. The large impressive early 20th century building has wide cool verandahs, a drawing room with authentic period furniture and great ambience. The rooms are large, many are elaborately furnished, and all have an authentic historic feel. The dining room has a long family dining table where His Highness, Krishna Chandra Pal, often joins guests when he is in residence. The extensive hotel grounds also boast an old fashioned swimming pool -sadly only rarely in use these days - a collection of vintage cars, a stable for Marwari horses, a cattle farm, an orchard, and an organic vegetable garden.
advantage: Chance to stay with the Royal Family,
roomfacility: All rooms Tastefully Furnished in Traditional Style

WebWriteUp1:
Almost two decades ago, one of our trips brought us to Karauli, a small town, quite off-the-beaten track, midway between Bharatpur and Ranthambhore. The first sight of the Bhanwar Vilas Palace, a low pleasant building in Art Deco style, convinced us that we had found a gem. Later we were astounded to see the nearby City Palace, a stunning place which is still the private property of the royal family. Complete with painted durbar hall, a myriad of terraces, balconies, pavilions and grand rooms, the City Palace is an absolute treasure trove of architecture. 

Under the British rule, Karauli was a state worthy of a 17 gun salute! As a result, there were many occasions of state visits and hunting parties. The formal drawing room of the Palace is full of family memorabilia from that era. 

The meals are served in the family dining area - the kitchen is just behind and is the same one which caters to the Royal family. His Highness, Krishna Chandra Pal is often in residence, and guests may well find him seated next to them at dinner-time. 

When we first visited the Bhanwar Vilas Palace in the late 1980s, there were just 4 bedrooms in the main building, all large and gracious with a lot of old word charm. Over the years, the Maharaja has converted more rooms in the secondary wings of the main palace and some of the outbuildings. These new rooms are bright and cheerful, with carved wooden furniture and colourful local fabrics. All the rooms have neat sit outs in the common verandahs.
Metatype: Be a guest in a royal but homely atmosphere. The Bhanwar Vilas Palace is a pleasant building with wide cool verandahs, a drawing room with authentic period furniture and great ambience.
Descr: Bhanwar Vilas Palace in Karauli - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bhanwar vilas palace, karauli, rajasthan, heritage hotel, luxury, special places

Great little family-run hotel in the suburbs of Bikaner. The owners Mr. and Mrs. Vikram Singh are very helpful and accomodating. Be sure to try one of the owner's home- cooked Rajasthani meals. 

The family lives on the ground floor and the guest rooms are on the second floor. The rooms are immaculate with cable TV and A/C. The atmosphere is more likely a homestay than a hotel.

There's a wonderful view of the Lallgarh Palace a few hundred meters away. You can also eat a meal at the palace, which has been converted into a high-end heriotage hotel.

description:
Mahendra Prakash is a haveli-style hotel, in a quiet location on a shaded avenue near the Rose Garden, with the main city sights still in close proximity. It is a wonderful oasis in the busy city of Udaipur.

The rooms are tastefully furnished in traditional style. After a long day of sightseeing you can relax by the pool in the garden with a few tortoises for company. There is a good restaurant by the pool too.
WebWriteUp1:
This is a favourite of many budget conscious guests. This newly built haveli has many attractive features typical of older havelis, along with modern touches such as bright courtyards, a swimming pool, and modern bathrooms. 

The sprawling building has interesting features such as scalloped arches, coloured glass windows and beautifully laid out marble floors. The common areas include the poolside lawns and deck, a dining room which serves fresh cooked snacks and meals and a few shaded courtyards. 

The rooms are all spacious, some with their own private balcony, and others with access to shared verandahs with comfortable lounge chairs. The furniture is all Rajasthani style and the fabrics used are colourful, locally sourced soft cottons. 

There is an air of relaxed peace inside, while the bustle of the old city is just outside.
WebWriteUp2:
The City Palace Complex
Udaipur was built by the Mewar ruler Udai Singh to replace his old capital of Chittaurgarh after it was conquered by the Mughals in 1568. The royal family still occupies a section of the immense City Palace complex which also houses a Museum and the Shiv Niwas and Fateh Prakash hotels. From here you have fabulous views over Lake Pichola and the famous Lake Palace Hotel on Jag Niwas Island.

The Bazaar
The Udaipur area is famous for its miniature paintings and during a walk through the bazaar, you will see many artists' studios and shops. Udaipur was also an important centre for other arts like pottery, sculpture etc. The Shilpagram is an arts and crafts complex a short drive away from the town and well worth a visit. 

Sunset Boat-trip on Lake Pichola
A sunset trip on the Lake, is a beautiful way of admiring the multitude of its white palaces. The lakeside is always full of life; with evening prayers going on in the many temples, people washing doing their laundry, vehicles crossing the narrow bridges - there is not a minute of boredom. With the sunset, the lake changes colours rapidly, going from a deep blue to red-gold. As darkness descends, a million lights go up around the lake, turning it into another chimera. The entire city palace complex is floodlit, turning it into deep golden colour. 

Saheliyon Ki Baari (Gardens of the maids of honour) 
This is a beautifully laid garden complex. The gardens have rows of fountains, lush lawns, delicate pavilions carved in marble and lotus pools.
Metatype: Mahendra Prakash is a haveli-style hotel, in a quiet location on a shaded avenue near the Rose Garden, with the main city sights still in close proximity.
Descr: Mahendra Prakash in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mahendra prakash, udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake, special places

description:
One of Rajasthan's most spectacular palaces, Deogarh Mahal is a fabulous building of yellow ochre with ornate domes and white accents. 

The rooms are spread across the palace on different levels. Many rooms have original furniture and some have exquisite frescoes and murals with mirrors. Beautiful handpicked fabrics enhance a feeling of quiet elegance. There is a well designed swimming pool in its own secluded area.
cuisine: Indian, with an emphasis on Rajasthani, ingredients organicallly grown in the family's farms
advantage: Palace with many Terraces and Court-yards, offering Splendid Views of the Country-side
roomfacility: All Rooms Traditionally Decorated, all with Attached baths, Running Hot & Cold water
otherfacility: Jeep Safari, Ride on a Rural Train, Special Theme Dinners/Picnics and High Teas can be arranged with prior notice
services: Swimming Pool & Spa,
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms come in all shapes and sizes but all have great style. The furniture is colonial and Rajasthani whilst the fabrics are a combination of traditional local and modern Indian, in exuberant colours and design.  Most rooms have some seating area, often in traditional Indian lounging style, from which to enjoy the unique interiors. Bathrooms too come in a variety of styles, having been added to the centuries old buildings without disturbing the original facade.

There is a large restaurant, a coffee and wine bar and many terraces on various levels which have extensive views of the surrounding countryside.There is a beautifully designed swimming pool in a secluded area. Ayurvedic massages are also offered here. The hotel organises interesting jeep safaris into the surrounding countryside.

The Deogarh miniature painting school is famous for its delicate rendering of various subjects. The late royal head of the family, Rao Nahar Singh, was in fact the greatest authority on miniature painting in Rajasthan, having co-authored a scholarly coffee table book.
Metatype: One of Rajasthan's most spectacular palaces, Deogarh Mahal is a fabulous building of yellow ochre with ornate domes and white accents.
Descr: Deogarh Mahal in Deogarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: deogarh mahal, rajasthan, heritage hotel, jeep safari, birds, special places

That apart, the hotel also offers several inviting places to relax with a book, such as the courtyard lawn bordered by flaming bougainvillea, or the wide verandah draped by fine muslin curtains to keep out the bright mid-day sun.

WebWriteUp1:
The first time we visited Rawla Narlai was in the late 1980s when the late Maharaj Swaroop Singh of Ajit Bhawan took us there for a private visit. Back then, the lodge was in a sadly neglected state, but one could see the potential. Over the next few years, Swaroop Singh restored the lodge into an exceptionally enjoyable hideaway. 

The work he started was continued after his death by his two dynamic and talented sons. Touches of modern chic were introduced by the young head of the family, Raghuveer Singh Rathore. He is a designer, celebrated for his use of a mix of Indian and Western styles. 

A courtyard welcomes you with blooming bougainvillea climbing along white washed walls. The garden within the fortress-like walls has green lawns, day-beds draped in white muslin and small statues hidden here and there. The building is renovated in such a sympathetic manner that it is hard to know what is new and what is old. The building and its verandah looks straight out at a gigantic 350 feet granite boulder.

The small number of rooms and suites are all delightfully different from each other. All are decorated in traditional Rajasthani stayle. Most rooms have private sit-outs or access to an outdoor terrace or balcony. Some of the older rooms with fading frescoes have been left untouched, giving guests a chance to live literally amidst history. Apart from the 21 rooms and 4 suites, there are also 5 luxury tents, pitched on an adjoining lawn bordering an attractive swimming pool. These deluxe tents with Western-style toilets are also a pleasant option and offer great value.

There are several inviting places to tempt you to relax, such as the courtyard lawn bordered by flaming bougainvillea, or the wide verandah draped by fine muslin curtains to soften the mid day sun 

The Rawla Narlai offers cocktails in the idyllic garden as well as delectable rooftop dinner. They also organise romantic candlelit dinners in an ancient step-well nearby.
Metatype: This former hunting lodge is now a charming heritage hotel. The small number of rooms and suites are all delightfully different from each other. All have local Rajasthani furniture and light cottons.
Descr: Rawla Narlai in Narlai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rawla narlai, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village, special places

description:
Located in lush green gardens, the summer palace of the Maharaja of Wankaner is a true Art Deco bungalow.

Royal Oasis has just a handful of spacious rooms. All rooms are elegantly appointed and have most of their original furniture intact, with some extravagant pieces. 

There is also an indoor swimming pool and a beautiful step-well.
advantage: Set in Peaceful Gardens
roomfacility: All Rooms have Original Art Deco Furniture, All With Sumptuous En-Suite facilities.
otherfacility: Magnificent Private Step-well, Moghul Gardens, Collection of Vintage & Classic Cars, Stables of Horses
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call, In-door Art Deco Swimming Pool
WebWriteUp1:
The Royal Oasis in Wankaner was so named because it was intended as a summer retreat for the royal family. With this aim it was built close to the Machchu River so that cool winds would blow over it, and this is the reason why it also features a 3 storey step well complete with sculptures and carvings of both Indian and Greco-Roman gods. The faded yellow and white of this 19th century building is enlivened by the Art Deco colours and designs that decorate its interiors. 

The grounds of the Royal Oasis are large with shade giving trees and slightly unkempt lawns. The main building sits in the centre of these with a colonial style arched gateway with a garden of marble benches and statues to match. 

The rooms have dark wood floors and light pastel coloured walls, with the beds and furniture belonging firmly to the Art Deco period. The bathrooms are modern but still quaintly 1940's. There are 2 suites in the Royal Oasis - the Queen's Room and the King's Rooms. Both evoke a sense of faded grandeur as a result of the slightly moth eaten leopard skins on the floor and their shiny cerulean blue cupboards, and a sense of the utterly bizarre because of the bathrooms that are made entirely from mirrored and coloured black glass. 

Dinner is served in a room surrounded by photos of the royal family and speckled green walls to match the dining table and chairs. Dinner is an elaborate affair with a fixed menu involving Indian vegetarian and meat dishes. 

The most fascinating feature of the Royal Oasis is surely the step well or "vaav" which is a mixture of Hindu, Islamic, Gothic and Art Deco architecture, and is housed in a separate building. The scarcity of water in the state of Gujarat was responsible for the popularity of step wells and while you are likely to see a few different varieties of them, this one is quite likely to be the most memorable, inspite of its slightly green and murky water. Its floral arches, inlaid stone work and carved stone "chatri" cenotaphs are delightful.
Metatype: Located in lush green gardens, the summer palace of the Maharaja of Wankaner is a true Art Deco bungalow.
Descr: Royal Oasis in Wankaner - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: royal oasis, wankaner, heritage hotels, gujarat, art deco, special places

description:
Set in lawns and gardens beside the river Gondali, the Riverside Palace was built in 1875 in colonial style. 

Much of the interiors are unchanged; there are crystal chandeliers, framed paintings and many pieces of period furniture.

The 11 double bedrooms are spacious, with heigh ceilings and lavishly appointed with elegant period furniture and western style bathrooms.

The location is idyllic with water and garden views from many places. The orchards and the river atrract a great number of resident and migratory birds.

Your stay is on Full Board.
WebWriteUp1:
The Riverside Palace was built in the 1880's to be the official residence of the Crown Prince of Gondal. This powder blue colonial style building has large overhanging eaves that form broad balconies from which one may enjoy the breezes coming from across the town's river and the extensive gardens that surround the property. 

The 11 rooms of this converted palace are all large, airy and elegant. Large four poster beds, portraits of the royal family and the old world charm of the building recreate the atmosphere of the bygone British Raj. 

The rooms are distributed on the 3 floors of the palace and each room has large canopied brass four poster beds covered in brightly coloured Indian bed linen, a sitting area and well sized bathrooms with modern fittings. Most rooms have direct access to the wide porches lined with a mixture of cane chairs and original Chippendale tables. 

The palace was furnished to suit the taste of a young Rajput Crown Prince. Hence the many hunting trophies of tiger skins and mounted blackbuck, lion and deer heads. The sitting room, also called the India Room, features brass work and samples of traditional Kutchi beadwork. 

Meals are prepared by the excellent royal chef and served in the formal dining room in the palace which has restored Elizabethan china cabinets filled with gilded porcelain bric-a-brac. 

The lawns sometimes are venues for Indian weddings which can be observed from the overhanging galleries on each floor.
Metatype: Set in lawns and gardens beside the river Gondali, the Riverside Palace was built in 1875 in colonial style.
Descr: Riverside Palace Hotel in Gondal - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Quality Inn (India) Pvt Ltd in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: A lovely old haveli set around a pleasant garden courtyard, located just inside the Old City walls. Built as a townhouse for the royal family of Samode, the family still resides in a wing of the hotel. The fourty odd rooms in the rambling building are well furnished with local hand-block printed fabrics and period furniture. The restaurant is decorated throughout with exquisite frescoes. The pool area, with adjoining spa, is a very welcome area for relaxation.
advantage: Near City Centre & Monuments
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C Running Water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Parking, Garden, Lawn, Bar, Restaurant, Travel Counter

WebWriteUp1:
An excellent Haveli right in the middle of the old city, Samode Haveli was the town house for the Prime Minister of Jaipur state. The family still resides in an adjoining wing of the hotel. Restored and added to with impeccable style, Samode Haveli combines comfort with good taste in a traditional setting

The 29 rooms and suites are reached through delightful courtyards and gardens. The recently refurbished rooms have ample space - including a luggage rack that can accommodate the largest of suitcases, extremely comfortable beds, interesting smaller pieces of furniture and well chosen artefacts. The hallmark of Samode hotels are the excellent bathrooms - clean, large, with generous size shower stalls and world class fittings. 

The dining hall at Samode is extravagantly decorated with floor to ceiling intricate frescoes, making it a special setting for dinner. Beside the dining room is an airy verandah lounge where afternoon tea is served. Private meals and candle-lit dinners in the lush green garden are possible with prior notice.

The Haveli has several courtyards, pleasant lawns and gardens with many old trees. There is also a romantic swimming pool, flanked by an arched bungalow with a bar downstairs and a spa upstairs. There are also three pavilions which offer sumptuous daybeds for pool-side lounging. The ambience is of modern sophistication with regal Indian touches.
Metatype: A lovely old haveli set around a pleasant garden courtyard. Built as a townhouse for the royal family of Samode, the family still resides in a wing of the hotel.
Descr: Samode Haveli in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Rimo Ganges Tented Camp is situated on a beautiful sandy beach by the river Ganges, an hour beyond Rishikesh. Accommodation is in deluxe twin-bedded safari tents, and is given out on full board basis. 

A two night stay at the tented camp includes an exciting half-day rafting trip. No previous experience is necessary and rafting this section of the river Ganges is a great introduction for those who have not tried this activity before.
WebWriteUp1:
Rimo River Rafting Camp is located on the Rishikesh-Devprayag road, on the bank of the river Ganges, 2 km beyond Kaudiyala village. Unlike most other camps in the area, it is on an isolated hidden beach hidden from the road, and so offers peace and seclusion.
 
Rafting can be done by anybody (except for those with serious medical problems) - young and old alike. No previous experience is required, in fact most guests have never rafted before. You need not be able to swim in order to experience the thrills of this sport. 

All equipment is provided - rafts, life jackets, helmets, oars and paddles Every raft has a first aid kit, repair kit, dry bags (rubberised water proof) to keep spare clothes and cameras dry. The wearing of helmets and life jackets is compulsory!

The river has rapids graded from 1 to 4 (as per the grading below), intersterced with placid stretches where one can even body surf in the gentle waves. Each raft is steered by a qualified rafting guide who is there to ensure your safety.  No risks are taken and if the guide determinse that certain sections of the river are not suitable for rafting, their decision is final.

Grade I - Relaxing - Waves are so small you may not even get wet.
Grade II - Easy does it - Clear passages and moderate waves.
Grade III - Adventurous - Lots of waterslide like waves, short rapids with clean passages. Excellent family adventure!
Grade IV - Thrilling - Long rapids, powerful waves.
Grade V - Awesome - Long exciting rapids, big technical drops and steep gradients.
Grade VI - Don't try this!!
(Grade V and Grade VI rapids are not undertaken for commercial rafting).
Metatype: Rimo Ganges Tented Camp is situated on a beautiful sandy beach by the river Ganges, an hour beyond Rishikesh.
Descr: Rimo River Rafting Camp in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rimo river rafting camp, rishikesh, ganges, special places
address:
Near Mandal Vikas Nigam House

description:
The Grand View Hotel is one of the few standing buildings in Dalhousie that still evoke the grace and grandeur of this erstwhile British retreat. 

The building has a long wooden facade complete with the original fretwork and gabled roofs that faces panoramic views of the majestic Pir Panjal snow peaks in the distance. 

There is a large sunny dining area that serves steaming hot Indian food, perfect to warm your insides after a walk along the nearby Mall.
advantage: Facing Pir Panjal Range
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Channel Music, Tea/Coffee maker
otherfacility: Business Centre, TV. Video Games, Access to Dalhousie Club, Pool Table, Electronic Dat Board
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Banking, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service
creditcards: AMEX, CAN, BOB, Diners, VISA, Master, Andhra, Bank of America, Central, ANZ, Citi, MER Card
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are largely wood built, with wooden flooring, regal wooden beds and winged armchairs, but this in no way makes them gloomy. The colours of the furnishings and walls are light pinks, greens and yellows and the rooms are large, allowing plenty of light to filter through. The bathrooms are modern and a few even have bathtubs. The larger rooms have a separate living area. 

The principal walks of Dalhousie - the Mall towards Gandhi Chowk or to Subhash Chowk past the Tibetan rock paintings - are all close by. But by early evening you'll probably find yourself making your way back to the dining room where fires are lit on colder days. 

However, the best views Dalhousie offers are probably those from the front lawn of the hotel itself so you may find simply relaxing there admiring the grace of the white flowered wild pear tree as it reaches for the mountains is a highlight of your stay.
Metatype: The Grand View Hotel is one of the few standing buildings in Dalhousie that still evoke the grace and grandeur of this erstwhile British retreat.
Descr: Grand View Hotel in Dalhousie - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
