description:
Popular with sophisticated travellers, high level monks and business delegations alike, the Surya McLeod stands out as one the most professionally run hotels in Dharamsala.

The rooms have wood or carpet covered floors, large, soft beds, tall windows with grand views, tea and coffee makers and modern bathrooms with hot water in the mornings and evenings. 

The restaurant serves a range of cuisines and the bar is probably the best stocked in town.
advantage: Facing Bathri Valley - Near Main Market

WebWriteUp1:
The biggest hotel in Dharamsala as well as the most modern, Surya McLeod is a multi-storey building a short walk away from the town centre. It is not the kind of hotel that offers individually designed rooms however, the rooms are perfectly comfortable and of an international standard. 

The restaurant has views over the valley and all meals are served here. The food on offer is Indian, Chinese, Continental, Tibetan and also includes the chef's speciality snacks. There are also plans to open an all day Coffee Shop. 

Within walking distance are plenty of outdoor cafes and roadside stalls selling everything from hand made jewellery to hiking gear for those wanting to get a closer glimpse of the snow blanketed Dhauladhar mountains which loom over Dharamsala.

description:
This aristocratric, low, cream coloured building is Amritsar's oldest hotel. 

Ritz Plaza is being gradually modernized, and now has an inviting swimming pool, a multi-cuisine restaurant, and a lounge bar. The large air-conditioned rooms are well furnished.

Ritz Plaza is spread over an aristocratic 2 acres on Mall Road, the most sought after location in Amritsar, some 2 km from the Golden Temple.

WebWriteUp1:
A comfortable hotel in a good location, Ritz Plaza was recently renovated. The rooms are warm with buttery yellow walls, wooden or marbled floors and unfussy furniture. The sofas and armchairs are comfortable and the beds covered with paisley and flower prints. The bathrooms are modern and well stocked with toiletries. 

The enclosed lawn is surrounded by palms with a seasonally functional pool in its centre. The coffee shop spills out onto this lawn. There is also a bar/lounge leading off the reception area. 
  
The staff is friendly and helpful and the management professional. The Ritz Plaza promises a comfortable stay and its prime location ensures easy access to the Golden Temple and Jallianwallah Bagh - the main sights of interest in the city.

description:
Carmelia Haven is an eco-friendly plantation retreat close to Thekkady. The resort nestles amidst 55 acres of tea and cardamom plantations and has a swimming pool, tennis court and ayurvedic massage centre.  

Here you can stay in a tree top wooden cabin with an attached bathroom and balcony, offering unmatched views at a height! There are also cave houses and circular honeymoon suites as well as regular thatched cottages.
WebWriteUp1:
Carmelia Haven is a lovely resort set in 55 acres of plantations full of cardamom, spices, coffee, tea and fruit trees. There are paved walkways where all the trees or shrubs are labeled. Don't miss the majestic tree from whose bark (resin) incense is collected.

The rooms come in several different types - all in cottage style. Covered with thatch, they are quaint and have a private sit-out to enjoy the views of either the pool or the plantation.

There are also two tree houses - one of them built on the oldest tree of the property. Stoically, the tree continues to grow around the tree house! Inside, the ambience is like a game lodge in Africa - an abundance of wood, and large glass panes looking out to the trees and a verandah that runs around almost all sides. 

There is a large Ayurveda centre which offers full treatment programs of various durations. Of course, the short term guest can simply relax with a massage. 

Excursions can be organised to Kailasam - 30 kms away. This is where the Periyar river cascades over boulders before crashing into the flat ground below, and is a thrilling day trip.
Metatype: Carmelia Haven is an eco-friendly plantation retreat close to Thekkady. The resort nestles amidst 55 acres of tea and cardamom plantations and has a swimming pool, tennis court and ayurvedic massage centre.
Descr: Carmelia Haven in Vandanmedu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Spice Village is built to resemble a Kerala tribal village of thatched roof, white-washed cottages, set in a large tropical garden with each tree neatly labelled. 

The rooms are spacious and furnished with terracotta tiled floors, wooden beds and chairs, and whitewashed walls. The resort has an exclusive Ayurvedic clinic, swimming pool, games room and badminton court.

WebWriteUp1:
A delightful resort consisting of individual cottages, thatched with elephant grass, amongst a fabulous landscaped spice garden. There are stand alone cottages as well as larger structures with two guest rooms together under a larger roof. 

The restaurant, the reception, the wildlife club and the bar are all decorated in a mix of colonial and traditional Kerala style. The bar and the library/film screening rooms are especially charming with comfortable club style furniture which invites guests to enjoy a quiet time. 

The restaurant serves meals in buffet style, innovatively presented, and with many choices for the health conscious and those on an Ayurvedic diet. 

The activities include trips into the Periyar and Gavi wildlife parks; including boat rides, jungle walks and bamboo rafting. There are also plantation nature walks with a guide. Each day there are also other activities such as cooking demonstrations and yoga classes. 

If you would rather relax, then there is a good sized swimming pool and of course, plenty of shaded corners where you can catch up on your reading. 

The service is professional yet personalized and the staff is genuinely concerned that enjoy your time in Thekkady.
Metatype: Spice Village is built to resemble a Kerala tribal village of thatched roof, white-washed cottages, set in a large tropical garden with each tree neatly labelled.
Descr: Spice Village in Thekkady - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A gracious landmark on the waterfront facing the Gateway of India, The Taj Mahal Hotel  was built in 1905 using dark coloured stone with creme coloured facings. It is a fabulous piece of indigenous architecture. The 560 rooms are divided between the Old and New Wing. There are multiple restaurants and a swimming pool. 

The Taj Mahal Hotel is one of the `Leading Hotels of the World'.

WebWriteUp1:
Since it opened in 1903, The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai has created its own unique history. From Maharajas and Princes to various Kings, Presidents, CEOs and entertainers, the Taj has played the perfect host, supportive of their every need.

Built in 1903, the hotel is an architectural marvel and brings together Moorish, Oriental and Florentine styles. Offering panoramic views of the Arabian Sea and the Gateway of India, the hotel is a gracious landmark of the city of Mumbai, showcasing contemporary Indian influences along with beautiful vaulted alabaster ceilings, onyx columns, graceful archways, hand-woven silk carpets, crystal chandeliers, a magnificent art collection, an eclectic collection of furniture, and a dramatic cantilever stairway.

Over the past century, The Taj Mahal Palace, Mumbai has amassed a diverse collection of paintings and works of art and is a veritable showcase of artifacts and art of the era. From Belgian chandeliers to Goan Christian artifacts, the hotel incorporates a myriad of artistic styles and tastes.
Metatype: A gracious landmark on the waterfront facing the Gateway of India.
Descr: Taj Mahal Hotel in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: A lovely pink sandstone haveli located in the narrow winding streets of the old town of Bikaner. Built in the early 20th century, the building is a fascinating combination of Indian and European styles with large, attractively furnished, with high ceilings, rooms located around a central courtyard.
advantage: Located in the heart of the Old Town with Carved Havelis
roomfacility: Spacious Rooms with painstakingly restored interiors featuring Gold Leaf work, Attached bath with Hot & Cold Running water
WebWriteUp1:
Walls surround the old city of Bikaner. As a result, the city could not spread horizontally but only vertically. This led to the construction of large four of five storey high buildings, some with exceptional carvings. The most famous group of havelis is the Rampuria Havelis, one of which, Bhanwar Niwas is now a heritage hotel. 

One day, we were enjoying a good cup of coffee on the upper verandah, when Ravel's Bolero was played - its notes getting higher and higher, filling the courtyard and creating a wonderful ambience.

The Bhanwar Niwas has a grand salon - adorned with real gold leaf work - painstakingly retouched by the present owner. There are grand ceilings, stencils, friezes, and an overall feel which is so Baroque as to evoke reminders of the Palace of Versailles!  The Blue Drawing room is in pale blue and gold leaf, the Grand Staircase in a riot of gold - you will literally be dazzled! 

The rooms, in keeping with the opulence of the place, are large, high ceilinged and impressive. The beds are of carved wood, and there are heavy damask draperies, rich carpets and silk wallpapers. There are only a handful of rooms giving the place a hushed, private feel.
Metatype: A lovely pink sandstone haveli located in the narrow winding streets of the old town of Bikaner. Right at the entrance, an impeccably maintained Buick of 1927 greets you.
Descr: Bhanwar Niwas in Bikaner - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bhanwar niwas, bikaner, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

description:
One of the most exclusive palace hotels in India, spread over regal grounds of the magnificent City Palace complex, Shiv Niwas makes for a majestic stay. 

Formerly the Maharana's guest quarters, this restored historic hotel offers ornate architecture, romantic terraces and a lovely swimming pool set in the courtyard under old trees. 

Part of the magnificent City Palace complex, its original ornamentation is splendidly preserved. 

The fabulous suites offer the best accommodation in Udaipur. There are also well appointed standard rooms in the annexe building.
advantage: Situated in the heart of City
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Tea/Coffee maker
otherfacility: Business Centre, Separate Executive Floor, Executive Lounge, Swimming Pool, Tennis, Billards, Holistic Massage, Squash Court, Badminton Court
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Banking, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service
creditcards: AMEX, CAN, BOB, Diners, VISA, Master, Andhra, Bank of America
WebWriteUp1:
The terraced hill on which the City Palace complex of Udaipur is built, allows the various buildings inside to get fabulous views of the lake and the hills beyond. The Shiv Niwas Palace, a half moon shaped building was built as a royal guest house. Built around a marble lined swimming pool, a lofty platform/verandah takes you to the lake facing rooms. 

The menu is fairly eclectic with a choice of Indian and western dishes. Food can be served on the poolside terrace or guests have a choice of dining in the restaurants of the next door Fateh Prakash hotel or the open air sunset terrace overlooking the lake below.  

The exclusive suites are located just off the swimming pool. A profusion of crystal, glass inlay work and seductive coloured chandeliers above awaits the guest.  Delicate platforms, raised a small height house windows, give views over parts of the lake and of Sajjan Niwas gardens, the royal gardens beyond.  One can imagine the dignitaries around the world having been entertained in a style that only the very rich of the Indian royalty could offer.

Do try and look carefully at the single coloured glass inset in plaster. Deep, jewel-like tones are rich and glowing. This is the similar type of work that you can see in the bar of the Lake Palace - a property that also belongs to the royal house of Udaipur. 

Besides the suites, there are a number of `Palace Rooms' which are towards the back of the Shiv Niwas. These rooms are comfortable, overlook the gardens and the elegant driveway and have their own private sit-outs. These are comfortable but the `palace feel' is faint!

Any of the traditionally attired service staff will be delighted to show you where Octopussy, the James Bond extravaganza was filmed. 

A dapper Roger Moore, starts his chase of the bad guys starting from the Shiv Niwas swimming pool; of all the things giving the chase in autorickshaw through the narrow bazaar lanes of Udaipur!
Metatype: One of the most exclusive palace hotels in India, spread over regal grounds of the magnificent City Palace complex, Shiv Niwas makes for a majestic stay.
Descr: Shiv Niwas Palace in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Jagat Palace is a newly built `palace' which makes use of rescued carvings and has amazing examples of stone work. The rooms have interesting pieces of period furniture, and traditional hand-painted borders around the ceilings.

Standing a little outside the town of Pushkar, the Jagat Palace greets you with a massive carved stone entranceway. Small carved pavilions with swings and colonial furniture make inviting nooks and crannies for relaxing. Behind the hotel building is a large swimming pool with a spacious deck.
advantage: Located in Peaceful Area with Views of The Hills and Sand Dunes
ac: All Rooms Airconditioned and with Heating Facilities
roomfacility: All Rooms Well Decorated with Period Furniture and Colouful Frescoes
otherfacility: Camel Cart Ride, Horse & Jeep Safaris, Special Camping Arrangements, Large Gardens, Palace with Many Architectural highlights
services: Room Service, Travel Desk, Laundry, Doctor on Call, Internet Services
WebWriteUp1:
Jagat Singh, the pioneering hotelier of Pushkar, carefully transported parts of a neglected fort to Pushkar, to incorporate them in his new palace. Traditional craftsmen were employed in this ambitious project and they also created pillars, latticework wall pieces and corbelling to match the old style to the smallest detail. The result is a remarkable building. 

Jagat Palace has possibly the largest stone entrance arch after the Buland Darwaza of Fatehpur Sikri. Buff coloured walls offset the deep red of the stone. The carvings are intricate in some cases, the sheer size is awe inspiring. 

Inside the building the entrance lobby is grand and supported by oversized pillars decorated with colourful murals. The dining room is another grand room. Being in Pushkar, the hotel only serves vegetarian food, but it has a large choice of Indian and western dishes, with the traditional thali lunches and dinners being especially popular. 

The Place has two identical wings, with a very pleasant garden courtyard in between. The gardens are laid out in a formal, symmetrical style with many trees which are rare in Rajasthan. Small carved pavilions with swings and colonial furniture make inviting nooks and crannies for relaxing. Behind the hotel buildings is a large swimming pool with a spacious deck. 

The rooms are neatly divided by a narrow well of a courtyard. They are airconditioned and also provide heating in winters. Ceilings have traditional borders hand painted around the ceilings and floors are laid with marble. Jagat Singh is a collector of antiques, especially from the colonial times, and he has used some wonderful pieces to furnish the rooms, including beds with carved headboards or four posters. The bedside tables are often delicately carved, inset with hand painted glazed tiles.
Metatype: A newly built `palace' which makes use of rescued carvings and has amazing stone work. The rooms have interesting pieces of period furniture, and traditional hand-painted borders around the ceilings.
Descr: Jagat Palace in Pushkar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: jagat palace, pushkar, rajasthan, heritage hotel, camel fair, special places

description: An upmarket option in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada is situated 2 km out of town but offers splendid views of the Fort. An impressive stone arch welcomes you to the large grounds of the hotel. The interiors are luxuriously cool with central air-conditioning and an abundance of marble. There are two restaurants, an attractive bar, and a large swimming pool. The hotel also has a billiards room, a health club, gymnasium and spa.
advantage: Jaisalmer's Most Luxurious Hotel, Interiors Designed by Award Winning Opera Set Designer
roomfacility: Spacious Rooms, with Views Either of the Fort or the Gardens. Telephone, Cable TV, Attached Bath, Running Hot & Cold Water
otherfacility: Swimming Pool, 24 Hours Coffee Shop, Safe Deposit Lockers, Doctor on Call,  Travel Desk, Parking, Internet Access
services: 24 Hours  Room Service,
WebWriteUp1:
Although larger than our usual favourites, we have a soft spot for this magnificent building as an old friend, Jitendra Singh, was one of the co-founders of this hotel. We saw the years of painstaking work which went into the building of this hotel, including bringing in rescued pieces of sculpture and matching them with new ones. When the Rajwada finally opened its humongous gates (said to weigh 2.5 tonnes), the first guests to walk in were ours! 

Beyond the very impressive carved gateway with the enormous gates, the circular driveway leads to the large and airy lobby where one wall is covered by a beautiful mural depicting colourful Rajasthani scenes. 

The lobby opens out on to inner courtyards which lead to the swimming pool. The bar, restaurant, and coffee shop are on this ground floor level too. On most evenings, there is live music and performances in some outdoor location, often accompanied by barbeques.  

The 91 deluxe rooms and 4 suites are very well appointed. The rooms are large and all have jharokha windows overlooking the gardens and the Jaisalmer Fort in the far distance. The rooms are furnished with modern amenities and are clad in acres of granite and green marble. The fabrics are rich and the linen is of excellent quality. 

Being the top hotel in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada has hosted many celebreties including Paul MCartney and Amitabh Bachchan!
Metatype: The most luxurious hotel in Jaisalmer, situated 2 km out of town but with fine views of the fort.
Descr: Fort Rajwada in Jaisalmer - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort rajwada, jaisalmer, rajasthan, heritage hotel, luxury, desert, special places

description:
This resort was designed by the renowned architect Laurie Baker along the lines of a typical Kerala village. It is situated very close to the entrance of Periyar National Park.

Constructed in traditional style, the tiled roofed cottages feature arras and nirras. These are the wooden stores attached to traditional Kerala houses for storing rice. 

There is an attractive reception center and a good quality multi-cuisine restaurant.
WebWriteUp1:
An old favourite of travelers, Ambadi has enormous character. The clusters of buildings and cottages have facades of exposed red bricks contrasting with white-washed bricks. There is an abundance of wood and wooden furniture which gives the place a mellow charm. Ambadi is located just a short distance away from the entrance to the Periyar wildlife sanctuary. 

Many of the rooms are in small cottages, with balconies, as well as.charming and comfortable furniture. The restaurant/dining area just off the reception serves some good quality food. 

The grounds are shaded by old woody trees - and around the cottages grow lush tropical plants are planted, such as the brilliant lobster-claw Heleconia.
Metatype: This resort was designed by the renowned architect Lauwrie Baker along the lines of a typical Kerala village. It is situated very close to the entrance of Periyar National Park.

description:
Another version of the holiday home resort, the  Kohinoor Hotel is cheerful but fairly unimaginative. 

The fairly sprawling hotel complex includes a large swimming pool including some slides for children, a gymnasium and an Ayurvedic treatment centre. 

The rooms are housed in faux villas, each with a sunny sit out overlooking the gardens and pool. The rooms are fairly modern but comfortable. 

Situated much closer to the sites of Diu than its close competitor, the Radhika Beach Resort, the Kohinoor hotel is more accessible but farther from the Nagoa Beach.
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone,  CCTV., Safe Deposit
otherfacility: Banquet & Conference Facilities, Health Club, Swimming Pool, Indoor Games
services: Doctor, Laundry, Safe Deposit, Travel Desk Service, Fax, Intercom
WebWriteUp1:
The swimming pool is the focus of the resort and all rooms and facilities are located around it. The rooms are fairly plain and simply decorated on the assumption that guests will be spending most of their time outdoors. However they are clean and feature almost everything that you could expect. 

The Kohinoor Hotel as all other hotels in Diu, caters mainly to the Gujarati families that crowd its beaches on weekends and so the hotel offers such recreational facilities like a discotheque and bar, a Jacuzzi, and indoor and outdoor games. Their Ayurvedic Centre even offers special packages for treatments lasting from 40 minutes to 21 days.   

The restaurant's menu features both vegetarian and non vegetarian foods cooked in Indian, Continental and Chinese styles.
Metatype: Another version of the holiday home resort, the  Kohinoor Hotel is cheerful but fairly unimaginative.
Descr: Hotel Kohinoor in Diu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A lovely palace with just seven guest rooms, set in a huge complex of fruit orchards, lawns and gardens. Another delightful accommodation option is the beautifully restored Rail Saloon of the royal family!

The "room of miniatures" is a splendid sitting room with a collection of miniature paintings, brass and antique furniture. 

The vast property also includes an impressive collection of classic and vintage cars belonging to the royal family.
advantage: Located in Fruit Orchards
roomfacility: All 7 Rooms Beautifully Furnished, With Much of the Original Furnishings. En-suite Baths with H/C Running Water
otherfacility: A Grand Sitting Room with a Splendid Collection of Miniature Paintings, Bird Watching
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call, Extensive Collection of Vintage & Classic Cars
WebWriteUp1:
The long curving gravel driveway of the Orchard Palace brings you past a large pink water lily pool, impressive lawns dotted with intricately carved stone statues of Indian gods, and up to the 19th century terracotta red and white arched structure that is the Orchard Palace. 

Originally built to house the guests of the Maharaja of Gondal, this is now a small hotel with airy, elegant rooms decorated in the best of the 1930's and 40's Art Deco style. 

Fine Mughal tapestries, paintings of harriers and waders, and prints of Indian masterpieces from the personal collection of the royal family of Gondal line the walls. However, this vast collection of memorabilia does not become overpowering because of the large size of the rooms and their 15 foot high ceilings. The furniture is beautifully polished and preserved. The dominant Art Deco style is interspersed with older pieces of period furniture. 

At the back of the garden is the beautifully restored Rail Saloon of the royal family. This lilac and white carriage sits on rails next to a mock railway platform. Inside is a drawing room, a dining section, a bedroom and 2 bathrooms. Complete with its original fittings, dark inlaid wood and chintz sofas, this 1907 saloon is an utter delight. 

The vast property also includes the royal family's present home and the impressive collection of classic and vintage cars belonging to the royal family, including a Formula 5000 from 1972, a couple of classic Studebakers, and several Rolls Royces.

The Palace offers a wide variety of places to lounge in, such as the garden inhabited by peacocks, the broad verandahs of the palace, or the relaxing floor cushions of the upper salon.
Metatype: A lovely palace with just seven guest rooms, set in a huge complex of fruit orchards, lawns and gardens. Another delightful accommodation option is the beautifully restored Rail Saloon of the royal family!
Descr: Orchard Palace in Gondal - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A peaceful retreat surrounded by fruit trees and spice gardens with a gurgling stream running through it. 

The cottages are simple but well furnished in colours which blend with the environment. A great deal of attention has been lavished on the immaculately designed and spotless large bathrooms. There is a lovely swimming pool and Ayurvedic massage and yoga centre. There is even a library with a fireplace where one can curl up with a book.
cuisine: Indian, Western, prepared from Freshly Grown Ingredients

WebWriteUp1:
A short distance away from Thekkady, en-route to Gavi, the more dramatic sanctuary which adjoins Periyar, is Shalimar Spice Garden. This small boutique resort was one of the first in Kerala to incorporate a European sense of style in a Kerala setting.

At the end of a winding and narrow road which climbs steadily uphill past plantations and villages homes, is the entrance to Shalimar. Here you set off across a hanging bamboo bridge over a small green valley into the resort lounge. 

A benevolent Ganesh statue greets you in the cool lobby. There is comfortable seating here with colourful cushions in a cozy fireside lounge. To the side is the restaurant/dining area.

The rooms come in different categories but are all in cottages spread in the lush plantation garden. Each room has a different charm. The honeymoon cottages have romantic rose lighting, and chic black rough stone bathrooms with stylish fittings. Coloured fabrics are used to bring out the dark wood or white walls. All rooms have a sit-out from where you can enjoy the gardens. The whole place has a great sense of style and panache.

There is a fair-sized pool with a small deck where dinner can be served on request. Close by, is a pavilion which serves as a reading/television lounge with deep comfortable chairs and sofas. There is an Ayurveda centre with excellent massages on offer. 

All in all, Shalimar Spice Garden is an excellent choice for people looking for peace and privacy in an unusual setting.
Metatype: A peaceful retreat surrounded by fruit trees and spice gardens with a gurgling stream running through it.
Descr: Shalimar Spice Garden in Thekkady - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shalimar spice garden, thekkady, periyar wildlife sanctuary, kerala

description:
A majestic fort now converted into an immaculate heritage resort, the Karni Fort has architectural elements that have been aesthetically replicated. The original fortifications and turrets have been left virtually untouched. 

The interiors invoke a feeling of medieval opulence with interesting mirror work and gilded furniture. 

The resort has 30 rooms and a spectacular swimming pool.
advantage: Situated near Jagat Temples, Jaisaland Lake
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Channel Music, Coffee maker
otherfacility: Swimming Pool, Hamam, Banquet & Conference facilities,
services: Doctor on call, Laundry, Safe Deposit, Money changer, Banking
WebWriteUp1:
Located atop a hillock, the Karni Fort at Bambora is approached by a fairly steep slope. The gates are large enough to allow the entry of elephants; but inside it is more of a palace than a battle-ready fort. Smaller courtyards are softened by flowering plants. 

The rooms are on varying levels; they are spacious, bright, beautifully furnished, and feature round beds in the turret rooms. The interiors have maybe made a bit too generous a use of mirrors and opulent fabrics but the overall effect remains stylish and impressive.

There are beautiful panoramic views from everywhere - don't miss the sunset from the makeshift bar at the top of the fort!
WebWriteUp2:
Karni Fort's dining area is on the uppermost level and the views of sunset and early mornings are very dramatic. 

The swimming pool, located down the slope in its own area, is clad in marble with a marble pavilion floating in the centre! Carved elephants spout steady streams of water. Thick original fort walls surround the pool and the contrast between their ruggedness and the delicately carved marble is remarkable.
Metatype: A majestic fort now converted into an immaculate heritage resort.
Descr: Karni Fort in Bambora - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: karni fort, bambora, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

description:
A delightful palace situated in one of the most scenic and unexplored areas of Himachal Pradesh. 

The Taragarh Palace has 15 rooms and a seasonal swimming pool, set on a forested estate surrounded by tea gardens of the Kangra valley. 

Located at the foot of the Dhauladar mountains, there are splendid views of the surrounding snow-capped peaks.
accessair: 250 kms from Jammu Airport & 152 kms from Kuuu
advantage: 5 kms from Baijnath, 11 kms from Palampur
roomfacility: H/C running water, Telephone
otherfacility: Trekking walks, Swimming Pool, Tennis, Badminton Court, Children's play ground.
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry
WebWriteUp1:
Built as recently as 1930, the Taragarh Palace still resonates a great deal of historic charm. The royal crest of Jammu and Kashmir on its doors reveals its present owners to be the erstwhile royal family of that highly disputed state. 

Built in the cool shadows of the Dhauladhar mountains to be the summer residence of a Nawab, the Taragarh Palace was later acquired for the dowager Queen of Jammu and Kashmir. 

For all its illustrious history, the Palace hotel is a fairly modern establishment with a seasonal swimming pool, exercise facilities, and telephones and televisions in each of its grandly furnished room.   

The newer wing is a sturdy, red brick building. Less graceful than the original building, this is a low bungalow with a painted wooden facade and filigree like fretwork. However as alluring as it is to stroll through the tiger skin lined corridors of the heritage wing, it is the rooms in the modern wing that are surprisingly the more appealing. Larger and sunnier, these rooms have queen sized, 2 poster beds, cool marble patterned floors and brick fireplaces. The bathrooms are equally elegant and modern, some even have marble bathtubs.

The dining area is a large, exposed brick affair with charming wood and brass ceiling fans and large figurines of deer on the long tables, designed for formal dining.
 
Outside on their lawns are benches under trees and canopies, a cordoned off section for the prized polo ponies and a pool behind the green roofed heritage wing. The professional health care centre offers therapeutic ayurvedic massages.
Metatype: A delightful palace situated in one of the most scenic and unexplored areas of Himachal Pradesh.
Descr: Taragarh Palace Hotel in Palampur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: taragarh palace, palampur, heritage hotels, tea, himachal  pradesh

The hotel's 226 rooms and suites are the ultimate in old world elegance and luxury. The Oberoi Grand has three exclusive restaurants, a bar and a tea lounge.

Gleaming lobbies and corridors, grand salons, a profusion of flower arrangements, period furniture grace the public areas of the Oberoi Grand. The restaurants serve western as well as Thai dishes. There is also a handsome bar with a selection of fine wines and cigars.    

The guests rooms have high ceilings, canopied poster beds, soft silk carpets and priceless art on the walls. In addition, there are modern facilites like wi-fi, secretarial assistance etc. 

Standing stately for over 125 years, The Oberoi Grand combines classic architecture and charm with state of the art amenities and facilities. It is truly an island of calm in this bustling city.

WebWriteUp1:
Nestled in the midst of 20 acres of magnificent gardens The Taj West End is one of the finest hotels in Bangalore. 

Built in 1887 as the citys first hotel, The Taj West End has the stamp of old world charm and colonial architecture thats been carefully preserved for over the centuries, blended with the most modern amenities; distinctive bar and fine dining restaurants, personalized butler service, rooms and villas interspersed over 20 acres of landscaped greenery. 

The hotel is centrally located - just 36 kms from the domestic and international airports and close to the citys prime commercial, banking and shopping and entertainment districts center. The hotel is opposite to Bangalore Turf Club and is next to Bangalore Golf Club.
Metatype: A delightful hotel with a lot of old world charm which makes it feel more like a club, set in twenty acres of landscaped gardens.

Lucknow's most luxurious hotel. The Taj Residency is set in 33 acres of lavish landscaped gardens on the banks of the river Gomti. 

The elegant rooms either overlook the blooming gardens or the swimming pool. There are three restaurants including one serving specialty authentic Awadhi cuisine.

WebWriteUp1:
The Taj Residency in Lucknow is a classically beautiful white structure with a grand colonnade and an elegant cupola. Although an entirely new building in the recently developed residential complex of Gomti Nagar, the building is a celebration of the opulent lifestyles of the Nawabs of Lucknow. Its grounds include extensive lawns and an artificial lake that attracts birds and visitors alike.  
 
Some of the rooms have been refurbished to reflect modern tastes - bold, solid colours against a background of white, light coloured wood in unfussy designs - giving a bright and open feel to the rooms. The older rooms are more charming, with deeper greens and used n thick, rich fabrics. 

The rooms overlook the lawns or the pool. The pool is large, with palms and bushes surrounding it. Smooth, inlaid marble floors lead onto the lawns - the best place for a stroll in the early mornings or evenings. There is a spa, as well as a gymnasium and tennis courts.   

The hotel has a restaurant dedicated to the fine tradition of royal Nawabi cuisine for which Lucknow is famous.  The 'Sahib Cafe' has a more typical multi-cuisine menu.
Metatype: Lucknow's most luxurious hotel. The Taj Residency is set in 33 acres of lavish landscaped gardens on the banks of the river Gompti.
Descr: Taj Residency in Lucknow - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: taj residency, luxury, hotel, lucknow, cuisine, special places

description:
The Taj Residency, Aurangabad, is a low, sprawling white building with Mughal style cupolas, arches, and even an onion shaped dome. The hotel's rooms are set amongst lovingly landscaped and terraced lawns. 

The hotel is centrally airconditioned and the rooms are pleasantly appointed with all standard facilities. There is a 24 hour coffee shop, a multi-cuisine restaurant and a bar. For recreation, there is a swimming pool, a health centre, and even tennis and volley-ball courts.
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone with Direct dial (STD/ISD), T.V., Channel Music, Mini Bar, (Mineral Water, Aerated Water) Balcony with swing in each room, Internet facility

services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
The Taj Aurangabad architecture differs from that of most other Taj city hotels, resembling a palace more than a business hotel.

Being a chain hotel the rooms are decorated to a common standard, with the Deluxe Rooms being the most attractive in shades of white and elegant browns, golds and reds. The rooms have a balcony overlooking the pool and even a swing. 

There are 5 acres of gardens surrounding the hotel with paved paths leading past bottle palms and flowers to the large pool which offers a welcome respite from the dry heat of Aurangabad. The boundary of the hotel incorporates walls dating from the reign of the 17th century Mughal king Aurangzeb. 

The Garden Bar, with its leather chairs, has a pub like atmosphere. Leisurely meals can be served on the lawns in the shadow of this classic white palatial building while being serenaded by crickets.
Metatype: The Taj Residency is a low, sprawling white building with Mughal style cupolas, arches, and even an onion shaped dome. The hotel's rooms are set amongst lovingly landscaped and terraced lawns.
Descr: Taj Residency in Aurangabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Previously known as the Taj Garden Retreat Madurai, the 63 room Gateway Hotel Pasumalai Madurai is located on 60 acres of land on a hill overlooking Madurai, providing a peaceful place to relax in a beautiful setting. 

An old colonial villa forms the core of the hotel with the rooms in low rise blocks set amongst the gardens, many with fine views of the city. A large pool surrounded by lush vegetation provides a place to relax after exploring the town.
advantage: located on a Hillock to have wonderful view of the city

services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service, Indoor Games, Fax
WebWriteUp1:
With a stunning hilltop location 5km west of Madurai, this colonial building sits in landscaped grounds, and is a peaceful retreat from the busy city

A road climbs past thick bushes of fuchsia pink bougainvillea and up to the serene villas of the Gateway hotel perched on Pasumalai Hill. Built in 1890 to house the owner of a textile company, the villas sit at a sedate distance from each other. Although rooms have been added on to the original structure, they have retained the country style terracotta floors, dainty fretwork and red rooves of the older buildings. The turn-of-the-century grace of the building and the rolling lawns are reminiscent of the days of the Raj.
 
The colonial era rooms are generously sized with light wood floors and sometimes large French windows. The furniture leans towards the classical style, covered with heavy brocade and chintz in brown and gold tones. Carnations and rose petals floating in bowls give a splash of red to the black and white bathrooms. 

The open air barbeque restaurant commands a birds' eye view of the city, while the indoor restaurant offers a range of cuisines. Peacocks roam the terraced gardens.
 
The swimming pool is large and is surrounded by swaying palm trees, with the sunbeds arranged facing the panoramic views of Madurai. There is also an Ayurvedic centre that provides massages and treatments that have been practiced and perfected over hundreds of years.
Metatype: Previously known as the Taj Garden Retreat Madurai, the 63 room Gateway Hotel Pasumalai Madurai is located on 60 acres of land on a hill overlooking Madurai, providing a peaceful place to relax in a beautiful setting.
Descr: The Gateway Hotel Pasumalai Madurai in Madurai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: gateway hotel pasumalai, madurai, taj, colonial, heritage, luxury, hotel

WebWriteUp1:
It is amazing that in the city of Madras (Chennai), which has so many beautiful colonial style buildings, only one of them is a hotel. The Taj Connemara, built in 1891 by Spencer and Company, was named after Lord Connemara, the Governor General, who was a frequent guest here. The nearby Binny gardens have dwindled but vestiges of the old trees still remain. 

The centrally located Taj Connemara has a total of 150 guest rooms. The Deluxe rooms retain much of the old world charm, but have also been modernized to ensure guest comfort. The Hip Asia restaurant at the hotel is very popular as is the Raintree, the speciality Chettinad restaurant. The hotel also has a swimming pool.
Metatype: The only heritage hotel in Chennai with splendid art deco features.
Descr: Taj Connemara Hotel in Chennai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

The castle offers rooms of varying sizes and decor, simply furnished using local materials. There is a lovely swimming pool where you can relax.

WebWriteUp1:
Nestled amid a peaceful village bordered by farmland and rocky hills, is Castle Bijaipur. About half the current building are from the original fort while the other half is new, but designed to blend in smoothly. A graceful arch leads guests in to a large lounge. The rooms fan out from here along a wide corridor, decorated with family heirlooms. 

The rooms have antique furniture that complements the tall ceilings and thick walls. The colours are vibrant and fabrics locally sourced. Many rooms have window seats with bolsters and plump cushions which are perfect for sitting with a book or enjoying the wide views.

The dining room is a bright, large room. Meals are generally served buffet style but some a la carte dishes are available. 

The large outdoor pool is a delight. The deck is large with many shady spots. Several old carvings are arranged here, and the gardens attract many birds. Guests can enjoy the birdlife and watch the scampering squirrels, while enjoying a swim.
Metatype: A 16th century castle, now converted into a heritage hotel run by the local ruling family.
Descr: Castle Bijaipur in Bijaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: castle bijaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, horse safari, cycling, special places

WebWriteUp1:
Around the turn of the 20th century, Maharaja Ganga Singh decided that it was time to move out of Junagarh Fort and build a modern palace that more clearly reflected the progressive new character of his kingdom. The result was the impressive Lallgarh Palace.

The opulent Lallgarh Palace draws its inspiration largely from the Rajput tradition. Its facade, like a Rajput fort, has almost no decorative features, except its topping of arrayed cupolas. But there is also a strong touch of the Renaissance in the way the palace has been laid out, with its collonades and corridors. 

Bikaner's royal family produced many statesmen who regularly met with India's British rulers. As a result, Lallgarh Palace saw the maximum number of visiting dignitaries from British India. Walking through the broad corridors flanked by a long colonnade of elegant pillars, it is easy to imagine those days. The public chambers such as the dining hall, the drawing room, the library and the bar, are large and furnished in a heavy masculine, royal style.

The central courtyard and the expansive gardens soften the austere feel. There is a tennis court, croquet grounds, billiards table and much more. Even if you are not inclined towards sports, the grounds are most pleasant for walks and ambling. Lallgarh Palace also has an interesting in-house museum which tells the colourful history of Bikaner and Rajasthan. There is an indoor pool that is as grand as its surroundings - with double height ceilings and arched windows.
Metatype: This huge red sandstone Maharaja's palace was constructed in the beginning of the 20th century and is a perfect example of Indo Saracenic architecture.
Descr: Hotel Lallgarh Palace in Bikaner - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: lallgarh palace, bikaner, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Chandelao Garh is a medieval fortified home converted by the sympathetic owner, Praduman Singh, into a lovely small hotel, which is at the heart of the local community. 

Innovative water storage systems are used, and the property is fully solar powered. The "Sundarang" arts and crafts centre at the entrance is run by village women.  The rooms are traditional yet comfortable, and the food is locally grown. Staying here is a genuine eco-friendly rural experience.
WebWriteUp1:
The vast entrance gates set in carved stone may have kept intruders away, but today they stand open in welcome. The Garh is a small compound of mainly low, modest buildings, barring one, the Zenana section, which has excellent carvings in red stone. 

The buildings surround a large enclosed garden courtyard with flowering bougainvillea and grass. Along with an elevated terrace, this is the perfect place in which to relax.

There are fifteen rooms in this 300-year-old fortified home and they are furnished with genuine period furniture from the family's own collection. All the soft furnishings come from local sources, and are made in the traditional hand-block printed style. No two rooms are alike, and they have been kept as original as possible, except the bathrooms which are modern. Each has a small verandah or an open sit-out.

The upper terrace affords good views over the countryside and is the venue for dinners. Breakfast is served in the smaller ladies courtyard.
Metatype: Just an hour's drive away from the bustling city of Jodhpur, is the small village of Chandelao.
Descr: Chandelao Garh in Chandelao - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: chandelao garh, rajasthan, heritage hotel, bishnoi villages, safari, special places

description:
A fabulous 19th century palace overlooking a lake backed by green hills. Still the residence of the former royal family, there are beautiful guest rooms furnished with authentic period furniture. 

The beautifully designed swimming pool borders the lake beyond and has some fabulous carved statuary around. The lake has a small island which houses the family temple of the owners of the palace.
advantage: Lake-Side property ideal for Bird-watching, Colourful Bazaar with Silver Jewellery

otherfacility: Spectacular Swimming Pool, Bar Lounge for Post Dinner Drinks, Ball-room Size Dining Room with Crystal Chandeliers

WebWriteUp1:
Dungarpur, literally, the "town of hills", has one of the most remarkable palaces of princely India. The palace overlooks the Gaibsagar lake, and offers delightful views and some excellent birdwatching in the winter months. 

The beautifully designed swimming pool borders the lake beyond and has some fabulous carved statues around.  

The palace has a central courtyard with a most unusual structure - Ek Khambiya mahal - a miniature tower intricately carved in deep grey stone with contrasting accents in white marble. This central courtyard gives the palace a totally unique identity. 

The Udai Bilas is an intimate property with only 22 suites and rooms. The overall ambience of the palace and the interiors is of the late Art-Deco period. The suites are extremely large and offer some of the best views of the lake. The standard rooms, in their own wing, are smaller, but they are still charming and comfortable and offer a view of the pool.

Another attraction is the Dungarpur Mews, a 100-years-old heritage building, initially used to stable horses and carriages and then extended to make it a huge garage in the 1930s. The current owner, Harsh Vardhan, has spruced up the old building to showcase some old carriages used in the pre-independence era, some old British cannons, a great collection of vintage cars, a couple of WW1 BMW motorcycles, and even two DH- 5 aicraft!

The mews has a nice bar with music and it is a great place to party in the midst of all the old cars and other modes of transport. The garage is full of automobile memorabilia which auto buffs will love!
Metatype: A fabulous 19th century palace overlooking a lake backed by green hills, which is still the residence of the former royal family. There are 22 guest rooms furnished with authentic period furniture. Meals are served in the banquet hall with crystal chandeliers.
Descr: Udai Bilas Palace in Dungarpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: udai  bilas palace, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, birds, special places

description:
Ratan Vilas is a charming family run heritage hotel. A circular formal drive leads you to the handsome sandstone building built in 1920. With a pleasant front lawn, this is a calm oasis away from the clamor of the old city. 

The large verandah surrounding the family drawing room leads to a nice and airy courtyard from where you access the guest rooms. All rooms are spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated with antiques and block-print fabrics. There is now a good swimming pool surrounded by a lawn for relaxing.
WebWriteUp1:
Ratan Vilas is a charming heritage home run by a young Rajput couple. The entrance is inviting and elegant and overlooks the well kept gardens with mature trees on both sides. A large verandah with comfortable chairs leads to the family drawing room, a delightful place with comfortable deep sofas. Family photographs and photos of Rajasthans nobility line the walls. The drawing room is open for everyone as the Rajput owners, Brijraj Singh and his wife Namrata, consider everyone as their personal guest. They are friendly and gracious hosts and justly proud of their beautiful home.

The main courtyard is flanked by wide corridors with a number of lounge chairs. This is the main open dining area with wrought iron dining tables and chairs, spaced so that each table has a sense of privacy. In the main building is another cosier dining room. The food here is excellent, being freshly prepared in the family kitchens.

A large verandah leads to an airy courtyard from where you access the guest rooms. The rooms are spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated with antiques and block-print fabrics. They are generous in size, the beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are well planned with all modern facilities and are squeaky clean. Each room opens out into the common verandah and in addition, there are smaller terraces, for lounging.
Metatype: Ratan Vilas is a charming family run heritage hotel. A circular formal drive leads you to the handsome sandstone building built in 1920. With a pleasant front lawn, this is a calm oasis away from the clamor of the old city.
Descr: Ratan Vilas in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This impressive fort has recently undergone a total renovation. The rooms now have modern bathrooms but for the rest they retain an old world charm with classic furniture and colourful local fabrics. 

Fort Khejarla has white-washed terraces, cool private sit-outs and fabulous views from the upper windows and terraces. You cannot miss the massive granite boulder jutting out of the earth which now borders a stunning marble swimming pool.
WebWriteUp1:
A drive through the narrow lanes of Khejarla village brings you to the fort entrance. You enter a different world when you pass the imposing gates of the fort and enter a large courtyard and look up to see a fabulous fort building. Thick walls covered with a mellow beige colour offset the deep red coloured carved stone work on the top. The intricate latticework, and the canopies arching over graceful windows, is breathtaking.
 
The rooms are on two different levels, accessed from a smaller, inner courtyard. The rooms are all very comfortable, freshly painted and spotlessly clean. Classic furniture and colourful local fabrics are used throughout. The bathrooms have been newly installed with modern fitting and have hot and cold running water. You may find old niches converted into soap holders or a bathroom with a domed ceiling, elevating it into a fabulous chamber. 

At the bottom of the fort is one of the most imaginative swimming pools you will come across in Rajasthan. The area around Khejarla is home to pink/grey granite. One such huge granite rock juts out of the earth and now forms one end of a swimming pool. The tiling of the pool is done in white marble, giving the water a delicate aqua tone. 

The Khejarla fort is a delight to explore. The walls are as thick as two metres in places and its many terraces and windows give unexpected views over the countryside. Watch out for details of corbelling, a lone pavilion standing over the small courtyard. At the highest point of the Fort are three domes, topped by delicate finials. These attract jade green parakeets, and sparrows and pigeons nest in the stone walls.
Metatype: This impressive fort has recently undergone a total renovation. The rooms now have modern bathrooms but for the rest they retain an old world charm with classic furniture and colourful local fabrics.
Descr: Fort Khejarla in Khejarla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort khejarla, rajasthan, heritage hotel, spa, special places

description:
The old fort of Kishangarh provides a mysterious background to the delicate Phool Mahal palace, a combination of Rajasthani architecture and distinctive European touches. 

The lounge and the main dining area overlook the lake which attracts hundreds of resident and migratory birds. The Phool Mahal belongs to the royal family of Kishangarh, famous for its miniature school of painting.
advantage: Peaceful Lake-Side Location
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attached Bath, Running Hot & Cold water, Colourful Murals

WebWriteUp1:
Just off the main Jaipur-Ajmer highway, in a quiet lakeside location, is Phool Mahal, the monsoon garden retreat of the Kishangarh royal family. The Fort of Kishangarh provides a sombre backdrop to this graceful building set in colourful gardens. 

The Phool Mahal palace has hosted many British dignitaries, hence the distinctive architecture of the building - a combination of Rajasthani with a European touch. The lounge and the main dining area overlook the lake. The lake is a fantastic sight if the monsoons have been kind to the area, when blooming lotus and lilies make it a very pretty sight. The reeds on the shore and the lake attract a great number of birds. 
  
The rooms all are decorated in traditional style and most have lake views. The furnishings are charming and the feel is uncluttered due to the bright light outside. All rooms feature murals reflecting the family's history, and the local plant and birdlife.
Metatype: The old fort of Kishangarh provides a mysterious background to the delicate Phool Mahal palace, a combination of Rajasthani architecture and distinctive European touches.
Descr: Phool Mahal Palace in Kishangarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A small and cozy family run mansion in serene garden surroundings. The fifteen well appointed rooms have been tastefully furnished to maintain the character of a heritage home. 

Built in 1870 as a residence for the British surgeon in Kota, Sukhdham Kothi is an excellent blend of English and Indian architecture. There are open terraces, cool arcades, foliated arches and intricately carved stone screens.
advantage: Located in Peceful 3 Acre Gardens
roomfacility: All Rooms Spacious and Well Appointed with Period Furniture. Attached Baths with Running Hot & Cold water
otherfacility: Open Terraces, Garden and
services: Room Service, Doctor on Call, Laundry Facilities, Car Rentals, Parking Space, Cable TV, Phone in Every Room
WebWriteUp1:
Sukhdham traces its history back to the 19th century. After the 1857 mutiny, Sukhdham was built as a safe haven for the British Surgeon. In 1929 it became the residence of Col. Thakur Prithvi Singhji, a distinguished army commander from Kota. 

Today Sukhdham Kothi is home to the Colonel's grandsons, Jaywardhan and Harshwardhan Singh, and their families. Both brothers are closely involved in the running of the place and are helped by their charming wives. Accomodation at Sukhdham Kothi is therefore very much like a luxurious home stay. 

Just off the reception is the handsome drawing room, with seating areas of comfortably upholstered sofas and armchairs. The soothing colours, fresh flowers, neat fireplace and elegant lamps, make this room delightful. The adjacent dining area too, is furnished with care and elegance.

There are only 15 rooms, making this an intimate, homely place. The rooms are located on two levels, joined by cool deep verandahs. The rooms are generously sized, with comfortable colonial beds and windows overlooking the gardens. The bathrooms are modern - above all, spotlessly clean.

Large colonnaded verandahs envelop the place in typical colonial fashion. They make for an ideal spot to admire the large formal lawns and the gardens. There are a number of open terraces, screened off from each other with stone latticework. The wooded areas around the hotel attract a large number of birds.
Metatype: A small and cozy family run mansion in serene garden surroundings. The fifteen well appointed rooms have been tastefully furnished to maintain the character of a heritage home.
Descr: Sukhdham Kothi in Kota - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Aodhi, or `watchtower' is a resort in a peaceful location close to the entrance of the magnificent Kumbhalgarh Fort. 

On terraces on the wooded slopes, the stone cottages are built to resemble small fortresses. They are spacious, with rustic wooden furniture, and many have good views over the Aravalli hills. The Aodhi also has a well designed swimming pool. The tented restaurant here serves excellent food.

advantage: Near Kumbhalgarh Fort
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, T.V., Safe Deposit

WebWriteUp1:
The craggy Aravalli hills and the nearby Kumbhalgarh fort make an impressive backdrop for Aodhi (which literally means a "machaan", from which to watch wildlife).

Built from locally mined stone, Aodhi occupies a series of terraces on the hilly slopes. The resort's own gardens have nurtured some original trees, augmented by well kept lawns and flowering shrubbery.  

The cottages are well designed, each with its own balcony or sit-out from which to enjoy good views of the surrounding forests and hills. The rooms are large and have rustic wooden furniture. Each room follows the theme of an animal or a bird and the colours and artefacts are chosen accordingly.

The hotel has a restaurant with cane furniture and a lounge with seating arranged against the walls. On cool winter evenings, the restaurant is heated by a campfire which makes for a very convivial atmosphere. With its wooden rafters and tiled roof, the setting is evocative of a hunting lodge.
Metatype: The Aodhi, or `watchtower' is a resort in a peaceful location close to the entrance of the magnificent Kumbhalgarh Fort.
Descr: The Aodhi in Kumbhalgarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
An 18th century fort in a peaceful village setting, Fort Chanwa is a charming building converted into a hotel. The rooms are furnished with comfortable period style or Rajput furniture and local fabrics. 

The red sandstone walls, broken up by lattice work and arched gateways are impressive and keep the building pleasantly cool. There is a sizeable formal garden with flaming bougainvillea. The Fort has a swimming pool with an attached sauna and steam room and a Jacuzzi. Village safaris can be organised from here.
otherfacility: Valet Service, Village Safaris, Horse Riding
services: Laundry, Travel Desk, Swimming Pool and Ayurvedic Health Centre, Sauna, Steam & Jacuzzi
WebWriteUp1:
Built of red Jodhpur stones offset by carved arches, windows and pillars, Fort Chanwa is full of interesting corners to discover. There are carved jaalis and jharokhas, most often with parakeets clinging to the various projections. The building faces a large open garden with lawns bordered with shrubs. The rooftop terraces afford pleasing views over the fields and wide open areas beyond. 

The rooms are all air-conditioned and have been extensively renovated. No two rooms are identical. They are all spacious and furnished with well chosen period furniture. Note the sandstone brackets, tiny windows set deep in the thick walls, scalloped arches and other such architectural elements. The bathrooms are newly designed and modern with some delightful touches. 

Meals are served in various locations - breakfast in the courtyard, lunches in the enclosed and air-conditioned verandahs, tea on the upstairs terrace and dinner on the lower terrace. The deep blue pool with its intricate tile motif contrasts wonderfully with the red of the fort building and is a treat after a day's travelling. There is also a spa and Jacuzzi, created with an old world charm, matching the medieval atmosphere. Ayurvedic treatments and massages are also available.
Metatype: An 18th century fort in a peaceful village setting. The rooms are furnished with comfortable period style or Rajput furniture and local fabrics.
Descr: Fort Chanwa in Luni - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort chanwa, luni, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village, special places

Descr: Connaught House in Mount Abu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This former hunting lodge is now a charming heritage hotel. The small number of rooms and suites are all delightfully different from each other. All have local Rajasthani furniture and light cottons. 

There are also 5 luxury tents, pitched on an adjoining lawn, bordering an attractive swimming pool. There are several inviting places to relax with a book, such as the courtyard lawn bordered by flaming bougainvillea, or the wide verandah draped by fine muslin curtains to keep out the bright mid-day sun.
advantage: Located in the Shekhawati Region, Famous for Its Painted Havelis
otherfacility: Horse Safari Specialists, Jeep Drives, Camel Rides, Folk Dances
services: Swimming Pool, In House Laundry, Billiards Room, Mehendiwali and Doctor on Call, Gardens, Lounge and Ample Parking Space
WebWriteUp1:
The low rise building is pleasingly symmetrical, with large areas for dining and relaxing. The palace has many little nooks furnished with easy chairs and marble topped coffee tables to enjoy the peaceful surroundings. The formal gardens are a delight for walks and birdwatching. There is a long lily-filled channel which is a welcome sight in the dry climate. 

The rooms are airy and cool and the floors are covered by simple hand-woven dhurries. The furniture is a mix of colonial and traditional Rajasthani. Sepia photographs and old paintings on the walls and delicate hand block prints of the fabrics make the bedrooms inviting. The en-suite bathrooms mostly have marble or granite vanities and are well appointed.

The owner of Roop Niwas Kothi has pioneered horse and camel safaris throughout the surrounding region. They have well bred and schooled horses in their stables and they  also own a number of their own camels. Interesting safaris are offered on unusual routes, some visiting the annual cattle fairs in little visited parts of Rajasthan.
Metatype: An early 20th century palace set in a lovely garden.
Descr: Roop Niwas Kothi in Nawalgarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: roop niwas, kothi, nawalgarh, rajasthan, heritage hotel, havelis, special places

description:
An impeccably restored 15th century fort, Palace is located at a lofty height, providing many a vantage point for dramatic views over the surrounding countryside. The palace structures cut into the hillside to sprawl over three acres and rise to ten levels.

The rooms are all individually named and decorated with different emphasis. They are full of character and are beautifully furnished with collectors items.
cuisine: Painstakingly Created Menus Based on Traditional Rajasthani and French Cuisine
advantage: Magnificent Fort now Restored to Its Former Glory
roomfacility: Well Designed Rooms with a Mixture of Rajput & Colonial Style Furniture. Most Rooms With Private Balconies & Sit-outs. All Rooms Offer Good Views of the Country-Side
otherfacility: Theme Dinners, Special Evenings
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
When an enterprising and creative duo, Francis Wacziarg and Aman Nath, took over the dilapidated Neemrana Fort, it started a special chapter in Indian hospitality. From 1986, the ruins of this Fort were sensitively restored and reconstructed into a magnificent Palace hotel.  

An enormous entrance gate leads into the fort. You pass smaller gates, and ascend a stone-paved ramp to the main level of the fort. Here you will find the reception and most of the common areas.  Rooms literally head off in all directions, through various staircases, passageways and terraces. 

The rooms come in all sizes and themes, each with its own descriptive name, and are decorated in an eclectic fashion, with a combination of Rajasthani and colonial furniture and colourful fabrics. There are some exquisite pieces of furniture. Most rooms have access to balconies or terraces which offer superb views. The suites are superb -- our favourites being the Chandra Mahal with its black and white decor, Francisi Mahal with its elegant poster beds, and Kailash Burj with its unusual round shape.

The many superb common areas include various terraces, indoor and outdoor dining venues, lily pools and a swimming pool with a deck. The pool in a secluded location is accessed by a series of steps and winding passages. The pool is built with traditional Rajasthani motifs and small steps built in the style of a step-well go down one side. The deck overlooks the valley and gardens below and is an excellent place to watch the sunset.

Another good place to watch the sunset is the large terrace just past the main entrance, on the lower level. This terrace offers great views not only of the terrace but also a large section of the imposing fort facade with balconies, cupolas and canopied windows. 

Meals are served in different venues, depending on the season. One of the most impressive is an open-air courtyard created by high old walls with partial views through arches and high windows. In winters this area is kept warm by gas torches and heaters. With the French connection, there is generally a French chef looking after the kitchens and the food usually includes some innovative European dishes.
Metatype: An impeccably restored 15th century fort. Located at a lofty height, the fort has dramatic views over the surrounding countryside. The palace structures cut into the hillside to sprawl over three acres and rise to ten levels.
Descr: Neemrana Fort Palace in Neemrana - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: neemrana fort palace, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, special places

description:
A 300-year old rambling place with massive ramparts, thicker than a couple of metres, the Pachewar Garh has a large lawn with a tiny family temple. 

Some of the rooms here are large with enormous high arches supporting the ceilings and grand frescoes on the walls. Other rooms are smaller but brightly decorated with local furnishings. The courtyard with its lovely lawns is the place to relax. A swimming pool has recently been added too.
advantage: Located in Quiet Village Surroundings, Fort run By a Lady from Rajasthani Aristocratic family
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attached Bath with Hot & Cold Water
otherfacility: Cooking Lessons in a Village Home, Jeep/Bullock cart to Visit Village Craftsmen, Visit the Famous Toda Rai Singh Stepwells
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
Located off the highway between Jaipur and Ajmer highway, the approach road to Pachewar goes through peaceful rural areas. After reaching the village of Pachewar, the road ends at the massive entrance of the Garh. Enormous gates are supported by walls more than a couple of metres thick. The yellow ochre colour softens the walls and gives a warm welcome. The whole fort area is hidden behind these thick and tall walls. Inside is another world. There is a large lawn interspersed with trees that attract birds. One side has old stables and the other side gives access to the roof tops. 

A smaller gate leads into the second, family courtyard. Inside this, is the small, but charming Durbar Hall, now converted into the main dining hall. This room has some colourful frescoes on the arched ceilings. Breakfast and lunch is served here, while dinner is often eaten around a wood-fire on the paved terrace outside.  

The rooms are spread over the various parts of the Garh, and each has a unique character. Some are large old chambers with arched ceilings and painted frescoes on the walls. Other rooms are smaller but brightly decorated with local furnishings.

Throughout the fort there are open air terraces with fabulous views of the countryside. Sunsets are spectacular here as are moonlit nights. 

An interesting fact about Pachewar Garh is that the force behind it is a Rajput lady, the daughter of the present ruler. Wife of an army major, Madhulika Singh took over the fort and turned it into an aristocratic hostelry. She is charming and hospitable and is happy to join guests at mealtimes.
Metatype: A 300-year old rambling place with massive ramparts, thicker than a couple of metres. Once inside you see a large lawn with a tiny family temple.
Descr: Pachewar Garh in Pachewar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: pachewar garh, rajasthan, heritage hotel, fort, village, lake, special places
address:
Village Pachewar
Dist. Tonk, Via Dudu

description:
This deluxe tented camp only operates during the one week Pushkar Fair period. 

The camp, a little distance away from the fair ground, consists of spacious and carpeted Swiss Cottage tents with comfortable beds, good quality linen and Rajasthani hand-block printed quilts. 

The camp has specially designed modern toilets with running hot and cold water. Your stay is on full board basis.
advantage: Located near the Pushkar Fair Ground

WebWriteUp1:
This surreal `city of tents' comes up to accommodate the large number of guests who flock to take part in the annual Pushkar Fair. Reminiscent of the battle camps of Moghul Emperors, the Royal Desert Camp is organized by the Pushkar palace team. Being the pioneers in this concept, the Royal Desert Camp runs with good efficiency and an eye for detail. 

Three restaurants serve food to the large number of guests. Food of course is totally vegetarian as Pushkar is a holy city. Guests can take complimentary camel cart rides to the nearby fair grounds. Throughout the day, there is some music or entertainment provided by visiting fold artists from all over Rajasthan. 

The tents are furnished with good quality wooden furniture, with floors covered with Rajasthani carpets and beds covered with snowy linen! All tents have attached facilities including specially made toilets, wash-basins and shower areas with heated water. The tents are heated by electric blowers as the nights at the Pushkar fair can be rather cold.
Metatype: This deluxe tented camp only operates during the one week Pushkar Fair period.
Descr: Royal Desert Camp in Pushkar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A charming garden retreat just a short distance away from Jodhpur. Still the family home of the erstwhile rulers, it now offers elegantly appointed rooms which feature frescoes and Rajasthani antiques. 

The drawing room has ornately carved wooden ceilings, traditional lamps and old photographs. There is a dramatic swimming pool flanked by elegantly carved chhatris. The owners organise excellent safaris by jeep, camel and horse to the surrounding Bishnoi villages.
advantage: Located on a River Bank with Good Views and Birdwatching Opportunities
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attached Bath and Running Hot & Cold Water

WebWriteUp1:
Rohet is a picturesque hamlet in Pali district south of Jodhpur. The focal point of the village is Rohet Garh, a lovely 17th century fortified home with a long wrap-around verandah. The main room has old paintings, weapons, traditional furniture and family memorabilia. The pleasant, low building has some nice architectural details such as carved chhatris, latticework screens and delicate arches. 

Thirty-four beautifully appointed air-conditioned rooms offer comfort and charm. Rooms are large and feature frescoes and Rajasthani antiques. They have attached modern bathrooms, which are spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated. 

The winter months attract a vast variety of birds to the region. In a good year upto 200 different species can be sighted. The numerous lakes and Jheels around Rohet are a haven for birds. A bicycle, a bird book, a bottle of water, a pair of binoculars, and a packed breakfast will be all that a true bird-lover needs! 

There is a beautiful swimming pool with traditional motifs in the tiles. The pool area is in a courtyard, surrounded by an arched colonnade and traditional chhatris. The terrace has cushioned seats to enjoy the arboreal surroundings and watch the many birds in the flowering trees.
Metatype: A charming garden retreat just a short distance away from Jodhpur. Still the family home of the erstwhile rulers, it now offers elegantly appointed rooms which feature frescoes and Rajasthani antiques.
Descr: Rohet Garh in Rohet - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rohet garh, rajasthan, heritage hotel, horse, village safaris, special places

description:
Roopangarh Fort is a 17th century hilltop fort of the royal family of Kishangarh, famous for its school of miniature painting. 

The fort offers some of the largest rooms found in Rajasthan. They are filled with the usual royal Rajasthani artefacts - but their setting in such grandeur makes them extra special. Several of the rooms have colourful frescoes and chandeliers, impressive antiques and some nice art work.
advantage: Rambling Fort with Wonderful Panoramic Views, Colourful Village with Lively Bazaar
roomfacility: All Rooms With Attched Bath, Running Hot & Cold Water

WebWriteUp1:
Located near the Makrana marble mines, which produced the marble for the Taj Mahal, the hilltop fort of Roopangarh is a vast building. The fort belongs to the royal family of nearby Kishangarh, famous for its miniature paintings. 

Narrow, winding streets lead from the Roopangarh town up to the Fort. The impressive fa�ade has military aspects such as turrets, gun windows, as well as delicate arched windows. There are beautiful views from the fort, especially at sunrise and sunset.

Inside the thick fort walls are some of the largest rooms to be found in Rajasthan. They are filled with the usual royal Rajasthani artefacts - but their setting in such grandeur makes them extra special. Several of the rooms have colourful frescoes and chandeliers. 

There are only 20 rooms in the vast building. Almost every room has its own terrace   offering panoramic views of the salt flats on one side and the town on the other. The rooms are comfortably furnished, and individual in character and decor. 

There is a vast terrace on an upper level, large enough to host a football match. This terrace has been converted into a hard tennis court. At a corner of the terrace, is a curious structure - a tomb of a Muslim saint.

The main dining room is on the level of the terrace - a formal affair with portraits on the walls and a general abundance of dark carved wood. However, dinners are often served on the terrace by an evening campfire.
Metatype: A 17th century hilltop fort of the royal family of Kishangarh, famous for its school of miniature painting.
Descr: Roopangarh Fort in Roopangarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: roopangarh fort, rajasthan, heritage hotel, travel, kishangarh, special places

description:
Among the heritage hotels, the highest category is Grand Heritage - denoting an especially opulent palace. Fateh Prakash is jutifiably rated in this category. 

Fateh Prakash consists of a handful of rooms which are part of the City Palace and a new wing of excellent rooms adjacent to the lake. Most rooms enjoy fabulous views over Lake Pichola and the Lake Palace, and are furnished with authentic period furniture.
advantage: Walk in the city Palace Complex & Free from Pollution

WebWriteUp1:
Part of the awesome City Palace complex, Fateh Prakash is truly luxurious. This high, domed and arched palace overlooks Lake Pichola, the Lake Palace Hotel and the hills that encircle Udaipur. The views are spectacular, but the interiors are something out of this world. 

The magnificent Durbar Hall is large enough to hold a few hundred guests. Enormous Venetian chandeliers hang from the lofty ceilings, while a minstrel's gallery (converted into the Crystal Gallery) runs the entire length of the room. This single room may be one of the largest you have ever seen! The Crystal Gallery is said to be one of the most extensive private collections of crystal in the world, housing everything from dinner sets, to figurines and larger pieces of furniture, including a bed of crystal! 

There are a handful of royal suites in the main palace building. Used even today to accommodate guests of the royal family, these suites have hosted many heads of state. Each suite at Fateh Prakash Palace is decorated with original portraits and authentic period furniture, which have been in the family for generations. 

In addition to the suites, there is an entirely new wing on the banks of the lake. These large and bright `Dovecote' rooms all overlook Lake Pichola and are constructed with great comfort in mind. They may lack the sheer opulence of the suites in the main palace, but are still extremely attractive.

There are several venues for meals, including the gallery restaurant, with uninterrupted views over the lake, the poolside, or at the adjacent Shiv Niwas palace.
Metatype: Among the heritage hotels, the highest category is Grand Heritage - denoting an especially opulent palace. Fateh Prakash is jutifiably rated in this category.
Descr: Fateh Prakash Palace Hotel in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fateh prakash, udaipur, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, palace

The erstwhile winter palace of the royal family of Bikaner is an impressive building, set in serene, lush surroundings - ideal for some serious rest and relaxation.

The palace has luxuriously appointed suites and rooms. The amenities include period furniture, private sitting areas; central air-conditioning, international direct dial telephones, satellite television, mini-bar, and tea/coffee making facilities.

The Mirage is a multi cuisine restaurant serving speciality Indian, Continental, Chinese and Rajasthani meals. 

An in-house museum displays a plane from the First World War presented by the British, which is now parked in one of the durbar halls. Another section of the museum showcases the clothes of Bikaner's royal women, family crockery, cutlery, and other bric-a-brac.
Metatype: A former royal hunting lodge, the Gajner palace is located on a lake which attracts an incredible number of birds. The surrounding forests are home to a great variety of wildlife.

description:
A small secluded bungalow outside Rishikesh, the Glass House on the Ganges houses 12 exclusive rooms, set in a lichee orchard with a garden of tropical plants which attracts rare birds and butterflies. 

Rooms are either in the main block, fronted by a pillared veranda with relaxing planters' chairs, or in cottages in the lush gardens of mango, lychee, and citrus trees and tropical plants.
cuisine: Freshly Prepared Meals Served in Indoor/Outdoors Overlooking the River
advantage: Secluded Property on the Ganga Riverbanks is set in a Lychee orchard, Home to Tropical plants, rare birds and butterflies. It has a sand beach of its own.
