WebWriteUp1:
Spectacularly situated on the banks of the Ganges, 23km north of Rishikesh, this former garden-retreat of the Maharajahs of Tehri Garhwal is - quite correctly - billed as a "non-hotel". 

The Glass House on the Ganges is a small secluded bungalow outside Rishikesh with just 12 exclusive rooms, set in a fruit orchard with a garden of tropical plants which attracts rare birds and butterflies. Walls have been replaced with sheets of glass to allow incomparable views of the river and the mountain ranges beyond. With its many opportunities for reading, fishing or walking, the Glass House offers a magnificent spot for relaxation. 
  
Francis Wacziarg and Aman Nath, of the Neemrana group, refurbished this riverside retreat with an artistic touch and produced a series of individual accommodations, all named after Indian rivers. Simply furnished with cotton hand block printed curtains and bed linen, the rooms have cool stone or terracotta floors. Most rooms open out onto balconies or the gardens.
  
Meals are served in buffet style on the main verandah or, when the temperature drops, indoors in the large dining room. This room has tall glass walls that give the bungalow its name. Other walls are lined with prints and sketches illustrating ancient Indian medical practices. The food is a mix of continental and Indian, all vegetarian.

The hotel has the best views of the holy river owing to its close proximity to the banks, and chairs and loungers have been arranged along the water. The garden behind has lychee, mango and citrus trees with hammocks conveniently hung between them.
Metatype: A small secluded bungalow outside Rishikesh. There are just 12 exclusive rooms, set in a lichee orchard with a garden of tropical plants which attracts rare birds and butterflies.
Descr: The Glass House on the Ganges in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

The heritage properties of Neemrana Group of Hotels, The Old Bungalow (1830) and Writer's Bungalow (1860) collectively called the Ramgarh Bungalows is the best address in Ramgarh to repose in comfort.

The property incorporates what a mountain retreat ought to: naturally landscaped surrounds and chic, earthy furnishings to soothe strung nerves. 

The rooms are evocatively titled, Lemon, Iris, Fuschia, Bird Suite, Butterfly Suite, Kashmir, etc., and accordingly done up in pleasing colours.

From May to September the orchards by the Writers' and Old Bungalows hang with Apricots, Plums, Peaches, Pears and Apples. The fruit trees attract many birds and butterflies.

description:
The design of Devi Garh's interiors is completely contemporary, almost austere in its simplicity. The luxury is in the spaces, the subtle plays of textures and colours and the flawless execution of designs. 

You will not see the typical riot of colours associated with Rajasthan. If there is a dominant colour here, it is white - of marble, of white on white plaster motifs on walls. The colour is introduced by just a few elements - silk cushions, fresh flower arrangements, the deep coloured stone of the vanity counters in the bathrooms.
advantage: Award-Winning Interiors in a Centuries old Fort, World-Class Spa and Personalised Service
ac: All rooms offer Air-conditioning and heating

WebWriteUp1:
Devi Garh offers only suites, each one with its own theme of decor which is exquisitely rendered. World class comforts include private balconies, extra large beds with sumptuous linen, air conditioning and heating, large televisions with DVD players. The large spaces are very elegant and offer guests the unique experience of living in a medieval fort juxtaposed with award winning ultra modern interiors.  

Bathrooms are spacious and decorated in a combination of white and green marble, with tubs and separate shower stalls and every other amenity you could think of. Large glass windows give panoramic views of the hills and valleys below. 

The swimming pool is in black marble, a marvellous sight. Located at a height, the pool offers stunning views of the fort walls and the craggy hills beyond. There is a full and very romantic spa, offering an assortment of packages and treatment. Devi Garh offers luxury which is certainly worth splurging on!
Metatype: The design of Devi Garh's interiors is completely contemporary, almost austere in its simplicity. The luxury is in the spaces, the subtle plays of textures and subtle colours and in the flawless execution of the designs.
Descr: Devi Garh Fort Palace in Delwara - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: devigarh fort palace, delwara, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, special places
address:
Village Delwara NH 8
Tehsil Nathdwara
District Rajsamand

description:
A traditional Rajput feudal homestead, this rambling structure has well-appointed rooms around a courtyard with a shimmering swimming pool. 

Off the main courtyard is the small but lavishly decorated dining hall where meals are served in buffet style. There is also a separate formal lounge with comfortable sofas. 

The garden area has small shrubs and trees and inviting benches for relaxation.

The rooms at Ravla Bhenswara are decorated in a riot of colour and using various painting techniques such as dragging and sponging stencilling, making each room a very different experience.

Meals can be had in the dinning room or under the stars in the open courtyard. On Mondays only vegetarian food is served, according to the family's religious tradition. Evening entertainment includes traditional folk dances & music.

description:
The Hotel Prince is a 30 year old Bhuj institution. Its modern rooms and unbeatable local food continues to draw both Indians and foreign visitors. 

A 3 star hotel, the Prince offers a range of rooms which are renovated every 6 months to give them a fresh, newly finished feel. 

The spacious rooms have discreet, diffused lighting which reveals light coloured flooring and walls with patterns of purple and orange.
roomfacility: All Rooms With Attached Bath, H/C Running Water
WebWriteUp1:
Wood paneled softly lit corridors, lined with large photographs of men and women from different Kutchi tribes and handmade designs in white clay, lead to the rooms. 

Rooms range from simple single roomed accommodation with attached bathroom, to the zen like two roomed suite with two television sets and the 70's style bathroom. 

All the rooms have large beds and most are covered with brightly coloured applique or embroidered bedspreads. 

There are 2 restaurants in the hotel. The one serving the usual North Indian Mughlai and Continental fare also offers non vegetarian dishes, not something you can be assured of everywhere in the state of Gujarat. The other restaurant offers an all you can eat traditional vegetarian Gujarati "thali" - an array of up to 10 or 12 different dishes.
Metatype: The Hotel Prince is a 30 year old Bhuj institution. Its modern rooms and unbeatable local food continues to draw both Indians and foreign visitors.
Descr: Hotel Prince Residency in Bhuj - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: prince residency, bhuj, kutch, hotel, gujarat, special places

description:
Hotels in Diu tend to be of the holiday home variety and Radhika Beach Resort is no exception. With double storied tile roofed villas surrounding a paved garden and swimming pool, it is generally considered to be the best hotel in Diu.

It is located on what is Diu's best beach - Nagoa. The rooms are more imaginatively done up than in other resorts as well. In accordance with holiday home norms the Radhika Beach Resort also features a health club and indoor games.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms at the Radhika Beach Resort are bright and cheery with white walls set off by panels in sun burst yellow and burnt orange. The beds are comfortable and all rooms are equipped with a television set and air conditioning. Every room also has a balcony and a sit out overlooking the garden or the pool depending on the category.

The well manicured lawns lead up to the coconut grove behind the hotel. An occasional tacky plastic dolphin somewhat mars the beauty of the gardens. Food is served in the indoor restaurant that is all lights and suede covered seats. The walk to the Nagoa beach is a short one and the beach itself is fairly empty except on weekends when thirsty Gujarati-folk come to Diu for its liquor shops. However, be warned against trying out the water sports on Nagoa Beach as most operators are unlicensed and unprofessional.
Metatype: Hotels in Diu tend to be of the holiday home variety and Radhika Beach Resort is no exception with double storied tile roofed villas surrounding a paved garden and swimming pool.
Descr: Radhika Beach Resort in Diu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: radhika beach resort, diu, hotel, india, tours, gujarat, special places

WebWriteUp1: Darbargadh Palace is great - not fancy, few frills, but loads of atmosphere and history and run as more of a Heritage Homestay than a hotel by the owner Harendra Singh (Hanu). He will pretty much arrange whatever pax want. The rooms are fine, the food is great, the market and Jain temples at Ambaji are interesting and coulorful, Poshina itself and the nearby villages are interesting, and the terracotta horses on the nearby hill are unique and extraordinary. It is also "nearly" in Rajasthan, so alcohol and non-veg food are easily available. All in all, anyone except for "top end" pax would enjoy staying here.

description:
A wonderful 6 bedroom bungalow in the Carolina Tea Estate. Situated 2.5 km from Coonoor on the Mount Pleasant side, the Tryst has an Olde English feel with rooms filled with wood and cane furniture, antiques and curios. 

It is a cosy home run by a charming couple, who can advise on walks in the unspoilt areas of the Nilgiri Hills. The Tryst is therefore a perfect base for those who wish to relax in beautiful surroundings.
advantage: Set in Tea Estate with Lush Gardens. Surrounding Country-side is Ideal for Walks
roomfacility: The 5 Rooms are all Well appointed in 5 different Themes. Elegant En-suite bathrooms

WebWriteUp1:
Set on the side of a hill surrounded by spectacular scenery, The Tryst is a wonderful home packed with antiques and fine furnishings. The Tryst is owned and run by Dr Sathya Rao, a holistic medical practitioner and writer, and his wife, Ann.

The Tryst has six deluxe bedrooms with luxurious en-suite bathrooms decorated in individual style. 

The estate has two lawns, three gazebos with ponds, waterfalls and fountains, topiary, and fruit, vegetable, herb and medicinal gardens - all organic. 

There are also six secluded sit-outs scattered around the gardens, ideal for reading, writing, sketching, or simply day-dreaming. There is also a music room, a billiards room and a recreation room with various board games, a gymnasium, television and music system.

The library has an excellent collection of books, including some of Dr Rao's own, as well as magazines and comics, and is a favourite haunt of guests.
Metatype: A wonderful 6 bedroom bungalow in the Carolina Tea Estate. Situated 2.5 km from Coonoor on the Mount Pleasant side, the Tryst has an Olde English feel with rooms filled with wood and cane furniture, antiques and curios.

description:
Jungle Retreat offers accommodation in country style cottages with sprawling private verandahs that afford spectacular views of the surrounding hills and tropical jungles. 

The resort is owned and run by the Mathias family who has an extensive knowledge of the area. There is no television, no telephone and no music in the rooms to disturb the peace and quiet of the surroundings. This creates an atmosphere of utter serenity, which is as refreshing as it is rare.
WebWriteUp1:
The Jungle Retreat has an important environmental philosophy. They believe that the natural beauty of the land is best left as is! Outdoor lighting is restricted to only that necessary for orientation, security and safety, and is directed so as to minimize the disturbance to nocturnal wildlife.

12 years ago Jungle Retreat was a sericulture plantation devoid of trees and vegetation. On their 35 acres, the owners began a regeneration and reforestation program, which continues today; protecting and planting diverse species local to the area. Over a hundred species of birds and a whole herd of spotted deer now delight their visitors. More recently Malabar Giant Squirrels, Flying Squirrels and peacocks have begun to frequent the land. On rare occasions even leopards are seen. 

The swimming pool is built to resemble a watering hole. Besides employing 80% local staff, Jungle Retreat have gone a step further and now run a specialist programme in which they train, and subsequently provide work opportunities to, members of the local community. They learn about the importance of interpretation, being responsible guides, and about nature including ornithology (birds) and herpetology (reptiles). 
 
The Jungle Retreat organises a variety of activities, and guests are briefed as to the various options available on arrival.
Metatype: Jungle Retreat offers accommodation in country style cottages with sprawling private verandahs that afford spectacular views of the surrounding hills and tropical jungles.
Descr: Jungle Retreat in Mudumalai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: jungle retreat, wildlife resort, mudumalai, jeep safari, hotel, special places

description: Mankotta is an island in the backwaters near Allapuzha and there is only one home on the island. The owners, a delightful couple, have converted their ancestral home in a small guesthouse with three spacious rooms with ensuite bathroom. This is a perfect place to explore the backwaters in country boats, enjoy the scenic beauty and watch life on a waterfront village. You can see a lot of migratory as well as local birds. Nearby are some ancient temples and churches on the waterfront which are worth visiting.

description:
A specially created fishing village with thatched villas built in the local village style, set in a superb location of 25 acres of coconut palm groves leading down to the vast expanse of white beach. 

The villas are all air-conditioned and offer all the comforts of a superior resort, either in garden villas and deluxe pool villas. The resort also offers a large swimming pool, Ayurveda centre, beach volleyball court and cycles for rent.
advantage: Only beach resort in Central Kerala

WebWriteUp1:
Of the 60 cottages, 13 are private pool villas, with huge private pools. The rest are independent cottages. All are large and very well equipped. 

The extensive grounds have a large swimming pool, a restaurant, plus a separate open air restaurant and bar overlooking the beach, a yoga centre, a butterfly garden, tennis, badminton and volleyball courts, cycles for hire, an Ayurvedic centre, a Yoga and Meditation centre with daily classes, and an extensive programme of daily activities. 

There is direct access onto the beach, which is cleaned and patrolled by the resort's own lifeguards.

The extensive grounds of Marari also harbour a wealth of medicinal plants (helpfully labeled), many of which are used in treatments at the ayurvedic centre. 

The menu at Marari Beach features plenty of fresh fish. The Malabar coast is rich with abundant varieties of seafood, a typical choice may include blue crabs, fat mussels, giant prawns, lobster, sea bass, shark, mackerel, red snapper; barracuda, bigeye, skipjack tuna,  baby octopus, reef cod ...the list is endless.

A long verandah is an ideal place to enjoy a sundowner. Apart from the bar area, the clubhouse has a television (the only one on the premises) and a library.
Metatype: A specially created fishing village with thatched villas built in the local village style, set in a superb location of 25 acres of coconut palm groves leading down to the vast expanse of white beach.
Descr: The Marari Beach Resort in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Over three centuries the Malabar House Residency in Fort Cochin served as a residence for wealthy traders and influential bankers. 

Now the new German owner has converted this heritage building into a small boutique hotel with 12 rooms, all furnished with select antique furniture and artifacts. 

Situated near the famous St. Francis Portuguese Church, it is now one of the most stylish boutique hotels in Cochin.
cuisine: Meditterranean, South Indian and Indian Tandoor & Bar-be-que
advantage: Located in Fort Kochi, walking distance from many Historical landmarks
roomfacility: Attached Modern Bathrooms, CCTV, and are furnished with Authentic Antique Furniture
otherfacility: Swimming Pool, Life-Style Shop, Lush Tropical Gardens
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
The pioneer of stylish boutique hotels in Fort Kochi, Malabar House is a success story. The owner has not only kept his USP of chic style, well chosen art and European/fusion cuisine, but has also created some remarkable boutique hotels elsewhere in Kerala. The flagship though remains the elegant Malabar House with its air of restrained and slightly elitist chic. 

Located in the centre of Fort Kochi, the Malabar House faces the tree lined Maidaan. Inside the gates, lies the almost cloistered atmosphere of this boutique hotel. Just off the elegant lobby, is a small but pretty pool. Frangipani trees droop over it. Towards one end is a small elevated stage where dances are performed, flanked by ancient granite columns. The elegance of the materials chosen and the use of bold colours is breathtaking. 
 
The twelve rooms and suites all incorporate handpicked antique furniture along with well chosen hand-woven fabrics. The luxury is in the use of space and the elegant sense of restraint along with some wonderful works of art. The mattresses are comfortable and the bathrooms imaginative and well appointed.  

The restaurant is decorated in a bold combination of deep red and white with comfortable seating. The menu is eclectic, and makes a delightful change from the standard `tourist' fare.
Metatype: Over three centuries the Malabar House Residency in Fort Cochin served as a residence for wealthy traders and influential bankers.
Descr: The Malabar House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: malabar house, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places

description:
Fort Heritage is located in a 17th century building now converted into a delightful small hotel. 

This hotel has ten spacious air-conditioned rooms, a multi-cuisine restaurant, a lovely garden, and an Ayurvedic massage centre with steam bath.

Fort Heritage is within walking distance of the main sights of Fort Cochin such as the St. Francis Portuguese Church and the Chinese fishing nets.
cuisine: Continental, Chinese Indian with many Syrian Christian Specialities
advantage: Located in the Fort Cochin Area, Close to many Historical Monuments
roomfacility: All Rooms Furnished in Period Furniture, All with En-suite Facilities, Hot & Cold Running Water
otherfacility: Ayurvedic Massage Centre & Steam Bath, Lawn & Gardens
WebWriteUp1:
In a small street close to the centre of Fort Kochi is Fort Heritage, an old aristocratic Dutch building. The wooden entrance lobby leads to a large room, formerly a formal reception room, which is now the dining area. There are large old fashioned mirrors on the wall elegant chandeliers and wall scones illuminate the place. The dining area opens at the rear into a courtyard garden which is ideal for early morning cup of tea or late afternoon snack. 

Upstairs from the dining area is yet another large room which may have been a ball room originally. The combination of the expanse of wooden floors and high ceilings make this a wonderful lounge. Don't miss the traditional wooden swing supported by brass chains from the ceilings! 

The rooms are spread along the lower area, or on the upper level reached by a gracious wooden staircase. There are also additional rooms in another wing of the L shaped building. The rooms in the old building have muted light while the ones in the newer part are brighter. All of them are comfortably furnished and have spacious private facilities.
Metatype: A 17th century building now converted into a delightful small hotel.
Descr: Fort Heritage in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort heritage, cochin, kochi, kerala, hotel, special places

description:
A delightful farm house style resort in the hills 3 km from Munnar, with great views of the surrounding mountains, Windermere has a quiet and subtle charm. 

Set in a private cardamom and tea estate and located high in the hills, there are cottages in different styles - all of them are spacious and well furnished with sturdy wooden pieces. 

A short walk leads to an observation point from where there are spectacular mountain views.
advantage: Planter's Home in Lush Tea Estate
roomfacility: Well Furnished Rooms with En-suite Facilities
otherfacility: Visit to Tea Factory, Indo-Swiss Cattle Project, Boating & Trout Fishing Can be Arranged
services: Dining Room, Living Room
WebWriteUp1:
A lovely small plantation resort, Windermere is more like an extended homestay. It is the private property of a successful eye-surgeon from Kochi, Dr Simon and his family.  

The main building is an elegantly symmetrical stone building with a sloping roof characteristic of this hilly area. A flight of stone steps in a landscaped garden leads you to the upper level which is a gently undulating plateau. The cottages are scattered here, with enough distance between them to remain private and peaceful. 

Another building here houses the dining room and above this is a lounge cum library. Golden hued wood is used generously; with large pillars supporting the roof. This is very reminiscent of the graceful simplicity of the Shaker style of architecture. The small pantry/kitchen resembles a country cottage and the whole area exudes a warm atmosphere on chilly evenings. 

The food served is of the highest quality - freshly prepared breakfasts with cereals, home grown fruit and warm breads. Dinner is a combination of western and Kerala dishes. Tea and coffee, the staple of this area, is served through the day in a small thatched pavilion in the garden. 

Windermere is very much a working cardamom estate and the air is gently scented with the smell of the spice. The resort offers walks along plantations and visits to a tea factory or cardamom curing unit. There are also guided treks to a nearby waterfall in the surrounding hills.
Metatype: A delightful farm house style resort in the hills 3 km from Munnar, with great views of the surrounding mountains, Windermere has a quiet and subtle charm.
Descr: Windermere Estate in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: windermere estate, munnar, kerala, boutique hotel, tea plantations

description:
This resort was one of the first to come up in the beautiful Wayanad district of Kerala, famous for its rainforests and plantation at high elevation.

Vythiri Resort is a lovely place set in a beautiful seven-acre plot of lush rain forest. There are three boulder-strewn mountain streams flowing through it - one waterfall has created a wonderful plunge pool. 

Tasteful cottages and rooms with private balconies are scattered throughout the lush area. There are also thatched huts with a tribal theme.
advantage: Unique Resort in the Wynad Hills offering Fabulous Jungle and Valley Views
roomfacility: Well Appointed Rooms, All with En-suite facilities with H/C water, Most Rooms with Sit-outs or Balconies
otherfacility: Swimming Pool
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call, Safe Deposit Lockers, Travel Assistance, Table Tennis
WebWriteUp1:
Set amidst acres of rain forest in Wayanad, Kerala - Vythiri resort is one of the most sensitively designed rain forest resorts in India. The gurgling of streams and the chirping and hooting of birds is all the company you can expect. 

Located off the main road, and approached by a steep dirt track, Vythiri Resort is located in a dramatic section of the forest. The resort is spread over 150 acres, with its own ravines, streams and plantations. 

A bamboo bridge crosses a small ravine to reach the rooms from the reception area - one one of the many adventurous elements of staying at Vythiri. There are different kinds of rooms, most in cottages and some in tree houses.
 
The age old trees near Vythiri soar high over the smaller ones, their canopies reaching many meters above ground. The tree houses are built on strong platforms resting on the forks in the branches. The access to one of these is an ingenious pulley (operated on the principle of counter-weights) cage! Once in the tree house, you are entirely surrounded by the tree tops. Spending a night there is an unbelievable experience. 

Even if this kind of adventure is not for you, there is plenty to be enjoyed while living closer to terra firma. Every room has a balcony from which you can enjoy the forest which surrounds you. Day and night, the forest is alive with birdsong. Some of the largest butterflies in India can be see here. 

The resort has a good sized pool, a health club, an Ayurveda centre and a restaurant serving Kerala delicacies as well as a choice of Continental cuisine.
Metatype: This resort was one of the first to come up in the beautiful Wayanad district of Kerala, famous for its rainforests and plantation at high elevation.
Descr: Vythiri Resort in Vythiri - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: vythiri resort, wayanad, kerala, rainforest, tree houses, birds, special places

description:

WebWriteUp1:
High above the main streets of Bangalore, MG Road and Brigade Road, Hotel Ivory Tower occupies the 13th floor of Barton Centre. Barton Centre itself has many interesting shops and the area immediately next to the hotel has many more shopping centres, bookshops, cinerma halls, and eateries of all kinds. One cannot get more central than this. 

The hotel itself is very popular for its restaurant, Ebony, which serves excellent Parsee food. There is also the relaxing `13th Floor' lounge which plays upbeat music and offers a range of cocktails and snacks that can be enjoyed while overlooking the breathtaking views of city lights.
 
The rooms at the Ivory Towers are of a good size; with the most spacious being the suites. Most rooms offer panoramic views of the Bangalore skyline. The service is courteous and attentive.
Metatype: An excellent mid range choice, this is a modern `all-suite' hotel located on the top floors of a tall building on Bangalore's main shopping street.

WebWriteUp1:
This delightful resort is set in 300 acres of working coffee and spice plantation. The district of Coorg is at an elevation of 800 metres and offers a wonderful climate, much cooler than the plains of southern India. 

A portion of the resort is on the banks of the Cauvery river and there are many good walks along the water and even a peaceful coracle ride. The resort also has its own small lake where guests can enjoy paddle boating. There are many recreational amenities including a table tennis table, a badminton court and even some bicycles to explore the nearby areas.

The rooms are all in stand alone cottages, offering a good deal of privacy and peace. All rooms feature some characteristics of local Kodavu architecture. The most expensive villa has a private swimming pool.
Metatype: A delightful resort with mock Tudor style bungalows scattered around a lovely garden.
Descr: Orange County - Coorg in Siddhapura - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Kabini River Lodge -- the former Maharaja's hunting lodge, with its vast wooded compound, splendid lakeside scenery and gracious old-world air, is one of the best wildlife resorts in South India. 

Professionally organised jeep safaris guarantee good sighting of wildlife. There is a short elephant ride in the jungle and a lovely coracle trip on the river to observe the bird life. 

Your stay is on full board and includes all jungle activities.
advantage: Adjacent to the Nagarahole National Park On the Bank of the River Kabini
roomfacility: H/C running water, Telephone, In the Reception - STD, Facilities, Conference Hall With Colour TV & Multi Media Projector, Video Films on Wild Life
otherfacility: Conference Facilities, Picture Post Card / T. Shirts & Caps for Sale, Wild Life Drives In jeeps / Coracle & Motor Boat Rides ? Elephant Ride
services: Laundry, Safe Deposit, Fax
creditcards: AMEX, CAN, VISA, Master, Andhra, ANZ, Citi
WebWriteUp1:
Kabini River Lodge has colonial style architecture. There are fourteen spacious double rooms with modern amenities, ten twin-bedded cottages in sylvan surroundings, and six tented cottages with attached modern bathrooms. There is no air conditioning, or television. The setting is a well maintained 54-acre campus, surrounded on three sides by the bend of the River Kabini..

The Viceroy's building houses a well stocked bar. The dining area, called the Ghol Ghar, is a circular, open sided gazebo, overlooking the river Kabini, serving a buffet of Indian, Chinese or Continental food.

Kabini offers an enchanting experience all through the year. However, during the dry season, especially in March, April and May, many of the elephants from the surrounding forests converge around the waters of the river, and feed on the grass growing on the dried out river banks. This is when you can view the largest congregation of Asiatic wild elephants anywhere in the world.
Metatype: This former Maharaja's hunting lodge, with its vast wooded compound, splendid lakeside scenery and gracious old-world air, is one of the best wildlife resorts in South India.
Descr: Kabini River Lodge in Nagarhole - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: kabini river lodge, nagarhole, wildlife, sanctuary, special places

description:
A delightful former summer palace of the Maharaja of Bikaner. Set on vast garden lands with its own private lake, the palace has 33 large and airy rooms with high ceilings, almost all furnished with original period furniture. 

The grand formal dining room serves traditional Rajasthani as well as Continental cuisine. There are two tennis courts and a billiards room.
advantage: Ideal Place for Relaxing

WebWriteUp1:
Besides once being the summer residence of the Maharaja of Bikaner, this was for decades also the center of Mount Abu's aristocratic social life. Built in 1893 and now a Heritage Hotel, it still feels something like a hunting lodge, and is a good place to retreat and relax for a few days. 

The grounds of this old estate are large and worth exploring at leisure. The two tennis courts are flanked by the high mountains and great scenery. 

The handsome dining room has seen many dignitaries in its past and serves a mix of Indian and Continental dishes. 
Each of the 33 rooms and suites have been modrnised while keeping the feel of the past.
Metatype: A delightful former summer palace of the Maharaja of Bikaner. WebWriteUp1:
Built right on the banks of the backwaters where they curve around a large hill, Kadavu is a large resort. Located on a cliff, Kadavu offers fabulous views from many locations including the gardens, restaurant, Ayurvedic spa and many of the rooms. 

There is a large swimming pool, two restaurants and a specialist Ayurvedic treatment centre. Many cultural shows take place in the amphitheatre overlooking the backwaters and the palm groves. 

The rooms are either in separate cottages or in the large main building, and most have good views over the backwaters. The separate cottages have a much greater feeling of privacy.
Metatype: A modern resort on the backwaters near Khozikhode, Kadavu consists of air-conditioned and well-appointed cottages built on an aesthetically landscaped hillock sloping down to the river.

description:
A 19th century palace set in beautiful formal gardens. The decor is rich with much of the original furniture intact.

There are 18 spacious air-conditioned rooms with large bathrooms and 5 rooms at the royal cottage, an annexe of the palace. 

Set among 10 acres of woodland this hotel also features an enormous Roman style swimming pool, a fitness centre, and tennis courts.
advantage: Well Preserved Palace makes an Ideal Base for Visits to Palitana Jain Temples, Velavader Black-buck Sanctuary
roomfacility: Mostly Furnished with Original Colonial Furniture. En-suite Baths, H/C Running Water, TV, Channel Music
services: 24 Hour Room Service, Travel Desk, Exchange Counter, Roman Style Swimming Pool
WebWriteUp1:
The imposing lobby of the hotel was once the royal living room and much of its original furniture such as the heavily carved wooden entrance, the Czechoslovakian chandeliers and the larger than life portraits of the royal family are still in place today,.  
The building, in accordance with traditional Gujarati architecture, has an open central courtyard that lets in natural light and breeze. The rooms are on both floors of the hotel, wrapped around this paved courtyard. 

As is the case with all heritage hotels, the rooms are of differing sizes. However, the treasure trove of furniture has been generously divided amongst all the rooms and is a mixture of Rococo, traditional Indian, modern and Victorian styles. The bathrooms are modern and well sized. 

Meals can be served in the traditional dining hall inside the palace or in the garden just behind the palace. Breakfast is often served on the verandah overlooking the garden.
 
The hotel has much to offer in the way of entertainment and recreation. Apart from the health club and tennis courts housed at the end of the garden, there is also a faux Roman swimming pool in the grounds and a cosy library with overstuffed armchairs in which to relax.
Metatype: A 19th century palace set in beautiful formal gardens. The decor is rich with much of the original furniture intact.
Descr: Nilambag Palace Hotel in Bhavnagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nilambag palace, bhavnagar, heritage hotel, gujarat, special  places

description:
Even from a distance the domes of The Palace Utelia are seen silhouetted over the flat plateau of the region as they rise above the humbler tiled roofs of the small village. 

The palace is built in the best of the Indo Saracenic styles with domes, arches, and pillars. 

The rooms are of 2 types - standard and deluxe but are all graced with the same enchanting period furniture and high ceilings. 

The magic of Utelia coupled with conversations with the feudalistic hosts are sure to take you on a trip back in time.
advantage: Peaceful Village Location. An Ideal Base to Visit Lothal, A Site where Remnants of Indus Valley Civilization were found
roomfacility: Comfortably Furnished Rooms with En-suite Facilities, Running H/C Water
otherfacility: Excursions to Lothal, Velavadar, Horse Riding
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call, Village Tours
WebWriteUp1:
The deluxe rooms are distinguished by the careful choice of furniture and the dry dressing area that extends from the bathroom. The Victorian four poster bed with hand painted panels and dressing table are sure to make you wish your suitcase was big enough to carry them away in. The elegant dressing area also features a sunlight bathed cushioned alcove. 

The standard rooms are perhaps more simply done up but nevertheless evoke visions of turbaned men with swords and charging horses. Their floors are a mix of Rajasthani yellow sandstone and multicoloured cement tiles. They also feature the same dream inducing four poster beds and modern bathrooms, but minus the extended dressing area. 

Meals are served in the palm and bougainvillea ringed garden or in the formal dining room and the kitchen effortlessly churns out an abundance of dishes of multiple origin. But perhaps you will spend most of your time at the palace lounging on the long armed cane chairs that line the peach coloured verandahs along with priceless family memorabilia.
Metatype: Even from a distance the domes of The Palace Utelia are seen silhouetted over the flat plateau of the region as they rise above the humbler tiled roofs of the small village.
Descr: The Palace Utelia in Utelia - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Devi Bhawan is a delightful little garden hotel, run by a friendly young Rajput couple, Rambha and her husband Pritviraj Singh.  

A series of cottages surround a lush garden full of old trees, flower-beds and lawns with peacocks roaming around. The rooms are charmingly decorated with some period furniture and bright colourful Rajasthani fabrics. Devi Bhawan also has a good sized pool, set to one side in a screened off area.
WebWriteUp1:
Being on the edge of the desert makes Jodhpur a dry city. Therefore, walking into the Devi Bhawan compound is such a pleasant surprise. The first thing you notice is the garden - which seems to have its own micro-climate. 

The garden is dominated by a large neem tree which provides shade to much of the area. There is a small fountain, which adds to the cooling effect. The gardens are a true delight, to sit and read, to birdwatch, or simply to relax. 

Shaded paths in the garden lead to the rooms, in cottage style buildings. Small courtyards and terraces adjoin the rooms, which all offer good views of the garden. The rooms are comfortable and good sized, have spotlessly clean bathrooms and a private sit-out. The furnishings are tasteful and of an old colonial style. 

The restaurant has a small indoor section and a larger seating space on a patio overlooking the fountains in the garden. The food is freshly cooked, and the kitchen is supervised personally by Rambha - the beautiful lady of the house. 

There is an attractive swimming pool, off to one side in a screened off area, surrounded by its own lawns and garden. Both sunbathers and shade-seekers will find a suitable place for themselves on the large deck and surrounding areas.
Metatype: Devi Bhawan is a delightful little garden hotel, run by a friendly young Rajput couple, Rambha and her husband Pritviraj Singh.
Descr: Devi Bhawan in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: devi bhawan, jodhpur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, garden, special places

description: A 300 year old sandstone haveli in the old part of Jaisalmer, Nachana Haveli has a lovely secluded courtyard with narrow corridors leading to the rooms scattered throughout the building. The rooms vary in size but they are all full of character, furnished with lovely traditional carved furniture and old paintings and relics. The rooftop Saffron restaurant has fine views of Jaisalmer Fort and is a popular gathering place in the evenings.
WebWriteUp1:
A quirky haveli right in the centre of the old city, Nachana Haveli has much going for it. The small haveli is home to a brother-sister duo, who have managed to infuse some funky charm in the traditional building, giving guests a chance to live in a genuine haveli with quaintly furnished rooms and an unbeatable location from which to explore the amazing city of Jaisalmer. 

You may almost miss the entrance gate to the haveli, as it is so well-blended into the surrounding buildings. The entrance is flanked by two semi open pavilions - originally meant for the gatemen on security duty. 

Inside, the passage widens into the front courtyard - giving a glimpse of the interiors including another courtyard further in. This series of courtyards give the various areas privacy and peace from the busy street outside. 

There are only 14 rooms, of a modest size, but all given character by the antique furniture and paintings. Once again, bright colours and opulent fabrics create a funky atmosphere. The rooms have windows that overlook either the central courtyard or the adjoining havelis. All rooms have en-suite bathrooms, with some of the newly renovated bathrooms being very stylish.

The rooftop restaurant serves good Indian food and has fabulous views of the Jaisalmer fort, of the fascinating street scenes below and a few of the famous havelis nearby.
Metatype: A 300 year old sandstone haveli in the old part of Jaisalmer. From the lovely secluded courtyard there are narrow corridors branching off to the rooms which are scattered throughout the building.
Descr: Nachana Haveli in Jaisalmer - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nachana haveli, jaisalmer, rajasthan, heritage hotel, fort, desert, special places

description:
The Camel Camp at Osian is a deluxe tented camp on rolling sand dunes, evocative of "the Arabian Nights". It has fabulous views over the desert and the ancient temples of Osian. 

The camp comprises luxurious tents with comfortable furniture with an attached shower and toilet. Each tent has a little canopied sit-out from where one can enjoy the desert landscape. There is a lovely lounge bar, a restaurant and a fabulous swimming pool sure to make your camping experience royal in style!
advantage: Located on Rolling Sand Dunes with Excellent Views of the Desert till the Horizon
roomfacility: Well Furnished Tents with Attached Toilets, Private Sit-outs and Insect Screens
otherfacility: Cocktails on the Sand Dune, Camp-fires,
services: Separate Dining Area and a Cozy Lodge with Library and a Selection of Music
WebWriteUp1:
A deluxe tented camp on some of the best sand dunes you are likely to see in Rajasthan, this Camel Camp is situated just outside the small village of Osian, and provides fabulous views over the desert.

You approach the Camel Camp along a dusty desert road until you reach a large fort-like entrance. This grand entrance adds a surreal touch to what is a whimsically luxurious tented camp. The camp is the brainchild of Reggie Singh, grandson of Maharaj Ratan Singh - a royal of Jodhpur, famous for his polo and shikaar exploits.

The camp comprises spacious and luxurious tents furnished with colourful dhurries, solid wooden beds, a dressing table with mirror, and a small luggage rack. The inside fabric of the tents is also printed with traditional motifs, making them cheerful and bright. The bathrooms are imaginative, with stone flooring and a wash basin, toilet, and shower area. Each tent has a small patio in front with easy lounging chairs.

The central covered area has a thatched bar and restaurant. The long bar has informal lounge style chairs on two different levels. The atmosphere is very much like that of a game lodge, with photos from the old hunting days adorning the mud-plastered walls. On the other side is the dining hall which is enclosed by knee high walls. Along a long wall are the buffet and dining tables. On winter nights the many lamps and candles create a warm ambience. 

Nearby, on another level, is the swimming pool - a touch of unashamed luxury in the desert. A simple, thatch covered pavilion offers shade in the blazing afternoons. From this height, there are extensive views over the desert.
 
Around the Camel Camp are some of the highest dunes of the Thar Desert. A camel ride here is an exhilarating experience. You mount camels from the bottom of the dune and return to camp in time for sunset and champagne cocktails by the poolside.
Metatype: A deluxe tented camp on rolling sand dunes, evocative of "the Arabian Nights". Situated just outside Osian, the camp has fabulous views over the desert and the ancient temples of Osian.
Descr: The Camel Camp Osian in Osian - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: camel camp, osian, rajasthan, desert, luxury tents, camel safari, special places

description:
Tranquil is a delightful and secluded resort set in a 400 acre coffee plantation.
 
This sprawling 70 year old bungalow full of old-world charm has 8 comfortable rooms. Staying here with the convivial hosts is a fabulous way of getting to know plantation life, in a peaceful environment.

You can swim in the pool, lounge in a hammock, have a therapeutic Ayurvedic massage or spend a day trekking to the Edakal Caves.
advantage: Home Stay of the Best kind, Tranqul is a part of a 400 Acre Coffee & Pepper Plantation
roomfacility: Beautifully Furnished Rooms with En-suite Facilities
otherfacility: Walks in the Plantation, Excursion to Wildlife Park
services: Swimming Pool, Ayurvedic Massage Centre
WebWriteUp1:
Tranquil is one of the best homestays in Kerala. The main house is a sprawling affair in warm wood, with warp around verandahs adorned with hanging potted plants and easy chairs, in an atmosphere of bonhomie. 

The rooms are either in cottages or in a tree house. Since Tranquil is surrounded by the plantation, there is no disturbance beyond the sounds of nature. The rooms are  imaginatively designed and are spotlessly clean. However, you may find yourself spending most of the time on one of the verandahs or at the look-out points which have great views all around. 

There is a wonderful swimming pool set in the garden, and the gardens are immaculate with a riot of colours. 

The hosts are delightful and enjoy spending time with the guests. They are well traveled themselves so there will be plenty of stimulating conversation with them, as well as other guests. The atmosphere is very much like that of a house party. 

There are plenty of walks nearby, such as the plantation walk: it is amazing how much you will see and learn in a short couple of hours. Tranquil also organizes jeep safaris in the surrounding forests where you may be able to see wildlife, and will definitely see plenty of birds.
Metatype: Tranquil is a delightful and secluded resort set in a 400 acre coffee plantation.
Descr: Tranquil Resort in Sultan Battery - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: tranquil resort, sultan battery, wayanad, kerala, heritage bungalow, plantation

description:
Cutting edge chic on a hill-top Nilaya Hermitage is an exclusive boutique hotel, perched on the crest of Arpora hill. It has a spectacular swimming pool and just 12 guest rooms, each one of a unique detailed fantasy. 

The rooms have bold colours that liven up the walls, there are amazing pillars, and a special acoustic chamber for meditation. 

The hotel provides superb views of the paddy fields and plantations of the coastal plains and the Arabian Sea beyond.
cuisine: Fusion of Eastern & Western Cuisine, with Emphasis on Fresh Sea Food
advantage: Exceptional Boutique Hotel in  a Heavenly loaction on top of a hill
roomfacility: Each Room Individually Decorated after a Theme. Exclusive Furniture and Daring Colour Schemes, All rooms with En-suite facilities, some with open to sky bathrooms
otherfacility: Car Rental, Excursions to beaches and other places of interest
services: In-house Laundry, Doctor on Call, Swimming Pool, Health Club with Ayurvedic Massage, Steam Bath, Jogging Track
WebWriteUp1:
Nilaya means `heaven'. When Hari Ajwani and Claudia Derain opened Nilaya in the early 90s, they were true pioneers. Until then, no one in Goa had ever thought of building a small hotel in the hills, and not on the beach. Apart from the choice of location away from the beach, Nilaya also broke every stereotype of a `hotel'. It didn't have any of the conventional `must have' features of hotels otherwise found in Goa, such as a large lobby, a reception, 24 hours coffee shop, room service, etc!  

What it did have is rooms hidden away on several levels amongst vast gardens, a swimming pool large enough to hold all the guests at the same time, and a total sense of privacy. Generally, only in-house guests have the access to the property, which perches atop the Arpora hill, with the coastline visible past paddy fields and coconut groves.  

The rooms, named after various natural elements, like earth, fire etc, are designed in Claudia's impeccable if startlingly bold style. Vibrant colours liven up the walls, there are amazing pillars, and even special acoustic chambers for meditation. The furniture is often of wrought iron or wood.  One thing Nilaya was and remains is uniquely original. 

A beautifully designed dining area overlooks the swimming pool and the horizon beyond. There are also tables scattered in the large gardens.
Metatype: Cutting edge chic on a hill-top. This very exclusive boutique hotel, perched on the crest of Arpora hill,  has a spectacular swimming pool and just 12 guest rooms, each one of a unique detailed fantasy.
Descr: Nilaya Hermitage in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nilaya hermitage, arpora, boutique hotel, goa, beach, pool, special places

description:
An exquisite, tropical hideaway set in superb tropical gardens, Pausada Tauma is built in laterite stone around a lovely natural swimming pool. 

The hotel has 12 comfortable villas, each with its own garden, lush with tropical plants. The rooms are decorated in earthy colours so as to blend in with the surroundings. 

Pousada's restaurant, the Copper Bowl, serves great coastal food with an emphasis on sea food.
advantage: All suite Boutique Hotel with Award Winning Design
roomfacility: Each suite has a Private dining area, bedroom with a dressing table, wardrobe, Patio with  private garden/terrace. Direct dialing facilities, TV with satellite channels, Minibar
otherfacility: Fully Equipped Ayurveda Centre, Swimming Pool
services: Travel Desk, Car Rental, Foreign Currency Exchange, Laundry Service,
WebWriteUp1:
Neville Proenca has created a paradise hideaway right in the busy Calangute area. When you enter the wrought iron gates of the Posada Tauma, you leave behind the crowds, the noise and the general hubbub of the tourist belt. 

For tucked away inside this gate, is the world of Pousada Tauma - with tropical greenery, rare plants and red stone cottages scattered around a large azure pool. Walking around the Pousada, is a visual, and olfactory treat. Red laterite arches against the blue skies, blooming creepers and graceful frangipani trees with every conceivable coloured flower and the soothing gurgle of water over the rocks. 

Pousada's twelve suites are in cottages, and all are based on various charming themes; Sea, Garden, Castle, Field and Mountain.  Each suite has its own private sit-out, a lounge/living area and a spacious bedroom. The furniture and furnishings are specifically made for the particular room. The overall ambience is one of elegance in a country style - no polished marbles or smelly wall to wall carpets here. Arched windows let in plenty of bright sunlight. There is also a complete Ayurveda spa in its own separate area. Underneath is a well equipped gym. 

Sitting out near your own suite either on the terrace or the gardens, you will be amazed at the sheer variety of rare plants interspersed with lily ponds and water bodies. To one end of the garden, is a large, man-made lagoon filled with Koi. This lagoon attracts a large number of birds: pond herons, egrets and the brilliant blue Kingfishers.
Metatype: An exquisite, tropical hideaway set in superb tropical gardens.

description:
The most celebrated of Darjeeling hotels, The Windamere Hotel has accommodated a pantheon of rich and famous guests. 

The Windamere has 27 old-fashioned, independent cottages with Raj period furniture and crackling fireplaces lit at night. 

The hotel serves traditional English food at meal times and High Tea is accompanied by the hotel's string quartet. The cozy bar is beautiful too.
advantage: A British Raj `Jewell', Located on Obersvatory Hill with Unsurpassed Views of the Himalayas
roomfacility: In order to preserve the peaceful atmosphere, TV & Telephones are only limited  to Annexe houses. All Rooms with original colonial furniture.
otherfacility: Windamere has its own company of Artistes who perform in an outdoor setting, DHR Club for Railway Enthusiasts in the Windamere Grounds
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
The Windamere Hotel is utterly and unashamedly nostalgic. Most of the rooms have no televisions or telephones, high tea is regarded more as an institution than refreshment, and dinner is only served to the appropriately attired. The low roofed cottages are set well apart from each other and bear elegant names such as 'The Snuggery'. The chintzy charm however is of the relaxed and inviting kind.

The rooms at the Windamere Hotel come in a variety of shapes and sizes. But they all have gorgeous views over the hills or of the hotel's flowers gardens. The beds are comfortable but not elaborate, and you can be sure that the sofas and armchairs have a long and interesting history. Many bathroroms feature claw footed bathtubs that once belonged to the Loreto Girl's Convent.

Only residents are allowed to enter the Daisy Music Room for high tea which consists of Darjeeling tea, scones and crumbly cookies. Dinner is a formal affair and along with lunch, is served according to a set menu of the day which usually includes continental dishes along with a selection of local fare. 

Do peep into the Darjeeling Hill Railway's Club room to enjoy their documentary about the history of the 100 year old toy train. Here, as well as in all the indoor spaces of the hotel, lithographs, black and white photos, and sketches cover the walls. Old and fragile, you are asked not to photograph them, but they provide a unique insight into the Darjeeling of a century ago.
Metatype: The most celebrated of Darjeeling hotels, which has accommodated a pantheon of rich and famous guests.
Descr: Windamere Hotel in Darjeeling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: windamere, hotel, luxury, heritage hotel, darjeeling, british raj, special places

description:
A well-preserved Victorian mansion dating back to 1885, The Elgin has interiors that are dominated by teak floorboards covered with Tibetan hand-made rugs, comfortable over-stuffed armchairs, and crackling log-fires. 

The 25 rooms are all charmingly designed with period furniture and many have marble bathrooms and open fire-places.
advantage: Below the mall
otherfacility: Banquet & Conference Facilities, Health Club, Swimming Pool, Tennis, Golf, Discotheque, Water Sports
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
The Elgin hotel in Darjeeling has been running for close to a hundred years now. Built as the summer residence for the Maharaja of Cooch Behar, the Elgin then went on to change hands several times, without losing much of its original charm and elegance. Nevertheless the rooms have been modernized and fitted with several conveniences. The liveried waiters, fluted furniture and Anglo-Indian cuisine however, firmly declare the Elgin to be a child of the sepia tinted British Raj days.  

Most of the rooms at the Elgin have large windows that frame Darjeeling's rolling hills and let in vast amounts of light. Warm maroons and muted golds set off large white beds. Colourful Tibetan rugs cover the wood floors and elegant satin covered armchairs complete the rooms. 

The set meals are served in the 'The Orchid Room' and the food tends to be a mixture of fresh mountain vegetables, meat and the occasional river fish, served in Continental, Indian and the hybrid Anglo-Indian style.

You may find yourself lingering in the hotel's salon - 'The Douglas Room', with its low coffee tables, century old moulded ceilings and warm lighting. This is also a good spot for the afternoon high-tea with home made, jam-filled cookies. Or you may choose to relax out on the patio in true colonial style, watching the sun set and the mist rise over the lawns of the hotel.
Metatype: A well-preserved Victorian mansion dating back to 1885.
Descr: The Elgin in Darjeeling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the elgin, colonial, heritage hotel, darjeeling, british raj, special places

description:
A delightful hotel in a lovely garden, Nor-Khill used to be the royal guest house of the Chogyal dynasty. 

Now a warm and well run hotel belonging to the Elgin group of Darjeeling, Nor-Khill has traditional decor. There are 30 rooms, all clean and comfortably furnished. Your stay is on full board basis. The hotel offers good views over the surrounding countryside.
advantage: Centrally Located Above Paljor stadium
roomfacility: Room Service, 24 hrs. H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Tea/Coffee maker
otherfacility: Banquet & Conference Facilities, Garden
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Counter
WebWriteUp1:
Norkhill was built for the Chogyal (King) of Sikkim in the early 20th century. Today it is the oldest heritage hotel in Gangtok, and has a distinct sense of style and luxury. Perched on a hill overlooking a sports ground, the hotel is located a few minutes drive outside of Gangtok. Life inside Norkhill continues at a slower, more tranquil pace.
 
The rooms are sumptuous but not overwhelming, and the generous use of satin and rich colours evoke the royal past of the hotel. This is balanced by brightly coloured hand woven rugs on the wooden floors. Almost all rooms have wide windows which look out towards the mountains and let in bracing air and warm sunshine.

The intimate Dragon Bar is where the Chogyal of Sikkim would sip a warming drink or two. The original gilded pillars and Tibetan style furniture have been retained and the bar is a good place to try the flavourful Sikkimese millet beer or Tongba. The meals at the Norkhill are carefully designed to include a range of cuisines.  

The front lawn has comfortable cane chairs and sun umbrellas for protection from the strong mountain sun. The hotel has on display, a large number of traditional hand painted thangkas, motifs and icons sacred to Tibetan Buddhism.
Metatype: A delightful hotel in a lovely garden, Nor-Khill used to be the royal guest house of the Chogyal dynasty.
Descr: Nor Khill Hotel in Gangtok - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nor-khill hotel, heritage, gangtok, sikkim, elgin, special places

description:
A member of the `Heritage Houses of the Himalayas', Netuk House is the old house of a prominent Sikkimese family, the Dengzompas. 

This small family-run hotel has 12 spacious, well-furnished rooms in ethnic Sikkimese style. All rooms have attached modern bathrooms. The hotel has fine views from the rooftop terrace, and a friendly and hospitable atmosphere.
advantage: More a Home than a Hotel, Member of the Heritage Houses of the Himalayas.
roomfacility: Spacious, Well Furnished Room using Many Sikkimese elements. Attached modern  Bathrooms with H/C Water
otherfacility: Terrace with Good Views of Gangtok & Kanchenjonga with its surrounding Country-side
services: Doctor on Call, Guide Services, Taxi Hire, Travel Assistance
WebWriteUp1:
A family run establishment located within walking distance of Gangtok's M.G. Road, Netuk House is a low stone building with painted wooden columns and ornamental brackets carved and painted in the colourful Tibetan style. The rooms are unpretentious and uncluttered and have balconies overlooking the central courtyard. The living room also reflects the Tibetan heritage of the family.

The 12 rooms are simple, with wooden floors and pinewood wainscoting and some slightly aged furniture. Hand painted flower motifs cover the walls of the rooms in the older building. The rooms in the newer wing are decorated in a more European style with pistachio green walls and checked bedspreads. 

The dining area is in the new building and meals tend to consist mainly of Sikkimese specialties, with some Indian or Continental dishes. The common sitting room is furnished with traditional Tibetan hand painted low tables and sofas. 

Located on a quiet street just off the main road, Netuk House is ideally situated for exploring Gangtok on foot, whilst maintaining a sense of privacy.
Metatype: A member of the `Heritage Houses of the Himalayas' ,Netuk House is the old house of a prominent Sikkimese family, the Dengzompas.
Descr: Netuk House in Gangtok - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: netuk house, heritage hotel, gangtok, sikkim, special places

A luxury boutique hotel in Kalimpong which offers 25 rooms of great charm. Most of the spacious rooms are furnished with heavy original furniture. 

The ivy-covered building is set in landscaped gardens filled with orchids and ferns. The gardens slope down towards pine, rhododendron and magnolia trees.

WebWriteUp1:
The Silver Oaks was built in 1930 and once belonged to the prominent architect Frederick Desraj who built the old Teesta Bridge. It used to be a boarding house for the Britishers away from the hot and dusty plains.

The Silver Oaks hotel sits on a quiet street just off the main market junction of Kalimpong. The steeply sloping lawns rise towards the low building that is Silver Oaks. The long, handsome front lobby has a formal feel, but the staff is warm and welcoming. The large, stately rooms all overlook the manicured gardens and Kanchenjunga beyond. 

The rooms at the Silver Oaks hotel are grand, both in their size and decor. Deep, forest greens and royal reds colour the rooms and the glossy hardwood floors bear thick carpets. The clean lines and round edges of the furniture speak of a return to Art Deco chic - elegant but unimposing. The rooms are built on a generous scale and offer wide views.

The dining room is, again, a slightly formal space with straight backed, skinny wooden chairs and crisp white linen tablecloths, and offers Indian and Continental food. The bar, on the other hand, is a snug, warmer area whose round bay window looks out over the front lawn.

Kalimpong's busy shopping streets are a mere 5 minute walk away from the peace and quiet of the hotel's lawns.
Metatype: Once a boarding house for the Britishers away from the hot and dusty plains, Silver Oaks now offers 25 rooms of great charm. Most of the spacious rooms are furnished with in heavy original furniture.
Descr: Silver Oaks in Kalimpong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: silver oaks, elgin, heritage hotel, kalimpong, special places

description:
This heritage hotel is owned by descendants of David Macdonald who, as British Trade Agent, helped the Dalai Lhama escape from Tibet in 1910. It was here that he wrote "Land of the Lhama" and "Twenty Years in Tibet". 

The Heritage Rooms have a nostalgic ambience - rose motifs cover the bedspreads and curtains and sturdy armchairs face the working fireplaces. The new Annexe Rooms may not bear the same imprint of British country life but they tend to be brighter, with larger windows and balconies.
cuisine: Indian, European, Chinese, Tibetan on Request
advantage: Close to Down Town Area
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Safe Deposit, In House Generator, TV in Lounge, Garden with Front Lawn
otherfacility: Car Parking, Golf can be Arranged near by
services: Doctor on Call, Money Changer, Banking, Baby Sitting, Valet, Fax
WebWriteUp1:
Famed Tibetologist and foreign affairs expert, David Macdonald built his family home in Kalimpong in the early 1900's. This handsome home would later be turned into a hotel and play host to such distinguished guests as Sir Edmund Hillary, Tenzing Norgay and Prince Peter of Greece. Even today the hotel remains in the hands of the Macdonald family and is a chintz covered memento of that exciting age.

The Himalayan Hotel has heritage rooms housed in the original structure, and more recently built rooms in the annexe buildings. Most bathrooms have doors that lead out onto a small balcony with a view, and there are winding wrought iron staircases that lead out of the bedrooms and into the garden.

The common areas in the hotel include the charming gardens, punctuated by such features as a wisteria draped covered walkway and tall pines. Meals are served in the soberly lit dining area which includes a friendly bar.
Metatype: This heritage hotel is owned by descendants of David Macdonald who, as British Trade Agent, helped the Dalai Lhama escape from Tibet in 1910. It was here that he wrote "Land of the Lhama" and "Twenty Years in Tibet".
Descr: Himalayan Hotel in Kalimpong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A splendid 15th century fort, now converted into a heritage hotel. 

The Fort Nalagarh commands wonderful views above an estate of forests and orchards which is rich in bird life. 

The hotel has 22 air-conditioned comfortable rooms, including some charming suites, a swimming pool, health club, tennis court and put golf croquet.
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running Water, T.V., Telephone, Music
otherfacility: Banquet facility, Conference facility, Health Club, Swimming Pool, Tennis, Golf, Croquet, Badminton, Table Tennis, Ayurvedda Health Centre
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Fax, Safe Deposit
WebWriteUp1:
The Nalagarh Fort was a royal residence which has now been converted into a luxurious Heritage Hotel. There is no grand entrance though. In fact, one must drive through an industrial area, and then through a half mile or so of narrow bazaars (literally, just wide enough for one car if all the people, scooters, dogs and bikes get out of the way). 

Once you reach inside the gates, you can enjoy the fort and the views as Nalagarh is a beautiful property. The hotel is located in a 20 acre estate of forest and orchard, and is built on five levels, three of which are manicured lawns. The hotel has a restaurant, swimming pool and an Ayurvedic nature centre.

Nalagarh was the capital of the 12th century kingdom of Hindoor, founded by Raja Ajay Chand. A part of the capital was a dried up flood plain, which explains the name -'nala-garh'. The garh, or fort, was built in 1421, by Raja Bikram Chand, on a hillock about 1400 feet high. The rulers of Hindoor trace their origins to the Chandela Rajputs of Bundelkhand. The ancient Khajuraho temples in Madhya Pradesh were built by these Chandela kings.
Metatype: A splendid 15th century fort, now converted into a heritage hotel.
Descr: The Fort Nalagarh in Nalagarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The stately country manor of Judge's Court has it all; rooms with period furniture and fire places, fields to wander in, the colourful, rustic heritage village of Pragpur at its very doorstep, birds to watch and carp to catch. 

Originally built as a home in 1918 to commemorate a son's graduation from law college in England, Judge's Court has only a few rooms, each unique, housed in different buildings on the property and some even in a 300 year old cottage in the village.
advantage: Located in Kangra Valley at India's only Heritage Village
roomfacility: Attached bath with H/C running water, Fax, Tea/Coffee maker
otherfacility: Conference Facilities, Cultural Programme, Plunge Pool, Bird Watching, Angling, Walking, Fishing Cycling, Trekking, Shopping Village Market, Local crafts, Hand woolen shawls
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Banking, Valet
WebWriteUp1:
Most of the rooms have wide bay windows or open out onto the lawns. The rooms have been furnished in a few different styles such as art deco angular, or curvy modern baroque with well used winged armchairs. The rooms in the 300 year old brick cottage in the village are generally reserved for families and are a bit like dolls houses with narrow, wooden stairs and loft-like bedrooms.

White and red crystal chandeliers, regal red and cream sofas and family photographs and trophies create a wonderful atmosphere in the sitting area. The dining room is an unusual mix of the rural and the urbane - mud walls but classy, patterned terrazzo floors with elegant chairs and furniture. Preserves and pickles are, like all the food served in Judge's Court, made from home grown fruits and vegetables. This locally grown produce also includes wheat, oil seeds and milk fresh from their own dairy.

The lawns have plum, mango and clove trees and cardamoms bushes. The 12 acre orchard attracts its own fair share of bird-life, such as the white throated fan tail and the crimson sunbird, and the wetlands of the Maharana Pratap Bird sanctuary are only a short drive away.
Metatype: The stately country manor of Judge's Court has it all; rooms with period furniture and fire places, fields to wander in, the colourful, rustic heritage village of Pragpur at its very doorstep, birds to watch and carp to catch.
Descr: The Judges Court in Pragpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: judge's court,  pragpur, heritage village, himachal, special  places, kangra

description:
Built in 1860 for the Maharaja of the princely state of Dhar, this palace underwent a paradigm shift under the capable hands of the architectural firm of Gregson, Batly and Kings in 1945. 

Now it stands as an excellent example of Art Deco and Bauhaus styles with a smooth plain white exterior, large open spaces and minimalist furniture. 

The palace is set amongst acres of gardens and farm and orchard land, and offers a cool oasis in the dry Malwan landscape.
cuisine: Fresh Meals prepared with Organically Grown ingredients in Palace farms
advantage: Ideal Base to visit the Romantic city of Mandu
roomfacility: Individually Decorated Rooms in various Themes
otherfacility: English Speaking guides for Local Excursions
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
The epitome of old word luxury, the palace's rooms are furnished in thick rosewood with enormous four poster beds, large squashy sofas and airy modern bathrooms. 

If you ever leave your vastly comfortable room, there are a number of common areas, adorned with sepia tinted photographs of the family and scenes from Indian history. There is also a swimming pool, steam, sauna, gymnasium, audio-visual room and ayurvedic spa.

The attentive staff will look after you as they serve you home grown organic vegetables cooked according to traditional royal recipes.
Metatype: Built in 1860 for the Maharaja of the princely state of Dhar, this palace underwent a paradigm shift under the capable hands of the architectural firm of Gregson, Batly and Kings in 1945.
Descr: Jhira Bagh Palace in Dhar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: jhira bagh palace, dhar, mandu, madhya pradesh, boutique, heritage, hotel

description:
The Noor-Us-Sabah sprawls in white elegance on a hilltop overlooking Bhopal's lake. Built in the 1920's as a residence for the then princess of Bhopal, this 70 bed-roomed palace was declared to be the 'light of dawn' (Noor-Us-Sabah). 

A few turrets rise up into the sky but for the most part the palace is modern, both in its architecture and facilities, which include a pool. However, its indoor spaces are large and opulently furnished, as befitting a palace.
advantage: Excellent View over looking the Lake / Peace full Lush Green Surroundings

WebWriteUp1:
A hilltop palace with stunning views of Bhopal's lake and the hills, Noor-Us-Sabah Palace is furnished in deep reds, blues and golds, the rooms attest to old world luxury. Scalloped curtains hang heavily at the windows and French doors. Beds are large and the furniture dignified. Tall gold legged lamps are placed on the side and coffee tables.
  
There is a range of restaurants to choose from: a sunset barbecue restaurant, a Pan Asian restaurant and an Oriental restaurant. There is also an intimate bar.

description:
An understated and chic offering of the Taj Group of hotels, the Usha Kiran Palace was originally built in the 1930's to house the King and Queen of England. 

As you step into the manicured grounds it is clear that the palace is unique. Luxurious without being overpoweringly opulent, and sophisticated but not snobby, the Usha Kiran Palace will be a highlight of your visit to Gwalior.
advantage: Walking Distance from Jai Vilas Palace Museum
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Channel Music
otherfacility: Seperate Executive Floor, Safe Deposit, Banquet & Conference Facilities, Beauty Parlour, Shopping Arcade, Croquet, Billiards, Badminton, Table Tennis, Jogging Strip, Garden
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Banking, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
A 1930s palace built to accommodate the European guests of the Maharajah of Gwalior. The palace is set in pleasant gardens with sprawling lawns, and features the original coloured glass walls, a crystal collection and antique carpets.
 
The rooms are decorated with deep blue and plum coloured tiles that contrast with muted wall paint, cushions that are squares of concentrated colour on the pure white duvets and glistening glazed tiles in the airy bathrooms. Sheer Chanderi silk and cotton sarees flutter in the archways. 

The furniture is, for a converted palace, unusually low-key and modern, making the d�cor minimalist without being outr�, the final effect being one of relaxed elegance. To keep the rooms from losing all their antiquity, features such as the original columns supporting the ceilings, and the old fashioned bathtubs have been retained.
 
Facilities include a fragrant spa set among the water bodies and greenery of the erstwhile women's chambers which offers aromatherapy and rejuvenation therapies. A great way to spend a couple of hours is to explore the 9 acres grounds that surround the palace. Attractions include 2 small graves where the beloved dogs of friends of the royalty are buried, and a small shrine dedicated to the elephant-headed god, Ganesh.

Meals, including dishes from the imperial Nepali and Marathi kitchens of the Scindia royal family, are served either in the restaurant with it's air of quiet sophistication, or in the lush gardens.
Metatype: An understated and chic offering of the Taj Group of hotels, the Usha Kiran Palace was originally built in the 1930's to house the King and Queen of England.
Descr: Usha Kiran Palace in Gwalior - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: usha kiran palace, taj hotel, gwalior, madhya pradesh, heritage hotel

Hardwood-floor rooms feature a cable flat-screen TV and a pillow menu. Each is well-equipped with a minibar and tea/coffee-making facilities. Safes and ironing facilities are available for convenience.

The hotel has a variety of amenities including a shopping arcade and health club. A business center and hair and beauty salon are available. A concierge sees to guests requests and needs.

Mediterranean cuisine is served at Sevilla, while Dhaba offers North Indian fare. Pastries are available at Ye Old Bakery Patisserie and Jade serves Chinese food. Choose from 75 Vodka brands at Aura  The Vodka Bar.

description:
The most plush hotel in Allahabad, Hotel Kanha Shyam is the hotel most prefered by large groups of foreigners and Indian business travellers. 

A grand, sweeping lobby with glossy marble floors occupies the bottom floor of the hotel, and the rooms are located in the ascending stories of this tall, modern building. 

The rooms are large but tend to be bland and now, slightly worn at the edges. There is a coffee shop, a traditional Indian restaurant and a rooftop bar overlooking all of Allahabad.
advantage: Located in the Heart of the City
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Channel Music
otherfacility: Business Centre, Seperate Executive Floor, Executive Lounge, Banquet & Conference Facilities, Beauty Parlour, Health Club, Swimming Pool
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Banking, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Valet, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms have been done up in beige, blue, gold and rose. Heavy drapes and bed linen and classically styled furniture lend a formal touch to the rooms. A glass topped writing table and a couple of armchairs complete the room. The bathrooms are simple but have all the amenities you can expect.

The coffee shop is located in the lobby and is a bright and pleasant place. Pasteries, light snacks and soft beverages are all available here. Full meals are served in 'Baradari' the Indian speciality restaurant that is the more formal eating place. A separate bar, Court View, is dominated by dark wood and is masculine in decor. 
 
As a modern, four star hotel in Allahabad, the Kanha Shyam continues to be popular choice inspite of the fact that it is a little run down, simply because it is still the grandest hotel in town. However, there are other smaller hotels that provide better quality accomodation.
Metatype: The most plush hotel in Allahabad, Hotel Kanha Shyam is the hotel most prefered by large groups of foreigners and Indian business travellers.
Descr: Hotel Kanha Shyam in Allahabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
One of Allahabad's oldest hotels, Hotel Yatrik is a medium range hotel. Its rooms are well sized and recently renovated to be simple in style, yet comfortable with all the basic amenities. 

Although situated in the heart of Allahabad Hotel Yatrik has a large lawn framed by bottle palms to relax in and a large pool which helps beat the dry summer heat of the city. 

The rooms are all air conditioned and done up in pleasing shades of beige, green and blue. 

The hotel is situated close to the down-town area and the upmarket shopping area of the Civil Lines.
advantage: 5 minutes walk from Civil Lines main posh shopping area
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Garden

services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are built in a semi circle around the lawn that occupies the centre of the hotel. Large airy verandahs with comfortable seating lead to the rooms. The rooms are sunny, with generous beds and a bright bathroom. The furniture is of the modern, clean lined variety and there is satellite television and a phone in every room. Cosy armchairs are placed near the windows. There is a writing table bearing sprays of dried flowers and a chair. The rooms are clean and well ordered. 
  
Their slightly gloomy restaurant offers Indian, Chinese and Continental cuisine but you'd probably prefer to stroll on to the lawn and eat there. The staff is well trained and the management very experienced.   
  
Most of Allahabad's hotels are located in the same area as the city's sights are within easy distance and the railway station nearby.
Metatype: One of Allahabad's oldest hotels, Hotel Yatrik is a medium range hotel. Its rooms are well sized and recently renovated to be simple in style, yet comfortable with all the basic amenities.
