description:
A charming small heritage hotel owned by the Kasmanda Royal Family, that still in residence, The Kasmanda Palace is built on 3 acres of wooded hillside and commands panoramic views over the Doon valley. 
The interiors of the lodge are charming with an eclectic mix of furniture and other memorabilia of varied vintage.

There are terraces and lawns, badminton courts, and a multi cuisine restaurant.
advantage: In the Heart  of the Town yet Away from the crowd Situated in 3 acres of Gardens & Pine Forest
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, Fax, T.V., Safe Deposit, Channel Music
otherfacility: Conference Facilities, Treks, Picnics, Horse Riding
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Safe Deposit, Baby Sitting, Travel Desk Service
WebWriteUp1:
The Kasmanda Palace is a fairytale castle of high snow white walls and turrets, gazing regally down upon Mussoorie town. Owned by the royal family of Kasmanda, the hotel has undergone many transformations in its 150 years, having also once been a sanitorium and school. 

The Palace is a formal place, all gleaming dark furniture, red carpets, and tiger skins on walls. Although completely modernised in terms of plumbing and electricity, the essential old-world charm is intact - the building is in the Anglo-French style, there are potted plants in cast iron stoves, ornate four poster beds, and brick fireplaces. 
  
A steep slope takes you up to this majestic building. The small wooden lobby has a broad, sweeping staircase leading to the rooms upstairs. The floors are dark wood, the beds are large and old fashioned, chintz curtains hang at the large windows and floral carpets line the floors, but the rooms are neither gloomy nor fusty. The colours are bright, the windows let in a lot of light and the room is immensely comfortable.
  
The carpeted corridors are lined with hunting trophies, sepia tinted photographs, and other memorabilia of the royal family. Marble topped tables bear fragrant flower arrangements.
Metatype: A charming small heritage hotel owned by the Kasmanda Royal Family, who are still in residence.
Descr: Hotel Kasmanda Palace in Mussoorie - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: kasmanda palace, heritage hotel, mussoorie, himalaya, special places

description:
Hotel de l'Orient is a large terracotta pink and white villa at the heart of the town of Pondicherry. 

Originally built in the 1760's, the house has been expertly restored to retain much of its original paint and plaster, its shiny red oxide floors, and its high louvered wooden doors and windows. Exquisite objects d'art, aquarelles and lithographs are found throughout - this is as close as you will come to re-living the magnificence of French Pondicherry.
advantage: Heritage Mansion Restored Sensitively
roomfacility: All Rooms with Hand Picked Furniture and Furnishings
otherfacility: Atmospheric Restaurant, Car pick-ups, Visit to Auroville & Matrimandir
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
An old colonial mansion which has been beautifully restored by theNeemrana Hotel group, Hotel de L'Orient is more a guesthouse than a hotel. This is a charming 1760's manor house located in the heart of the French Quarter. Sensitively restored and furnished with French colonial antiques, it captures the period grandeur of a colonial nobleman's mansion.

There are sixteen rooms with colonial furniture such as four-poster beds, planters chairs, dowry chests and large old mirrors filling the high-beamed spaces. Each of the guest rooms - set around an inner courtyard shaded by citrus and neem trees - is themed and named for a former French colony.

Since every effort was made to alter as little as possible of the original structure, the rooms come in a charming range of shapes and sizes, some resemble a cosy loft, some are large and majestic, and others have a private terrace. Each room has been named after French "possessions" (Gingy in Tamil Nadu, 'Surate' in Gujarat etc) in India and in their differing decor reflect the flavours of the diverse regions.  

The ceilings are lofty, the beds high and heavily carved, and there are loungers and divans in every room. The walls are either shiny with age or have a delightful mottled effect due to the layers of paint. The bathrooms have been completely modernized but still have charm, with rough stone floors, maybe even an old brass bucket, and with fragrant Neemrana bath products to pamper yourself with.

Apart from the wrought iron tables and chairs arranged in the inner courtyard, food is also served indoors, in a peach room dotted with old French "cartes" (maps) of India. The Creole food here refers to a blend of south Indian and French cuisine that the chef has inherited from old Pondy families.
Metatype: Easily the best accommodation in Pondicherry, the Hotel de l'Orient is a large terracotta pink and white villa at the heart of the town.
Descr: Hotel de Lorient in Pondicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel de l'orient, pondicherry, french, colonial, heritage, neemrana, special places

description:
A lovely resort situated in the heart of Kerala's backwaters. This is a beautiful area of coconut forests, green paddies, thatched villages and lotus-filled lagoons. 

There are individual cottages along the banks of the canal with sit-outs to enjoy the views. The restaurant serves Kerala cuisine, served on the traditional plantain leaves. 

You can explore the surrounding areas on foot, by bicycle or in a dug-out canoe.
cuisine: Traditional Kerala Cuisine served on Banana leaves
advantage: Small Resort located on an island on the backwaters between Alleppey & Kollam
roomfacility: All with Attached Bath, H/C Running Water
otherfacility: Ayurvedic Health Centre
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
The road from Alleppey narrows until your car will be brushed by bananas on either side and then you arrive at a clearing. Here, you have to cross a small canal by punted country boat before arriving at the Coir Village reception, a charming shelter of bamboo and thatch. 

The reception is on a narrow strip of land - the cottages are on either banks of this canal. Like all backwater canal banks in Kerala, this area is also thickly dotted with palms, bananas and many flowering shrubs. From anywhere on the resort property, guests can enjoy the view of at least two canals. 

The rooms are all in cottages, and are simple but comfortable. Each room has a sit-out to enjoy the backwater views, and to observe the life on the waterways. This is a unique way to experience the heart of the Kerala backwaters.
Metatype: A lovely resort situated in the heart of Kerala's backwaters. This is a beautiful area of coconut forests, green paddies, thatched villages and lotus-filled lagoons.
Descr: Coir Village Lake Resort in Thrikunnapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: coir village lake resort, thrikunnapuzha, backwaters, kerala, special places

description:
A charming small guest house in the peaceful estate of an old colonial house. The five independent cottages are modern and spacious, each with a small living area as well as private facilities. 

The rough hewed stone cottages seem to have always been a part of these mountains. On the inside they are warmly decorated using large amounts of deodar wood cut from trees from the property itself. There is a verandah with superb views over the mountains.
advantage: Situated in Upper Dharamsala, in a Estate featuring forests of Oak, Cedar & Rhododendron
roomfacility: Well Appointed Rooms. Cottages Equipped with Attached Bath with Hot & Cold Water, Kitchenette. Suites with Sitting Area and Bedroom with Attached Bath.
WebWriteUp1:
The erudite Ajai Singh and his wife own and run Glenmore Cottages. Mr. Singh's family bought the main cottage from the British some 50 years ago and have slowly added four more to it. These stone cottages are all separate, with a private space overlooking the thickly wooded cedar, deodar and rhododendron forests. 

Mist floats gently up the hills and the cottages can sometimes seem to be suspended in it. The likes of Richard Gere and Paul Simon have succumbed to the charm of Glenmoor Cottages, situated a mere kilometer from the centre of Upper Dharamsala.

The cottages are cozy and neat and the bathrooms are tiled and modern. The highlight however is the grassy sit out in front of each cottage from where you can enjoy the magnificent view of the feathery conifer tree tops. Some rooms even have a glassed in section so that when Dharamsala receives one of its frequent drizzles you can be dry and warm inside the room but still enjoy the view.

Meals are served in a sunny room with windows all around so you aren't deprived of the surroundings while you tuck into simple, Indian home cooked food. Their hot lemon water with a sprinkling of mint will warm you up on a cool day. 

The town centre is an easy 1 km walk downhill, and here you can try the various Tibetan, Italian and Indian restaurants that line its narrow lanes.
Metatype: A charming small guest house in the peaceful estate of an old colonial house. The five independent cottages are modern and spacious, each with a small living area as well as private facilities.
Descr: Glenmoor Cottages in Dharamsala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: glenmoor cottages, dharamsala  hotel, himachal, special places

description:
A fabulous resort which was once the residence of Lord Kitchener. Tastefully done, all the rooms offer unsurpassed views of the Himalayas outside. 

Burma teak floors, hand knotted rugs and glorious views of the valley - thats the stuff the Wildflower Hall's rooms are made of. Tapestry covered round, scroll armed sofas and elegant woodbacked chairs. The beds are king size with twisted wooden posts.
cuisine: Fine Continental, Asian & Indian Cuisine in two Restaurants
advantage: Elegant Former Residence of Lord Kitchener, Overlooking Magnificent Hill Scenery
roomfacility: All Rooms with Fabulous Panoramic Views, , Walk In Closet, Private Bar, Satellite TV, CD & Digital Video Player, Complimentary Fruit & Flowers, 24 Hour In room Dining, Marble bathrooms with Separate Shower Stalls
otherfacility: Private Butler Service, In House Laundry & Dry Cleaning, World Class Spa with Holistic treatment
services: Heated in-door Swimming Pool and Jacuzzi, Library with a Selection of Books, Tennis Court,  Gymnasium,
WebWriteUp1:
The Wildflower Hall is a class apart. Recognised and held up as India's leading spa resort for its consistent performance year after year, Wildflower Hall is situated high in the Himalayas at 8000 feet on the site of the erstwhile home of Lord Kitchener. 

Rebuilt now in a more modern style, the hotel nevertheless has the feel of a fairytale castle as its steepled roof dominates its surrounding 23 acres of cedar and pine forests. Entirely off limits to non residents and to children below 12 years, the hotel is one of those rare things, a truly private, full service sanctuary. 
  
There are a few different cuisines and restaurants to choose from. The main restaurant serves Pan Asian and Continental food and three separate seating areas including an outdoors and a 'conservatory'. There is a separate Indian restaurant and a bar and coffee shop. This health and wellness focused hotel also offers healthy vegetable and fruit juices and custom designed menus. 
  
Wildflower Hall offers a plethora of services and activity options to its guests. Aside from the infinity edge jacuzzi and heated indoor swimming pool you can indulge in some croquet, archery or billiards. 

Of the more mordern recreational pursuits, the hotel has among its staff a team of white water rafting experts that can take you through the frothy rapids of the River Sutlej. There is also horse riding, ice skating in the winters and some pre-designed walking routes to explore the wildflowers of the mountains.
Metatype: A fabulous resort which was once the residence of Lord Kitchener. Tastefully done, all the rooms offer unsurpassed views of the Himalayas outside.
Descr: Wildflower Hall in Mashobra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Built in 1884 the Oberoi Cecil is a heritage offering of the prestigious Oberoi group of hotels. Sophisticated in every way, from its glossy Burma teak floors to its well groomed staff, the Cecil is Shimla's top end hotel. 

The building is tall and a bit unimaginatively designed but nevertheless commands splendid views of the high mountains and deep valleys that first attracted the British here.

WebWriteUp1:
Voted one of the top ten luxury hotels in India, The Cecil is a sumptuous getaway in India's most famous hill station.

Parquet floors  strewn with Persian rugs, along with crackling wood-fires create a rich and warm atmosphere. Much of the furniture is original classic and the furnishings are sumptuous. 

The Cecil features a number of eateries featuring a range of cuisines- snacks at the outdoor Cedar Garden restaurant, European and Asian delicacies in The Restaurant which rotates its menu twice a week and tea and drinks in the sunny atrium. 

A heated pool and an international standard spa and sauna are just some of The Cecil's attractions.
Metatype: Built in 1884 the Oberoi Cecil is a heritage offering of the prestigious Oberoi group of hotels. Sophisticated in every way, from its glossy Burma teak floors to its well groomed staff, the Cecil is Shimla's top end hotel.

description:
One of Shimla's oldest hotels and the nostalgically cherished first hotel of the now impressive Oberoi Hotel, Clarke's is a quaint, mock Tudor building situated right on Shimla's famous Mall Road. 

While the facade of the hotel still looks very much like it did in 1898 when it was built, the rooms have been refurbished and brought upto modern standards, all the while preserving the atmosphere of a old world grace and regality. 

There is a sunny terrace with views of the Shimla valley and Shimla's main promenade is just outside your doorstep.
advantage: Centrally Located
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, T.V., Safe Deposit, Channel Music
otherfacility: Banquet & Conference Facilities, Indoor Games
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Banking, Baby Sitting, Travel Desk Service, Car Rental, Fax
creditcards: AMEX, CAN, BOB, Diners, VISA, Master, Andhra, Bank of America, ANZ, Citi
WebWriteUp1:
A period building converted into a comfortable 5-star hotel. Located on the main promenade of Shimla, the Mall, this hotel is the first of the now famous Oberoi Group of hotels. 

Built in 1935, the building has a lot of character. The rooms are spacious and elegantly furnished with attached baths and all other modern facilities. Some rooms have a good mountain view.
  
Being a colonial building not all the rooms are of equal size or shape but this just adds to the unique charm of the hotel. Muted coloured colours in subdued prints, elegant restored period furniture and wide views over the pine tops. The bathrooms are modern and luxurious. 
  
There is a large formal dining room where white gloved, tuxedo'ed waiters serve Indian, Continental and Chinese food. The more relaxed terrace lined with flower beds is the place for a frothy cappucino or a pre dinner drink. A separate bar/lounge area leads off from the reception. Built in the late 18th century style, the lounge is a quiet, sophisticated space. 
  
Its location in the middle of the pedestrian only Mall road ensures that you are only a couple of steps away from the bazaars, churches and historical monuments of Shimla. The Mall comes alive especially in the evenings - the traditional promenade hour.
Metatype: One of Shimla's oldest hotels and the nostalgically cherished first hotel of the now impressive Oberoi Hotel, Clarke's is a quaint, mock Tudor building situated right on Shimla's famous Mall Road.
Descr: The Oberoi Clarke"s Hotel in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Kanglachen is a 25 room hotel set amongst lawns, a stone's throw away from the shops, restaurants and the local fruit market of the Main Bazaar Road. 

A simple 2 storey building built in the style of traditional Ladakhi homes, this hotel is popular throughout Leh's short season and fills up early. The uncluttered rooms are pine floored and overlook the front lawn.
advantage: A Class Hotel
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attched Bathrooms
otherfacility: Cultural Programmes arrangedon Request
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry & Dry Cleaning Service, Parking Facility
WebWriteUp1:
One of the most popular hotels in Leh, the Kanglachen. Refurbished to suit more upmarket tastes, the rooms are sunny with plain white walls complimented by the light wood of the floor. The bathrooms are functional but clean.

The centre courtyard and front lawn are almost always sunny with low tables that are the ideal spot for reading and relaxing. The restaurant serves buffet meals on prior notice and is known for its steaming hot plate meals called Sizzlers. Meals are generally of the hearty variety, breakfast generally involving a large quantity of preserves and butter.

Like most hotels in Leh, the Kanglachen does not have televisions in the rooms. But you wouldn't miss out, since Leh's outdoor attractions are far too many and far too alluring to ignore. 

Since the hotel is located so close to the social hub of Leh, street noise does occasionally float up into the hotel rooms, often magnified by the still mountain air.
Metatype: The Kang Lha Chen is a 25 room hotel set amongst lawns, a stone's throw away from the shops, restaurants and the local fruit market of the Main Bazaar Road.
Descr: Hotel Kanglachen in Leh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: kanglachen, hotel, leh, ladakh, indus valley, special  places

description:
A luxurious spa resort built around a Maharaja's palace near Rishikesh. The rooms and suites have a fabulous location overlooking either the valleys of the Ganges below or the palace gardens. 

Located in the purer airs of the hills of Rishikesh, the spa offers not only a multitude of healing and beauty experiences and wellness rituals, but also "spa meals" custom designed to suit your body type all of which are based on the ancient principles of ayurveda. 

The accommodation is also designed as a part of the holistic rejuvenation that Ananda provides and the rooms are all quietly tasteful, uncluttered and open to the outdoors.
accessrail: 45 Minutes Drive From Haridwar Railway Station
advantage: Offers Fabulous Views of the Ganges valley & the Himalayan Foothills
roomfacility: Each Room has a Private Balcony, Telephone,, In Room Safe, Tea Coffee Maker, Private bar
otherfacility: A Boutique Offering `Ananda' & Aveda care Products, Country's Oldest Billiards salon, Library with a Collection of Priceless Old Books, Nature Walk, White Water Rafting, Fishing & Tennis
services: 24 Hour Rooms Service, World Class Spa, Well Planned Meals Using Organically Grown Vegetables
WebWriteUp1:
Ananda In The Himalayas is probably India's best known spa destination. The resort offers Ayurveda, Yoga,  Aromatherapy as well as Himalayan spring water therapy. The well designed pool and steam/sauna complete a world class spa resort.
  
Although the building that houses the rooms is fairly square and uninspired, the rooms inside are special. Furnished with an eye for beauty and detail, the rooms are plush but understated - creams and beiges, meditation symbols hang in prints on the walls. A wonderful balcony presents high, bird's eye views of the wooded slopes and silvery Ganges below, perfect for breakfast or a romantic dinner. The rooms have walk in closets and tubs to soak in. 
  
Experts are on hand to recommend which of the 79 body and beauty treatments would best achieve the health goals you've set yourself. While the many therapies, yoga and meditation practices and massage techniques may be found elsewhere also, it is in Ananda that there are found all under one roof (albeit at a certain price). Aside from these there is also the large lap pool to relax in and evening entertainment in their amphitheatre. 
  
The chefs at Ananda design menus with not only taste in mind but also the ayurvedic division of body types. But Ananda encourages you not to look at your stay here as a quick fix-it solution to your health concerns. They instead see it as only the first step in a lifestyle change. So chefs at Ananda work from an open kitchen so that you are able to observe the dishes they create and replicate them at home. Similarly, during the yoga and meditation sessions the instructors will be able to formulate a meditation programme for you to follow at home.
Metatype: A luxurious spa resort built around a Maharaja's palace near Rishikesh. The rooms and suites have a fabulous location overlooking either the valleys of the Ganges below or the palace gardens.
Descr: Mandarin Oriental Ananda, The Himalayas in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: India's most exclusive hotel, the Oberoi Amarvilas is the only hotel in Agra to offer unobstructed views of the Taj Mahal from throughout the complex- from the lobby, the restaurants, the bar, the swimming pool, and even all of the guest rooms themselves. These are sumptuously decorated, and many have private balconies with breathtaking views over the swimming pool, the fountains and the garden towards the Taj Mahal, which is a mere 600 meters away. Staying here is a memorable experience which will remain with you forever.

WebWriteUp1:
Situated only 600m from the Taj Mahal, this 112 room top notch hotel gives its guests a chance to view the `most beautiful building in the world' from the total privacy of their own room. 

The beautifully appointed rooms feature Burma Teak flooring, teak armoires and spacious marble bathrooms with both a bathtub and a separate shower cubicle. 

The classical architecture of the hotel is complemented by the elaborate Mughal gardens, terraced lawns, fountains, reflection pools and pavilions.

The hotel offers a range of activities to relax and recharge yourself. Rejuvenate yourself with a holistic treatment at the Oberoi Spa, get in touch with your inner self with a yoga session, or explore the famous sights of Agra - Taj Mahal, Agra Fort or the Fatehpur Sikri. All three monuments are recognised by UNESCO as a World heritage site. 

A two nights stay is recommended at Agra to experience these architectural wonders of the Mughal era at your leisure, while taking time to explore the relaxation options at the hotel as well.
Metatype: Situated only 600 m from the Taj Mahal, this 112 room top notch hotel gives its guests a chance to view the `most beautiful building in the world' from the total privacy of their own room. The classical architecture of the hotel is complemented by the elaborate Mughal gardens, terraced lawns, fountains, reflection pools and pavilions.
Descr: Amarvilas in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

The Hans Coco Palms is a resort in the true sense of the word: with swaying fan shaped Travellers Palms catching the breeze from the nearby sea, and a dozen lounge chairs around an inviting swimming pool. 

Located at the quiet end of the long stretch of the Puri beach, it is close enough to the brightly lit food stalls but far enough away for you to be able to truly enjoy its peacefulness.

WebWriteUp1:
A modern complex with the best beach front location in Puri, just 1.5 km from Lord Jagannath's temple. The hotel is centrally air-conditioned and offers 36 rooms, all with balconies overlooking the sea. There is a bar and a multi-cuisine restaurant with beautiful potted palms.

The large Italian marble floored lobby is sparsely decorated with luscious fresh flowers indicating that this is a hotel that truly appreciates space. The rooms therefore are very comfortably sized and furnished using large amounts of polished wood and wrought iron fashioned along classic lines. Yellow brass and wrought iron lamps shed a warm yellowy glow and a wooden fan spins lazily above.

The gardens are expansive and artistically landscaped with palm sized purple dahlias, and red and yellow hibiscus. It is an oasis of peace, with the busy beach just a short walk away.
Metatype: The Hans Coco Palms is a resort in the true sense of the word: with swaying fan shaped Travellers Palms catching the breeze from the nearby sea, and a dozen lounge chairs around an inviting swimming pool.

description:
Norbu Ghang Resort is situated at the end of the ridge in Upper Pelling, and so offers the best mountain views. The attractive cottages are positioned so as to take full advantage of this location, with superb views form their private balconies. 

The cottages have walls clad in chatai matting, and tastefully designed interiors in ethnic Sikkimese themes. There is a peaceful garden, an attractive bar, and a restaurant.
advantage: Overlooking A picturesque Valley
roomfacility: Well Appointed Rooms with En-suite facilities, H/C Water
services: 24 Hour Room Service, Laundry & Valet Service, Tours & Car Rental
creditcards: This property only accepts cash payments.
WebWriteUp1:
The Norbu Gang Resort sits high on a hill in Pelling, away from the slightly overcrowded streets of the lower town. Its cottages have unimpeded views of the majestic and sacred Kanchenjunga Mountain. The narrow, stone pathways of the resort are overhung with drooping wildflowers. The hotel is unpretentious but with a rustic charm that seems to belong to the green hills and clean mountain air around it.

Built according to local Sikkimese architecture style that is now rapidly disappearing, the cottages are placed in a line along the upper ridge of the hill, each surrounded by a path of flowers. Each cottage has 2 rooms separate except for the common patio they share in the front of the cottage. 

The cottages have wooden floors and pine wood wainscoting and are decorated with locally crafted cane work. Low windows in the rooms give the feeling of always being outdoors. The bathrooms are serviceable and clean. 

You can relax in the warm comforts of the Dzongri Bar, or pamper your taste buds at the Silver Fir Restaurant where chefs stir up both local and international cuisines. The front lawn is also a great spot to relax in, as it overlooks the town of Pelling and the mountains beyond.
Metatype: Norbu Ghang Resort is situated on the western face of a mountainside and is barely a minute's walk away from the quaint little hamlet of Pelling
Descr: Norbu Ghang Resort in Pelling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: norbu gang resort, hotel, pelling, sikkim, special places

description: The imposing Kusum Vilas Prem Bhavan Palace in Chhota Udepur is set in 18 acres of `Mughal' gardens decorated with fountains, ponds and statues. The architectual style is predominantly Indo-Saracenic while the interiors reflect a strong European influence.The palace hotel has recently been opened with 13 rooms and suites, including one suite in a former Royal Railway Saloon Carriage . The rooms are comfortably furnished with modern en-suite facilities. The Palace has an indoor swimming pool, tennis court, and a billiards table.The Palace can organise jeep safaris to the nearby tribal villages to see the weekly `haats' or markets where tribals get together to engage in lively bartering for day to day commodities.

description:
Anandham (formerly known as Sterling Swamimalai) resembles a typical south Indian village, with mud streets, rooms in the form of tiled village houses, a common area where cultural performances are regularly held, and a swimming pool in the shape and appearance of a village temple tank.

The original home has been beautifully refurbished and additional rooms have been built with the same ambience.
advantage: 200 Old Heritage Mansion, Located in 5 Acres of Coconut Grove and Gardens on the banks of Cauvery River
roomfacility: Well Furnished Rooms with Telephone, Fridge, TV, En-suite Bathroom with Modern Conveniences
otherfacility: Ayurveda Therapy Centre, Classical & Folk Theatre, Yoga, Foreign Exchange Counter, Travel Desk, Bullock Cart Rides
services: Laundry, Docor on Call,
WebWriteUp1:
A beautifully restored 100-year old heritage home, Anandham is set in a coconut grove by the river Cauvery near Thanjavur. It offers simple air-conditioned en-suite rooms, traditional meals, cultural shows, yoga, meditation, and an Ayurveda Herbal Health Centre.

Anandham is constructed in such a way as to evoke the traditional culture and heritage of a South Indian village. The thatched rooves, wooden framework and courtyards are all in traditional style. Even the swimming pool is designed to resemble a village temple tank. 

The 25 rooms are well furnished with ethnic d�cor and have private sit outs overlooking the scenic garden. The resort itself is set inside a coconut and banana grove. The staff dressed in the traditional white dhoti and white khadhi shirt, the lush fruit-bearing trees, and flowering plants, the brook running inside the resort, the cattle and deer will all remind you of a relaxed and leisurely village life. 

Artefacts such as palanquins, bullock carts, and bronze idols are scattered around the resort, and Steve Borghia's museum has a collection of antiques.
Metatype: Anandham (formerly known as Sterling Swamimalai) resembles a typical south Indian village, with mud streets, rooms in the form of tiled village houses, a common area where cultural performances are regularly held, and a swimming pool in the shape and appearance of a village temple tank.
Descr: Indeco Swamimalai (Anandham) in Kumbakonam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: anandham, heritage hotel, kumbakonam, temple town, swamimalai

The Imperial rooms have a large double bed, a writing table almost too beautiful to use and regal spindly legged sofas, with pristine bathrooms and balconies. These rooms will satisfy your every need.

description:
The Chiramel Residency is located in the heart of Fort Cochin, just across from the historic St. Francis Church where Vasco da Gama is buried. 

This ancient Dutch house has been converted into a small guest house with simple rooms but lots of atmosphere. 

Your personal hosts are Sunny Mathew and Asha Abraham, the owners, who occupy the lower half of this rambling mansion.
WebWriteUp1:
The historic streets of Fort Kochi are dotted with handsome bungalows with pleasing Dutch/British influences. Some of them are delightful home-stays, with a handful of rooms for guests. Chiramel Residency is one of these. 

The elegant building has acres of teak wood and in some places, gleaming Chinese mosaic tiles. There is a very pleasant living room cum lounge with wooden floors and large windows. Stuffed sofas are perfect for day time lounging. There are also some more rooms in a newer annex, reached through a sunny, plant-filled courtyard. The rooms are comfortably furnished with old wooden furniture and gossamer mosquito-netting. 

Chiramel offers freshly prepared breakfasts and a selection of snacks through the day. The gracious Syrian Christian family is always at hand to answer any queries or simply to ensure that the guests are truly at home.

description: Built in 1932-34 as the residence of the Maharajah of Kolhapur, the Shalini Palace is set a lake-side surrounded by peaceful and lush gardens. The palace is built in dark grey/black  coloured stone and is a blend of several styles. There are scalloped arches set with etched Belgiun glass whilst the interiors are rich with wooden carvings and Italian marble. In 1987 the palace was converted into a hotel with 42 spacious rooms, charmingly furnished with period furniture.

description:
Bangaram Island Resort is currently closed until further notice due to a court hearing over the new licence agreement. 

No bookings are currently being taken for this resort but please speak to our India specialists for alternatives in Kerala and beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
This is a real Robinson Crusoe experience, with simple but spotless accommodation on a virgin beach. Don't expect luxurious touches though - Bangaram is basic. 

There are about 30 rooms along the main beach. They are basic and have no airconditioning or hot water. Neither of these should be missed though as the water is always warm enough for a shower and the rooms have a ceiling fan that helps to cool the air. What Bangaram lacks in amenities is more than made up for by the spectacular location.
 
There is a reception hut, a dive school, a restaurant, and an Ayurvedic massage centre. Dinner is served on the beach (weather permitting) and is buffet style. The food is great, particularly considering that everything (apart from coconuts) has to be brought in by air or by ship from the mainland.
WebWriteUp2:
This resort has been carefully designed to respect a delicate eco-system. There are thirty tiled-roof beach huts, each with its own verandah, en suite bathroom, ceiling fan and fridge. 

The resort offers facilities for scuba diving, snorkelling, catamaran sailing, deep sea fishing, rafting and kayaking. 

The restaurant serves delicious meals with an emphasis on seafood, and all meals are included during your stay.
Metatype: This resort has been carefully designed to respect a delicate eco-system. There are thirty tiled-roof beach huts, each with its own verandah, en suite bathroom, ceiling fan and fridge.
Descr: Bangaram Island Resort in Bangaram - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bangaram island resort, lakshadweep, coral, diving, snorkeling, beach

A nature garden lies adjacent to the house, where one can relax and take in the various sights on offer. Two double rooms and a chic cottage make up the accommodation, and contain pleasant earthy decors with comfortable furnishings. The kitchen serves home-cooked food and comprises of an interactive blend of Indian, Nepali, Chinese and Sikkimese recipes, with some Western variations on offer, and is served in the company of a family that makes for a memorable experience.

description:
Fortune Resort bay Island is Port Blair's most luxurious hotel, designed by Charles Correa. 

The hotel is spread over various levels in an elegant and airy way, and is furnished with a lot of wooden flooring. All rooms have balconies with a panoramic sea view. 

The hotel also has an excellent restaurant, a bar, swimming pool, indoor games, and its own private jetty.
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, T.V., Safe Deposit, Channel Music
otherfacility: Banquet & Conference Facilities, Swimming Pool, Table Tennis, Carroms, Chess, Dort Board, Outdoor Shuttle Cock
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Valet
WebWriteUp1:
Fortune Resort Bay Island boasts the best view and location. Added to it the fact that it is designed by renowned architect Charles Correa, makes this hotel the most luxurious of its kind in Port Blair.

The hotel offers 45 standard rooms, built on a number of levels spread across a sloping hill side, with some rooms overlooking the sea. Aesthetically designed, the rooms offer glorious views, fresh air and plenty of atural light. All the rooms are equipped with CCTV and direct dial STD telephones.

Please note however, that Port Blair being a small town, hotels do not necessarily match up to the service standards and room quality as in other cities or towns of India.
Metatype: Port Blair's most luxurious hotel, designed by Charles Correa.
Descr: Fortune Resort Bay Island in Port Blair - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fortune resort bay island, port blair, hotel, andaman

description:
Hotel Ibex is located in the small village of Jispa, on the banks of the River Bhaga, a tributary of the great Chenab River, and boasts great views over the valley and the mountains beyond. 

The rooms are simple, but clean, and there is plenty of hot water in the en-suite bathrooms. The welcoming restaurant serves hearty local dishes, and packed lunches are provided on departure for the following day's long drive.
WebWriteUp1:
A small hotel in the shadow of mountains with the Bhaga River running behind it, Hotel Ibex is a popular night halt. Open only for a few months of the year the hotel doesn't offer luxury but it is comfortable and clean. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the food wholesome.

The rooms are generously sized with large windows that let in the plenty of light. The d�cor harks back to the 1990's - brown carpets and inoffensive blue furnishings. The bathrooms are clean and, with the exception of during powercuts, hot water is available at all times.
 
The buffet meals offer a wide range of food - with Indian dals and vegetables along with a Continental offering or two. The hotel can also arrange a packed lunch for the next day's journey. 

You can take short walks from the hotel if you arrive in Jispa while it is still light. Being in a valley, the surrounding land is flat and the views stunning.
Metatype: Hotel Ibex is located on the banks of the Bhaga, a tributary of the great Chenab River.
Descr: Hotel Ibex in Jispa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ibex hotel, jispa, manali, leh, himachal pradesh, hotel, special places

description:
Built over 200 years ago in the Portuguese style, the Old Courtyard has been lovingly restored to its original glory. 

The hotel has only eight rooms, furnished with the heavy wooden furniture, overlooking the central courtyard with its ancient mango tree. The building features handsome arches and niches cut into the thick white-washed walls.
cuisine: Continental & Indian, Sea food preparations are famous
advantage: Located in Fort Kochi Area
roomfacility: All Rooms with Wooden Floors, Ceilings & Four Poster Beds. Attached Baths with Individual Heaters.
otherfacility: Popular Restaurant, Live Indian Music on Weekends
services: Laundry, Doctor on Call
WebWriteUp1:
This utterly charming small hotel is right in the centre of Fort Kochi. The white-washed building encloses a courtyard which is dominated by an old mango tree. 

The eight rooms are spread around the courtyard, offering views either over the quiet street outside or the interior courtyard. The wooden floors gleam with care and thick white walls that keep the heat out ensure that the are cool even on hot afternoons. The linen is spotlessly white and the atmosphere is languid and soothing. 

The suites are spacious and the other rooms range from medium sized to small. However, they all have been decorated in a subdued, comfortable way and are excellent value for money. There are several verandahs and nooks where one can sit and relax in the shade.
 
The restaurant on the courtyard level is another peaceful place and serves excellent food. The menu is not large, but offers a select choice of contemporary European and Kerala specialties.
Metatype: Built over 200 years ago in the Portuguese style, the Old Courtyard has been lovingly restored to its original glory.
Descr: The Old Courtyard  in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: old courtyard, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places

description:
An excellent hotel in a fantastic location, with enthusiastic owners who have a great eye for detail and personalised service, Udai Kothi has its own style and character. Each of the air-conditioned rooms is decorated with carefully selected furniture, soft furnishings and decor. 

The attractive rooftop terrace restaurant and swimming pool has spectacular panoramic views over Pichola Lake, especially at sunset and when the city's palaces are beautifully lit up in the evening.
advantage: Close to the Lake and offering Fabulous Views of the City Palace and the Ghats
roomfacility: All Rooms Beautifully Appointed with Rajasthani Furniture & Fabrics. Each Room with A Jharokha (Bay-window) . All have Attached Bath with Running Hot & Cold Water
otherfacility: Roof Top Jacuzzi & Steam Bath, Well Designed Garden, Parking, Money Change
services: Roof-top Swimming Pool, Roof-top Restaurant, Room Service, Doctor on Call, Lift, Telephone, Fax & Internet
WebWriteUp1:
Udai Kothi is an excellent new hotel in a fantastic location, with enthusiastic owners. Kunnu and Daisy, who have a great eye for detail. The hotel's most charming feature is the rooftop restaurant and swimming pool. Swimming high above the twinkling city of Udaipur is an unforgettable experience.  

Spacious and with tall ceilings, the attractive rooms are beautifully furnished with four poster beds, a small desk, bathtub with toiletries, and plenty of sitting space. The attention to detail is evident; with flowers and bowls of rose and marigold petals changed daily even in the bathrooms. The rooms on the upper floors have views of the lake, whilst those on the lower levels have a garden view.

Udai Kothi is a great example of a new building which is as beautiful and imaginative as the old palaces and havelis. Whether it is the lavishly decorated front entrance, the number of photographs and hand picked ornaments in the airy passages or the decadent luxury of the rooftop pool, Udai Kothi has style in abundance. A tall building by Udaipur standards, standing as it does on a height, the roof top at Udai Kothi is a fantastic advantage. 

From the rooftop, through the white cupolas and pavilions, one can see the expanse of the City Palace on one side and the lake with its myriad havelis, and the Lake Palace Hotel, on the other. As you can imagine, sunsets are wonderful and when the colours in the sky start to dim, the city below lights up with a thousand lights. The entire city palace is floodlit.
Metatype: An excellent hotel in a fantastic location, with enthusiastic owners who have a great eye for detail, and personalised service. Each of the air-conditioned rooms has its own character and style, with carefully selected furniture, soft furnishings and decor.
Descr: Udai Kothi in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: udai kothi,udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake pichola, special places

description:
Built in the style of a wooden lodge, this well-run place has an easy charm. Ideally located between New and Old Manali, and backed by pine forests, the tastefully decorated wood-paneled rooms are exceedingly spacious, comfortable and homely. 

Log fires can be arranged to heat the rooms in winter, when there is often an open fire in the dining room too. The breakfast here is a highlight, with a wide variety of locally produced jams.
WebWriteUp1:
Negis Mayflower is located on Club House Road, approximately 1 km from the Mall. It is a stately wooden lodge, with a cascade of wooden balconies. The hotel has 21 beautifully furnished and spacious rooms that provide garden views from the front veranda and forest views from the covered balcony at the rear.

The open wood-fires in the hotel could be a great selling point, but there are government wood quotas and restrictions on the use of wood for burning, so these may not always be lit. If it does get cold at night then the owners kindly offer electric fires if you need them.

The hotel owner is also regarded as being the most accomplished continental food chef in Manali. He is obviously a keen trout fisherman as his trophies decorate the reception area and there is trout on the menu too. 

Located just a short walk from New Manali, Old Manali and to a nearby temple, the hotel is at a convenient distance from most places.
Metatype: Built in a wooden-lodge style, this well-run place has an easy charm. Backed by pine forests and with a lovely garden, the tastefully decorated wood-paneled rooms are exceedingly comfortable and homely.
Descr: Hotel Mayflower in Manali - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel mayflower, manali, wood, himachal pradesh , hotel, special places

description:
This small unique boutique guesthouse offers Upper Dharamsala's finest accommodation. 

Each of the 11 rooms is uniquely themed according to different aspects of Tibetan culture. The furniture and murals offer a treasure chest of style and history.

The hotel is in a great location, about a 10 minute walk from the heart of McLeod Ganj, and next door to the Namgyal Monastery.
advantage: Set Amongst Peaceful Area of Pine Groves and Surrounded by Gardens. Close to Macleod Ganj
roomfacility: Rooms All Created by the Famed Artists of Norbuligka Institute, Featuring Tibetan Design Elements and Hand-knotted Carpets
otherfacility: Lounge with Satellite TV, Extensive Collection of Books on Tibetan subjects, Magazines & Journals, Cyber Cafe, Shiatsu & Holistic Massage, Relaxing Gardens Adjoining the Restaurant
services: In-house Laundry Service, Purified Water, Room Service, Safety Lockers
WebWriteUp1:
Have you ever imagined what it would be like inside a painting? The walls of the rooms of Chonor House have been used as vast canvases for depicting scenes, people and animals from Tibet in a myriad of colours. 

Plush hand knotted carpets blanket the floors and the beds are covered with Tibetan applique work. The furniture is teak and rosewood but is also painted and carved in the traditional Tibetan way. There is colour everywhere but it is light, pleasing and very beautiful. 

All the paintings, carpets and furniture have been designed and executed by artists belonging to the Norbulingka Institute. All proceeds from Chonor House are given to this institute, which is dedicated to preserving Tibetan culture and arts.
  
Each room has a unique design and theme and the wall art, carpets and other furnishings have been carefully chosen to enhance it. Each room therefore highlights a specific aspect of Tibet and Tibetan life - paintings of tigers, snow leopards, pandas or monkeys may grace the walls, or there could be scenes of nomads from different regions with their livestock. 
  
These well sized, sunny rooms have armchairs or even separate sitting rooms depending on the category. Some special rooms even have carved and painted altars and carpet covered sofa loungers.
  
The common areas are equally alluring. The Dzipak Parlour has a floor length silk Roman curtain with painstaking applique work depicting richly coloured jewels and the 8 auspicious symbols. There is an outdoor cafe overlooking the hillside where you can listen to the relaxing boom of drums from the nearby Namgyal monastery. 
  
The indoor restaurant is a sunny room, also with exquisitely painted walls and charming wooden furniture. Freshly baked cookies and cakes are on sale as well as fresh salads and authentic Tibetan food.
Metatype: This small unique boutique guesthouse offers Dharamsala's finest accommodation.
Descr: Chonor House in Dharamsala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: chonor house, dharamsala, tibetan culture, himachal, special places, heritage

description:
A large Victorian house converted into a hotel in a quiet part of central Kolkata. The hotel has 34 large and atmospheric rooms with attached bathrooms. 

130 years old, The Astor is a handsome red coloured brick building. Located in busy Shakespeare Sarani, close to the Esplanade, the Astor is a peaceful retreat from the busy life of the city.
cuisine: Chinese, Indian. The Famous Kebab e Que Restaurant
advantage: Located On one of Kolkata's Main Avenues
roomfacility: 34 Rooms with Wall to Wall Carpeting and a European Ambience, En-suite Facilities with Running H/C water
services: 24 Hour Room Service, Laundry & Dry Cleaning, Doctor on Call, Car Parking
WebWriteUp1:
The ambience is graciously old world with teak wood staircases, wainscoting, and floors covered with beautiful carpets. This is a place of great character.

There is a small but neat front garden, bordering the popular Kebab E Que restaurant which serves tandoori and barbeque food. A recent addition is a specialty Italian/Mediterranean restaurant. 

The rooms are on the upper two levels of the building and there is no elevator, so this hotel is not recommended for those with a mobility problem. No two rooms are alike, but all have the air of a genteel country home. The furnishings are of excellent quality, and the bathrooms have been fitted with modern amenities while keeping their old world charm. 

The Astor fits well into the graceful colonial buildings which give Kolkata its distinct historical feel.
Metatype: A large Victorian house converted into a hotel in a quiet part of central Kolkata. The hotel has 34 large and atmospheric rooms with attached bathrooms.
Descr: The Astor in Kolkata - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the astor, heritage hotel, Kolkata, calcutta, special places

description: A charming relic of the Raj, this old-fashioned Calcutta institution has been run for more than 50 years by Mrs Violet Smith. It is a rambling place filled with memorabilia, family heirlooms, paintings, well-stocked bookshelves and sitting rooms. Here, guests are encouraged to eat together in a sociable atmosphere. There is a delightful beer garden which is a popular meeting place in the evenings.
advantage: Close to the Indian Museum
roomfacility: Room Service, H/C running water, Telephone, T.V., Tea/Coffee Maker
services: Doctor on Call, Laundry, Money Changer, Safe Deposit, Fax, E-mail, Pleasant Garden
WebWriteUp1:
This quaint, green walled 200 hundred year old house is a much loved Calcutta institution. The writer Dominique Lapierre became so enamoured of it that it became the inspiration for his ode to Calcutta: "The City of Joy". Still owned by the Anglo-Indian Violet Smith, the hotel houses the family's eclectic collection of dolls, vases, plates and other bric-a-brac. An eccentric hotel in the heart of Calcutta, the dense thick greenery of the garden that surrounds the house offers an escape from the traffic fumes and dust of the city. 

The rooms are white and bright and airy with heavy red brocade bed covers and antique four legged bathtubs. This is not the place to which to bring expectations of mechanised modernism. Some of the bathroom tiles may be a cracked and the rooms an awkward shape but this is only part of the Fairlawn's old world charm. 

The chintzy armchairs of the upstairs lounge are the ideal perch from which to take in all the mind boggling memorabilia. The family's vast collection of photographs featuring the a vast number of celebrities both national and international, requires a couple of hours to appreciate.
Metatype: A charming relic of the Raj, this old-fashioned Calcutta institution has been run for more than 50 years by Mrs Smith.
Descr: Fairlawn Hotel in Kolkata - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fairlawn hotel, violet smith, heritage hotel, kolkata, calcutta, special places

description:
Mandawa Haveli is a late 19th century building converted into a heritage hotel. A majestic entrance leads to an inner courtyard decorated with fresco paintings portraying legends of Lord Krishna's life. 

The rooms branch off from the inner courtyard. They vary in size and shape as they had to be accommodated within the old structure. However, the bathrooms are modern and functional. Candlelit dinners in the rooftop restaurant provide a chance to enjoy Rajasthani food in the magical ambience of this frescoed building.
advantage: A 19th Century Haveli, set around a Court-yard and with Original Frescoes
roomfacility: All Rooms with Attached Baths, Hot & Cold Running Water
otherfacility: Camel Ride, Jeep Safari, Folk Dances & Puppet Shows, Roof-Top Restaurant, Thali Dinners, traditional oil massage
services: Small Library, Laundry, Doctor on call , Bicycles on Rent
WebWriteUp1:
A small, lavishly frescoed haveli in the heart of the town, Mandawa Haveli gives a rare chance for visitors to stay in one of the famous painted havelis of Shekhavati. 

Built in 1890 by a Marwari jeweler, the haveli is a lovely building with beautiful frescoes. A few years ago, a dynamic young man, Dinesh Dabhai, bought the haveli and carefully restored it so that today it is a memorable place to stay. 

A broad flight of steps take you through a massive entrance to the inner courtyard. Intricate frescoes depicting legends from Lord Krishna's life adorn the many walls. 

The rooms branch off from the inner courtyard. They vary in size and shape as they had to be accommodated within the old structure. The bathrooms too, come in quaint shapes but are modern and functional. Each room has a different theme of d�cor and colour and each one is charming. 

Candlelit dinners are served on the rooftop. It is a wonderful experience to enjoy the traditional Rajasthani food in the magical ambience of this frescoed building.
Metatype: A late 19th century building converted into a heritage hotel. A majestic entrance leads to an inner courtyard decorated with fresco paintings portraying legends of Lord Krishna's life.
Descr: Mandawa Haveli in Mandawa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mandawa haveli, rajasthan, heritage hotel, frescoes, special places

WebWriteUp1:
This new hotel is a pleasant small resort with low bungalows set against the backdrop of hills. There is a lobby - with sunlight from the inner courtyard making it bright and inviting. The restaurant has large glass panes to let in light and the views of the swimming pool and the surrounding lawns. 

The rooms are set across the lawns - and built around another small courtyard. The rooms are generous sized, with plenty of space left after including a seating area, desk and good sized beds. The bathrooms are modern and also good sized.

description:
This 3 star hotel has been completely re-furbished recently and makes for an excellent mid-range choice in Mumbai. 

Located at Byculla, Hotel Heritage is a short drive away from Mumbai's main attractions and monuments: the Gateway of India, the Jehangir Art Gallery, the Prince of Wales Museum and the Victoria Terminus.
  
The Heritage is also very conveniently located close to the 3 main railway stations of Mumbai.
WebWriteUp1:
Comfort Inn Hotel Heritage is located at Byculla, very close to Mumbai's Central Railway Station. Hotel Heritage has 96 rooms spread over 5 floors. The rooms are set a couple of steps above the main corridor thereby allowing a window to be open and yet retain privacy. They are decorated in contemporary style with neutral colours offset by bright cushions and curtains. The fabrics used are bright cottons, satins and silks. Each room has space for a small seating corner and a writing desk. 

Downstairs, is a small coffee shop, a bar and also Nizam's, a restaurant famous for its meat Biryanis. Directly opposite the hotel is one of the most noteworthy churches of Mumbai, the Gloria church, which can be seen as you walk the long sunlit corridors to the guest rooms.
Metatype: This 3 star hotel has been completely re-furbished recently and makes for an excellent mid-range choice in Mumbai.
Descr: Hotel Heritage in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel heritage, mumbai, gateway, india, travel, special places

description:
Just opposite the royal cenotaphs, this hotel is about one km outside town, but it offers one of the best views of the Jaisalmer fort, especially at sunset. 

The small, circular burj (tower) rooms are charming, with marble beds and lights concealed in the nooks of the stone walls. The hotel also has a restaurant, a bar and a large swimming pool.
WebWriteUp1:
Right opposite the sunset point, where the beautiful and photogenic Vyas chhatris (cenotaphs) stand, is Himmatgarh Palace. In common with almost all buildings in Jaislamer, Himmatgarh too is built is the golden yellow sandstone, and since the hotel occupies a small hill by itself, the building looks very attractive. 

The hotel is built in a L shape, and spreads over two levels. In the centre is an enormous terrace with large azure swimming pool. In the dry and often hot climate of Jaisalmer, the pool is welcome. This terrace offers unbeatable views of the Jaisalmer fort with the village spreading beyond. 

The rooms are in two different categories. Some are in round, turret shaped buildings that mimic the large turrets of the Fort. These rooms have one large double bed along one wall and a smaller, day bed. The ceilings are high here and the round rooms have an unusual appeal. The other rooms are in the other arm of the L shape. These are accessed by an arched corridor.

Himmatgarh Palace has a grand indoor restaurant which serves Indian food with some continental dishes.
Metatype: Just opposite the royal cenotaphs, this hotel is about one km outside town, but it offers one of the best views of the Jaisalmer fort, especially at sunset.
Descr: Himmatgarh Palace in Jaisalmer - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: himmatgarh palace, jaisalmer, rajasthan, heritage, hotel, fort, desert

description:
In the heart of the colourful village of Anjuna is the 200 year old yellow and white Hotel Bougainvillea, affectionately called Granpa's Inn.
 
Here, you will find lush gardens, a large swimming pool and cool, cosy rooms that offer a shady retreat just minutes from the weekly flea market and Anjuna beach. 

The Hibiscus restaurant spills over from the shady wrap around verandah of the house onto the lawns and is decorated in a nostalgic 1970's style of purple and mauve.
WebWriteUp1:
The best rooms in Hotel Bougainvillea are in the new part of the house, built in the same charming style as the older ones, with high ceilings and a red oxide bench on the yellow and white porch. 

The advantages of the modern construction are seen in the bathrooms which are prettily done up in blue and green glass mosaic tiles and which, in addition to having a bathtub, also offer an outdoor shower which is open to the sky and the overhanging trees. 

The Hibiscus restaurant serves Goan and Continental cuisine. Also within the premises of Granpa's Inn is a centre for Brahmanic yoga which the guests may use.
Metatype: In the heart of the colourful village of Anjuna is the 200 year old yellow and white Hotel Bougainvillea, affectionately called Granpa's Inn.
Descr: Hotel Bougainvillea in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bougainvillea, grandpa's inn, goa, village, anjuna, hibiscus restaurant, hotel

The ferry ride from the mainland Ernakulam to the island is a pleasurable experience.

The palace is two-storeyed and contains well-decorated bed chambers, a huge lounge wherein historical portraits are displayed. The ferry ride from the mainland Ernakulam to the island is a pleasurable experience.
Descr: Bolgatty Palace in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
An atmospheric heritage hotel with spacious rooms and suites, situated in peaceful and verdant surroundings, a short distance from the Mall.  

Being a heritage property, the rooms vary in terms of size and the choice of colour, but they all feature furniture of the classical style - large wooden beds, the occasional carved cupboard, and vividly patterned carpets. There are also a couple of overstuffed armchairs which are perfect to read in.
WebWriteUp1:
When Mohammad Yahya Khan, an aristrocrat from Lahore wanted to build a summer retreat, he must surely have browsed the pages of fairytales for ideas. Springfields is a whimsical little cottage with winding paths and trellis draped over its doors. 

A small 11 roomed hotel, Springfields is located in Chhota Shimla, a pleasant 2 km walk from the popular promenade that is Mall Road. The staff is courteous and welcoming and the rooms old fashioned and sunny. The restaurant features elegantly laid out tables in intimate groups and the lawns offer excellent views over the valley. 

Sunshine streams in from the windows in the corridors and falls upon wooden floors and beautiful inlaid wood tables and cane sofas. The Kipling Lounge Bar is where people gather in the evenings to warm up with a couple of cocktails and the spicy tandoori snacks that are the hotel's specialities. Post drinks, one heads to the Lutyen's room for a choice of Indian, Continental and Chinese meals.

Shimla is best seen on foot, and there are many different roads to choose from. The immediate surroundings of the hotel include a small market and a Tibetan school.
 
On cold nights a pleasant option can be to sit around a bonfire (which the hotel organises on request) on the lawns while looking down upon the twinkling lights of the valley.
Metatype: An atmospheric heritage hotel with spacious rooms and suites, situated in peaceful and verdant surroundings, a short distance from the Mall.
Descr: Hotel Springfields in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: springfields hotel, shimla, heritage, hotel, himachal pradesh, special places

description:
Low roofed, fat pillared cottages and long courtyards make up this resort, built around a vast artificial lagoon. Graceful, jewel studded statuettes and black and white photographs of Indian royals line the corridors that lead to the rooms.

The rooms are sumptuous, with fluffy four poster beds, bathrooms with gold filled light and fittings to match. Set amongst 11 acres of gardens, the rooms are all cooled by breezes coming from either the lagoon or the gardens.
WebWriteUp1:
The Mayfair group of hotels is well known on the east coast for their unique style and the Bhubaneshwar property is most definitely the jewel in their crown. 

If you ever get around to leaving your room there are table tennis matches to be played, a pool to splash around in, local Oriya food to be discovered and even an English pub to relax in. But perhaps you'd prefer to just wander around the vast property, admiring its South East Asian trinkets or following black and red Tiger butterflies as they drink their fill amongst the hotel's tropical gardens. 

The Mayfair Lagoon's Balinese styled villas may not offer the authentic Indian experience but they do provide a healthy dose of tranquility and comfort.
Metatype: Low roofed, fat pillared cottages and long courtyards make up this resort,  built around a vast artificial lagoon. Graceful, jewel studded statuettes and black and white photographs of Indian royals line the corridors that lead to the rooms.

The resort is located a half hour drive away from the main sights of Hampi, amidst an incredibly stunning location. You actually drive over large boulders to reach it! Spread over a large area leading down to the river, this really is a unique place to stay.

This private and remote resort is surrounded by nature. It occupies the bank of a river, amid bamboo trees, coconut groves, mango trees, and the huge boulders that Hampi is famous for.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are in cottages scattered all over the property. They are furnished simply and comfortably.

There is a double storied, open, granite and thatch cottage that houses the lobby and dining room. The views from here are panoramic. The rooms are in individual cottages, all having their own sit-out or terrace to enjoy the views.

description:
This is a wonderful hotel in rural surroundings managed by a very hospitable family.

Part of the 18th century fort has been restored to create rooms and suites. The facade mirrors the old style of the original fort, complete with scalloped arches and delicate latticework.

In the courtyard garden is a delightful Rajasthani pavilion tent. Afternoon tea can be enjoyed here, overlooking the garden and giving a glimpse of the swimming pool behind a latticework wall.
WebWriteUp1:
One of the nicest of the country homes, Rawla Jojawar is located amongst the Aravalli hills in a rural area. A short drive off the national highway from Jodhpur to Udaipur passes working fields to the small town of Jojawar, at the centre of which is Rawla Jojawar. 

The family at Jojawar is very warm and welcoming. The head of the family, Maharaj Singhji, often personally escorts guests on an exciting train ride through scenic rural areas. He is well liked and respected in the village and guests can get a genuine insight into rural India.  

Jojawar kitchens are famous for their tasty cuisine which is cooked under the supervision of the ladies of the house. Meals are served in the large and cheerful dining room. 

The guest rooms are spread throughout the large rambling structure. Rooms are all spacious - each with enough space for a classic writing desk, old fashioned bed, side tables and some with even cushioned bay windows. The bathrooms all are newly decorated in pleasing colours with imaginative tables or marble counter tops for the wash basins.
Metatype: This is a wonderful hotel in rural surroundings managed by a very hospitable family.
Descr: Rawla Jojawar in Jojawar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rawla jojawar, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village safari, family, special places

description:
This majestic old home was one of the first to open its teak doors to guests. Your host, Mr Bhagwaldas, has a genuine desire to give his guests a true glimpse of the local life and culture.

You can explore the village,vsit the temple to observe the evening rituals and pooja, or walk or cycle along narrow winding roads through beautiful unspoilt rural landscapes.
cuisine: Kerala style cuisine both non vegetarian and vegetarian
roomfacility: attached bathroom
services: sightseeing and activities organised at the Tharavad
WebWriteUp1:
The drive through the Kandath family's vast agriculture holdings brings you to the Tharavad. The facade and the interiors speak of the family's affluence, and guests have an opportunity to live with an aristocratic Kerala family. 

Mr Bhagwaldas, often personally accompanies guests to the surrounding small village to see local craftspeople at work. He is a much respected person in the community and can take guests to see the school, visit local family homes, visit a place which makes traditional idlis, and enjoy a freshly brewed cup of chai in the local style.

The Tharavad has massive teak columns with magnificently carved brackets and finials. Right at the entrance is a raised area, which was traditionally where the head of the family would receive visitors, and is now adorned with a stunning mural. The seating is Indian style, with bolsters and cushions to lean against. 

If you wish, the host can arrange for his family astrologer to come and predict your future with the help of cowrie shells. This ascetic man with slender fingers reads the shells and reveals details about your personality, some past landmarks in your life and may be able to make some startling predictions. 

There is an intimate dining section where meals are served as guests mingle with each other - you are encouraged to feel at home here! The food is freshly prepared in the family kitchens and includes many Kerala delicacies. 

The rooms aren't large, but have great character, and are filled with original furniture and small art objects. The attached bathrooms are modern and adequate.
Metatype: This majestic old home was one of the first to open its teak doors to guests. Your host, Mr Bhagwaldas, has a genuine desire to give his guests a true glimpse of the local life and culture.
Descr: Kandath Tharavad in Palakkad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: kandath tharavad, homestay, heritage hotel, village, palakkad, kerala

Descr: Hotel Westwood in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A slim slice of pure paradise, the Elsewhere villas - the Captain's House, the Piggery, the Bakery and the Priest's House - straddle a narrow piece of land between the sea and a creek. 

The rustic villas sit well away from each other and house a world of comfort within. Their earthy coloured walls and fat white balustrades shelter many a lounge chair, fluffy white beds, and traditional dark wood cupboards. They are just a stone's throw away from one of the most beautiful beaches in Goa.
WebWriteUp1:
The villas have been charmingly named for their original purposes. The piggery, for example, was used to house livestock and the priest lived in his villa well into the 1950's. But they were lovingly and stylishly restored by Denzil Sequeira, the great grandson of the original owner, who is a prominent fashion photographer in Mumbai. 

His artist's eye is clearly seen in bold use of colours like ochre, deep rust and blazing white and the precise placement of Goan curios such as enamel cookware, hand woven baskets and metal pots. But Denzil's deep affection for Elsewhere would not allow him to make any changes to the real essence of his ancestral home. And the result is a preservation of the traditional Goan architectural elements of the house - the tiled roofs, the laterite and mud walls, and the broad verandahs that instantly invite you to sit down and enjoy the sea breeze.

At Elsewhere, modern world comes to a halt and is firmly kept away by the wooden walkway bridge which is the lone access to the villas - no television sets, no ringing telephones and no cars. Just gently swaying palm trees and the warm sea which is a stone's throw away.  Here, only the essential, the restorative and the nostalgic are allowed in.
Metatype: A slim slice of pure paradise, the Elsewhere villas - the Captain's House, the Piggery, the Bakery and the Priest's House, straddle a narrow piece of land between the sea and a creek.
Descr: Elsewhere in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: elsewhere, beach, villa, ashvem, mandrem, goa, special places, hotel

Descr: Otter Creek in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: A well run royal family home. Mr Digvijay Singh and his wife Kavita have a keen eye for detail that has won them many repeat guests over the years. Located in a quiet residential area, Madhuban embodies the charm of old age. The common areas and the rooms are all decorated with a classic ambience and period furniture. There is a small swimming pool, and a peaceful garden.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are set on different levels and many have access to small terraces which offer shaded spots ideal for reading or relaxing. The main terrace of the hotel has good views of the surrounding areas. All rooms have attached baths (some with bath tubs), and television with international channels. Rooms of a higher category have four poster or canopied beds. All rooms have original classic furniture.

Just off the formal family living room, which is also open to guests, there is a small collection of ceremonial robes and silver ornaments belonging to the family. 

The restaurant serves delicious home-cooked food, there are beautiful lawns and a small swimming pool.
Metatype: A well run royal family home. Mr Digvijay Singh and his wife Kavita have a keen eye for detail that has won them many repeat guests over the years.
Descr: Hotel Madhuban in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This small and unpretentious resort is a good base from which to visit the nearby Ranakpur temples and to take walks in the beautiful countryside. 

It is a pleasing low structure built around lawns and carefully planted trees and shrubs. There is a large swimming pool with paved deck space to relax and sunbathe. 

The stone floors of the spacious rooms are decorated with small colourful rugs and wide bay windows are filled with mattresses and cushions for relaxing.
WebWriteUp1:
The area between Ranakpur to Udaipur is one of the prettiest in Rajasthan. It is hilly and surprisingly fertile, with contiguous forests and many streams and lakes. The bird-life is varied and the scenic drive up and down the small hills is attractive

Here, secure in the hills, an amazing temple complex was built by Jains in the 15th century. The Ranakpur temple complex is regarded as amongst the best temple architecture. These marble edifices are a highlght for any traveller to India. 

Ranakpur Hill Resort is situated at the base of the towering Aravalli hills. This small and simple resort makes is a good base from which to visit the temples and to take walks in the countryside. 

Located just off the road, Ranakpur Hill Resort is a pleasing low structure built around lawns and carefully planted trees and shrubs. There is a large swimming pool with paved deck space to relax and sunbathe. The poolside offers the best views of the craggy hills strewn with enormous rocks. 

The rooms are in two wings, reached by pleasant pathways or wide passages, and are large in size. The stone floors are decorated with colourful rugs. Most rooms have a wide bay window, with mattresses and cushions in Rajasthani fabrics. 

The restaurant is a large room done with light coloured walls and interesting niches with Rajasthani furniture. It is a bright and cheerful plac, offering a variety of cuisines, the speciality being barbequed Indian dishes.
Metatype: This small and unpretentious resort is a good base from which to visit the nearby Ranakpur temples. and for walks in the beautiful countryside.
Descr: Ranakpur Hill Resort in Ranakpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ranakpur hill resort, rajasthan, hotel, jain temples, hills, special places

description:
The Travancore Heritage is a sea side resort set in 8 acres of lush green coconut gardens south of Kovalam. 

The resort stands on a high cliff overlooking the Arabian Sea and a long wide beach of powdery white sand. 

The charming cottages have elements of the traditional typical timber houses with tiled roofing. There is a swimming pool, Ayurveda centre, a seafood grill and a multi-cuisine restaurant.
WebWriteUp1:
An eclectic combination of old Kerala cottages and a modern building to one side, Travancore Heritage is a large resort. The lobby, done up as a replica of a traditional Kerala open courtyard, is always busy. Efficient ladies, wearing Kerala sarees check you in and escort you to your room.

The resort is spread over a large area from the cliff leafing down to to the beach front, so expect a fair bit of walking. A lift is available to go from the upper level to the seafood restaurant on the beach.

The guest rooms in the cottages all have a private sit-out overlooking the lawns and the sea beyond the palms. Some of these have outdoor showers in a semi-walled in garden. The modern rooms in a building to one side, all have large verandahs with direct views over the sea and are spacious and comfortable. 

There are two restaurants; The main one serves generous buffet style meals. The restaurant is spread over a large verandah with a pavilion attached, and is quite busy at meal times. The specialty sea food restaurant is at the beach level and has a more relaxed ambience.
Metatype: The Travancore Heritage is a sea side resort set in 8 acres of lush green coconut gardens south of Kovalam.
Descr: The Travancore Heritage in Kovalam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: travancore heritage, kovalam, beach, resort, kerala, special places

Descr: Maharani Guest House in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This small hotel is located in a peaceful residential area of Gurgaon, the buzzing satellite city of Delhi. 

The hotel is a short drive away from the domestic airport and makes for a good base when you arrive late at night on an international flight or have to leave Delhi in the early morning.
WebWriteUp1:
Royal Retreat is a pleasant low rise building. The lobby is spacious and has an eye catching, large tropical fish aquarium behind the reception. The Rooms are either on the ground floor or on the first level. Wide and bright corridors lead to the rooms. We recommend the `Deluxe' rooms here. These rooms all face the front and have a good sized balcony overlooking the quiet street. The rooms themselves are well appointed. The beds and comfortable and all rooms have TV with satellite connection and mini-bars. The bathrooms are good sized and modern. 

The restaurant is located just below the reception area. Room service is available round the clock.
Metatype: This small hotel is located in a peaceful residential area of Gurgaon, the buzzing satellite city of Delhi.
Descr: Royal Retreat in Gurgaon - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: royal retreat, gurgaon, delhi, hotel, special places, rajasthan, golden triangle

description:
The Ashok Country Resort is set in sprawling green grounds close to Delhi's international airport. Upon arrival you'll immediately feel as if you've been whisked away to a sequestered retreat in rural India - truly amazing considering the hotel's proximity to the airport and a busy national highway. 

The rooms are light and airy and comfortable, with soft beds and pleasant furnishings. There is a lovely pool in the hotel gardens, and a library bar, making this the perfect place to relax before or after a long flight.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are well-appointed with all modern conveniences and all of them overlook the lawns, but the real beauty of the resort lies in its outdoor spaces with its wide lawns, enormous pool and spa facilities.

Its spa facilities are a matter of pride for the Ashok Country Resort and it offers a range of deep Ayurvedic massage treatments as well as scrubs and wraps. The spa also offers reflexology massages which are especially soothing after long flights.

The hotel's Picadilly Restaurant is located in a long, pleasant room reminiscent of a durbar hall. Many of the ingredients used in its dishes come from the organic vegetable gardens in the hotel grounds which you may visit.

Although located a mere half an hour's drive away from Connaught Place, the Ashok Country Resort is seems a world away and offers a serene escape at the end of a long day of sightseeing.
Metatype: The Ashok Country Resort is set in sprawling green grounds  in the airport vicinity. Upon arrival you'll immediately feel as if you've been whisked away to a sequestered retreat in rural India - truly amazing considering the hotel's proximity to the airport and a busy national highway. The rooms  are light and airy and comfortable, with soft beds and pleasant furnishings. There is a lovely pool in the hotel gardens and there is also a small gym to keep fit.
Descr: Ashok Country Resort in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

The Haveli Hari Ganga is situated on the banks of the holy river Ganges. It is a beautifully restored mansion which has now been converted into a heritage hotel with 20 well appointed air-conditioned rooms and suites.

The restaurant serves excellent vegetarian food. There is a well-equiped Ayurvedic Health Spa with massage and steam rooms. The hotel can arrange yoga & meditation and an astrologer for consultations. 
  
The haveli is situated near a teeming network of markets running paralel to the river. It is a mere 500 meters walk through the bazaar to the sacred "Hari ki Pauri" where the spectacular evening Aarti is performed every day at dusk.

description:
The grand old Marina Hotel on Connaught Place has been totally refurbished by the Radisson group, thereby introducing all their usual touches such as a large, bright, spacious lobby, with well trained and helpful staff. 

There are 90 rooms, and all are supremely comfortable. Though some are quite small, they all feature the abundant furnishings, fittings and amenities of a Radisson hotel.

The hotel also offers a bar, coffee shop, and a specialty kebab restaurant.
accessrail: 0.5 km from New Delhi railway statrion
advantage: The Marina hotel is located in Connaught Place, the Central Business District of New Delhi. The well known shopping centers of Connaught Place and Janpath are a short stroll away.
roomfacility: 24 hrs. Room service, H/C running water, Telephone, Colour T. V. Safe Deposit, Refrigerator in each room, Doctor on call
otherfacility: Mazlis Banquet Hall
