WebWriteUp1:
Flaunting, perhaps, what is the best address in all of New Delhi, the Radisson Blu Marina hotel sits right inside Connaught Circus, the majestic colonnaded circle of streets that is the landmark of New Delhi. 

A four-star boutique hotel, the Radisson Blu Marina is housed in a heritage building but has modern but warm interiors. Wood floors and pinewood furniture create a warm ambience in the room no matter what the time of the day and the general feel is one of subtle elegance. 

To begin your exploration of the chaotic, colourful capital of the country, you can simply step outside to see the glitzy side of India, the designer boutiques and international restaurants or make your way to the Metro stop that's only a few minutes away which will transport you to whichever corner of the city you wish to explore.

The hotel has two popular restaurants, one, The Great Kabab Factory is the signature restaurant of the Radisson chain of hotels in India, serving various meat, fish and vegetable kebabs served in a variety of interesting ways. Fifty9 is the in-house multi-cuisine restaurant which offers Continental, Asian and Indian delicacies.

There's also a pretty cool bar in the hotel which prides itself on its wide selection of whiskeys. 'The Connaught' as its called, is a great place to head to if you feel like getting dressed up and ordering some bubbly and nibbles.
Metatype: The Marina hotel is conveniently located in the heart of New Delhi, on Connaught Place. There are lots of shops and restaurants just a short stroll away. The hotel offers 94 centrally air-conditioned rooms with attached bathroom. All rooms are elegantly appointed with all amenities such as fridge and television. The hotel has an attractive reception, good coffee shop, a bar, and a restaurant serving Indian, Chinese & Continental meals.
Descr: Hotel Marina in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Situated right at Connaught Place, Delhi's happening centre, The Park is a superbly designed contemporary hotel. 

The Park is situated in the shopping hub of Delhi and is also close to the many emporia and the famous shopping area of Janpath. 

The Park has a swimming pool, a chic bar and two restaurants, including a 24 hour coffee shop and one serving contemporary and traditional Indian cuisine.
WebWriteUp1:
The Park, New Delhi, is situated in the heart of the city's business and entertainment hub- Connaught Place. It overlooks the historic 18th century Jantar Mantar observatory. Souvenirs from all areas of India can be found close by in the various state emporiums located here.

It is a very contemporary and stylish hotel. its spacious banquet halls and restaurants all buzz with activity. The rooms are a model of refined luxury with a personal touch, and superior amenities and services. Public spaces and guest rooms are lined with handpicked contemporary art. This is a place to relax and recharge, which at the same time reflects the electric energy of the city.

Agni, is the most talked about and happening night club of the city.

Aqua, the poolside restaurant/bar is the perfect setting for an evening of relaxing after a busy day.

Aura, the Spa, has recently been rated as amongst the top 10 spas of India.
Metatype: Situated right at Connaught Place, Delhi's happening centre, The Park is a superbly designed contemporary hotel.
Descr: The Park in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Hotel Host Inn in Ahmedabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A good budget option in Bhubaneshwar, the Royale Midtown is a fairly conventional looking modern building on the street that is modern Bhubaneshwar's lifeline.  

Green marbled corridors lined with potted plants lead to the rooms which are well sized for a city hotel and are well equipped. There is also a well serviced restaurant and a bar.
WebWriteUp1:
The Royale Midtown is a modern mid range hotel for a comfortable night's stay at a reasonable budget.  

The rooms have large beds, a work table and chair, and a sofa. The colours are pleasant if a little staid, with plenty of greens and browns. The rooms are large for a hotel of this category, clean, and have cable television, international calling facilities and 24 hour room service. The bathrooms are of green and white marble and well maintained.

The restaurant is cool with purple walls, artistically arranged dried flowers and straight backed chairs. The food is excellent, with an especially good breakfast buffet. There is also a small bar. 

There are plenty of shops offering a huge varirty of goods nearby, as well as several good local eateries.
Metatype: A good budget option in Bhubaneshwar, the Royale Midtown is a fairly conventional looking modern building on the street that is modern Bhubaneshwar's lifeline.
Descr: The Royale Midtown in Bhubaneshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the royale midtown, bhubaneshwar, hotel, orissa, special places

description:
Tigertrails is a private jungle lodge run by Amrut Dhanwatay and his son Aditya. They are keen wildlife enthusiasts who know the Tadoba Tiger Reserve better than anyone else. 

The jungle lodge is situated close to the core area of the park in a large private forest. The lodge has seven simply furnished rooms and a garden where meals are often served around a bonfire.
WebWriteUp1:
The only viable accommodation option for exploring the Tadoba Tiger Reserve, Tiger Trails Jungle Lodge consists of 2 standalone cottages with 7 rooms. The rooms are in fact located inside the core area of the park making it a unique accommodation experience. Tigertrails has its own fleet of safari vehicles and also has many machans (watchtowers) on its private land from where one can observe wildlife.

Amrut Dhanwatay, the man behind Tiger Trails and the one responsible for reviving the many acres of previously over-grazed land around his property, is an Environmental Engineer and has been conferred the title of Honorary Wildlife Warden by the state government.  

The rooms, in keeping with most nature lodges, are fairly simple, but they are large and extremely clean and comfortable. The orange ceramic tiles on the floor are warm, the beds adequate and the bathrooms well appointed. There is running hot water but no air conditioning. None is required however as even in the winter months the surrounding forest keeps the temperature pleasant.

Since all meals are included and the fresh air of the surroundings tends to improve the appetite, the owners have wisely decided on providing food which is as close as possible to the light, non greasy food of Indian homes. Buffets are of the local food of the region - lightly spiced, utterly delicious and not often served in restaurants. The ingredients are more than likely to have been grown in the owner's own fields and the results are a delight. 

A definite highlight of the stay is also speaking with and learning from Amrut and his son Aditya, on their efforts to salvage the forest, educate the local people on their role in wildlife conservation, and their desire to support the surrounding villagers. One of them will accompany you on the park rides. Guests often find themselves chatting with the hosts well in to the night around the crackling bonfire that welcomes you back from the afternoon safari.
Metatype: Tigertrails is a private jungle lodge run by Amrut Dhanwatay and his son Aditya. They are keen wildlife enthusiasts who know the Tadoba Tiger Reserve better than anyone else.
Descr: Tigertrails in Tadoba - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: tigertrails, tadoba, wildlife, lodge, hotel, tigers, national  park, jeep safaris

description:
The Amarpreet Hotel offers possibly the best mid range accommodation in Aurangabad . Although a simple hotel, it has comfortable rooms, good service and memorable food at an affordable price. 

This hotel draws crowds of local residents on weekends, who come to dine at the in house restaurant, which is known for its Indian tandoori and Chinese food, and regular barbeques on the front lawn.
creditcards: American Express, Visa, Master cards, Maestro cards
WebWriteUp1:
The Amarpreet Hotel offers possibly the best mid range accommodation in Aurangabad .Since the hotel was originally built more than 30 years ago, the rooms are of a rather more generous size than the modern matchbox variety. Decorated in staid blues and browns, there are large beds, sofas, and writing desks. The bathrooms are well equipped. 

The small garden in front of the hotelensures that there is a lot of natural light in the rooms. 

Situated in the newer part of the city, the hotel is nevertheless located at an easy distance from the city's sights, and there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby.
Metatype: The Amarpreet Hotel offers possibly the best mid range accommodation in Aurangabad . Although a simple hotel, it has comfortable rooms, good service and memorable food at an affordable price.
Descr: Hotel Amarpreet in Aurangabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Fort Unchagaon was built in the early 18th century as a home for the Jat rulers who rose in prominence during the decline of the Mughal Empire. 

It was originally made of mud, but the walls ware later replaced by brick, and the old building inside the fort was totally renovated during the 1930's to give it a distinctly colonial look. 

The present Raja converted the property into a heritage hotel, which is still his personal residence.
WebWriteUp1:
Unchagaon is a small village, 35 km off the Delhi-Moradabad highway, from where a narrow road passes typical rural scenes of buffaloes, women hidden behind veils collecting wood and hay, and tractors ploughing the fields.

Fort Unchagaon has 17 spacious guestrooms, furnished with antiques, and surrounded by landscaped lawns. This is an ideal stop between Agra and Corbett National Park or Nainital. It is situated in a fertile region close to the Ganges river, at a spot which is known for the sighting of Gangetic Dolphins. Unchagaon is also close to the ancient temple of Amantika Devi.
Metatype: Fort Unchagaon was built in the early 18th century as a home for the Jat rulers who rose in prominence during the decline of the Mughal Empire.
Descr: Fort Unchagaon in Unchagaon - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort unchagaon, colonial, heritage hotel, village, special  places

description: A short driveway lined by tall bottle palms brings you to Usha Bundela. While the temples of Khajuraho date back to the 9th century, the rest of the town was built in more recent times, as were its hotels, including Usha Bundela, a comfortable old fashioned hotel with a relaxed ambience. Set among large gardens, and featuring a swimming pool this peaceful hotel is within easy distance of the small town of Khajuraho and its famous temples.
WebWriteUp1:
Usha Bundela is a comfortable modern hotel, set in four acres of quiet grounds. The rooms have been recently refurbished. Decorated in white, blue and red the rooms are of an agreeable size with large windows. There are tea and coffee makers and televisions in all rooms. 

The hotel has a multi-cuisine restaurant, open lawns, a swimming pool, and an ayurvedic massage centre. A bar on the mezzanine floor overlooks the lobby and has a pool table.
Metatype: A short driveway lined by tall bottle palms brings you to Usha Bundela a pleasant modern hotel in Khajuraho.
Descr: Usha Bundela in Khajuraho - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: usha bundela, khajuraho, hotel, erotic temples, madhya pradesh

description:
Staying in hotel Ganges View feels more like staying in a grand historic home with a wonderful traditional and spiritual feel.

Much of the furniture is antique, there are various shrines, and historic paintings and religious items decorate the many lounges and terraces. 

The overall effect is of peaceful contemplation, offering a more in depth understanding of the history and culture of this pilgrimage city.
WebWriteUp1:
This popular small budget hotel - the best on the Ganges - is ideally located in the fascinating Assi Ghat area, opposite one of the most sacred spots of the River Ganges. In fact, it's so popular with certain repeat guests that you'd do well to book your room up to a year in advance. 

There are superb views over the river from the terraces of the hotel, especially at sunrise, the most auspicious time to worship the holy river, and at sunset, when an "aarti" ceremony is held.

There are 14 rooms, each individually furnished with traditional decorative items. All are bright, welcoming and comfortable, with modern bathrooms. Many have attractive verandahs outside for relaxation.   

There are many lounges, and terraces, with comfortable, often antique, furniture. Books and pamphlets concerning the history, art and culture of Varanasi are found throughout the property, and the friendly owners can be seen attending to the various religious shrines, and are happy to spend time discussing the religious and cultural aspects of this most fascinating, and often confusing, city. As a result the hotel is very popular with those wishing to gain a more in depth understanding of Hinduism, and has been host to many artists, scholars, poets, writers, musicians and philosophers. 

The dining room occupies part of the main lounge, and is a very convivial space. Sharing of tables at mealtimes is encouraged, so as to facilitate conversation with your fellow guests, while enjoying the delicious, traditional vegetarian meals, which end with samples of some of the many sweets for which Varanasi is famous.  

A stay here is therefore ideal for those who desire a relaxing stay in an atmospheric property which offers an insight into many of the spiritual, historical and cultural aspects of the holy city of Varanasi.
Metatype: You're required to remove your shoes upon entering this lovely colonial lodge at the edge of the Ganges, and it's an appropriate gesture of respect given the effort that has turned this budget guesthouse -- the best on the Ganges -- into such a comfortable haven. In fact, it's so popular with certain repeat guests (many of them artists and musicians) that you'd do well to book your room up to a year in advance. The gorgeous, simple guest rooms feature marble floors and French doors that open onto enclosed corridors filled with ornamental columns, charming bric-a-brac, antique furniture, and animal trophies. Straw mats and colorful Indian throws add character to the tiny bedrooms. There is no formal dining area, but room service is available. A delightful covered courtyard is stuffed full of portraits, religious artifacts, memorabilia, objets d'art, and books. Upstairs, an open-air terrace packed with potted plants and stylish cane furniture has excellent views of activity at the ghats.
Descr: Hotel Ganges View in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
The Senetor in Kolkata - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Gordon House in South Mumbai is a stylish four star boutique hotel located near the buzzing Colaba Causeway. 

With its colourful and spacious themed rooms, the Gordon House is totally unlike the average city hotel. 

The hotel offers excellent Pan Asian cuisine in their ground floor restaurant.
WebWriteUp1:
The Gordon House Hotel is a charming little hotel located at Colaba, right behind the Taj Mahal hotel. 

The design elements are simple yet stylish and redefine the conventional concept of a hotel. There are three themed floors and the attention to detail of design in all the rooms is apparent in the custom-made furniture, drapes, wall hangings and accessories.

All the rooms are extremely comfortable with innovative and bright interiors. The Mediterranean rooms are warm with stucco walls, burnt orange floor tiles, painted furniture and glazed tiles. The Scandinavian rooms embody the essence of the north of Europe with plain white surfaces, clean lines, and minimalist decor. The Country Cottage rooms truly belong to the countryside with cream wainscoting on the walls, pinewood floors and patchwork quilt wall hangings. 

Depending on the season you will either be served breakfast on the roof, watching India's commercial capital wake up, or in the contemporary styled restaurant. 

The hotel is perfectly located to explore the city's celebrated art and cultural institutions as well as to sample the bazaars and street food popular with the city's residents.
Metatype: The Gordon House in South Mumbai is a stylish four star boutique hotel located near the buzzing Colaba Causeway.
Descr: The Gordon House in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the gordon house, mumbai, boutique, design, hotel, special  places

description: Built to resemble Orchha's palaces of the distinctive 'Bundela' style, Amar Mahal is a low white building with open lawns, with comfortable rooms surrounding a large swimming pool. Its gardens have an unrestricted view of the famous royal cenotaphs and there are plenty of comfortable outdoor spaces in which to relax in and enjoy the sense of space and peace.
WebWriteUp1:
Amar Mahal is a new hotel, built in the traditional style of an Indian country palace. Wide marble-tiled corridors are flanked on one side by pillars topped with scalloped arches, each leading out to the formal squares. 

The rooms are extremely large, built on the proportion of palatial bedrooms. White marble floors and pure white walls are subtly enlivened by frescoes of flowers in colours of red, blue, green and gold. The beds are befitting of royal guests, with many high four poster beds of dark wood. Some rooms overlook the lawns, others the pool.

The generously sized pool is very welcome during Orchha's long summers. The indoor restaurant serves multi-cuisine food and also has a well stocked bar. The hotel is also within easy walking distance of the main sights and the riverside.
Metatype: A new hotel built to resemble Orchha's palaces of the distinctive 'Bundela' style, Amar Mahal is a low white building with open lawns.
Descr: Amar Mahal in Orchha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: amar mahal, orchha, hotel, special places, madhya pradesh

description:
A lovely boutique hotel with a swimming pool and a thatched restaurant.
 
Presa di Goa has only seven rooms, each named after a flower. Rooms are furnished in Goan/Portuguese style with balconies that overlook the garden below. 

Inside the rooms, there are four poster beds, magnificent wardrobes, planter's chairs and treasure chests. Well chosen paintings and little artefacts adorn the walls.
WebWriteUp1:
Presa di Goa is a quaint blue jewel of a country house tucked away in the little north Goan village of Nagoa. With its authentic colonial style furniture, this hideaway evokes the gentle, sleepy Goa of yesteryear. Lounge on a long armed planters chair on the traditional broad verandah, cool off in their chlorine free pool or take a short drive to the lively beaches of Calangute and Baga. 

Each room is named after a local flower which also finds its way onto the delicately embroidered upholstery. The furniture is of the traditional dark wood but it is set off by colourful walls in rose pink, mango yellow and ocean green. The tall four poster beds have canopies of lace and muslin. These facets of Goan Portuguese luxury are given an individualistic twist by touches of Turkey due to the owner's long previous residence there. 

This is also why the hotel's restaurant offers Turkish and middle eastern delights such as the mezze platter and traditional kebabs.
Metatype: A lovely boutique hotel with a swimming pool and a thatched restaurant.
Descr: Presa di Goa in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: presa di goa, village, nagoa, portuguese style, hotel, boutique, special places

Descr: Hotel Ganpati in Orchha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Ram Pratap Palace hotel overlooks the Fateh Sagar lake, just north of Udaipur's main attractions. 

It's a rambling marble mansion with pleasant airy rooms with marble floors and lovely window seats overlooking the lake. 

There is a garden restaurant on the shore of the lake, which also has the hotel owner's personal vintage car collection. The hotel can arrange a drive around the lake in a vintage car, or in a horse drawn carriage.
WebWriteUp1:
On the shores of Lake Fateh Sagar, the lesser known lake of Udaipur, is the Ram Pratap Palace hotel. The impressive facade is in a subtle beige shade, against which delicate plaster work in white stands out regally. 

The haveli style building has rooms on three levels, including the ground level. Of course, the best rooms are those facing the lake. Many of the rooms have their own private balconies. The rooms are all large with plenty of natural light. The furniture is comfortable and in the authentic Rajasthani style. There are rare photographs on the walls in the rooms and the corridors. A cozy restaurant is located on the first level.

Ram Pratap has a small but attractive spa which offers a variety of massages and other therapies. There is also a well stocked gift shop. This is a good way of shopping for souvenirs if you don't like to shop in the crowded markets. 

Across the street, right on the lake shore, is a wonderful open restaurant which serves excellent food. This garden restaurant has vast lawns and direct views over the lake. Connoisseurs of vintage cars will be delighted to look over the collection belonging to Jitender Singh, the affable owner of the hotel.
Metatype: The Ram Pratap Palace hotel overlooks the Fateh Sagar lake, just north of Udaipur's main attractions.
Descr: Ram Pratap Palace in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ram pratap palace, udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake, special places

description: Florence Inn is an attractive mid range hotel, located at the edge of the buzzing market area of Karol Bagh. It is just a 2 minute walk from the new subway station which connects you to Connaught Place, the centre of New Delhi, in just 5 minutes and from where you can quickly and easily reach almost anywhere in Delhi by metro. The hotel has 26 well-appointed rooms and a small restaurant, an impressive marble lobby, and friendly and cooperative staff.
creditcards: American Express, Visa, Mastercard, Diners Club, Maestro
WebWriteUp1:
Florence Inn is a small hotel situated on a quiet, narrow lane, and with a nice facade of faux Italianate columns and plaster work. From the gleaming marble lobby onwards, you can see the high level of care lavished on the building. The Front Office and other staff is helpful and cooperative. 

All rooms at Florence Inn are spacious and spotless, with marble floors, comfortable beds, mini-bar, TV with satellite connection, and attached bathroom. 

On the lobby level, there is a small dining area where a buffet breakfast is served. The room service menu is extensive, with an emphasis on Indian food.
Metatype: Florence Inn is an excellent tourist class hotel in New Delhi.

description: A simple rustic resort set in a pleasant garden with many full-grown trees. The accommodation is in 12 delightful comfortable large tents, all with attached modern bathrooms. In the summer months of May and June, when the tents become too hot, the basic rooms are used instead. The resort is run by Aditya, an award winning wildlife photographer, and his wife Poonam, a sculptress. They encourage a very convivial atmosphere, making this a good place to meet wildlife enthusiasts and discuss the future of tigers and wildlife in general. More than 150 different species of birds have been sighted in the garden and they are still counting!
otherfacility: Jeep/Canter Safari, Fort visit
WebWriteUp1:
A simple, charming resort, the Ranthambhore Bagh is an excellent base for visits to the fabulous Ranthambhore national park.

The owner, Aditya Singh, is a wildlife photographer par excellence and you will see many of his award winning photographs on the walls. Aditya has also been the guide for some outstanding wildlife documentaries made by National Geographic and others. Needless to say, he is an extremely knowledgeable naturalist and can help you make the most out of your stay at Ranthambore. 

The resort has ten rooms and ten tents. The rooms are located in the building, a plain structure, though the rooms are adequately furnished and have attached bathrooms. The tents in the garden are much more charming, with beautifully printed fabrics for walls and delightful bathrooms.

A typical day at The Ranthambhore Bagh starts with a pre dawn wake up call, followed by a wildlife safari to the Ranthambore national park. You return to the lodge for a hearty breakfast. There is then time to relax in the garden, or you could visit the nearby town of Sawai Madhopur for a dose of local culture. After lunch you can return to the national park on a second safari, or visit the 1000 year old Ranthambore Fort. Evening tea awaits you when you return to the resort, and guests then gather around the bonfire for drinks and conversation, followed by dinner.
Metatype: A rustic resort set in beautifully landscaped rolling gardens with many full-grown trees. There are lovely luxury tents, all with attached bathroom.
Descr: The Ranthambhore Bagh in Sawai Madhopur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ranthambhore bagh, rajasthan, luxury tents, hotel, tiger, special places

description:
This family-run homestay is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Agra. Colonel Lamba and his wife are wonderful hosts who prepare fabulous food and warmly welcome you into their home.

The ten air-conditioned rooms have attached bathrooms and are all well appointed and spotlessly clean. 

The homestay has internet access, guest laundry, a safety deposit box and a dining area. From the rooftop there is a distant view of the Taj Mahal.
WebWriteUp1:
This homestay is charming and made even more delightful by the family that runs it. The clean and homely rooms are spread over two properties across the road from one another. 

Colonel and Mrs Lamba are very friendly and warmly wecome guests into their home. The home cooked food, made to Mrs Lamba's recipes, is delicious.
Metatype: This family-run homestay is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Agra. Colonel Lamba and his wife are wonderful hosts who prepare fabulous food and warmly welcome you into their home..
Descr: Lamba Indian Homestay in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Dera Rawatsar is a family-run boutique hotel where you are sure to feel the warmth of a home. 

Located just behind the bus station, but in a very quiet leafy lane, Dera Rawatsar is a low building. Within its walls are small courtyards and terraces, lawns and secluded corners. 

Meals, refreshments and snacks are served in the family's dining room as well as in the courtyard and the garden. The family has recently added a swimming pool in the garden.
WebWriteUp1:
Dera Rawatsar belongs to a remarkable family of Chundawats. The venerable lady who heads the family was an active member of the freedom struggle and after independence from the British she represented Rajasthan in the Indian parliament. 

Today her daughter-in-law and grand-daughter-in-law look after the guests. Urbane, warm and knowledgeable, the ladies treat you as house guests of the family.

The interiors show the women's presence. The rooms are creatively furnished and spotlessly clean. The decor is tasteful with interesting use of colours, fabrics and well chosen furniture. Most rooms have a seating area such as a bay window, a writing desk and good sized, well appointed bathrooms.
Metatype: Dera Rawatsar is a family-run boutique hotel where you are sure to feel the warmth of a home.
Descr: Dera Rawatsar in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: dera rawatsar, jaipur, rajasthan, boutique hotel, special places

description: A small classical building right on the banks of the Ganges, Palace on Ganges is situated at the end of the long line of ghats, at Assi Ghat, one of the most interesting and colouful areas of the city. The elegant rooms are designed on the theme of the cultural offerings of the different states of India. There are no views from the rooms themselves, a few of which do not have windows, but they are clean and comfortable. The views from the terrace restaurant are of the endless curve of the river and the constant flow of pilgrims, animals and boats.
WebWriteUp1:
The theme based rooms have been decorated carefully with the aim of capturing the essence of the different states or region in India. The Kerala room therefore, is hung with the celebrated Kathakali dance masks, and the room dedicated to Orissa possesses the fine wooden carvings of that state. The rooms are renovated frequently and are always fresh looking. They are a bit on the small side, and some do not have a window, but they are kept cool by the air conditioning.

The corridors are lined with elegant furniture, and sketches and photographs of famous Indian people and buildings, and musical instruments, decorate their walls. The rooftop restaurant is the best place for breakfast accompanied by the sounds of the city. 

You merely have to step out of your hotel to be absorbed into the life of this 3000 year old city.
Metatype: A small classical building right on the banks of the Ganges.
Descr: Palace on Ganges in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: palace on ganges, heritage hotel, varanasi, ganges, ghats, special places

description:
Hotel Florence is a comfortable 3-star hotel, conveniently located close to Delhi's most famous shopping hub called Karol Bagh. The hotel offers rooms of a very high standard both in terms of decor and cleanliness. 

The beds are huge and comfortable. The bathroom is immaculately clean with a good rain shower and plenty of clean, white towels. Excellent and good value meals are served either in the top floor restaurant, or by room service.
creditcards: American Express, Visa, Mastercard,Maestro, Discover & other
WebWriteUp1:
Located in the lively Karol Bagh area of New Delhi, Hotel Florence is a mid-size, comfortable hotel done in a contemporary style. Larger than its sister hotel, Florence Inn, the Hotel Florence has the same elegance and efficient service. The rooms are imminently comfortable although not overly spacious as is the case with most city hotels. 

However, the rooms are bright with muted furnishings and all modern conveniences such as a mini bar, relaxing rain showers, 24-hour room service and high-speed internet facilities.

The hotel has an enviable location just a walk away from the Karol Bagh Metro Station, which means you can be connected to most parts of the city within minutes. 

The Karol Bagh market is a great place to people watch as this is a shopping area for locals rather than tourists with shops selling brightly-coloured sarees, glitzy footwear and dazzling jewelry. Like any large market in India, the area is studded by a number of street food stalls serving all-time favourites like gol gappas (little round morsels of sprouts and spices) and aloo tikki (a spicy potato cutlet). Whether or not you actually participate in the shopping and eating you'll find yourself drawn into this colourful world that's especially busy on Monday nights during the all-night street market.

Given all this the quiet of Hotel Florence comes as a surprise, albeit, a welcome one. You can retire to the peace of your room or grab a bite in the dining area which acts as a caf� and restaurant serving morning breakfast, light all day eats as well as more substantial meals at lunch and dinner time. The menu includes both Indian and Continental foods.
Descr: Hotel Florence in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
note: For Reservations - Call Mr Ashish Sharda on 4502 5555 / 4504 9755 / 45025500

description: Hotel Broadway is a mid-range hotel straddling New and Old Delhi. In fact, it is very close to the main sights of Old Delhi such as the Red Fort, the Jama Mashid Mosque and the Chandni Chowk bazaar. The hotel is known for the  famous "Chore Bizarre" restaurant which serves formidable Mughlai and Kashmiri fare in quirky surroundings - there's a vintage car salad bar and a curious four-poster bed table. The "Thugs" bar serves just about anything you can think of.
Metatype: Hotel Broadway is a mid-range hotel straddling New and Old Delhi. In fact, it is very close to the main sights of Old Delhi such as the Red Fort, the Jama Mashid Mosque and the Chandni Chowk bazaar. The hotel is known for the  famous "Chore Bizarre" restaurant which serves formidable Mughlai and Kashmiri fare in quirky surroundings - there's a vintage car salad bar and a curious four-poster bed table. description:
A tented camp in a remote area of the Thar desert, Dera Eco is situated in a fabulous location next to rolling sand dunes. 

This camp features 16 well furnished tents with attached bathrooms, a dining area and bar. Each tent has a small patio, made of packed earth, complete with a cover and comfortable chairs.

The camel safaris are operated by local farmers who are cheerful and friendly and know the ship of the desert like no one else.
WebWriteUp1:
A few years ago Harish Chandra Singh showed us a remote picturesque location in the Thar Desert and told us of his plans to create an eco-friendly tented camp. When we saw the stunning sand dunes, we knew that this would be a perfect base for organising our camel safaris. Now Harish's Dera Eco camp has sixteen well furnished comfortable tents with attached bathrooms. 

The tented camp sits in a small dip flanked by sand dunes. The tents are arrayed in an oval shape facing each other across a wide open space. Each tent has a small patio, made of packed earth, complete with a cover and comfortable director's chairs. The `walls' of the tents are pleasant pale coloured fabric printed with tiny motifs. The wooden twin beds are covered by colourful Rajasthani quilts. The bathrooms have a quaint wooden platform for the toilet seat, a wooden vanity stand, and an iron wash basin. The `buckets' are canvas - a style much favoured by soldiers on campaign or the hunters of the Raj days. 

The food is all freshly prepared at the camp site in a round mud hut, built in the local style. The ingredients come from Jodhpur each day. Breakfast consists of cereals, eggs made to order, toast with butter and preserves, coffee/ tea and fresh fruit and juice. The buffet meals offer a choice of both vegetarian and non vegetarian food, and will include Rajasthani dishes. A picnic tea of Indian chai served with pakoras or sandwiches is offered after the afternoon camel safari. The bar offers cold drinks, juices, beer, wine and spirits. 

The "communal area" is a charming semi-open pavilion which holds the bar and the restaurant. Situated on a slight elevation, the thatch covered pavilion offers good views over the surrounding expanse of sand, bush and dunes. Surprisingly, the small bushes attract a number of birds like green flycatchers, red vented bulbuls etc.
Metatype: A tented camp in a remote area of the Thar desert, situated in a fabulous location next to rolling sand dunes.
Descr: Dera Eco in Osian - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: dera eco, osian, rajasthan, desert, luxury tents, camel safari, special places

Descr: Hotel Divya in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Mewar Haveli is located directly on Lake Pichola, and the rooftop restaurant provides amazing views of the lake and all its surroundings. 

The rooms, although small, are clean and adorned with beautiful hand paintings

The shops and restaurants of the old city are also on the doorstep, and there is a shop adjacent to the hotel selling books, snacks and toiletries, and also has an internet cafe.
WebWriteUp1:
Among the many buildings which stand shoulder to shoulder along the banks of Lake Pichola is Mewar Haveli. This narrow and tall building has just eleven rooms, most of which overlook the lake. 

The lake views are especially superb from the rooftop terrace, from where you can enjoy the sunsets followed by the romantic sight of the lights going on in the large City Palace complex and the floating Lake Palace hotel. 

The small rooms are charming, with a lot of natural light. The fabrics are colourful and the furniture comfortable. The corner rooms have the advantage of views on two sides. 

Next to the hotel is a shop that sells books, snacks and toiletries, and also has a caf� that offers internet connectivity.
Metatype: Mewar Haveli is located directly on Lake Pichola, and the rooftop restaurant provides amazing views of the Lake and all its surroundings.
Descr: Mewar Haveli in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mewar haveli, udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake pichola, special places

description:
This is a unique hotel located in the heart of the old city of Jodhpur, with superb views over the city.

Located close to the bottom of the majestic Meherangarh Fort, Pal Haveli is possibly the best place from which to admire the scope of this architectural feat.

The haveli itself is a maze of courtyards, stone stairways, terraces and some excellent carvings. The spacious guest rooms are delightfully furnished in the typical Rajasthani aristocratic style.
WebWriteUp1:
Pal Haveli, in the very heart of the old city of Jodhpur, offers a view of Jodhpur's most famous landmarks - the Meherangarh Fort, the Jaswant Thada and the Umaid Bhawan Palace. 

The haveli is made of carved deep red stone. Thick slabs of the stone are interspersed with carved lintels, arches and latticework. A grand entrance opens into a wide courtyard. On one side is the reception. On the other is a stairway which leads up three levels to the rooftop restaurant with its fabulous views. Yet another staircase leads to the family's private quarters and the museum. 

The rooms are delightfully furnished in the typical Rajasthani aristocratic style. Many have accents of the red carved stone - arches or windows and lofty pillars. Most rooms have a cosy seating area. The furniture and fabrics are all locally sourced and add a touch of earthy colours. All rooms have modern en-suite bathrooms. 

The rooftop restaurant is the piece de resistance. This terrace, located at one of the highest points in Jodhpur offers panoramic views of all the main monuments of the city. At night, the restaurant takes on a mysterious air, with soft lighting, candles on the table and the spectacular sight of the illuminated Meherangarh Fort. 

A part of the Haveli has been converted into a small but interesting museum. Here you can see the armour, swords and shields, which were so much a part of the life in Rajasthan. There are also ceremonial robes and dresses, ornaments and many other interesting artefacts. The rooms in the museum are decorated in traditional style, with low seating and glass lamps. Unlike larger museums, this one gives you a chance to look at things in peace and greater detail.
Metatype: This is a unique place located in the heart of the old city of Jodhpur, with superb views over the city
Descr: Pal Haveli in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: pal haveli, jodhpur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, old city, special places

description:
If you are looking for a friendly place to stay which has a great ethical philosophy, this is the place for you. The home cooked food is made from vegetables taken straight from the lodge's organic farm and served in the dining room around a large table which makes the whole experience very sociable. 

The accommodation is in 8 traditional clay huts clustered around a bourgainvillea shaded courtyard. All the rooms are beautifully decorated with regional handicrafts and feature full bathroom facilities.
WebWriteUp1:
Apani Dhani literally translates to "our village", and hat's what this tiny eco-conscious resort is -- a small village hamlet with a very homely touch. 

The cottages are spread over a small area with bougainvillea trailing colours against the buff coloured huts. Thatch covers the huts and creates a very rustic atmosphere. Inside, the cottages have comfortable, locally made furniture with vivid local fabrics. The dining area consists of a large table where all guests dine together.
 
Apani Dhani follows many eco-friendly practices such as the use of solar power for water  heating , treating the waste water for re-use in the gardens and the fields outside. It also gives training and employment to the villagers. 

Apani Dhani also offers several interesting options for staying and learning various crafts, thereby giving guests a chance of mingling with the local artisans. These include: learning tie and dye, Rasjathani cookery, the Hindi language and the basics of playing the tabla (Indian drums). 

This is a good place for those travelers who would like to have a closer insight into the life of a Rajasthani village.
Metatype: If you are looking for a friendly place to stay which has a great ethical philosophy, this is the place for you.
Descr: Apani Dhani Eco-Lodge in Nawalgarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: apani dhani, nawalgarh, rajasthan, eco, responsible travel, hotel

description:
Fateh Bagh is a striking building set against the backdrop of the Aravalli hills near Ranakpur. It was created from the ruins of a nearby 200 year old palace, thereby giving new life to some fabulous old stone-work. 

65,000 stone parts were carefully transported and meticulously reconstructed into a new delightful building with delicate domes, balconies and carved pillars. The result is an atmospheric boutique hotel which provides a perfect base to explore the nearby Ranakpur temples.
WebWriteUp1:
Set against a hilly backdrop is the striking building of Fateh Bagh. The dynamic Jitendra Singh Kelwa, was behind the creation of this superb place. 

Fateh Bagh is a delightful building with delicate domes, balconies, carved pillars and cornices. A well kept garden provides a wonderful setting for the building. The garden is watered by the traditional Persian wheel worked by a handsome bull manned by a Rajasthani man in full traditional garb. This is the perfect place to watch this simple but fascinating technique.

The front garden has a marble lined swimming pool with some beautiful carvings around it. Don't miss the massive single slab of marble which makes for a seat. 

Like the rest of the building, the rooms too are a pleasing combination of old and new. The furniture is dignified and the colours and fabrics are sumptuous. Each room has generous windows with garden or pool views. The bathrooms are large and have a large granite vanity table and bathtubs. 

The dining room is elegantly designed and has a double ceiling which makes it even more spacious. The kitchen offers a wide choice of Indian and Continental food. Upstairs, the balcony has a small museum which displays some interesting pieces of art and statuary.
Metatype: Fateh Bagh is a striking building set against the backdrop of the Aravalli hills near Ranakpur. It was created from the ruins of a nearby 200 year old palace, thereby giving new life to some fabulous old stone-work.
Descr: Hotel Ranakpur Fateh Bagh in Ranakpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ranakpur fateh bagh, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, temples, special places

description:
Dekeling Hotel is a well-situated, friendly and comfortable hotel. Spotlessly clean and simple, this is the place to go for Tibetan hospitality in Raj ambience. 

Victorian tiled fireplaces and polished wooden floors are combined with bright Tibetan decorations. An old iron chimney heater keeps the lounge/library cozy and warm; it's a wonderful place to relax with a book.
WebWriteUp1:
Situated just off Darjeeling's bustling Mall Road, the Dekeling Hotel is a cosy family run establishment. On a clear day the snow sprinkled peaks of the Kanchenjunga are visible from the common areas as well as from some of the wood paneled rooms.
 
Each of the hotels three floors has a sofa stuffed seating area in the centre. We use the attic rooms at the Dekeling, located as they are in the eaves of the building with sweet smelling pine wood walls and warm carpeted floors. The rooms are of a comfortable size and the bathrooms are scrupulously clean. 

The common sitting areas are a delight with tall shelves stacked with books, squashy sofas and colourful Tibetan thangka paintings on the walls. Early mornings offer the best chances of a glimpse of the Himalayas from the sitting room on the second floor. Breakfast is served on the first floor, and lunch and dinner are available from the excellent vegetarian restaurant in the same building and from the Dekeva's own restaurant, famous for its pizzas.

Mr Devaka, the hotel owner, is an important figure in the local Tibetan community, and he works for the preservation of the Tibetan language and culture. Together with his wife, the Dekevas have created a warm hotel which feels like a home.
Metatype: Dekeling Hotel is a well-situated, friendly and comfortable hotel. Spotlessly clean and simple, this is the place to go for Tibetan hospitality in Raj ambience.
Descr: Dekeling Hotel in Darjeeling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: dekeling hotel, darjeeling, tibetan hospitality, raj, ambience, tea

Descr: Estuary Island in Poovar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: No hotel in Varanasi has a better location, high above the river close to the Main Ghat with fabulous views, best appreciated form the rooftop "Dolphin" restaurant. The rooms are plain and simple, though the best of these also enjoy the great views over the river. It can only be reached via the narrow lanes of the Old City, so you have to walk to get here, and there are many steep steps, but for those willing to forgo luxuries, the difficulty of access is more than made up for by the spectacular location.
Metatype: If you want to experience the real magical atmosphere of the holy city Varanasi, than book your accommodation in Palace on River, Rashmi guesthouse. It is the perfect place to be, right in the center of all spiritual activities and ceremonies. The boat trips on the Ganges depart from right outside the door. The rooms are small but clean, including the bathrooms. The Dolphin restaurant is famous for its good food and the rooftop terrace has amazing views over the Ganges.
Descr: Rashmi Guest House in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Built on the same extensive grounds as the old hunting lodge of the Maharaja of Orchha, Bundelkhand Riverside is an atmospheric hotel built on the banks of the Betwa River. The hotel is a two storey structure built and furnished using stone and wood crafted by hand. The historic atmosphere, along with the swimming pool and abundant greenery, compensate greatly for the short 2km drive or riverside walk from the main sights of Orchha.
WebWriteUp1:
Formerly the Maharajah of Orchha's country retreat, Bundelkhand Riverside has an apparent aristocratic heritage. It is a wonderful building in Mughal design built around a lawned courtyard. 

The rooms are housed in the broad corridors that wrap themselves around a large central lawn. These corridors are topped by cupolas decorated with glazed tiles, a trademark of Bundelkhandi architecture.

The rooms have been carefully furnished. The heavy wooden doors are elaborately carved and the narrow windows are inset with coloured glass. Bright hand block printed cotton covers the beds and the floors bear traditional handwoven cotton "dhurries" (carpets).

The lawn and the small pool offer good options for relaxation and the open terraces on top of the corridors are a great spot from which to watch the sunset. The restaurant - the 'Turquoise Diner' - is charmingly decorated in blue and serves Anglo-Indian cuisine of the Raj era.
Metatype: Built on the same extensive grounds as the old hunting lodge of the Maharaja of Orchha, Bundelkhand Riverside is an atmospheric hotel built on the banks of the Betwa River.
Descr: Hotel Bundelkhand Riverside in Orchha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bundelkand riverside, orchha, hotel, special places, madhya pradesh

description: The Lutyens Bungalow is located in the plush green environs of New Delhi. Built  in 1935, its colonial architecture and mature gardens make it a fairly picturesque property.  Run by the family as a guest house for the last 30 years, all the rooms have every amenity as well as the feeling of being at home. The historical and tree-lined area of Lutyens Delhi has been designated a Heritage Zone, and is within strolling distance of the outstanding Lodhi Gardens as well as the Safdarjung Tomb.
Metatype: The Lutyens Bungalow is located in the plush green environs of New Delhi. Built  in 1935, its colonial architecture and mature gardens make it a fairly picturesque property.  Run by the family as a guest house for the last 30 years, all the rooms have every amenity as well as the feeling of being at home. The historical and tree-lined area of Lutyens Delhi has been designated a Heritage Zone, and is within strolling distance of the outstanding Lodhi Gardens as well as the Safdarjung Tomb.
Descr: Lutyens Guest House in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Cama Rajputana club is a venerable 135 year old building, built in colonial style. Wide verandahs give shade and peace from where one can admire the hills and the gardens spread over 18 acres on various levels. 

The lobby still radiates a colonial atmosphere. There is also a Billiards room, complete with the original 100 year old table. There is a large swimming pool in the gardens and a well equipped gym and Ayurvedic massage centre.
WebWriteUp1:
Hill stations were the invention of the British, who could not withstand the summer heat in the plains and thus created small communities in the cool hills. These hill stations became lively places in the summers with hectic entertaining, parties, concerts and hunting parties. Mount Abu became the summer capital during the British Raj and the Rajputana Club was the centre of activity.

After Independence the Club gradually became a dilapidated place. Fortunately, Jehangir Cama, a hotelier from Ahmedabad, bought the Club and restored it into a unique heritage resort with stunning panoramic views and beautifully landscaped gardens.

The Cama Rajputana club has several fascinating features such as a Billiards room, complete with the original 100 year old table..There is also a quintessentially English lounge with deep armchairs, a live fire in the winters, and a library containing rare books as old as the building itself.

The rooms are all in stone cottages on one side of the property. Extensively renovated recently, they now sport soothing colours and lighting. They are all spacious with well designed modern bathrooms.  Each room has a private balcony or a sit-out which leads to the gardens and the pool.

The restaurant serves Indian, Chinese and Continental food. There is a large bar on the terrace with great views. In addition, the extensive sports facilities involve cricket grounds, tennis courts, a volleyball court and indoor games - a table tennis table and a card room. There is a large swimming pool in the gardens with a well equipped gym and Ayurvedic massage centre.
Metatype: The Cama Rajputana club is a venerable 135 year old building - built in colonial style.
Descr: Cama Rajputana Club in Mount Abu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: cama rajputana club, mount abu, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Marina Towers is a modern three-star hotel with 112 well furnished and spacious air-conditioned rooms. 

The lobby is an inviting blue, tinted with green. Art works with a sea-and-music theme adorn the walls, giving a pleasant first impression of Marina Towers. 

The multi-cuisine restaurant is named `Seven,' denoting the seven basic notes in Carnatic music. The Upper Deck is a lounge bar with a sea and beach theme.
WebWriteUp1:
Marina Towers is a modern three-star hotel located at a convenient distance from Chennai's railway stations and is 16 kms from the airport.

The lobby is an inviting blue, tinted with green. The raised seats and couches, the cascade that gracefully falls over a glass slope, and art works with a sea-and-music theme adorning the walls, give a pleasant first impression of Marina Towers.

If the lobby and rooms follow a beach theme, at the restaurant, it's music. The multi-cuisine restaurant is named `Seven,' denoting the seven basic notes in Carnatic music. Portraits of the Trinity and eminent Carnatic musicians and musical instruments enhance the ambience at `Seven.' 

The Upper Deck is a lounge bar with the sea as the theme again, with fibre optic lights in the floor, an oar and a boat on the wall, shells embedded in the tables and fishing nets making up the roof.
Metatype: Marina Towers is a three star hotel close to the Egmore and Central railway stations in Chennai, and 16 km from the airport.
Descr: Hotel Marina Towers in Chennai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: marina towers, hotel, chennai, tamil nadu, special places
address:

description:
This ultra-modern hotel has a spanking white lobby, set off by splashes of colour provided by plush cushions, curtains and flowers floating in marble urns. 

On the mezzanine floor, overlooking the lobby are the two restaurants; a coffee shop and a specialty grill restaurant.

The rooms are exceedingly well appointed - with the highest quality of furnishing and beddings and judicious use of colour.
WebWriteUp1:
The Park Premier is an excellent superior hotel at affordable prices.

All rooms have a flat screen television, minibar, a writing desk and chair. The bathrooms are elegant and come with every modern convenience. The materials used are of high quality throughout and the finish is superb. 

TThe hotel has a swimming pool which is under an atrium, thus keeping the temperature of the water warm enough to be used even in Delhi winters. For those traveling on work, there is wifi internet in all areas of the hotel, and a fully fledged business centre.
Metatype: This ultra-modern hotel has a spanking white lobby, set off by splashes of colour provided by plush cushions, curtains and flowers floating in marble urns.
Descr: Park Premier in Gurgaon - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: park premier, gurgaon, delhi, hotel, special places, rajasthan, golden triangle

description:
Royal Court is a moderate business hotel in the heart of Madurai; within walking distance of the Meenakshi temple, the flower market, and the newer shopping areas, an area which dominates Madurai's spiritual and social life.

The rooms are pleasant, with modern furniture and wooden floors, colourful hand painted tiles and scenes from Indian life on the walls, and sleek bathrooms of steel and glass. There is a rooftop restaurant with excellent views of the city.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms at Royal Court have crisp clean sheets on comfortable beds, cosy armchairs and classic sofas in rich reds and greens. The Royal Executive rooms have the added feature of a glass walled bathroom and an all glass countertop and washbasin as well. The wood paneled floors make the rooms warm and inviting.

The hotel also offers modern amenities such as central air conditioning, satellite television and 24 hour room service.

The 'Crystal' restaurant offers Indian and Continental food and is very pleasant space with pretty flower tinted floor tiles and a glittering chandelier. But in the evenings you will probably prefer to dine in the rooftop restaurant, which has been converted into a veritable garden with flowering plants and bottle palms.
Metatype: Royal Court is a moderate business hotel in the heart of Madurai; within walking distance of the Meenakshi temple which dominates Madurai's spiritual and social life, the flower market, and the newer shopping areas.
Descr: Royal Court in Madurai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: royal court, hotel, madurai, tamil nadu, special places

description:
The small town of Nimaj, located between Ajmer and Jodhpur, is home to a lovely 18th century palace, Jagram Durg, now renamed Nimaj Palace. 

The approach to Nimaj Palace in through narrow market streets but once inside the compound, it is a different story. Stately palms line the formal gardens and the whitewashed facade of the palace is imposing with delicately carved pavilions and jharokha windows. Inside the palace, various buildings are joined by a series of terraces and open air courtyards.
WebWriteUp1:
The Nimaj Palace has recently undergone a complete refurbishment. By enlarging the original rooms, the Nimaj Palace is now an all suite hotel. The large suites make use of light colours and polished stone floors to give the rooms a look of contemporary beauty with royal touches.

Most rooms have Rajasthani architectural touches like arches and windows with coloured glasses. The fabrics are traditional but sport modern colours and re-interpreted motifs, creating a very pleasant and soothing feel.
Metatype: The small town of Nimaj, located between Ajmer and Jodhpur, is home to a lovely 18th century palace, Jagram Durg, now renamed Nimaj Palace.
Descr: Nimaj Palace in Nimaj - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nimaj palace, rajasthan, heritage hotel, suites, special places

description:
About an hour and half drive from the beaches of North Goa, and surrounded by hills and forests, Wildernest is for the true nature lover. 

The resort offers wooden cottages, each with a sit-out or a verandah to enjoy the views. There are naturalist-guided walks and hikes. For the more sedate guests, there is a swimming pool with the most dramatic views in Goa.
WebWriteUp1:
Far away from the beach, where Goa borders its neighbours, Maharashtra and Karnataka, lies the Wildernest resort. Wildernest is set on over 450 acres of forest land overlooking the stunning Swapnagandha Valley.

Many may have heard of the mineral mines that have destroyed so much of Goa's hills and forests. Well, Wildernest is a case where one such denuded hill was re-planted by someone with his priorities (and heart) in the right place. Today, the 300 acres are thickly covered once again with continuous efforts at re-forestation. The hills are once again alive with the sound of birds and other wildlife. 

One of the founders is young Nirmal Kulkarni, Goa's best known conservationist and naturalist. Nirmal has worked long and hard in these hills and is a true champion of Goa's ecology. 

But is the resort attractive to a tourist who may not be so keen to be involved in any ecological struggle while they are on a holiday? The answer is yes! There are naturalist led walks and hikes for the intrepid. For the more sedate guests, there is the swimming pool, possibly the most dramatic in Goa. Seeming to hang over the several hundred feet deep valley below and surrounded by high green hills, the swimming pool is the single biggest attraction of Wildernest.

The cottages, named after fragrant local flowers, are spread in the light woods around the main restaurant/lounge area. They are entirely wooden, with high ceilings, comfortable beds and spacious bathrooms. Each cottage has a sit-out or a verandah overlooking either the forest or the valley below. Both views are magnificent. 

The resort employs only local people from these hilly areas. The staff members are warm and simple and extremely eager to share the many delights of the resort and its surrounding area. 

So, if you would like to explore Goa beyond the usual sun drenched beaches, travel up to Wildernest. An enchanting experience awaits you.
Metatype: About an hour and half drive from the beaches of North Goa, and surrounded by hills and forests, Wildernest is for the true nature lover.
Descr: Wildernest in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: wildernest resort, hills, naturalist, nature walks, hikes, eco hotel

Descr: Annamalai International in Pondicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Situated at the busy and colourful end of Mahabalipuram, the Sea Breeze hotel is a no-fuss, unpretentious place located right on the beach and complete with a swimming pool and some cosy sea facing cottages. 

Located at the end of the line of shops and restaurants of Mahabalipuram, the resort manages to maintain its peace and quiet while having the local buzz just a few steps away.
WebWriteUp1:
The cluster of sea facing cottages is placed a little away from the rest of the hotel so as to give unrestricted views of the palm trees and sea beyond. The cottages are large and airy with a cool granite floor that helps as the day heats up. The bathrooms are similarly large and well ordered. Despite being fairly simply done up, the rooms have a charm of their own. The balcony outside with its easy chairs is particularly appealing and you will without doubt spend long hours there.

Since the beach at Mahabalipuram, along with most of the eastern coastline of India, is often too dangerous to swim in, the pool at Sea Breeze is a good place to cool off at. 

When you get hungry you can head to the hotel's multi-cuisine restaurant which serves fresh sea food and other local delicacies. Just ten minute walk along the market road will take you to a dozen or so eateries. 

The days end fairly early in Mahabalipuram, with not much night life to be had and a whole day's sunshine and historical sights to wake up to, so after that last Pina colada, you'll be glad to head back to the silence of your cottage and sink gratefully into the large bed.
Metatype: Situated at the busy and colourful end of Mahabalipuram, the Sea Breeze hotel is a no-fuss, unpretentious place located right on the beach and complete with a swimming pool and some cosy sea facing cottages.
Descr: Hotel Sea Breeze in Mamallapuram - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: sea breeze, hotel, mamallapuram, beach, cottages, special places

description:
An unusual hotel offering spacious apartments, Om Niwas is located in a leafy residential area not far from Jaipur's attractions. 

A sister hostelry of the famous Arya Niwas, Om Niwas is a comfortable and aesthetically pleasing hotel. Ideal for long staying guests, the apartments are all self-contained. 

A major attraction here is the terrace garden with a carefully tended lawn and a riot of flowering plants in neat rows.
WebWriteUp1:
Each apartment at Om Niwas has a well appointed kitchen with tea/coffee maker, a fridge and a cozy dining area. The bedrooms are pleasant with comfortable beds. Every apartment has at least one balcony making the rooms light and airy. Heating is supplied in the winters and all bedrooms have air-conditioning. 

There is a small dining area in the basement and a lawn at the front, although the terrace garden is very inviting too. 

With its tasteful interiors and peaceful ambience, Om Niwas is a good place to retire to away from the hectic Jaipur city life.
Metatype: An unusual hotel offering spacious apartments, Om Niwas is located in a leafy residential area not far from Jaipur's attractions.
Descr: Om Niwas in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: om niwas, jaipur, rajasthan, service apartment, hotel, special places

Descr: Jaiwana Haveli in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Located in the relatively quiet Cantonment area, this modern mid range hotel has pleasant rooms with modern furnishings and good facilities.

The hotel has a large open lobby which leads to a pleasant caf� in a bright, attractive atrium. There is also an enclosed restaurant to the rear, with an "open" kitchen. Upstairs is a large well stocked bar - a rarity in religious Varanasi!

Descr: Hotel Pradeep in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: In the heart of the Old City, immediately below Meherangarh Fort, Krishna Prakash Heritage Haveli is an authentic haveli which has been converted into a heritage hotel which now attracts a varied international clientele. The present family carried out the restoration of their ancestral home taking care to retain the integrity of its original style. The hotel has 28 air-conditioned rooms with attached bathrooms. The rooftop terrace offers splendid views and is a popular gathering place in the evenings.
WebWriteUp1:
With the Mehrangarh Fort just as the backdrop and a history similar to the fort, this place is a real gem. The rooms in this hotel make you feel like you are in an old palace. The service is wonderful and the owners take pride in sharing their family history with the guests.

Built in 1902, Krishna Prakash Heritage Haveli has delicately carved exteriors and simple yet comfortable interiors. It has fort view rooms, decorated in traditional Jodhpuri style, and a fort facing restaurant. It also has a swimming pool to cool you down in the hot summer.
Metatype: Situated just below the impressive Meherangarh Fort, the Krishna Prakash Heritage Haveli is an authentic haveli which has been lovingly resorted into a heritage hotel.
Descr: Krishna Prakash Heritage Haveli in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Conveniently located in the heart of the town, Hotel Seven Seventeen is an inviting 3-star hotel in Darjeeling run by a very hospitable Tibetan family. Apparently all family members were born or passed away on the 7th or 17th of any month of the Gregorian calendar, hence the name Seven Seventeen! All rooms have wall to wall carpeting and attached bathrooms and they are decorated in traditional Tibetan style. The hotel has an excellent restaurant which serves great Tibetan meals.

Apparently all family members were born or passed away on the 7th or 17th of any month of the Gregorian calendar, hence the name Seven Seventeen! description:
Fort Madhogarh is fabulously situated atop a lone hill in the plains. 
From the rampart walls you can have breathtaking views of the surrounding countryside. 

Madhogarh is a typical small Rajasthani town, even today communities of potters, carpenters, cobblers, carpet makers etc. can be seen plying their trade in the centuries old traditional way. 

You'll have the opportunity to explore the nearby village to get an insight into rural India.
WebWriteUp1:
A short drive from Jaipur brings you to this quiet, rural part of Rajasthan. Fort Madhogarh  sits on top of a hill with excellent views of the entire countryside. The chief job of the forts, of course, was to offer shelter from marauding armies. Therefore the forts were all prepared for battle - and the location was of paramount importance. 

The same turrets, terraces and ramparts which created the defensive barriers, today can be enjoyed for the sunrise and sunset views. Breakfast in Madhogarh is often served on the turrets - making it a surreal experience. 

The fort is recently turned into a heritage hostelry and is run by a very charming young couple, Shiv and Cutie, who personally supervise every aspect of running their home. 

A series of small courtyards bring you the central area. A semi enclosed lounge with  comfortable deep sofas and chairs opens out here. On the opposite side is a small platform where traditionally musicians sat to entertain the family and guests as they had their meals. This tradition still continues and you will be serenaded by a very local singer, and old man, accompanied by his shy daughter-in-law and young grandson. 

The rooms on the upper level are accessed by a few different staircases. Each room is different, with its own character. All rooms have en-suite facilities. The rooms are done in a style that matches the fort - traditional wooden furniture and hand-block printed fabrics. Some rooms sport the original frescoes and arches. The attached bathrooms have modern facilities.
Metatype: Fort Madhogarh is fabulously situated atop a lone hill in the plains.
Descr: Fort Madhogarh in Madhogarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Chattra Sagar is a small luxury tented camp based on a broad dam overlooking a lake, offering some of the best birdwatching opportunities in Rajasthan. 

The sumptuous tents, each with its own attached bathroom, offer very comfortable accommodation and each has its own private sit-out facing the lake. Stay in Chhatra Sagar is on full board and also includes a jeep safari to surrounding villages and a birdwatching trip.
WebWriteUp1:
A pretty road takes you past many working fields. You will see bright yellow mustard fields, talk stalks of wheat and smaller vegetable patches growing gourds and chillies as you drive towards Chhatra Sagar. The campsite, located as it is on a high embankment overlooking the lake, is an ideal place to recover from the overload of monuments one can experience travelling in Rajasthan.

If you are a birdwatcher or simply love being close to nature, then your will adore this small luxury tented camp. Right on the banks of the lake, the site offers some of the best birdwatching in Rajasthan. The common lounge is a large marquee with easy chairs and coffee tables. The entire area overlooks the lake and the fields beyond. Lunch, dinner and snacks are served here or in the open near a campfire depending on the weather. 

The ten comfortable tents have walls made of double fabric; the outside is cream colour while the inside is in bright colours and traditional patterns. Each tent has a comfortable bed and mattress covered with tastefully selected fabrics. The tent is roomy enough to allow a small tea table and two chairs. The attached bathroom is `permanent' - with stone flooring, a washbasin counter, a modern toilet and shower area with hot and cold water. There is also a small but useful dressing area. Each tent has a private sit-out with a sun canopy facing the lake. 

Food is a treat here with delicious Indian and traditional Rajasthani meals cooked with farm fresh vegetables in the family kitchen. Sitting around a bonfire at night, chatting with your hosts and enjoying dinner under a canopy of stars is an experience you will retain with you for many years to come.
Metatype: A small luxury tented camp based on a broad dam overlooking a lake, offering some of the best birdwatching opportunities in Rajasthan.
Descr: Chhatra Sagar in Nimaj - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: chhatra sagar, nimaj, rajasthan, hotel, luxury, tents, birds, special places

description:
Siana Gardens is a small and charming resort in the little visited south-western part of Rajasthan, close to the Gujarat border. There are a number of stone cottages, each with private balconies or sit-outs overlooking the gardens. 

Pradeep Singh, a descendent of the old Rajput aristocrat of the area, is a keen wildlife enthuasist and is the best person to take you on a leopard safari.
WebWriteUp1:
At Siana Gardens a large banyan tree creates a natural shaded area where guests can sit and relax with snacks or meals. Pradeep Singh's wife, the hospitable lady of the house, is responsible for the delicious home-cooked food available here. 

The area around Siana is dramatic; with high rocky cliffs and fantastically shaped rocks, and is home to much wildlife, including the shy panthers, which may be seen on the evening safaris organized by Pradeep. There are also jackals, Indian foxes and plenty of bird-life. 

Pradeep is extremely knowledgeable not just about the wildlife but also the customs of the many pastoral and nomadic tribes who inhabit the area. The tribals live in small hamlets, and carry on their age old practices of shepherding and living off the land. These colourful people are warm and generous to Pradeep's guests, who have a wonderful opportunity to see their simple life at close quarters.
Metatype: Siana Gardens is a small and charming resort in the litlle visited soth-western part of Rajasthan, close to the Gujarat border.
Descr: Siana Camps and Safaries in Siana - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: siana gardens, rajasthan, hotel, leopard, village safari, jeep, special places

Descr: Marshyangdi Annexe in Kathmandu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Ravla Khempur is a grand, two-storey haveli, pale yellow in colour, with arched windows trimmed with ornate white carvings. This was the place where The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel was filmed. With a history dating from the early 17th Century, the palace was once famed for its stud of fine Marwari horses and is still home to dancing stallions which perform when requested in front of the magnificent turreted building.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms at the Ravla are comfortable, each with its own gokhara (traditional bay window, topped by scalloped arches) covered with thick cushions, perfect for lazy afternoons. 

The furniture is from an older, more gracious time; wooden, with a hint of carving, and covered by bandhani printed cottons. 

And everywhere you look there is the presence of horses, portraits of long gone ones, photos of the current ones, including the famous star, Tipu Sultan. Coat hangers, shelf supports, table legs - all feature horses.
Metatype: Ravla Khempur is a grand, two-storey haveli, pale yellow in colour, with arched windows trimmed with ornate white carvings. It is the home of Hemant Singh Deval, a well-known breeder and trainer of Marwari horses.
Descr: Ravla Khempur in Khempur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ravla khempur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, horse riding, safaris, special places

description:
The Rohet family's new venture, this beautiful camp has just six deluxe tents in a picturesque location. The tents are very spacious and have solid wooden furniture. 

There is a large thatched pavilion which is the gathering place for the camp guests and the safari riders who may visit at sunset. The dining room is also similarly constructed with thatch and traditional mud plaster of the Bishnoi community. Comfortable cushions on L-shaped seats are great for relaxing.
WebWriteUp1:
This small but luxurious camp is located on a sand dune surrounded by a flat desert landscape, thereby giving excellent panoramic views. 

The six tents have teakwood polished furniture and rich jute floor rugs. Beautiful inner linings of block prints adorn each tent. They are large enough to accommodate a writing desk, luggage rack and two easy chairs. 

Large netted windows let in ample light which enhances the delicate fabric walls. Attached baths have washbasins, flush toilets and running hot and cold water.
Metatype: The Rohet family's new venture, this beautiful camp has just six deluxe tents in a picturesque location. The tents are very spacious and have solid wooden furniture.
Descr: Rohet Wilderness Camp in Rohet - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rohet wilderness camp, rajasthan, luxury tents, horse safaris, special places

description:
The 100 year old building that houses the Grand Imperial hotel is testimony to India's long and varied history. The low, white colonial building dating back to the Raj era is peppered with Mughal paintings and memorabilia. 
 
Host at one time to the Crown Princes of England as well as to Mohammad Ali Jinnah,  the wide lawn in the front, and the cupola marked pool at the back complete the feel of a luxury heritage hotel.
WebWriteUp1:
The Deluxe Rooms at the Grand Imperial are reached via sunny corridors with Victorian arches. Dark wood poster beds, carved writing desks and cut glass lampshades sustain the heritage feel of the hotel. The floors are colourful with patterned tiles characteristic of 19th century architecture in India. The claw footed bathtubs date back to the founding of the building.

The dining area is a formal space lit with large chandeliers and furnished with elegant chairs and tables on a checked floor. The menu includes Indian, Chinese and Continental foods. The bar on the other hand is a cosy place dominated by a heavily carved wooden bar.

The lawn is bound by an ivy covered wall, punctuated by a marble fountain or two - a great place for a traditional afternoon tea, and there is a swimming pool.
Metatype: The 100 year old building that houses the Grand Imperial hotel is testimony to India's long and varied history. The low, white colonial building dating back to the Raj era is peppered with Mughal paintings and memorabilia.
Descr: The Grand Imperial in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the grand imperial, luxury, heritage hotel, agra, taj mahal, special places
