description:
Located on an upper street in Yuksom, and near the 'king's coronation' stupa, the Tashi Gang Resort is a pleasant 2 storey building in the plaster and timber work style of Sikkimese houses. It has a large lawn in the front complete with tables and sun umbrellas. 

The rooms are simple, but comfortable, and are always clean. Traditional rugs and hand-woven cloth brighten the interiors.
WebWriteUp1:
Hotel Tashi Gang is the most well established hotel in the small town of Yuksom. This is a very scenic place, with a chorten just outside its gates, a well-maintained garden and rooms that have balconies with a view of the snow-covered peaks. 

The rooms have smooth stone floors and walls hung with Buddhist thangka paintings and local cane handicrafts. The bathrooms are small but clean. The rooms all have a narrow balcony with chairs overlooking the lawns and the tall hills beyond. 

The restaurant although small and dark, has a front lawn that makes a good alternative. The restaurant serves many local Sikkimese dishes, which should be ordered in advance. 

Yuksom is a small town and the hotel is a short walk away from its handful of shops and guesthouses. There is also a longer and steeper walk to the Dubdi Monastery.
Metatype: Located on an upper street in Yuksom, and near the 'king's coronation' stupa, the Tashi Gang Resort is a pleassant 2 storey building in the plaster and timber work style of Sikkimese houses. It has a large lawn in the front complete with tables and sun umbrellas.
Descr: Hotel Tashi Gang in Yuksom - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel tashi gang, yuksom, western sikkim, special places

Descr: The Monarch in Ootacamund - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
An old haveli turned into a small but chic guesthouse. Immaculate and gleaming in white, the haveli is built around a minuscule courtyard. 

Scalloped arches encircle the verandah restaurant and white walls set off a well chosen collection of artefacts. The 10 tastefully furnished rooms are on the upper floors.

The rooftop offers great views of the Palace complex, the hilltop Taragarh Fort beyond, and the panorama at sunset is nothing short of magical.
WebWriteUp1:
One cannot help but admire the courage of the Australian lady, Lulu, who took over a rundown old Haveli in the old town of Bundi and turned it into a cool oasis - a small and chic guesthouse. Immaculate and gleaming in white, the Bundi Haveli offers a cool retreat from the sun scorched city.

The Haveli is built around a small courtyard. Scalloped arches encircle the verandah restaurant. The furniture here is of delicate wrought iron. White walls set off a well chosen collection of artefacts - a group of wooden blocks used for printing, a marble Nandi bull, small brass ornaments. The effect overall is that of serene tastefulness. As you climb the staircase, you will be struck by the deep shadows playing on the walls with each level having its own little seating area. 

All rooms are very tastefully decorated. The beds are large and mattresses and pillows are of superior quality. Most rooms have window seats with padded cushions and modha chairs for relaxation. The bathrooms are thoughtfully planned with gleaming porcelain and high quality fittings.
Metatype: An old haveli turned into a small but chic guesthouse. Immaculate and gleaming in white, the haveli is built around a minuscule courtyard.
Descr: Hotel Bundi Haveli in Bundi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bundi haveli, bundi, rajasthan, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Nature Heritage Resort is a jungle lodge located in the lush, green and tranquil surroundings of Bandhavgarh National Park. There are 22 air-conditioned and elegantly furnished luxury cottages, each with its own personal verandah from which to enjoy the views. 

There is a thatched roof restaurant where breakfast and lunch are served. Evenings are a relaxed affair around the bonfire, where conversation is followed by a lavish dinner.
WebWriteUp1:
The day begins just before dawn with a wake up call along with a cup of tea or coffee before heading to the park in an open jeep. Fruits and a bottle of mineral water are provided for 4 hour safari in the jungle. In the evening you can take another game ride through the jungles of Bandhavgarh.

Nature Heritage Resort welcomes photographers and wildlife film makers. Their tiger expert has more than ten years experience in tracking tigers.
Metatype: Nature Heritage Resort is a jungle lodge located in the lush green, and tranquil surroundings of Bandhavgarh National Park. There are 22 air conditioned and elegantly furnished luxury cottages, each with its own personal verandah from which to enjoy the views.
Descr: Nature Heritage Resort in Bandhavgarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nature heritage resort, bandhavgarh, hotel, wildlife, tigers, national park

description:
Just a short distance from the main entrance gate of Kanha National Park, the Krishna Jungle Resort occupies 8 acres of thick forest and provides an ideal setting for bird watching. 

There are 17 comfortable and cozy twin bedded rooms, 'home-cooked' food, and an inviting swimming pool. Jungle rides are organized in open jeeps, beginning at 5.30 am in the morning and 2.30 pm in the afternoon.
WebWriteUp1: Located at the main entrance to the Kanha National Park, Krishna Jungle Resort organizes jungle rides are organized in open jeeps, beginning at 5.30 am in the morning and 2.30 pm in the afternoon. Packed breakfast is provided, while a hot, sumptuous lunch awaits you at the resort. Winters are cold in Kanha, so you will need warm clothes for the safaris, especially in December and January.
Metatype: Just a short distance from the main entrance gate of Kanha National Park, the Krishna Jungle Resort occupies 8 acres of thick forest and provides an ideal setting for bird watching.
Descr: Krishna Jungle Resort in Kanha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: krishna jungle resort, bandhavgarh, hotel, wildlife, tigers, national park

description:
Away from the noise of the central square and yet only a stone's throw from it, the very likable Pema Thang Guesthouse has spotless and tasteful rooms with cream walls and polished wood floors. 

The hotel is run by a family of Tibetan singers and restaurateurs - their experiences in owning restaurants in Paris and Amsterdam ensuring that Pema Thang's food - both European and Tibetan is excellent.
WebWriteUp1:
A small guesthouse on a quiet street 2 minutes away from Dharamsala's shops and restaurants, the Pema Thang or "Lotus Field" Guesthouse offers charming, no frills accomodation. The rooms have light wood floors with large glass windows that look out onto the valley below. 

15 rooms are spread over 3 floors to try and make sure that all rooms have a view or balcony. Glass panes let in copious amounts of sunlight. Simple low wooden beds and armchairs occupy the majority of the room. The attached bathroom is clean and has hot water throughout the day. Aside from the television with international channels and a fan to get the air circulating (its only very rarely that Dharamsala gets really warm) there is also a small kitchenette. Keeping in mind their long term guests the hotel also rents out pots and pans at a nominal price. 
  
The restaurant is lined again with the same light wood as the rooms and a cheerful chequered floor. The food served here is all vegetarian (in good Buddhist tradition), freshly made and served piping hot. Their Italian and Tibetan dishes are well known and widely appreciated, their pizzas and salads especially appreciated. 
  
Take your meal out on the balcony of the restaurant and watch the multi-coloured Tibetan prayer flags fluttering in the breeze. Stroll down to the street stalls of the market place and share a joke or two with the ever cheerful Tibetan shopkeepers.
Metatype: Away from the noise of the central square and yet only a stone's throw from it, the very likable Pema Thang Guesthouse has spotless and tasteful rooms with cream walls and polished wood floors.
Descr: Pema Thang Guesthouse in Dharamsala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Hotel Royale Residency in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Holumba Haven is a family run guesthouse with quaint wooden cottages in two acres of orchid farm and botanical garden. The owners export orchids species as well as exotic floricultures throughout the world. 

There is a delightful lawn, with hammocks and benches making this an ideal place for relaxation in a friendly and peaceful environment. Excellent home cooked meals are served, but these must be ordered in advance.
WebWriteUp1:
Holumba Haven has independent cottages set in a garden of more than a thousand orchids, plants and trees, which is a botanist's paradise. The cottages come in all shapes and sizes, some with 3 bedrooms and a common dining and living area, and some with private sit outs. A central garden contains a hammock and a small pond with a rabbit pen at one end. 

The cottages have names like Woodcot, Springsite, Magnolia etc and bear such plaques as "God Bless our Home" on their doorposts. You may feel an instinctive urge to wipe your feet on the mat and ring the bell before stepping inside! 

Brass lamps shed a mellow light on the smallish rooms that are made cosy by the snug arrangement of furniture and hand picked draperies. The windows are hung with lacy curtains and look out upon the gardens. The common spaces in each cottage are decorated with the family's personal collections of china and bric-a-brac.

The set meals are a congenial event around intimate dining table, and include local vegetables, river fish, and stewed fruit in the winters. The dining area has a small enclosed patio, perfect for an after dinner drink and chat with the hosts.
Metatype: Holumba Haven is a family run guesthouse with quaint wooden cottages in two acres of  orchid farm and forested botanical park.
Descr: Holumba Haven in Kalimpong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: holumba haven, hotel, kalimpong, orchid farm, special places
address:

description:
This small family run hotel on the outskirts of Gangtok is set amongst three acres of lush green garden planted with many trees, bamboos, ferns, flowers, shrubs, lilies and orchids, which attract a variety of birds and butterflies. 

There are spectacular views over Gangtok and the valleys surrounding the city. In the middle of this quiet retreat is a building which offers clean and elegant accommodation, with the genuine friendliness of a family run property.
WebWriteUp1:
The Hidden Forest Retreat began as a nursery and even now its difficult to tell where the nursery ends and the guesthouse begins. Delicate orchids and feathery tree ferns line the paths. The service is exceptional and the youthful resident family manage the property very professionally. The rooms are simple, but comfortable and inviting.

Most rooms in the Retreat are cottages with balconies or small verandahs by a profusion of flora. Instead of a vase of uncut flowers, a potted orchid graces every room. The sheets and linen are locally bought and always clean. 

The food at the Hidden Forest Retreat will definitely be a highlight of your stay. A set meal is actually a vast spread of local and continental dishes with an emphasis on locally sourced produce. There may be crunchy bok choy, aromatic pork momos, bamboo shoots, or even some local cheese cooked with onion and tomato. 

You can spend an afternoon discovering the many plants and flowers in the garden. Garden benches appear at regular intervals and are great places from which to watch the sun go down. The main sit out has unhindered views of Gangtok town below. There is also a library with well thumbed books to choose from. 

This retreat is a peaceful base from which to explore the nearby town of Gangtok.
Metatype: This homestay is set amongst three acres of lush green garden planted with many trees, bamboos, ferns, flowers, shrubs, lilies and orchids, which attract a variety of birds and butterflies.
Descr: Hidden Forest Retreat in Gangtok - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hidden forest retreat, hotel, gangtok, sikkim, special places

description:
Mt. Narsing Village Resort is located 3 km away from Ravangla on the road between Gangtok and Pelling. 

Set among quaint villages, it offers a splendid view of the Rangit valley and the surrounding countryside of west and south Sikkim, dotted with ancient and sacred monasteries. The close proximity of the snowcapped peaks of Mt.Narsing, Mt.Jopuno and Mt.Kabur provides a truly magnificent and awe inspiring backdrop.
WebWriteUp1:
The only construction on a tall high overlooking the town of Ravangla, Mount Narsing Village Resort is a circle of cottages arranged on a smooth lawn. The cottages are charming and rustic, built as they are of log and stone. The central building is a large dining area filled to the brim with local handicrafts. 

Quaint was a word invented for spaces like these - cosy and warm with wooden logs on the walls and ceiling. A small sofa, writing table, and a snug bed completes every room.

The cottages are located close to each other and yet care has been taken to preserve a private area around each. Some cottages are located higher up, above the smooth central lawn, backing onto the tall pine tree forest.

Meals are served in the dining area which is a veritable art and craft museum with wooden pots and earthenware, scooped out bamboo cups and vessels and hand made rugs. The food includes plenty of local dishes such as steamed momos and fried noodles.
Metatype: Mt. Narsing Village Resort is located 3 km away from Ravangla on the road between Gangtok and Pelling.
Descr: Mt Narsingh Village Resort in Ravangla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mount narsingh village resort, ravangla, sikkim, special places

description:
Mrs Bhandaris Guesthouse is very pleasant and comfortable, and above all a homely place in which to enjoy genuine Punjabi hospitality. The pleasant garden has a swimming pool and its own team of curious water buffalo.

There are separate chalets varying in size and location, arranged in and around Mrs. Bhandari's charming red-brick colonial home, complete with original 1950's fittings, furniture and atmosphere.
WebWriteUp1:
Tehmi Bhandari was born in 1906 into a wealthy Parsi family. She heard the firing at Jallianwallah Bagh in 1919 and her efforts at sowing clothes for refugees during the Partition were praised even by Lord Mountbatten. Outliving two husbands, Mrs. Bhandari converted the brick and bougainvillea covered home into a guesthouse and ran it for some 50 years in order to support her family. 

Mrs Tehmi Bhandari sadly passed away a few years ago but her daughters now manage the place and have succeeded in preserving the atmosphere of an old army guesthouse - the furniture is functional but charming, the colours art-deco pastels and there are buffaloes to supply fresh milk and cream everyday. 

The rooms come in all shapes and sizes and are housed in outhouses placed around the main building. What they may lack in modern facilities, is more than made up for by their character and nostalgic feel with claw footed bathtubs resting on patterned tiles, pink, yellow and green walls and chairs and dressing tables of the unmistakable clean-lined art-deco variety. The rooms even have functional fireplaces and the wood for it is provided at extra charge. 

There are neat English lawns at the front and back of the property brightened by pink roses, red pansies and multicoloured dahlias. A simple cement pool is filled with water during the summer months and offers respite from the dry Amritsar heat. Delicious, Indian home cooked food is served on the lawn during summer evenings. 

Breakfasts are enlivened by the thick milk and cream that the buffaloes provide. The buffaloes aren't the only animals around; several friendly dogs roam the property and only add to the laid back, unpretentious atmosphere of the place.

The guesthouse is located outside the city of Amritsar, but the Golden Temple is only 20 minutes by cycle rickshaw.
Metatype: A very pleasant, comfortable and, above all, homely place in which to enjoy genuine Punjabi hospitality. The pleasant garden has a swimming pool and its own team of curious water buffalo.
Descr: Mrs Bhandaris Guesthouse in Amritsar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mrs bhandari's guesthouse, amritsar, punjab, golden temple, special places

Descr: Hotel Victoria in Jaisalmer - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Greenwoods Resorts in Thekkady - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Anchor House is a small waterfront hotel near the old Bazaar Street in Mattancherry. Here, guests gravitate to the waterfront terrace, on both levels, where meals are served. One can spend hours sitting here, watching the boats in the harbour.

The waterfront has a constant bustle of various commuter ferries, large carriers and occasionally, the majestic Queen Mary! The centuries old trade continues in old warehouses belonging to grain and provision suppliers.
WebWriteUp1:
The Anchor House is a small building with less than twenty rooms. The rooms all open off a long shaded verandah. While they are a little on the small side, they are adequately furnished, with televisions, and a mini-bar.   

The waterfront terrace is popular for its good quality food and presentation. The staff is very obliging and helpful. The hotel offers internet facilities in the lounge.
Metatype: Anchor House is a small waterfront hotel near the old Bazaar street in Mattancherry. The guests all gravitate to the waterfront terrace, on both levels, where meals are served. One can spend hours sitting here, watching the boats in the harbour.
Descr: Anchor House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: anchor house, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, waterfront, hotel, special places

description: Located almost next to the entrance gate of the Keoladeo National Park, Birder's Inn is a quiet, peaceful haven for anyone keen to enjoy the natural surroundings, as well as the keen birdwatcher, with a friendly welcoming atmosphere. There are 24 spacious well-furnished air-conditioned rooms overlooking a garden populated with fruit trees that attract various garden birds. There is a large restaurant and a small swimming pool. Naturalists are always available to accompany visits to the Bird Sanctuary, which are particularly rewarding early and late in the day.
WebWriteUp1:
On account of the sheer diversity and richness of its bird life, Bharatpur's 29 sq km Ghana National Park has been recognized by the UNESCO as a World Heritage site. 

For those who want to explore its natural beauty, The Birder's Inn is the perfect perch. The lodge is run by some local naturalists who were actually born inside the park. 

Tirath Singh, the owner, is an Arts Graduate from Rajasthan and a diploma holder in Nature & Wildlife Interpretation. He is passionate about wildlife and wilderness and has guided many wildlife and cultural groups for local and overseas tour companies. 

The thatch restaurant acts as a watering hole for local birders, naturalists and photographers and is an excellent place to share information and anecdotes.
Metatype: Located a mere stone's throw from the entrance of the Keoladeo National Park (Bharatpur Bird Sanctuary), The Birder's Inn is a quiet, peaceful haven for the keen birdwatcher.
Descr: Birders Inn in Bharatpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: birder's inn, bharatpur, rajasthan, hotel, keoladeo bird sanctuary

description:
This stylish retreat is ideal for those interested in yoga and meditation, the accommodation is in spacious tented eco-chic lodges, or one of the enchanting boutique suites in the main house. 

Yoga Magic is an oasis of peace just two kilometres from the golden beaches of North Goa.

Whether you are looking for relaxation and tranquillity or rejuvenation of mind, body and spirit, the aim of Yoga Magic is to ease you back to nature without compromising on luxury.
WebWriteUp1:
Too nice to be called a tented resort, owner Steve has coined the term Canvas Hotel for this eco friendly resort, Yoga Magic. As you pass the main north Goa road from Calangute to Anjuna, you will see some colourful flags fluttering among paddy fields. This is Yoga Magic. There are tents spread around the well tended plantation of coconuts and other local trees. Each tent is covered by a thatch roof thus keeping it cool and giving a large shaded sit-out at the front. 

The electricity is provided by small solar panels just outside each tent. The tents are spacious, easily putting to shame many hotel rooms. There are beds and bedside tables with plenty of space to walk around. Beyond the bedroom, there is a dressing/lounge area with a comfortable mattress spread Indian style on the floor. True to the ecologically sound policies of Yoga Magic, the toilets use no chemicals. The pot itself is squat style and once you are finished, you have to sprinkle the matter with wood shavings and then spray it with a special liquid that helps to bio-degrade the waste in record time. This then is used as manure in the gardens, especially for the banana and other fruit trees. The method obviously works, as these are some of the most odour-free toilets we have come across! 

Yoga Magic holds special yoga and meditation residential camps. There is a large, thatched space which serves as the venue for the classes for yoga and meditation. An Ayurveda massage specialist is at hand to take away any aches and pains. 

Surrounded as it is by miles of fields and waving coconut palms, Yoga Magic is a wonderfully serene place in which to rejuvenate your body and soul.
Metatype: This stylish retreat is ideal for those interested in yoga and meditation, the accommodation is in spacious tented eco-chic lodges, or one of the enchanting boutique suites in the main house.
Descr: Yoga Magic Canvas Ecotel in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: yoga magic canvas ecotel, goa, anjuna, meditation, tours, hotel

Descr: Nahargarh Ranthambhore in Sawai Madhopur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A modern mid-category, mid-sized hotel in Puri, Shakti International offers clean rooms at a reasonable price. 

Though Shakti International is not located on the beach, it is a good budget option and the food served in its bizarre spaceship themed restaurant Aero Dine is excellent.

The rooms are air conditioned with plasma screen televisions, have running hot and cold water, and offer affordable comfort.
WebWriteUp1:
The Deluxe Rooms are good value for money. They are well designed, with heavy red, gold fringed curtains hanging in scallops and the bedspreads tend to be of the frilly variety. However, the rooms are well ordered and neat, the beds comfortable and the bathrooms quite acceptable. 

Breakfast is served in 'Misti' the snacks bar and while service may be a bit slow, their masala omlettes and dosas are worth the wait. Lunch and dinner are served in the Aero Dine and there are Indian, Continenatal and tandoori dishes to choose from.  

The chief attractions of Puri - the famous Jagannath Temple and the beach - are a short rickshaw ride away.
Metatype: A modern mid-category, mid-sized hotel in Puri, Shakti International offers clean rooms at a reasonable price.
Descr: Shakti International in Puri - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shakti international hotel, puri, orissa, beach, special places

description:
Rann Riders is a resort featuring different types of Gujarati traditional and tribal homes set around well kept lawns and shady trees. 

These mud, stone and tiled cottages are all furnished with modern comforts while preserving the essential rural feel of the homes. 

This eco friendly resort is a good base from which to explore the salt plains and wetlands that form the Rann of Kutch.
WebWriteUp1:
Rann Riders remains the best place to stay near the Little Rann of Kutch. The rooms vary in size and style, but all are comfortable and well equipped. The meals (all buffets) are excellent, and huge in terms of both variety and quantity. Tea, coffee, water and even soft drinks, are all included. They have their own jeeps (and canters) for safaris. Their guides are knowledgeable about the Wild Ass Reserve. 

The cottages are all built using local materials, have spacious modern bathrooms, and are of 3 distinct types.

The Bhunga cottages imitate the mud and thatch huts of the pastoral Rabari tribe. Their circular shape and small windows are designed to circulate fresh air and limit the entry of sunlight and heat. White clay, and mirrors fashioned into the customary folk designs, brightens the interiors. 

The sturdier, tiled Kooba homes are representative of the weaving community of the Bajanias who still practice their craft in the nearby village of Dasada. Their white walls are lined with framed pieces of fabric that exhibit the various styles of embroidery and tie and die fabric work found in the Kutch region. The small patio in front of each Kooba cottage features the hand carved wooden brackets of ancestral Gujarati homes and is complete with simple rope and wooden swings. 

The stone cottages sit back from the rest of the resort and are closer to the pond that is often completely covered by water lilies. They are cool and furnished with dark wood furniture that gives them a comforting forest lodge feel. 

The jeep rides into the Rann begin from the resort itself with a local driver who is knowledgeable about the local bird and animal life. A bird watchers guide could also be useful.
Metatype: Rann Riders is a resort featuring different types of Gujarati traditional and tribal homes set around well kept lawns and shady trees.
Descr: Rann Riders in Dasada - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rann riders, dasada, gujarat, wild ass, birds, flamengos, rann of kutch

There are also a great mosaic-tile pool, a pavilion with restaurants, a coffee bar, and a sweets shop. 

New Marrion has an interesting South Indian and Chinese restaurant attached.
WebWriteUp1: Brown wall paneling, a profusion of geometric shapes, sparkling white tile floors, and wall televisions contribute to an air of cool sleekness in the guest rooms. Bathrooms have triangular sinks, square taps, and lots of shiny chrome and glass. Deluxe rooms have marble floors and king beds.
Metatype: An unexceptional boxy exterior and a conventional and small lobby disguise some excellent, spacious, ultramodern rooms.
Descr: The New Marrion Hotel in Bhubaneshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Residency at Coimbatore is the finest hotel and a landmark in the city. 

This 4 star premium luxury hotel offers spacious and comfortable rooms with thematic interiors. Located on a major arterial road, it is a 20 minutes drive from the airport. The hotel's pub `Bike & Barrel' is a popular place with great ambience.
WebWriteUp1:
The Residency is rated as a 4 star hotel. The rooms are well designed and furnished; and kept very clean. The hotel offers luxuries such as a laundry and ironing service, bathrobes and slippers, very comfortable mattresses and a bathtub. The staff is very helpful and courteous. 

The hotel has three restaurants: The multi cuisine 24 hour Pavilion, the specialty Chinese Chin Chin, and the Afghan Grill, a pool side open air restaurant. There is also a bar named "House of Lords", and a popular pub with a bikers' theme.

description:
The Elgin Mount Pandim is set in eight acres of virgin forest and landscaped gardens. Built in colonial style, it was originally the summer home of the royal family of Sikkim.

The guest rooms are elegantly furnished with shiny wooden floors, silk bedspreads, drapes and Tibetan carpets. Granite and wood-lined bathrooms complete the look. Each room has a grand view of Kanchenjunga. The three- hundred year old Pemayangtse monastery is right next to the resort on a verdant hill top.
WebWriteUp1:
Perched on a hillside, quite close to the ancient Pemayangtse Monastery, this is one of the prettiest and best-located hotels in Sikkim. Once a summer haven of the Sikkim royal family, then a government-owned lodge, Mount Pandim was taken over by the Elgin hotel group and renovated in 2007. 

Stepping into the Mount Pandim's lobby is like entering a home. Handpicked furniture of the classic yet comfortable kind is arranged as if to welcome friends. A fire crackles in the hearth and the warm lighting inside contrasts with the cool blue colours of the Kanchenjunga range seen beyond the French doors.

The rooms are tasteful, their subdued colours cultivating the feel of the hotel as a quiet retreat. Thick rugs on hardwood floors and handsome restored furniture attest to the heritage of the property. Most rooms have large windows with wide views. On cold nights, heaters are placed in the rooms, and you may even find a hot water bottle in the bed!

The restaurant that opens out on the front lawn serves crunchy fresh vegetables and well marinated meat dishes typical of the hills. Located above the town near the Pemayagtse Monastery, the Mount Pandim's lawns drop rapidly to offer some of the best views of the mountains.

Mount Pandim offers a return to the old world hospitality of a time when guests were honoured friends.
Metatype: Built in colonial style, the New Elgin Hotel is a 120-year-old residence reminiscent of the days of the Raj.
Descr: The Elgin Mount Pandim in Pelling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: elgin mount pandim, hotel, pelling, sikkim, special places

Descr: Jaypee Palace Hotel in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Fort House is one of the older establishments on the water front of Fort Cochin. This atmospheric property has undergone extensive renovation recently and now offers over twenty rooms.

The restaurant on the waterfront is a big draw - not just for its location, for also its seafood specialties. Tourists as well as Kochi residents are regular visitors here, and they come to enjoy the evening views of the harbour.
WebWriteUp1:
Fort Kochi can be roughly divided into two areas, one of the waterfront and one facing inland towards large tree covered maidaans (open grounds). 

The Fort House is one of the older establishments on the water front. The older rooms are small and simple but are decorated in charming colours with clean attached bathrooms. The newer rooms are larger, once again with colourful curtains and bed covers. The bathrooms are attractive, with rough granite slabs and smooth yellow stone from Jaisalmer. 

A charming garden, filled with tropical plants and old statues which have acquired a mellow patina of age. There is an Ayurveda centre with separate rooms for men and women.
Metatype: The Fort House is one of the older establishments on the water front of Fort Cochin. This atmospheric property has undergone extensive renovation recently and now offers over twenty rooms.
Descr: The Fort House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort house, cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, india, special places

description:
Situated on a lofty terrace overlooking the Arabian Sea below, Thapovan is an enchanting resort. The guest rooms are either relocated Kerala homes or in new cottages, with strong Kerala architectural influence. 

Part of the resort is directly on the beach and another part is on a higher terrace with superb views, of not just the ocean but also the landscaped gardens spread below.
WebWriteUp1:
Thapovan resort is actually divided into two different areas, the first one being on the cliff and the other one, closer to the sea. Both are charming; the upper area has more panoramic views while the lower area is closer to the beach. 

The spacious rooms are all thoughtfully appointed; with large, clean bathrooms. Local handloom fabrics and silks have been used to bring in splashes of colours. The garden too has many interesting trees and flowering shrubs. 

Thapovan has an extensive Ayurvedic program with various duration therapies on offer, as well as a special Ayurvedic restaurant which serves food specially made for the different `personalities' according to the ancient science. The restaurant, in a charming pavilion with views over the ocean, is popular enough to attract guests from all over Kovalam.
Metatype: Situated on a lofty terrace overlooking the Arabian sea below, Thapovan is an enchanting resort. The guest rooms are either relocated Kerala homes or in new cottages, with strong Kerala architectural influence.
Descr: Thapovan Heritage Home in Kovalam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: thapovan heritage home, kovalam, beach resort, kerala, hotel, special places

description: Ranthambore Forest Resort is a comfortable, old fashioned, resort. Spread over five acres, the resort borders the lush green forest, behind which the hills of the National Park provide a unique backdrop. There are 46 large plainly furnished air conditioned rooms, in well spaced clusters spread out around the garden, and there is a large circular swimming pool, making this a good place to relax between safaris.
Metatype: Ranthambhore Forest Resort is a comfortable medium range resort. Spread over five acres, the resort borders the lush green forest, behind which mountains provide a unique backdrop.
Descr: Ranthambhore Forest Resort in Sawai Madhopur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Located in an orchard of rare beauty, and run by exceptionally amiable hosts, Shahpura Bagh is a real treat. This was the summer residence of the rulers of Shahpura and is now a fine heritage hotel with just 10 beautifully furnished rooms. The owners organise interesting excursions to a nearby fort and to their eco-farm. There is a walking trail around the property, and bicycles are available for the use of guests, though many find it difficult to leave the delightful swimming pool, making it ideal for those seeking some activity, as well as for those looking for pure relaxation.
checkout: Midday. Extended check-out is subject to negotiation / availability
WebWriteUp1:
A long driveway leads through simple gates and along an avenue of young trees, to Umaid Niwas, the guest house of the Royal family of Shahpura. An exceptionally benevolent line, the erstwhile ruling family has worked hard to create water bodies and reservoirs in this desert region. As a result, today's Shahpura has lush green fields and orchards. 

Set in the 45 acre plantation, are the two bungalows; Nahar Niwas, the residence of the family, and Umaid Niwas, the guest-house which now offers just 6 suites and four rooms. The suites, of at least 600 sq feet, are larger than most city apartments.
 
All rooms and suites have been furnished with exquisite taste - the fabrics and materials are silk and hand-woven cottons of a very high standard. The furniture is a mix of colonial and Rajasthani, to go with the building's character. High ceilings add to the feeling of space. 

Meals are served in the family's residence - either on the sunlit verandah, in the front garden or in the formal dining room. The meals are of excellent quality, made from farm fresh ingredients. The emphasis is on Indian and Rajasthani food tempered to suit the visitor's palate, and continental dishes can be prepared on request.

Possibly the nicest aspect in this charming place are the hosts. Shatrujeet Singh, gave up his photography career to return to his roots at Shahpura. His wife Maya runs the property with a firm hand and an eye for detail that ensures all guests are comfortable. Then there is Mamosa (an affectionate sobriquet given by his nephews), Durbar Saab - meaning the Head of the Royal Family - Mamosa is a treasure trove of stories from the colourful Raj era. His knowledge of the history and culture of the region is second to none.
Metatype: A peaceful guesthouse, located in an orchard of rare beauty, run by exceptionally amiable hosts, Shahpura Bagh is a real treat. This was the summer residence of the rulers of Shahpura and is now a fine heritage hotel with just 10 beautifully furnished rooms.
Descr: Shahpura Bagh in Shahpura - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shahpura bagh, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, boutique, special places

description:
The Kerkar Retreat is a guesthouse that has grown organically out of the art gallery belonging to Goas celebrated artist, Dr. Subodh Kerkar. 
The Retreat, situated a mere 300 meters away from Calangute beach, only houses 6 rooms all of which are spacious and clean. 

The mainly white walls form a larger canvas for art and guests spend a considerable amount of time gazing at local Goan scenes expertly recreated in oil and water colours by the owner. 

Your Goan experience here will be rounded off by the superb Goan Hindu food served by the in-house restaurant called `Waves'.
WebWriteUp1:
Kerkar Retreat is a small guesthouse just a few minutes walk from Goa's famous Calangute Beach. Simple bedrooms filled with paintings, objects d'art, curios and hand-painted ceramic tiles, make you feel as if you are in your own private museum. The guesthouse has an adjoining restaurant and art gallery.

The rooms are rather simply furnished but old Goan pieces of furniture are often used and the heavy wooden doors with exaggerated iron hinges give a feeling of a simple country house. Blue wooden lace work windows, a hand painted tiled headboard, and green striped curtains liven up the rooms. There is also a common pantry that guests can make use of, stocked with tea, coffee and sugar at no extra charge.

A unique aspect of this guesthouse is the real effort that is made at encouraging art and music among its guests and within the local community. Thus, if inspired by the art on the walls and in the gallery you wish to indulge in a bit of pottery or painting, a studio will be made available to you. During the busy season open concerts of Indian classical music are also organised.
Metatype: The Kerkar Retreat is a guesthouse that has grown organically out of the art gallery belonging to Goas celebrated artist, Dr. Subodh Kerkar.
Descr: Kerkar Retreat in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Kerkar Art Complex
Holiday Street
Gaurawado, Calangute

description: Amet Haveli is a lovely haveli right on the shore of Lake Pichola, in the heart of the romantic city of Udaipur. There are just a handful of rooms but all have lovely cushioned bay windows and balconies overlooking the lake, and there is a small swimming pool in the garden. The waterfront Ambrai restaurant has arguably the best location and views in the entire city.
WebWriteUp1:
Located on the shores of Lake Pichola, this pretty 350-year-old haveli (traditional residence) offers lovely accommodation in a fabulous location.

The old haveli has been extended in traditional style, with arched corridors, cushioned bay windows and balconies overlooking the lake. The charming rooms are reached via meandering corridors. The use of colours against white-washed walls is dramatic, as is the sheer proximity of the lake. There is a small swimming pool in a well tended garden. 

The waterfront Ambrai restaurant has a panoramic view of the Jagdish Temple, Gangaur Ghat, City Palace, Lake Palace, Jag Mandir and Sajjangarh Fort - in fact, the view from here is probably the best in Udaipur. Large numbers of water birds sit preening close enough to be spotted without binoculars. At any time of the day, you will see local women washing clothes and children enjoying a cooling dip in the lake. The evening views of the illuminated city are nothing short of magical.
Metatype: Amet Haveli is a lovely haveli right on the shore of Lake Pichola, in the heart of the romantic city of Udaipur.
Descr: Amet Haveli in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: amet haveli, udaipur, rajasthan, heritage hotel, lake pichola, special places

description:
A stay at Fort Barli is a delightful way to experience rural Rajasthan. Pretty much in the middle of nowhere, off the new highway between Jaipur and Udaipur, it offers and authentic Indian experience you cant beat.

Fort Barli is an intimate heritage hotel with a small number of beautiful rooms and suites where you can relive the days of the Maharajas as well as explore the village and the surrounding countryside.
WebWriteUp1:
Barli offers the comfort and grandeur of a fort combined with simple village life, unchanged for centuries, and makes for a peaceful interlude during your hectic travels in India.

Fort Barli has just 11 deluxe rooms and suites with stylish traditional interiors, high ceilings and large windows. It features a beautiful outdoor infinity pool in a bastion. Various activities can be arranged such as a cookery demonstration. 

Beneath the fort village life continues as it has done for hundreds of years and a walk down the narrow lanes reveal potters, cobblers, jewellers and carpet weavers at work. Farmers eke a living from the surrounding countryside. You can interact with the locals on a bullock cart ride through the village. Alternatively, you can use cycles to explore the surrounding countryside.

A trip to Dev Sagar lake which attracts winter migrants is a must for bird watchers and nature lovers alike. Amongst the breeds regularly seen here are plovers, cormorants, snake birds, herons, kingfishers and many others. Closer to the fort, you may see woodland birds like bulbuls, rollers, bee-eaters etc.
Metatype: South of Ajmer, on the highway linking Jaipur and Undaipur, is a small village called Barli.
Descr: Fort Barli in Barli - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort barli, rajasthan, heritage hotel, village, special places

Descr: The Park in Bangalore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Poovath Heritage Hotel is a renovated century-old Dutch Palace, located at Fort Cochin next to the Dutch Cemetery. It is stylish boutique hotel with lovely views over the Arabian Sea.

The hotel has 10 spacious and well appointed rooms that retain the colonial ambience. There is a swimming pool in the garden. The restaurant serves Thai, North and South Indian, Continental, Italian and Chinese cuisine. There is a swimming pool in the garden.

description:
Abad Turtle Beach is a very pleasant resort set amidst 13 acres of land. It has the beautiful white sands of Marari Beach on one side and the rivulet on the other side. 

The 28 cottages are modern, spacious and well equipped, with outdoor sitting areas and hammocks. There is a swimming pool, a vegetable garden, a fish pond, a butterfly garden, a badminton court, cycles for hire, an ayurvedic centre, and a restaurant with good value food. 

There is direct access onto the beach, which is cleaned and patrolled by the resort's own lifeguards. The overall feel is one of space, peace, and relaxation.
WebWriteUp1: There are 28 cottages (2 to each bungalow, so ideal for families) and 4 independent villas well scattered around the huge grounds.
Descr: Abad Turtle Beach in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Hotel Pichola Haveli in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The M. K. hotel is a modern building in a quiet residential part of Amritsar. The rooms are large and sunny, there is a rooftop pool, a multi-cuisine restaurant, a cafe and a bar. 

But inspite of its 20 year reputation, the management has allowed the hotel to go slightly to seed. Some rooms still have carpets that by now are a little stained and slightly smelly and the common areas tend to be a little gloomy. 

But the hotel is still a multi-star hotel by Amristsar standards and continues to be host to travellers and Indian dignitaries alike.
WebWriteUp1:
There is a standard style of decoration across the 69 rooms. Comfortable double or twin beds with heavy bed covers, a couple of armchairs arranged around a coffee table, and a writing desk and chair. The bathrooms are modern and clean with running hot and cold water. There is satellite television in the room, and room service on offer. 

Their multi-cuisine restaurant's menu features Indian and Continental food as well as some Amritsari specialities. Their Greenhouse Cafe offers all day snacks and soft beverages but for the non alcoholic kind you have to head to Dynasty. 

Along with the rooftop pool (which at times can be a little dirty because of the pigeons that regularly visit it) there is a well equipped fitness centre.
Metatype: The M. K. hotel is a modern building in a quiet residential part of Amritsar. The rooms are large and sunny, there is a rooftop pool, a multi-cuisine restaurant, a cafe and a bar.
Descr: M.K. Hotel in Amritsar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
