description:
In a quiet narrow street of Fort Kochi is Napier House, a small home-stay. This simple building dates back to the Dutch era with a few comfortable modern additions. 

The suite is done in the original Dutch style. There are hardwood floors, an elegant four poster canopied bed and a sunny private balcony. The other rooms are a mixture of original and modern.

All guests have access to a lounge on the first floor and a terrace with dining tables.
WebWriteUp1:
Situated in the heart of Fort Cochin within walkable distance to St Francis Church, the Dutch Cemetery, Portuguese Museum, Chinese Fishing Nets and the five hundred year old Santa Cruz Basilica. The serene lanes of Napier street reflect the colonial influence of the Dutch, the Portuguese and the British.

The Napier Suite has beautiful old wooden floorings and ceilings. You can enjoy your bed tea sitting in the Veranda, exclusive to you. The Deluxe Rooms also have wooden ceiling. These are spacious rooms with modern amenities. The Standard Rooms are in the budget category.
Metatype: In a quiet narrow street of Fort Kochi is Napier House, a small home-stay. This simple building dates back to the Dutch era with a few comfortable modern additions.
Descr: Napier House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Napier Lane
Napier Street
Fort Cochin

description:
This is one of the true gems of Fort Cochin. Located only a street away from the waterfront and the famous Chinese Fishing nets, the Old Harbour Hotel enjoys a superb location.

The Old Harbour Hotel building once housed sailors, was then passed on to a tea company and finally lay abandoned before it was bought and lovingly restored by the current owners.
WebWriteUp1:
The white-washed building has Dutch and Portuguese architectural influences. There is a sense of space which is generally lacking in other Fort Kochi buildings. There is a large central garden with a swimming pool and a lily filled water body. The restaurant serves very good cuisine, with a natural emphasis on sea-food, caught just a few metres away! 

The rooms are spread around the building with a few in the Kerala style cottages in the garden. The rooms are spacious, with well chosen pieces of furniture and the best of cottons and other natural materials. The bathrooms too are of a high standard. The cottages have their own little garden, outdoor showers and private sit-outs. Everywhere you will notice the small details - old brass phones in working conditions, a single flower on a windowsill, a sprig of papyrus in a white niche or a lone gold fish swimming in a flower vase!

For discerning travellers who love style, solitude and a touch of originality, this is an ideal place.
Metatype: This is one of the true gems of Fort Cochin. Located only a street away from the waterfront and the famous Chinese Fishing nets, the Old Harbour Hotel enjoys a superb location.
Descr: Old Harbour Hotel in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: old harbour, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places

description:
A handsome red coloured building, the Koder House belonged to a venerable Jewish family for two centuries. 

The family members have traditionally been the wardens of the Synagogue and the Koder family enjoyed an almost royal status in Cochin society. As a result Koder House has entertained many dignitaries from various parts of the world. It has now been lovingly restored and turned into a very special hertitage hotel.
WebWriteUp1:
The Koder House now has just a handful of suites, all in keeping with the character of the building. The restaurant on the ground has attractive silk wall hangings in niches and overlooks a small pool in the courtyard. There is also an Ayurvedic spa and on the top floor of the building is a wine and beer lounge, converted from one of the formal living rooms. 

The suites are spacious, and furnished in rich materials and authentic period furniture. The bathrooms have good quality modern fittings. With a conscious effort to preservse as many of the original features as posisble, Koder House is a delightful, elegant yet homely little inn for choosy travelers.
Metatype: A handsome red coloured building, the Koder House belonged to a venerable Jewish family for two centuries.
Descr: Koder House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: koder house, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places

description:
This wonderful building was built by Samuel Koder, of the adjoining Koder House, another excellent heritage hostelry with which is shares a wall and a hanging bridge! 

The old building, added to by different generations, has wooden staircases and unexpected corners in which to sit and enjoy the ambience.
WebWriteUp1:
Abad Grande Residencia is a small hotel with superior facilities including a fair sized swimming pool and well tended lawns. Wide arches lead from one area to the other, and unusual colours are set off by the predominant white of the building.

The rooms are almost all spacious and have been furnished with care to keep the original character intact, with antique wooden furniture, pristine linen and modern bathrooms.
Metatype: This wonderful building was built by Samuel Koder, of the adjoining Koder House, another excellent heritage hostelry with which is shares a wall and a hanging bridge!
Descr: Abad Grande Residencia in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: abad grande residencia, fort cochin, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places

description:
Tucked away, facing the waterfront and near the Church, is Le Colonial, very easy to miss behind the thick canopy of an imposing rain tree. 

This colonial building has a central living room with deep cushioned sofas in luxurious fabrics, while a verandah runs along the front of the house and the swimming pool. The verandah, both downstairs and upstairs has wonderfully cozy seating arrangements to appreciate the surrounding areas full of trees and the waterfront beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
This new addition to the "non-hotels" managed by the Neemrana group is possibly their most luxurious one.  Undoubtedly, it is India's oldest colonial house and has had a long and exciting history of ownership from the Dutch Government to being personal home of a major tea trader.

Today, the old house is one of the best remaining examples of colonial architecture with its deep verandahs and low eves. Le Colonial is a veritable living museum, with painstakingly collected colonial lithographs and paintings. The well travelled guest will recognize it as a smaller version of the Imperial in Delhi.

The rooms are regal in their appointments - wooden polished floors, high ceilings, amazing art and luxurious bathrooms in hand-polished wood and brass. Everything speaks of luxury dating from an era of late breakfasts, long siestas and decadent pampering. Spending some time at Le Colonial is to be part of an ultra select house party.
Metatype: Tucked away, facing towards the waterfront and near the Church, is Le Colonial, very easy to miss behind the thick canopy of an imposing rain tree.
Descr: Le Colonial in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: le colonial, fort cochin, kochi, kerala, heritage, hotel, special places
address:
1/315, Church Road
Vasco da Gama Square
Fort Cochin

description:
A pleasant seaside resort with a row of individual small bungalows, Fisherman Village Beach resort is situated between the port city of Cochin and Alleppey.

Fresh white sand starts right outside the rooms and a row of palms lead you to the ultra clear waters. A young garden, planted among the older palm trees, makes for a pleasant ambience.
WebWriteUp1:
Marari Fishermen Village is a new, moderately priced beach resort situated at Mararikulam, a local fishing village with endless miles of sand beaches and swaying palms situated between the port city of Cochin and Alleppey. 

The indepent airconditioned cottages have attached bath, cable television, and round-the-clock room service. The rooms are individual bungalows, and are comfortably furnished with clean, modern bathrooms. Each one has a small sit-out looking out to the sea, no further than a hundred metres away. There is a beach restaurant, and an Ayurveda centre.
Metatype: A pleasant seaside resort with a row of individual small bungalows.
Descr: Fishermen Village Beach Resort in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fishermen village beach resort, marari, mararikulam, kerala, hotel

description:
Tucked away behind village houses and thick groves, is the ancient home of the Arakal family. 

The old home, a mini-tharavad, sits sungly under thick tree cover and is separated from the beach by a lick of tidal water and sand. 

The small cottages are all under shady trees, hung with hammocks. Each cottage has its own sit-out enclosed by carved Kerala railing in wood. The beach is a mere minute's walk away!
WebWriteUp1:
Arakal Heritage is the home of Abi and Mini and they are delightful hosts. The rooms are simple but you may well find that you spend much more time relaxing in the hammocks than inside the rooms. The attached bathrooms have outdoor showers and have modern facilities. 

The food is excellent, all home cooked, and Mini is popular as a cookery teacher. She is also a trained beautician, so do indulge in one of her soothing facials - you will not find a more idyllic atmosphere in which to enjoy one!
Metatype: Tucked away behind village houses and thick groves, is the ancient home of the Arakal family.
Descr: Arakal Heritage in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: arakal heritage, homestay, beach, marari, mararikulam, kerala, special places

description:
A fabulous, stylish small beach resort with just 5 cottages, far enough from each other to feel totally secluded, each cottage is an utter delight. 

Some cottages have incorporated old wooden houses whilst others are totally newly built, but with such a glorious eye to detail that you will want to linger at each one of them.

There are sinuous smooth cement floors in earth tones, colourful silk cushions, bric-a-brac on the walls and amazing bathrooms.
WebWriteUp1:
A Beach Symphony is the dream of a charming Belgian couple, Jan and Christel, who searched long and hard for a place to make this their home. They are articulate, warm and very knowledgeable. What's more, Jan is a professional chef so you can be sure of delicious meals. 

The large gardens yield many delights apart from the wide sea views - rustling palms, an old fishing boat resting under an older palm, a tiny wooden seat, which used to be a road-side shop, and a thatched pavilion with humorously coloured columns.

The cottages are comfortable and well designed, each with different quirky touches. 3 have open to the sky showers. They all have coffee makers, and small libraries, and large verandahs with extremely comfortable loungers for relaxing and private dining areas. 

There is no restaurant and no menu - clients simply tell the staff what they want, and they then prepare it and bring it to the verandah. 

The overall feel is one of blissful relaxation in a beautiful private environment.
Metatype: A fabulous, stylish small beach resort with just 5 cottages, far enough from each other to feel totally secluded, each cottage is an utter delight.
Descr: A Beach Symphony in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: a beach symphony, marari, mararikulam, beach resort, boutique hotel

description:
The Beach at Pollethai is an exclusive, beautiful resort. Cottages tucked away under trees, offer privacy and peace, with the beach and blue sea on one side and meandering streams and water bodies on the other.

The beaches at Mararikulam and adjoining Pollethai thankfully remain pristine and quiet. The only sounds you will hear will be the waves, the rustling of the palms and the boats being pulled in by fishermen.
WebWriteUp1:
This small resort is an excellent example of how to achieve comfort whilst having minimum interference with the original surroundings.

The Beach at Pollethai is a plot of land which meanders from a narrow road to a large expanse of beach. In between are canals with humpbacked bridges, a few hundred old coconut trees, several flowering bushes and a handful of guest cottages. You may easily mistake this for a typical coastal village in Kerala. 

A thatched `reception' area is a far cry from the polished resort counterparts. Winding paths shaded by palm fronds lead to the cottages. Designed using a soothing combination of Kerala architectural features, this is some of the best tropical resort architecture you can find. 

Spacious rooms are cool and furnished with a simple sense of style. The white of the rooms is offset by warm coloured curtains and bedspreads. Each cottage has a private sit-out, with comfortable lounging furniture, where you may spend a large part of the day. 

A large swimming pool is tucked away to one side, near the multi cuisine restaurant which offers fresh seafood and a wide range of Kerala and Continental dishes.
Metatype: Cottages tucked away under trees, offer privacy and peace, with the beach and blue sea on one side and meandering streams and water bodies on the other. The Beach at Pollethai is an exclusive, beautiful resort.
Descr: The Beach at Pollethai in Mararikulam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the beach at pollethai, marari, mararikulam, hotel, resort, kerala, boutique

description:
Stay at this 100 year old mansion along one of the backwater canals in Allapuzha and enjoy the Kerala cuisine.

A stroll round the house feels like a tour of a lived-in museum; there's an abundance of curios and everything is properly ordered. 

Furniture is made of teak and rosewood. The living room boasts of a collection of antiques in brass and wood.
WebWriteUp1:
Spacious Airy Guest Rooms are Simple and Clean in the Heritage Style with modern private facilities attached. Each of the bedrooms air-conditioned and non air -conditioned has its own antique object: a huge metal safe in one room, an ornate set of trinket boxes in another.
A stroll round the house feels like a tour of a lived-in museum; there's an abundance of curios and everything is properly ordered. An antique rosewood gramophone and a brass and wooden Para (for measuring rice) are two of the living room discoveries. Traditionally hand crafted Cots, Tables, Chairs and decorative are adorned and preserved with much passion and compassion.
The stone-floored dining room that opens on to a garden dappled in shade cast by the impressive 100-year-old mango tree
This century old is pristine and immaculate in all its aspects. The enchanting ambience, tranquil and serene life steals you to its own world. Our villages with its traditional tiled houses, temples, canals, simple and friendly people offer a unique experience to the visitor.
Metatype: Stay at this 100 year old mansion along one of the backwater canals in Allapuzha and enjoy the Kerala cuisine.
Descr: Tharavad Heritage Resort in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
West of North Police Station
Sea View Ward

description:
This is a rare example of an exquisitely restored heritage building which balances modern comforts with gracious living.

Each room has rich wine-red velvet bedspreads, offset by the white walls. The furniture is all handpicked and includes many of the Raheem family heirlooms, including the grand matrimonial bed with hand-painted Taj Mahal!
WebWriteUp1:
Raheem Residency is a treasure trove close to the beach at Alleppey. The house was originally a colonial bungalow which was bought by the Raheem family, affluent and enlightened Gujarati Muslims, and hosted Mahatma Gandhi and Jawaharlal Nehru. The house was later acquired by its current owners, delightful Bibi and her partner, who restored it with genuine passion.

The large house looks deceptively small from the front - but then, sunny corridors take you to wings that you didn't know existed. A large pool offers total privacy - the staff has been trained not to disturb guests lounging by the pool unless summoned by a discreet bell! 

The grand lounge is filled with interesting furniture - sofas, arm-chairs, dowry boxes and even a carved doorframe now turned into a book case. Still, the high ceilings oupled with the generous size makes this a pleasingly open space. There are 4 rooms opening off this central lounge. 

There are verandahs which run almost the full length of the house - back and front. Lazy chairs are arranged here for afternoon naps or reading. In fact, there are so many corners of the house where you would like to sit, that a week would be needed to enjoy them all! 

Upstairs, the newer section houses a small restaurant in rich colours. This overlooks the sea on one side and on the other is a large open ground dominated by the Alleppey Lighthouse. The restaurant has set menus which offer a choice of both Kerala and European dishes.
Metatype: This is a rare example of an exquisitely restored heritage building which balances modern comforts with gracious living.
Descr: Raheem Residency in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: raheem residency, allapuzha, kerala, backwaters, hotel, special places

description:
A wonderful old heritage home on Kerala's backwaters with a very hospitable young host who believes passionately in preserving his family's traditions.

Emerald Isle offers an array of delights. Time can be spent watching the toddy tappers climbing the tall trees, walking among the paddy fields or along the river banks, or rowing through the narrow canals in a country boat.
WebWriteUp1:
A lovely backwater home with fish filled ponds, lily ponds, dozens of tropical plants and flowers and the peace that only a simple lifestyle can offer. 

There is a small, formal living room which is open to guests. There is a small reception area and lounge, and a simple dining tent (with mosquito netting) where excellent fixed Kerala meals are served at fixed timings. Fresh fruit from the gardens, such as bananas and papayas, is always on offer.

The rooms are all in the main wooden house, and are furnished with period pieces belonging to the family. The bathrooms are large and have wonderfully sunny outdoor showers. This homestay has currently only five rooms, but the owners are adding two extra ones soon.

The best part, however, is the host Vinod; the young, well educated son of the family. Nothing is too much trouble for the hospitable and helpful Vinod, who is ably assisted by Sam, a sort of man-Friday par excellence. Some evenings, Vinod arranges for folk singers to come and sing evocative songs, or even a short vocal recital in Carnatic music by a scholar friend.    

Guests are given a printout on arrival offering the following activities/excursions:

- Ayurvedic massages and herbal body treatments
- Free bicycles on hire (map provided, though I still got lost)
- Guided village walks
- Plantation walk (given to most pax on arrival) 
- Motor Boat trip through the backwaters 
- Canoe trip through nearby narrow canal 

Emerald Isle is an extremely attractive and well run place in a fabulous location and provides a comprehensive backwaters experience. Staying here you will truly feel a part of traditional Kerala family life.
Metatype: A wonderful old heritage home on Kerala's backwaters with a very hospitable young host who believes passionately in preserving his family's traditions.
Descr: Emerald Isle in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: emerald isle, allapuzha, heritage, homestay, kerala, backwaters, hotel

description:
At Akkarakalam Memoirs, a strip of lawn is all that separates you from the water. This beautiful bungalow is found amongst Kerala's backwaters,

It has rooms that are furnished to a very high standard of comfort and decorated with a pleasing mixture of period pieces and bright coloured fabrics. 

The location and the ambience of Akkarakalam Memoirs make it an excellent place to spend a few relaxing days in the backwaters
WebWriteUp1:
Akkarakalam Memoirs is situated in Kainakary village of Alleppey district. It is accessible by water and the homestay has its own motor boat.

Sprawled across 10 acres of land, Akkarakalam Memoirs is a grand structure that is over 150 years old.  All the rooms exude an old world charm with red oxide flooring, wooden furniture and walls, and porcelain fittings. Some rooms have outdoor showers, others have more conventional bathrooms.

Towards the rear of the house is a large bright dining hall that serves traditional Kerala cuisine and other coastal delights. In the back garden you will find a tall slender palm entwined by vanilla creepers. The lawn in the centre and the hammocks strung under the dappled palm shade make this a lovely area in which to relax.   

Facilities available at Akkarakalam Memoirs include Ayurveda massage and motorboat rides.

Please note that, although, classified as a home-stay, Akkarakalm has no host family in residence. There is however, a very capable manager, Deven.
Metatype: A beautiful bungalow amongst Kerala's backwaters, a strip of lawn is all that separates the house from the water.
Descr: Akkarakalam Memoirs in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: akkarakalam memoirs, allapuzha, kerala, backwaters, hotel, special places

description:
A newly built house on Kerala's backwaters which combines the best of Kerala architecture with modern touches.
 
Casa Del Fauno Boutique Homestay has gleaming stone floors, and white walls with well chosen and well placed  artifacts. The lounge has comfortably stuffed sofas on which to relax.
WebWriteUp1:
Casa del Fauno was created by the same Italian lady who built Shalimar Spice Garden in Thekkady. The location right on the water is fantastic and the house makes maximum use of the  views. Approached by water, you arrive at the private jetty, cross the lawns and walk through a open arrangement of stone columns before entering the Casa del Fauno. 

Apart from enjoying the views, guests can swim in the pool that overlooks the backwaters. The food is excellent - with a choice of Mediterranean and Kerala dishes - all prepared fresh from locally produced fruit and vegetables and freshly caught fish. 

In the evenings there are performances of Indian classical music or folk dances. 

This is a magical and stylish place.
Metatype: A newly built house on Kerala's backwaters which combines the best of Kerala architecture with modern touches.
Descr: Casa Del Fauno Boutique Backwater Homestay in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
organisation: Casa Del Fauno Boutique Backwater Homestay

description:
Another small gem from the Malabar House family of Kochi, Privacy sits on the banks of the vast Vembanad Lake. 

There are only two waterfront bungalows - one with just one air-conditioned suite and the other with two bedrooms. There is a lakeside swimming pool so that you can enjoy the views even while swimming.

Like with other Malabar House properties, this place too is furnished to a high level of comfort, with an emphasis on personal service.
WebWriteUp1:
Privacy at Sanctuary Bay has a secluded and tranquil setting right on the shore of Lake Vembanad. It is located opposite Kumarakom, 45 km drive from The Malabar House and 65 km from Cochin International Airport. It is accessible by car and boat and is the starting point of the backwater cruise.

Privacy has two distinct bungalows. The water front bungalow is an all air-conditioned suite with bedroom, dining and living areas, and two bathrooms. The heritage bungalow, a relocated ancient wooden cottage, has two individual bedrooms with attached bathrooms 

Both bungalows have private sit outs and verandahs overlooking Lake Vembanad. The swimming pool is located between the two.

The village outside is friendly and the staff can suggest walking routes. You can also take one of the mountain bikes available for a leisurely ride through the bewitching countryside of paddy fields, plantations and village roads.
Metatype: Another small gem from the Malabar House family of Kochi, Privacy sits on the banks of the vast Vembanad Lake.
Descr: Privacy at Sanctuary Bay in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: privacy at sanctuary bay, kerala, backwaters, luxury, hotel, malabar house

description:
An unpretentious homestay on a small island farm in the Kerala backwaters, Philip Kuttys Farm has lovely cottages with lakeside views.

You get a real feel for Keralan life here thanks to the Mathew family. All meals are included in the price and these feasts are invariably the high point of the day. Breakfast may be had in the privacy of your own cottage verandah.
WebWriteUp1:
This is a true working farm, which originally received guests on day visits to see the workings of a spice farm. The success of this allowed the owners to convert a few rooms to guest accommodation. 

The Farm is built on land reclaimed from Lake Vembanad by the grandfather of the current owner and, like all reclaimed land, is two metres below the lake level. This fascinating method of cultivation that has been perfected in the Kerala backwaters. The farm produces a mix of cononuts, bananas, pepper, cocoa and nutmeg. Guests can see toddy being tapped (and taste it too) and cocoa pods ripening. It's truly living with nature. 

The cottages are all in typical Kerala style with red tiled roofs, and white washed buildings with a red plinth. The rooms have plenty of windows and doors to let in much needed breezes and also to let in the fabulous farm views. Each has a sit-out or open area as well. 

Meals are served in a large open sided pavilion or in the main family dining room generally in the company of some family members.
Metatype: An unpretentious Keralan homestay on a small island farm in the Kerala backwaters. The antique-filled open-plan cottages have lakeside views and breakfast is served on the verandas.
Descr: Philip Kuttys Farm in Kumarakom - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: philip kutty's farm, homestay, kumarakom, kerala, backwaters, hotel
address:
Pallivathukal
Ambika Market P.O.
Vechoor
Kottayam District

description:
A wildlife lodge situated on the lush green banks of the river Periyar, adjoining the Thattekad Bird Sanctuary in Kerala.

The Periyar River Lodge is built of teak wood and offers spacious guestrooms with a large comfortable lounge. The sunlit verandahs present an unhindered view of the river and the forest beyond.

This is an ideal getaway for nature lovers and bird watchers.
WebWriteUp1:
The Periyar River Lodge is aesthetically built, with the 75-year-old basic structure in teakwood still in immaculate condition, and an added extension to this basic wooden structure to expand it into a traditional 'nalukettu'.

The architectural concept of a 'nalukettu,' of an open courtyard in the middle of the house with the four wings of the house built around this open courtyard, is a genre of ancient Hindu architecture in Kerala that was used to accommodate the erstwhile joint-families.

The Lodge has 2 bedrooms, with either a double bed or two single beds, and attached en suite bathroom with all modern amenities.

The bedrooms are completely made of wood with large windows overlooking the river. In keeping with this distinctive architecture, the bathrooms are open to the sky.

A spacious lounge separates the two bedrooms, with the open central courtyard beside it, and has a clear view of the Periyar River in front of the Lodge. 

Towards the rear of the 'nalukettu' is the dinning room and attached pantry. Surrounding the lodge is a large verandah where guests can relax on the traditional 'Charu Kasera' (leaning chair) or the comfortable swing, for an uninterrupted view of the Periyar River, backed by hills covered in luxuriant green forests.

The lodge has an in-house cook and an English-speaking caretaker who can help to organize treks into the bird sanctuary.
Metatype: A wildlife lodge situated on the lush green banks of the river Periyar, adjoining the Thattekad Bird Sanctuary in Kerala.
Descr: The Periyar River Lodge in Kothamangalam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: periyar river lodge, kothamangalam, salim ali, bird sanctuary, special places
address:
Anakkayam
Kuttampuzha P.O.
Near Thattekad Bird Sanctuary

description:
Mundackal is a grand bungalow built from exposed granite stone and with a red tiled roof. It has marble floors and five spacious simply furnished guestrooms.

Adjoining the house is a flower filled garden which leads a large farm of active rubber and cardamom plantations. 

The owners, Jose and Daisy, are wonderful hosts, and their homestay is a perfect base for visiting the nearby Salim Ali Bird Sanctuary.
WebWriteUp1:
The main attraction to the Mundackal Plantation Homestay is the larger than life personality of Jose - who is full of stories and anecdotes. His family has been in plantations for generations and he will tell you all about the processes such as rubber tapping as he takes you on a walk through it. 

Daisy, the lady of the house cooks feasts for each and every meal, and the delicious food is another highlight of a stay here. Mundackal homestay is just 12 kms from Thattekad's Salim Ali bird sanctuary. Jose can arrange for an excellent guide, Mr Girish, who actually lives inside the sanctuary. Girish is a wonderful guide who can place every bird call and knows the sanctuary as his backyard, which of course it is!
Metatype: Mundackal is a grand bungalow built from exposed granite stone and with a red tiled roof. It has marble floors and five spacious simply furnished guestrooms.
Descr: Mundackal Plantation Homestay in Kothamangalam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mundackal plantation retreat, homestay, kothamangalam, salim ali, bird park

description:
A charming, small cottage style resort with comfortably furnished, moderately priced rooms, Olive Brook has  rooms each of which has a private sit-out. 

The low bungalow with its red tin roof hugs the side of a hillock. There are verandahs from where one can look down on the hairpin bend in the road below, flanked by cardamom plantations.
WebWriteUp1:
There is a simple and genuine charm about Olive Brook. This affordable small inn is run by three youngsters, two of whom are brothers. They are anxious to please and will go out of their way to be helpful. 

Olive Brook offers cookery classes and mountain bikes for guests to hire for the day. This is a great way to explore the tea-lined roads of Munnar.

There are well tended flower beds ablaze with colours in front of the resort while immediately above, the slopes are covered by tea and cardamom.
Metatype: A charming, small cottage style resort with comfortably furnished, moderately priced rooms. Each of the six rooms has a private sit-out.
Descr: Olive Brook in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: olive brook, hotel, munnar, kerala, tea plantations, special places

description:
Rose Garden is a working plants nursery and is a passion of its owner, Mr Joseph Tomy and his wife, Rajee. There are only two guest rooms in Rose Garden - simple but adequate, with attached bathroom. 

Living at Rose Garden is being immersed in the world of flowers and plants. The verandah outside is draped with an orange flowering vine. The nursery area is all around the house and nature treks are possible nearby.
WebWriteUp1:
Rose Garden is an ideal place for those who love flowers and plants of any kind.

Joseph Tomy is justly proud of his flowers - anthuriums with many swathes in many colours, pink, red to deep purple, hibiscus, and of course roses from tiny ones to great cabbage sized ones. His favourites are the papyrus plants which rise up in feathery bracts. 

Joseph is extremely knowledgeable about the flora and will gladly share his knowledge with interested guests. 

Joseph also accompanies guests on treks to a nearby water fall and natural pools where guests can swim. He can also arrange visits to tea-growing farms and processing units. 

Meals are served with the small family in their own dining area and are freshly cooked by Rajee.
Metatype: Rose Garden is a working plants nursery and is a passion of its owner, Mr Joseph Tomy and his wife, Rajee. There are only two guest rooms in Rose Garden - simple but adequate, with attached bathroom.
Descr: Rose Gardens Homestay in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A 3 km long road winds through beautiful tea estates to the camp at Nature Zone. The views that greet you are truly awe-inspiring, overlooking Munnar, valleys, lakes and high mountain ranges beyond.

Around a dozen tents are pitched on the slopes, all enjoying these stupendous views. In addition, there are a few tree houses, each with a balcony hanging in the tree canopy from where you can enjoy the views.
WebWriteUp1:
The tents at Nature Zone are comfortably furnished with double beds made with cheerful duvets (yes, the nights can be very cold) and attached bathrooms with modern fixtures. 

Tall Eucalyptus trees provide shade on one side while hardy shrubbery covers the high mountains. Located in thickets of old jungle trees, the tree houses are the ultimate in seclusion. Simply furnished to resemble wooden chalets, they each have a balcony hanging in the tree canopy from where you can enjoy the views. 

Meals are served in a wooden pavilion, while barbeques and campfires take place in a clearing overlooking the valley.
Metatype: A 3 km long road winds through beautiful tea estates to the camp at Nature Zone.
Descr: Nature Zone in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nature zone, tents, munnar, kerala, tea plantations, tree houses, special places

description:
This is a small stylish homestay with excellent views of the Kanan Devan hills, famous for their tea production. 

The three guest rooms are in cottages - pleasingly low buildings in colonial style with a lovely verandah with a roof supported by bamboos. The views are fabulous from here. Inside, the rooms have high ceilings with wooden rafters. The rooms are spacious and open out onto the verandah and the views beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
This is a small stylish homestay with excellent views of the Kanan Devan hills, famous for their tea production. 

The three guest rooms are in cottages - pleasingly low buildings in colonial style with a lovely verandah with a roof supported by bamboos. The views are fabulous from here. Inside, the rooms are high ceilinged with wooden rafters. The rooms are spacious and open out onto the verandah and the views beyond.
Metatype: This is a small stylish homestay with excellent views of the Kanan Devan hills, famous for their tea production.
Descr: Casa Del Fauno Boutique Homestay on the Hills in Munnar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: casa del fauna, munnar, kerala, boutique, homestays, hills, special places
organisation: Casa Del Fauno Boutique Homestay on the Hills

description:
This is an excellent value for money bed & breakfast place - run by a friendly and knowledgeable young team. Wildernest has ten very spacious and well appointed rooms in simple stone and exposed brick structures. 

There is a choice of terraced rooms with spacious, open sit-outs and garden rooms that have an intimate little garden that offers total privacy and seclusion.
WebWriteUp1:
A small resort with a difference, Wildernest is accessed from the road that leads to the Periyar sanctuary gates just a short distance away. 

This buildings were constructed using the local river stones and is quite modern. A cozy coffee and pastry shop is next to the small reception. Breakfast is served here, as well as snacks later in the day. 

The rooms are located in two low buildings set on crescent shaped lawns. The rooms are large and comfortably furnished in pine wood. The bathrooms too are well appointed. The ground floor rooms have sit-outs with their own tiny path of garden and the upstairs rooms have private terraces reached via an internal staircase. 

Across the road, the trees of the sanctuary can be seen. Morning and evening brings a chorus of birdsong.
Metatype: This is an excellent value for money bed & breakfast place - run by a friendly and knowledgeable young team. Wildernest has ten very spacious and well appointed rooms in simple stone and exposed brick structures.
Descr: The Wildernest in Thekkady - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the wildernest, hotel, thekkady, periyar wildlife sanctuary, kerala, special places

description:
Just outside the bustling town of Kumily, Pepper County Homestay is a suavely modern and immaculate house with a sense of rural seclusion. 

Pepper County is spread across 7 acres of lush green landscape comprising spice plants and fruit trees. It is owned by Mr. Cyriac and his wife Dolly. 

From the house there are spectacular views across the hills and plantations. Mr. Cyriac is happy to show guests around the plantation to point out the different types of vegetation.
WebWriteUp1:
A little distance away from the main Thekkady/Kumily area, on a bluff overlooking the hills and green valleys, is Pepper County. A broad driveway leads up to a stone bungalow with sloping roof. It is a modern building, pleasing and bright. 

The rooms are all bright with windows overlooking the front or the back garden. There is an attached dressing area, which leads on to the attached bathroom, also spotlessly clean.

Mr. Cyriac and his wife Dolly are wonderful hosts. Like many homestay owners, the motive behind opening their home to guests was to have company after the children had moved out to work elsewhere. Mr. Cyriac has been involved in agriculture and plantations all his life and will gladly share his knowledge with guests. Dolly is a renowned cook and the guests can join her to prepare traditional meals in the kitchen. 

This warm and genuine welcome, coupled with the clean rooms and great views, makes Pepper County a very special place.
Metatype: Just outside the bustling town of Kumily, Pepper County Homestay is a suavely modern and immaculate house with a sense of rural seclusion.
Descr: Pepper County in Thekkady - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: pepper county, homestay, thekkady, periyar wildlife sanctuary, kerala

description:
Paradisa Plantation Retreat is a small boutique hotel, in a fantastic hillside location, an hour's drive from Thekkady. Each guest room is a transplanted old Kerala wooden house, painstakingly relocated so as to enjoy the best of the panoramic views. 

Each room has a verandah for relaxing on long lazy chairs and/or day beds with comfortable cushions. Located on a small plateau enjoying the view of the mountains across the steep valley is a pool with a stunning view.
WebWriteUp1:
You leave behind the main road from Kottayam to Thekkay, and climb up a steeply ascending track, passing coffee and cardamom plantations before ending at a traditional Kerala gateway. Even from here, all you can see are rough hewn granite columns and a thatched roof. Ahead is a magnificent expanse of thickly forested mountain ranges. This is a dream of a location.

The largest building here is a modest thatched building with flagged stone flooring and simple cane furniture. The luxury is in the views that spread across the many mountains and the thickness of the canopy of the old trees. 

The guest rooms are on various levels of the property. Each room is a transplanted old Kerala wooden house, painstakingly relocated so as to enjoy the best of the panoramic views. Each room has a verandah for relaxing on long lazy chairs and/or day beds with comfortable cushions.  

The rooms themselves have colourful rugs and cushions in bright colours that contrast with the somber tones of the old wood walls. Mosquito nets drape the beds.The bathrooms are large and many have original features such as massive rocks jutting out of walls. 

Located on a small plateau enjoying the view of the mountains across the steep valley is a stunning pool, possibly one of the most dramatically situated pools to be foun in India.. 

Paradisa is aimed at those who desire the seclusion and serenity that only a mountain retreat can offer. Nearby is a famous Ayurvedic hospital which offers long term treatments. Many women guests of Paradisa are treated by the doctors of the hospital while they stay at the Retreat. For the regular traveler though, simply being here surrounded by nature is a therapy in itself.
Metatype: Paradisa Plantation Retreat is a small boutique hotel, in a fantastic hillside location, an hour's drive from Thekkady. Each guest room is a transplanted old Kerala wooden house, painstakingly relocated so as to enjoy the best of the panoramic views.
Descr: Paradisa Plantation Retreat in Murinjapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: paradisa plantation retreat, murinjapuzha, kerala, heritage bungalows, periyar

description:
This handsome grand planter's home is now a very chic retreat belonging to the Malabar House family. Like all their other properties, Serenity combines a great home in a wonderful location, with a distinctive sense of style.

The old building makes a surprisingly grand background for the eclectic art collection, and the bold colours bring out the strong architectural features. Outside, in the sunlit garden, is a pool surrounded by trees and flowering bushes.
WebWriteUp1:
A bullock cart parked right under the regal porch invites you in. Aqua green walls are adorned with original old black and white photographs from old south Indian movies. The house has many verandahs, a courtyard, and rooms on two levels. The lounge has a handful of art objects, each carefully placed against a colourful background to bring out their most attractive features. In a corner stands an old gramophone with a stack of western music dating back to the 1940's and 1950's in their original record sleeves.

Almost all rooms have four poster beds piled high with silk cushions. Each room also has a restrained display of masks and wooden carved figures. Despite the presence of some rare pieces of art, the rooms have a homely simplicity which is endearing. 

Outside, in the sunlit garden is a pool surrounded by trees and flowering bushes. There is a small deck with chairs and a couple of wooden tables set up in picnic style under wooden umbrellas. The garden has several majestic trees spreading large shadows. The cardamom plantation starts from the fringes of this garden. There are cycles that guests can use, with route maps of the surrounding countryside provided. 

Here you have the chance of spending a day out with the plantation's own elephant! You ride along narrow village roads and plantation roads, towards her favourite water hole. Once in the water, you can help bathe the elephant - be prepared for a playful spray of water from her capacious trunk!
Metatype: This handsome grand planter's home is now a very chic retreat belonging to the Malabar House family. Like all their other properties, Serenity combines a great home in a wonderful location, with a distinctive sense of style.
Descr: Serenity at Kanam Estate in Vazhoor - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: serenity at kalam estate, vazhoor, kerala, malabar house, hotel, special places

description:
Vanilla County is a colonial bungalow with sloping roofs and belongs to the very warm couple Rani and Baby Mathew. They provide a wonderful homestay right in the centre of a working plantation of vanilla, coffee and rubber. Rani is a gifted cook and the meals conjured up by her in her immaculate kitchen are a delight.

During your stay you can tour the spice plantation, hike through the rubber plantation to lovely rock pools in the river for swimming, drive to nearby peaks for sunset views, and visit to a Christian Ashram in the nearby village of Vagamon.
WebWriteUp1:
The house is simple and spotlessly clean. The lack of sophistication is endearing. The rooms have cement floors, the furniture is wooden and often, gnarled woody branches of coffee plants have been used to make side-tables, lamp shades and cot stands. 

The drives to and from Teekoy are very scenic, and the surrounding area is hugely attractive, being one of the very few parts of Kerala which is totally uncommercialised. 

The main house has a verandah, a lounge, a dining room with an open air terrace, and an upstairs sitting area.  There are 4 rooms in the main house, 2 of these are large enough for families. There are also 2 connecting rooms in a bungalow by the entrance. There are 4 tents with attached bathrooms, but these are usually only used to accommodate drivers. 

The thousand odd acres surrounding the home are a treasure trove of plants and trees. Here you can see all stages of rubber processing; from catching the milky sap in coconut halves, to the boiling it and finally the sheets being pressed by hand in an old fashioned press.

Being a working plantation, you may even find elephants at work during your stay, felling or uprooting trees and transporting massive logs. The elephant handler, a mahout, has a very close relationship and the understanding that exists between man and the elephant is really rewarding to watch. You may also be able to accompany the elephant as he goes for his river bath - an unforgettable experience. 

Besides the plantation visits, there are also treks in the nearby  mountains ending up with a dip in one of the many scenic rock pools amongst huge boulders, enormously more appealing than a simple dip in a swimming pool!
Metatype: Vanilla County is is a colonial bungalow with sloping roofs and belongs to the very warm couple Rani and Baby Mathew. They provide a wonderful homestay right in the centre of a working plantation of vanilla, coffee and rubber.
Descr: Vanilla County in Teekoy - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: vanilla county, homestay, bungalow, teekoy, hills, plantation, kerala

description:
Villa Jacaranda is set in a tranquil and green part of Varkala called South Cliff. It is a newly-built house, modern in design with some traditional touches. 

There are four large and comfortable rooms for guests. At ground level is the garden with a lily pond and fragrant subtropical plants. 

The beach is a five minute walk away - as is the ancient Hindu temple of Janardhana, which is open to non-Hindus.
WebWriteUp1:
At the end of a small road leading down to the Varkala beach, is Villa Jacaranda - easy to miss behind the flowering bougainvillea. The entrance to the cottage is through the kitchen. Inside, is a living room that opens out onto a verandah and the flower filled garden. The walls of the living room display beautiful photos of some of the flowers, indicating that you are in the home of a photographer! 

Ajay Oza used to be a fashion photographer and the Villa is full of his work. Of the four rooms, one is on the ground level and three are upstairs. Each room has a private verandah and the topmost room has a large terrace. All overlook the ocean through the palms. 

Each room is decorated in pleasing colours; pastels as well as warm earth tones. The rooms are simple, but have a great sense of style and the entire place is spotlessly clean. There are potted plants everywhere and the garden is full of many well tended plants. Upstairs is a long verandah with a soothing blue balustrade. Here and there, you will find interesting artifacts displayed with great panache. 

Villa Jacaranda is the perfect place for those who appreciate quiet walks on the beach and a living environment which is full of delightful things. The presence of a well traveled host adds another dimension to this charming homestay.
Metatype: Villa Jacaranda is set in a tranquil and green part of Varkala called South Cliff. It is a newly-built house, modern in design with some traditional touches.
Descr: Villa Jacaranda in Varkala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Olappamanna Mana, in a 20-acre eco-friendly atmosphere, is an interesting place for travellers who want something out of the ordinary.

It is perfect for those who want to explore the Kerala countryside and the way of life there, for those who want to know more about the cultural heritage of the State, and for those who want to learn the nuances of Kathakali as performing art form. 

Olappamanna Mana is for those on the look out for a real heritage home-stay as different from star hotel. accommodation. 

Olappamanna Mana is also for those who want to savor the nuances of wholesome, delectable vegetarian cuisine, as only the traditional Namboothiri household can deliver .
WebWriteUp1:
This household has been the home for a Namboothiri Brahmins, and has been built and added to over last 300 years!  

Strictly speaking the Mana Complex cannot be called a home, it is rather an institution with many people staying there, in addition to the owners, with specific duties for each one. There were arrangements for food and stay for students and teachers of  Kathakali, music, Vedas and Sanskrit in the Mana.

Pure Vegetarian Home made Kerala Style food is served with an emphasis on fresh fruit. Hygiene is taken very seriously with the water being served is filtered, boiled and cooled or mineral water. The cooking utensils are washed in purified water and the food is served on freshly cut banana leaves in the Kerala style.

The rooms are simple but clean and guests can wander around in the entire Mana complex. Footwear is to be taken out at the main gate according to the tradition. Please also remember that no alcohol or smoking is permitted anywhere in the Mana.
Metatype: Olappamanna Mana, in a 20-acre eco-friendly atmosphere, is an interesting place for travellers who want something out of the ordinary.
Descr: The Olappamanna Mana in Palakkad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
