description:
Deep in the heart of India's southernmost state is a region once made famous by the Chettiars, the merchants who traded silks, salt, teak and spices across the south-east of Asia, and were respected equally for their wealth and their cultural and philanthropic interests.

The beautifully polished traditional red terracotta floors are a highlight of the mansion, as is the handcrafted teak wood furniture. The ceilings are lofty and the spaces uncluttered. The overall feel is definitely one of a home rather than a hotel, something reinforced by the warm and attentive service of the staff.
WebWriteUp1:
Visalam offers you to chance to stay in one of the many delightful mansions the Chettiar community built, this one being of particular interest as it formed part of a dowry of a girl called Visalakshi and only ever used for the occasional family celebration.

Unusual, not only for the fact that this is one of the rare Chettiar mansions built for a daughter, the house is also one that effortlessly combines the undeniable elegance of the Chettinad architecture with the luxuries of a modern travel.

A lovely pool and a restaurant serving delicious regional food complete Visala's attractions. Outside the hotel, of course, there is a lot to see, with more Chettinad mansions in varying conditions just a stroll away as well as temples and local village life to explore.
Descr: Visalam in Karaikudi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Aranyakam is a homestay in a coffee plantation. Overlooking hills to one side and a lush green forest on the other, the location could not be better than this. 

The guest rooms include traditional tribal huts with modern facilities, deluxe rooms and suites in a double storied heritage bungalow. The rooms have fantastic views and verandahs from which to enjoy them.
WebWriteUp1:
Aranyakam offers a quintessential experience of the Wayanad district of Kerala. It is situated inside a plantation, with the Nilgiri Hills on one side and the Nilambur Forest on the other. 

Rooms are either in independent huts equipped with all modern amenities, or in a Heritage Bunglow and blend perfectly with the natural environment.

The dining hall serves traditional Kerala delicacies. The host is an enthusiastic and warm person who delights in introducing guests to the local way of life. His knowledge and company is one of the highlights of a stay here.
Metatype: This is a homestay in a coffee plantation. The location is superb; overlooking hills to one side and a lush green forest on the other.
Descr: Aranyakam in Meppadi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: aranyakam, meppadi, wayanad, kerala, plantation bungalow, special places

description:
Enjoying an ideal location amidst three mist shroud hills, Rain Country Resort consists of 8 beautiful cottages built in the traditional style of Kerala architecture. 

The rooms are clean and tastefully furnished, and each has a verandah from which to relax and enjoy the views. Rain Country Resort is a perfect base for pleasant walks through the surrounding countryside.
WebWriteUp1:
Rain Country Resorts is located on an especially pretty piece of land, in a valley created by three mist shrouded hills. 

There are only a handful of cottages on this large piece of land. There are attractive natural lakes inside the 20 acre plot. There is also a natural spring which provides a soothing sound as it tumbles over the rocks..

The guest rooms are all in Kerala style wooden houses: some standing alone, others together under one large roof. Each cottage has its own sit-out with great views. Most rooms have outdoor bathrooms. 

The restaurant, in addition to Kerala food, also caters for more varied tastes, offering some Chinese and Continental dishes. 

There are great trekking options in the nearby hills, and the resort can arrange for a guide. Wayanad has many waterfalls and tree studded hills and the Rain Forest Resort provides a good base to explore them.
Metatype: Enjoying an ideal location amidst three mist shroud hills, Rain Country Resort consists of 8 beautiful cottages built in the traditional style of Kerala architecture.
Descr: Rain Country Resorts in Lakkidi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A beautiful home stay overlooking the sea, Ayisha Manzil has loads of old world charm. It is also famous for cookery classes where you can learn the rich Mappila cuisine of coastal Malabari Muslims.

The spacious two storey home was built in 1862 and was bought by the illustrious Moosa family of planters

The grand house is colonial in style and has much of the original furniture including large four poster beds, writing desks and mirrors.
WebWriteUp1:
The Moosa family truly enjoys having guests in their house, and are eager to show their guests the best that north Kerala has to offer. Knowledgeable and articulate, Mr Moosa is full of suggestions for excursions to the local markets and attractions. Mrs Moosa is a great cook and specializes in the rich Mappila cuisine of coastal Malabari Muslims. Her cookery classes are a true delight.
 
With its palm shaded terrace overlooking the sea, the swimming pool and the hospitable family, Ayisha Manzil is a great treat.
Metatype: A beautiful home stay overlooking the sea, Ayisha Manzil has loads of old world charm. It is also famous for cookery classes where you can learn the rich Mappila cuisine of coastal Malabari Muslims.
Descr: Ayisha Manzil in Tellicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ayisha manzil, homestay, bungalow, beach, tellicherry, kerala, cooking classes

description:
One of the most tranquil and relaxing things you can do in India is to cruise through the backwaters in a Kerala houseboat, known as a kettuvallam.

There is a larger open sitting area where you can relax and watch the world go by, sipping from a tender coconut and enjoying the sheer peace of the surroundings.

Freshly cooked Indian food and chilled beer make the experience even more enjoyable.
WebWriteUp1:
One of India's most beautiful landscapes, the Kerala backwaters are a vast interconnected network of picturesque canals, rivers, lagoons and lakes. 

An important transportation network for the fishing, spice and rice industries, the backwaters are also home to large communities of villages whose lives revolve around the waters, and exploring them is a highlight of a visit to this most attractive of Indian states.

One of the most tranquil and relaxing things you can do in India is to cruise through the backwaters in a Kerala houseboat, known as a kettuvallam.

The houseboats are very comfortable, and come complete with well furnished air-conditioned bedroom, bathroom, deck, driver, and personal chef. There is a larger open sitting area where you can relax and watch the world go by, sipping from a tender coconut and enjoying the sheer peace of the surroundings. 

We usually arrange a deluxe air conditioned houseboat for two but large family sized houseboats, with multiple bedrooms and living rooms, are also available.

An overnight trip includes a serene night's stay on the water. The houseboats then return to land after a leisurely breakfast the next day.
Metatype: One of the most tranquil and relaxing things you can do in India is to cruise through the backwaters in a Kerala houseboat, known as a kettuvallam..
Descr: Kettuvallam (Houseboat) in Allapuzha - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: houseboat, kettuvallam, cruise, kerala, backwaters, hotel, special places

description:
Ivy Suites offers a chance to stay with a modern Indian family in a white, ivy covered villa situated in quiet seclusion in an upmarket residential area of Bhopal. 

This home stay promises comfort, a warm and inviting atmosphere and interesting conversation with the hosts, the Sharmas.

With their easy welcoming manner and infectious enthusiasm for their city, it's easy to understand why the Sharmas opened their large home to guests.
WebWriteUp1:
The bedrooms are large and quietly and tastefully furnished in Indian prints and with warm wooden furniture that makes you feel immediately at home. The bathrooms are well appointed and clean. You may find that the many paintings and artwork on the walls are the work of the owners' daughter, or of one of their long term guests. 

The large, open living room overlooks the larger of Bhopal's 2 lakes, a view which at especially attractive at night, when the twinkling lights of the city are reflected in the water. This comfortable living room, dotted with potted plants, a fish tank and candles, is the focal point of the house and guests are welcome here  There are also separate common areas on the other floors, each with a distinctive decor. 

But perhaps the most enjoyable aspect of a stay in the Ivy Suites is the hosts themselves. Aside from offering information and advice about Bhopal and its sites, Mrs. Sharma will happily discuss Indian cuisine, and Mr. Sharma is a mine of information on tiger conservation in India, an issue which he has been studying for more than 20 years.
Metatype: Ivy Suites offers a chance to stay with a modern Indian family in a white, ivy covered villa situated in quiet seclusion in an upmarket residential area of Bhopal.
Descr: Ivy Suites in Bhopal - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ivy suites, bhopal, hotel, homestay, special places, madhya pradesh

description:
This homestay offers an enchanting little haven away from Indore's commercial activity. 

Set back from the main road, a vibrant green garden leads to the serene white home of the Dubey's. The rooms are tastefully decorated with white washed rough brick walls and warm Indian prints.
WebWriteUp1:
Rashid Kothi offers only two guest rooms, but they are designed to make guests feel at home, with flowers and carefully hand picked amenities. Guests often become close friends of the Dubey family, and they have several repeat visitors. 
  
Over home-prepared vegetarian meals with this old Indore family you will have the opportunity to hear about local history through their personal anecdotes and experiences.
Metatype: This homestay offers an enchanting little haven away from Indore's commercial activity.
Descr: Rashid Kothi in Indore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rashid kothi, homestay, hotel, indore, maheshwar, madhya  pradesh

description:
Selected as one of the world's 101 best hotels by TATLER, the Ahilya Fort belonging to the Holkar dynasty of Indore, is a charming example of 18th century Maratha architecture. 

Broad dark wood beams, cool secluded rooms and sweet smelling creepers welcome you and the wide views over the Narmada River and temples encourage you to linger. All meals are prepared using home grown organic vegetables.
WebWriteUp1:
While Ahilya Fort's accommodation consists of comfortable rooms each with their own individual charms, they do all share fascinating period furniture, roughly hewn floors, and muted furnishings. Unlike many other royal residences, the Ahilya Fort's attraction lies not in gilt and grandeur but rather in its warm and inviting air. The hotel has a multitude of lounging spots created by refreshing white walls and broad verandahs encircling pocket handkerchief sized courtyards, and a swimming pool in the shadows of the fort's ramparts. 

There are breathtaking views over the vast expanse of the Narmada River and the temples and ghats that grace its banks.

The hotel offers accommodation on a full board basis, which includes all meals prepared using home grown organic vegetables, drinks, and a boat trip on the holy Narmada river in a centuries-old sailing craft.
Metatype: Selected as one of the world's 101 best hotels by TATLER, the Ahilya fort belonging to the Holkar dynasty of Indore, is a charming example of 18th century Maratha architecture.
Descr: Ahilya Fort in Maheshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ahilya fort, maheshwar, narmada river, temples, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Amla Fort is 45 km from Ujjain. It belongs to a family which can trace its lineage back to a legendary ruler of the 8th century. A bumpy cattle track leads to the gates beyond which looms the white facade of the fort. 

The only modern touches anywhere in this sprawling building of wide sweeping arches and open courtyards are the fan which spins lazily above your comfortable bed and the water heater in the bathroom.
WebWriteUp1:
Large, light, airy rooms are furnished in beautifully restored dark wood, the beds often bearing paintings or tiles in panels and walls adorned by filigreed mirrors, all of which have been in the family for generations.

Justly proud of their heritage, the Singh family is always happy to share stories of their family's history and offer you advice about local sightseeing.
Metatype: Amla Fort is 45 km from Ujjain. It belongs to a family which can trace its lineage back to a legendary ruler of the 8th century. A bumpy cattle track leads to the gates beyond which looms the white facade of the fort.
Descr: Fort Amla in Amla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fort amla, village, india, hotel, ujjain, special places, madhya pradesh

description:
Mandu's best accommodation offering, the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Department's Malwa Resort has well kept lawns, stand alone cottages and clean rooms. 

While it may not have the best atmosphere to enjoy the surroundings, your stay here is certain to be comfortable, with good food and excellent views. 

The hotel is set against the backdrop of a water tank belonging to old Mandu and is just a 5 minute walk from the Sagar Talao group of monuments.
WebWriteUp1:
Mandu's best accommodation offering, the Madhya Pradesh's tourism department's hotel in Mandu is typical of their hotels with well kept lawns, stand alone cottages and clean rooms. 

While the atmosphere in the hotel isn't the best, you can be sure to have a comfortable stay with  good food and excellent views of the nearby sites. The hotel is set against the backdrop of a water tank belonging to old Mandu and is just a 5 minute walk from the Sagar Talao group of monuments.
Metatype: Mandu's best accommodation offering, the Madhya Pradesh's tourism department's hotel in Mandu is typical of their hotels with well kept lawns, stand alone cottages and clean rooms.
Descr: MPTDC Malwa Resort in Mandu - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mptdc malwa resort, mandu, hotel, special places, madhya pradesh

description:
Perched on a hilltop with uninterrupted views of the colourful temples and boats below it is the Madhya Pradesh tourism department's Narmada Resort. 

A simple budget hotel, the Narmada Resort nevertheless offers the best accommodation in the small town of Omkareshwar, with clean and comfortable rooms.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are well sized and let in copious amounts of sunlight from the attached balconies, 

From the dining room one can enjoy great views over the river. Being a pilgrimage town for Hindus, there is no alcohol or meat available anywhere in Omkareshwar. But do try the hotel's khichadi - a simple yet delicious mixture of dhal and rice.
Metatype: Perched on a hilltop with uninterrupted views of the colourful temples and boats below it is the Madhya Pradesh tourism department's Narmada Resort hotel.
Descr: MPTDC Narmada Resort in Omkareshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mptdc narmada resort, omkareshwar, temples, river, madhya pradesh

description:
The Madhya Pradesh tourism department's hotel in Ujjain offers simple yet clean and comfortable accommodation. 

The hotel is well located, situated within an easy distance of the main sights and the ghats or steps leading down to the holy Shipra River which forms the centre of religious and social life of people in Ujjain. 

It is on these ghats that people come to at the start and end of every day to bathe, wash clothes and to perform the sacred rites offering obeisance to the river.
WebWriteUp1: There is a central courtyard where one may enjoy the evening cup of chai. The hotel has a bar and a multi-cuisine restaurant and the staff is friendly and helpful.
Metatype: The Madhya Pradesh tourism department's hotel in Ujjain offers simple yet clean and comfortable accommodation.
Descr: MPTDC Shipra Residency in Ujjain - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Belonging to the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation, the Narmada Retreat is a series of cottages and luxury tents situated on a high bank of the serene Narmada River. 

While the hotel and its decor are simple, you are assured of clean, sunny, well appointed rooms, helpful staff and easy access to the sites either by car or boat.
WebWriteUp1:
Set among well kept lawns are a number of cottages, spaced well apart from each other to ensure privacy. Each cottage also has a pleasant sit out from which to enjoy the peaceful surroundings.

The resort also offers air conditioned tents perched on a bank high above the river with panoramic views of the river valley beneath.
Metatype: Belonging to the Madhya Pradesh Tourism Development Corporation, the Narmada resort is a series of cottages and luxury tents situated on a high bank of the serene Narmada River.
Descr: MPTDC Narmada Retreat in Maheshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mptdc narmada retreat, maheshwar, river temples, madhya pradesh

Descr: MPTDC Kiplings Court in Pench - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Laboo's Cafe is an enchanting little four roomed guesthouse ensconced within the ramparts of the 16th century Ahilya Fort. 

A hotel as whimsical and unpretentious as its name, the "cafe" offers rooms that are   simply yet tastefully decorated with rough white walls, furnishings in pastel shades, and large beds. 

Relax in the courtyard while you sample the eclectic menu of local fare and continental favourites such as rosti offered by Laboo's Cafe.
WebWriteUp1: Laboo's Caf� has rooms that are simply yet tastefully decorated. While they are not air conditioned, the meter thick walls of the fort help to lower the temperature and the upper rooms capture the cool breeze. The bathrooms are functional, well appointed and clean.
Metatype: Laboo's Cafe is an enchanting little four roomed guesthouse ensconced within the ramparts of the 16th century Ahilya fort.
Descr: Laboos Cafe in Maheshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: laboo's caf�, maheshwar, ahilya fort, hotel, madhya pradesh

description:
Panchavatti is a small luxury home stay (or a tiny boutique hotel), tucked away on a hilltop overlooking one of Mandovi river's tributaries. Having said that, Panchavatti is still just twenty minutes drive away to the nearest beach! 

Panchavatti's gardens that cover the slope to the river are planted with trees that are home to many birds. Down near the river, small perches invite guests to sit by and enjoy the beauty of the river and the mangroves.
WebWriteUp1:
Panchavatti is the brain child of Isla Polack, a Belgian lady who has a long relation with India. The house is like a grand country mansion built around an open to sky courtyard in the centre. However, the true heart of the place is the enormous verandah that runs the length of the house overlooking the river. With comfortable chairs and loungers, this is the perfect place for watching the sun rise or the moon light on the river. 

The 6 rooms are large and done lovingly in warm colours. There is a bit of Rajasthan in the d�cor, however the overall feel is very much Goan. There is a good sized pool a little down from the verandah and offers great views of the river from the deck. 

The food served is home made, mainly in Goan style, with an emphasis on fresh produce. There is also a western menu, which is equally well prepared. The staff is warm and welcoming, truly as if you are at home. 

Panchavatti is the perfect place for recovering from your travel weariness or simply as a retreat when you get your batteries recharged in its wondrous atmosphere.
Metatype: Panchavatti is a small luxury home stay (or a tiny boutique hotel), tucked away on a hilltop overlooking one of Mandovi river's tributaries. Having said that, Panchavatti is still just twenty minutes drive away to the nearest beach!
Descr: Panchavatti in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A charming heritage hotel with lots of character, located amongst the winding alleys of Fountainhas, the Latin quarter of Panjim.

The light filled rooms are endowed with furniture worthy of any museum. The restaurant serves perennial Goan and Continental favourites. 

There are many sun drenched balconies and shady courtyards for relaxation.
WebWriteUp1:
Within Goa's busy capital Panjim, is the colourful time bubble that is the Latin Quarter - Fontainhas, with houses in cyan, mango, mauve and earthy red. 

The Sukhija family has converted three of these, including one that has belonged in their family for 5 generations, into a guesthouse in an effort to preserve their heritage. Panjim Inn offers a variety of rooms housed in the separate converted homes which are in close proximity to each other. 

The Panjim Inn houses the mid range rooms, while the smaller but equally lovely economic rooms are found in the Panjim Pousada, a stone's throw away from the main building. The extra large luxury rooms with elaborately carved beds are in the Panjim People's, a converted school.

While the rooms differ in size and have varying degrees of luxury according to their categories, they are all immensely comfortable and carefully furnished. Large beds with Indian prints dominate the room and are complemented by rosewood cupboards, marble topped tables and interesting bottles for lampshades. You will find that the glass in the windows is often beveled and the bathrooms are imaginatively done up with mosaic designs in tile using natural motifs.

The many sun drenched balconies and shady courtyards are ideal places to relax into the Goan laidback susegade lifestyle.
Metatype: A charming heritage hotel with lots of character, located amongst the winding alleys of Fountainhas, the Latin quarter of Panjim.
Descr: Panjim Inn in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: panjim inn, goa, heritage hotel, latin quarter, guesthouse, fontainhas, panaji

description:
Marbella is a  lovely guesthouse located in Sinquerim village, close to the Taj Fort Aguada.

This charming hotel houses 3 very stylish suites and 3 spacious rooms. Both suites and rooms have en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning, and televisions. 

The elegant dining areas are the perfect place for a romantic or social meal. The menu at the Marbella  includes a wide variety of western and Indian delicacies.
WebWriteUp1:
The Marbella Guesthouse is a celebration of old Goan warmth and comfort. Although the house itself is not very old, all effort has been made to use architectural and design elements used in centuries past. The result is superbly authentic; ubiquitous protective lions at the gate posts, a charming circular portico, lacy fretwork and patterned floor tiles. But in the bedrooms these classic Goan Portuguese motifs are tempered by the necessity of modern comforts and the use of elements from the rest of India.

The first thing you will notice about the rooms is a feeling of open space. The bedrooms and indeed even the bathrooms are much larger and airier than most. Then there is the use of light pastel greens and pinks and fresh whites in the colour schemes for the rooms. 

Each bedroom has a distinct personality and has been named accordingly; the Garden Room with extensive views over the gardens, the Rajasthani Suite with a heavily carved Rajasthani wooden panel for the headboard. etc.

The Marbella Guesthouse also boasts of a Beauty Room where you will find a beautician, a massage therapist and a Toni and Guy hair stylist at your disposal.

The guesthouse is not suitable for children under the age of 12.
Metatype: A lovely guesthouse located in Sinquerim village, close to the Taj Fort Aguada.
Descr: Marbella Guesthouse in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Dwarka is a very laid back place - perfect for a few days of getting close to playing Robinson Crusoe. 

This small resort with just a dozen cottages offers basic but stylish accommodation. The rooms have twin/double beds, bedside tables, and a small sit-out to enjoy the breathtaking views. 

The gathering area, the restaurant, is a thatched shack overlooking the impossibly lovely sandy beach, a wonderful lagoon, and a veritable thick canopy of mature palm trees.
WebWriteUp1:
A rough road of about 3 kms over a rock strewn plateau finally ends and you see a quiet ribbon of water flanked by palm trees. As you cross a charming bamboo bridge, you see on your right that the small stream meets the blue blue sea past a sand bank. Along both sides of the stream are thatched huts. This is Dwarka. 

Photographer Clemente with partner Arlene, have come up with the ultimate in `Blue Lagoon' style living. The small resort with just a dozen cottages offers basic but stylish accommodation. The rooms have twin/double beds, bedside tables, and a small sit-out to enjoy the breathtaking views. The toilets are charming; with showers, washbasins and toilets. The cottages are placed on different levels, giving each one privacy and undisturbed views. Hammocks strung along the coconut trees invite you to read, dream or simply snooze. 

The gathering area, the restaurant, is a thatched shack overlooking the impossibly lovely sandy beach and a veritable thick canopy of mature palm trees. When the tide comes in, it fills the small stream and makes a small lagoon. Comfortable cane chairs offer easy seating and one can literally spend whole days simply soaking in the beauty of the place. The entire area is covered in soft white sands which makes it a pleasure to walk around barefoot. The food of course, is mainly sea-food based, and you can see local fishermen bringing in the fresh catch of the day.

Immediately below the shack, is a slice of beach, Dwarka's own! Some enormous rocks are the favourite perches of kingfishers and further on, you will see waders and plovers. High above, some fishing eagles can be seen as well as Brahminy kites, the sunlight catching their copper colours.
Metatype: This small resort with just a dozen cottages offers basic but stylish accommodation. The rooms have twin/double beds, bedside tables, and a small sit-out to enjoy the breathtaking views.
Descr: Dwarka Beach Resort in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: dwarka beach resort, goa, palms, beach, khola, stylish, boutique hotel

Descr: Fort Tiracol Heritage Hotel in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The House of MG is a bastion of tranquility and early 20th century charm against the swirling noise and colour of modern day Ahmedabad. It has beautifully decorated rooms and a wonderful ambience.

Located in the heart of the city, the House of MG is also the home to the perennially popular Agashiye, the rooftop restaurant that serves delicious traditional Gujarati food.
WebWriteUp1:
The 80 year old erstwhile home of Mangaldas Girdhardas (MG), once one of Ahmedabad's most important businessmen and philanthropists, has been carefully and wisely restored and converted into a hotel by his descendants. More home than hotel, the rooms are furnished as if to anticipate the visit of an old family friend. 

Every little detail has been carefully looked at and tweaked to perfection. Books line the shelves, rose petals drift in the marble trough in front of the tall, tilted ancient mirror, overstuffed sofas covered in flower patterns sit angled towards the television. Some rooms even feature an old fashioned swing with its original brass supports. 

With so much to choose from it may be difficult to decide on the room's best feature, but their very original bathrooms are all special, suffused in warm diffused light with textured white or glass brick walls or green brown tiles, with all the usual amenities.
 
The indoor pool is a complete delight, designed to resemble a lotus pool in Kerala. Coloured mosaic tiles sketch out pink lotuses and green leaves on the pool floor, a motif that is mirrored on the high ceiling above the pool. The curving prows of traditional Keralan snake boats mark the edge of the pool, creating a feeling of swimming in an isolated paradise.
Metatype: The House of MG is a bastion of tranquility and early 20th century charm against the swirling noise and colour of modern day Ahmedabad. It has beautifully decorated rooms and a wonderful ambience.
Descr: The House of Mangaldas Girdhardas in Ahmedabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: house of mangaldas girdhardas, ahmedabad, hotel, gujarat, special  places
address:
Opp. Sidi Saiyad Mosque
Lal Darwaja

description:
The tribal people of Hodka, with the support of development agencies, built the Shaam-E-Sarhad Resort, using only local building materials and natural products used also in their own houses. 

You can visit different families to see their nicely decorated and painted mud houses, learn about their livelihoods and customs and admire their fine embroideries and leather works.
WebWriteUp1:
Gain a first hand experience of the life of the tribals and their crafts by staying in a village resort in Hodka, just 63 km north of Bhuj. 

Both the tent and the "bhunga" mud huts feature hand smoothened mud floors and walls which also form the base of the bed, the sofas and seats. The furnishings are all of bright block printed or hand woven fabrics from nearby villages. 

In addition to the furnishings, locally sourced objects like the lacquer painted wooden window grills and the square pieces of colourful cloth which form the ceiling of the dining area reveal the desire to create a truly ethnic resort. 

But perhaps the most innovative architectural detail has gone into the making of the bathrooms. All feature a clean mud or brick floor, western toilets and a large mirror surrounded by white clay built into the serrated brick wall that divides the space in two. 

In addition to this, the bathrooms of the "bhunga" huts feature a wall made entirely of glass; this 'window' looks out on the enclosed private space wrapped around the hut. This space is surrounded by a short mud and stick fence which ensures privacy without disturbing the open community living feel of this hamlet/resort. 

In the evening after the smiling staff have served and cleared away the delicious traditional "thali" meal, you will be drawn towards the bonfire and the sounds created by the local folk musicians. 

The "Shaam e Sarhad" (Sunset at the Border) resort is the realisation of an ideal, a dream that facilitates the direct interaction with, and thus the true understanding of, the indigenous people of Kutch.
Metatype: Gain a first hand experience of the life of the tribals and their crafts by staying in a village resort in Hodka, just 63 km north of Bhuj.
Descr: Shaam-E-Sarhad Village Resort in Hodka - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shaam e-sarhad village resort, hodka, bhuj, kutch, gujarat, tours, special places

Descr: Old Bell Guest House in Sayla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Sayla Circle
Ahmedabad - Rajkot Highway

description:
The Vijay Vilas Palace is a charming heritage home-stay that sits in the shadow of the Shatrunjay Hill with its spectacular Jain temples. The palace has been simply and very tastefully decorated with delicate Victorian furniture and warm colours. 

This quaint 100 year old property was built by the local Maharaja and has been passed down to his descendants, Mr. Yashpal Singh and his wife. You can enjoy long chats with the wonderful hosts, while you savour the peace of the countryside and sample the exquisite home cooked food.
WebWriteUp1:
There is something distinctly different about Vijay Vilas Palace in comparison to other heritage properties. As you walk into the handsomely sized drawing room with its original tiled mosaic floor, with the spindly legged chairs and sofas upholstered in burnt orange, surrounded by the family's brass and ceramic bric-a-brac you slowly come to the realisation that this palace is first and foremost a home. 

The rooms have all been furnished with the lovingly restored original possessions of the house that had been locked away while the family was using its other homes. In accordance with the strict code of the Rajputs, the beds are all twins, but these can now be joined together! They are mostly brass four poster beds or polished wooden ones. There are also chintz covered divans and small tea tables. 

Most rooms also have a dry dressing area with tall antique, mirror topped dressing tables and traditional colourful cotton "dhuries" (carpets). The bathrooms on the higher floors overlook the quiet fields and hills. Each room also has access either to a private balcony with a gently creaking swing or to a common lounge area in addition to the main drawing room. 

The cooking is supervised and often personally prepared by the lady of the house and as a result is mouthwateringly authentic. Meals are served on the long table and if the hosts are able to join you for dinner you are assured of a memorable evening.
Metatype: The Vijay Vilas Palace is a charming heritage home-stay that sits in the shadow of the Shatrunjay Hill with its spectacular Jain temples. The palace has been simply and very tastefully decorated with delicate Victorian furniture and warm colours.
Descr: Vijay Vilas Palace in Palitana - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: vijay vilas palace, palitana, gujarat, heritage hotels, jain temples
address:

P.O. Gheti

description:
The Centre for Desert and Ocean (CEDO) is the brainchild of ecologist and ornithologist Jugal Tiwari. The CEDO project is his attempt at wildlife conservation in the desert area of Kutch. 

The accommodation at CEDO is fairly basic with only a handful of rooms in a small villa. Mr. Tiwari and his family live in a house adjoining the guest quarters and CEDO is therefore also a homestay.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms here have plain decorations but are comfortable in size and cool inside. The rooms on the top floor overlook fields at the back of the house. The freshly cooked food is brought in steel tiffinboxes from the house of an old friend of Mr. Tiwari's. The food is vegetarian, local and completely satisfying and is served in an open gazebo in the garden. 

The CEDO camp is designed for serious birders and for people with little concern for extravagant material comforts. But minor discomforts are likely to be well compensated for by the boundless knowledge and expertise of Mr. Tiwari and his staff as they take you around the surrounding areas.

Safaris are conducted in open jeeps and on foot and aside from the birdlife your guides are also knowledgable about the many different tribes of the area, their local customs and origins.
Metatype: The Centre for Desert and Ocean (CEDO) is the brainchild of ecologist and ornithologist Jugal Tiwari. The CEDO project is his attempt at wildlife conservation in the desert area of Kutch.
Descr: Centre for Desert and Ocean (CEDO) in Moti Virani - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: cedo, centre of desert and ocean, moti virani, gujarat, kutch, bird watching

description:
Set back from the beach at Mandvi is the Maharaja of Bhuj's present home - the Vijay Vilas Palace. 

A luxury tented camp has been created on a beautiful stretch of private beach belonging to the Maharaja. Here you can relax in luxurious air conditioned tents that resemble the colonial era hunting camps of the Maharajas. 

You can also feast on the wide variety of seafood that Gujarat's 1,666 km coastline supplies.
creditcards: Credit Cards / Debit Cards are not accepted at The Beach Camp
WebWriteUp1:
Peach, blue, mauve, and pistachio green striped tents greet you as they sit facing each other. 

Sturdy modern Indian heavy wood has been used to make the immensely comfortable beds, as well as the writing tables and chairs. The pristine white sheets and bathrooms are perhaps the cleanest you'll see anywhere in Gujarat. 

The staff is efficient, capable and friendly and will offer you advice and explanations on the local fare served in their restaurant. But once they lay out your food you will be left in peace to savour it along with the magnificent view of the moonlit sea. 

Astonishingly and sadly given Gujarat's immense coastline, there are is very little beach accommodation in the state, but the Mandvi Beach Camp management seem to have taken it as a personal challenge to provide the best beach experience possible and they have accomplished this with flair.
Metatype: Set back from the beach at Mandvi is the Maharaja of Bhuj's present home - the Vijay Vilas Palace.
Descr: Beach Camp in Mandvi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: beach camp, mandvi, gujarat, special places, travel, plan, hotel

description:
The individual, coffee coloured cottages of the Gir Birding Lodge are set in a rambling mango orchard that merges with the deciduous forests of the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary beyond. 

These tastefully furnished cottages have been built in such a way as to ensure privacy whilst still offering unrestricted views over the trees and fields that attract their own share of birdlife. 

The Gir Birding Lodge offers a good base for tracking the Asiatic Lion in the wild.
WebWriteUp1:
Close to the edge of the Gir Sanctuary, this cozy, small, two-story lodge has an enviable location and is an economical option. Simply furnished with camouflage prints, verandas and swings, the decent, modest rooms are either within cottages or are part of the main building. 

The cottages are decorated with furnishings of earth colours of brown, green and orange against textured white walls. The floor is wood patterned and the large four poster beds have frames made out of dark polished wood that contrasts vividly with the dazzling white sheets. The bathrooms are large with wonderful rain showers. 

The cottage's porch has canvas director's chairs from where you can admire the pink roses and red and yellow marigolds in the garden. 

The common areas of the lodge are housed in the double storied cottage at the entrance to the resort. The compact dining room has a balcony and large windows overlooking the orchard. The food here is a mixture of excellent local, North Indian and Continental dishes.
 
If pre-arranged the hotel can, along with jeep rides into the sanctuary, also organise bird watching hikes accompanied by a naturalist.
Metatype: The individual, coffee coloured cottages of the Gir Birding Lodge are set in a rambling mango orchard that merges with the deciduous forests of the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary beyond.
Descr: Gir Birding Lodge in Sasangir - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: gir birding lodge, sasangir, gujarat, lion, sanctuary, special places, hotel

Descr: Geo Eco Camp in Chilka lake - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Located just outside Udaipur, on a hill with 360 degree views, Fateh Garh is a newly built palace hotel.

The breathtaking panoramic views from the terrace stretch over Lake Pichola with the Lake Palace Hotel, the City Palace complex, and the magnificent hills which surround Udaipur.

The rooms are a study in space, light and luxury. The predominant colour is white, and large windows bring the outside scenery right into your bedroom.
WebWriteUp1:
The brainchild of Jitender Singh, who also created the superb Fateh Bagh at Ranakpur, Fateh Garh is a very special hotel. At first sight one wonders whether it is a fort, a retreat, or a temple. In many ways Fateh Garh is a combination of all of these!

A long uphill drive through the rugged hills leads to a rusty coloured building standing against the blue skies. The lobby is approached via a broad ramp, lit by lamps in recessed niches. The lobby is a sweeping area with beautifully draped lounges, well chosen carvings, and lamps. From here a flight of steps, graced by carved marble statues, and reminiscent of a traditional step-well, leads up to the main level. 

The terrace is simply breathtaking. The panoramic views include Lake Pichola with the Lake Palace Hotel, the City Palace complex, and the magnificent hills which surround Udaipur. The terrace is vast, with a cascading blue swimming pool, and the pavilion restaurant. A large marble tub shaped like a lotus has rose petals floating in it. 

The hotel lounge - called the Baradari (the hall of 12 pillars) - is open on all sides. In reality, there are many more than 12 pillars and they are all superbly carved in marble, hence the resemblance to the great temple of Ranakpur.
 
The rooms are a study in space, light and luxury. The predominat colour is white and there are acres of polished marble, snowy linen and large windows which bring the outside scenery right into your bedroom. The attached bathroom is of highest quality. On the lower terrace there are two rooms which share a private pool. 

The chef prepares world class Rajasthani and Indian food, which can be served in several venues, according to the guests' wishes - outside on the main terrace, or in the glass enclosed restaurant if the evening is cold, or in one of the many peaceful and private spots inside the building.
Metatype: Located just outside the city of Udaipur, on a hill with 360 degree views, Fateh Garh is a newly built palace hotel.
Descr: Fateh Garh in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: fateh garh, udaipur, rajasthan, luxury, heritage hotel, palace, special places

description:
This new hotel is located in Friends' Colony, a residential area which offers many entertainment options, and has a buzzing market close by. 

On the lobby level is a lounge and a restaurant which overlooks the small but well tended garden. 

Once in the rooms, the decor is contemporary and chic with a Zen like simplicity. The very pleasant rooms are large enough to allow a small seating area besides a very comfortable bed.
WebWriteUp1:
Dolphin Inn is part of a small group of boutique hotels in Delhi. From flooring to furnishings, and bedspreads to towels, a lot of care has been taken to create a pleasant ambience. Every room has its own style and decor, so no two rooms are alike.

One of the main attractions of the hotel is the bright natural light that floods the rooms. The extra large plate glass windows allow a large amount of light in, while keeping away the noise of the busy road below. The rooms therefore are remarkably bright, a rare thing in Delhi.

There is a multicuisine restaurant at the lobby level that has an `a-la-carte' menu, as well as buffet on weekends.
Metatype: This new hotel is located in Friends' Colony, a residential area which offers many entertainment options, and has a buzzing market close by.
Descr: DolphInn in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: dolphin, hotel, delhi, golden triangle, india, tours, rajasthan, special places

description:
The Manor was originally developed as a small country hotel in the 1950s, in Friends Colony, in what was once the outskirts of Delhi. Today, it is an oasis in the centre of this sprawling bustling city. 

The 2-storey, 16-room boutique hotel is set in landscaped gardens and has been completely redesigned as a contemporary luxury hotel. Public areas combine cool Italian mosaic flooring with warm, rich wood panelling.
WebWriteUp1:
This large bungalow was built in 1950 as a small country hotel in Friends Colony, which was then outside the city limits of Delhi. Today, the city has grown around the Manor and much beyond. However, within the hotel, the feeling of being out of the urban sprawl remains thanks to the open spaces and deep shades created by mature trees.

The straight lines of the facade offer few clues to the wealth of beauty that lies within. Italian terrazzo floors and columns, lofty ceilings and smooth wood have created a singularly fine atmosphere. The colours used are muted beiges with some subtle greens and chocolate browns. 

High ceilings give the Suites a spacious feel. A combined sitting area and bedroom features a king-size bed, sofa, chairs, and large writing table. Some suites have a small private terrace. Other rooms are smaller with a queen-size bed and writing table.

A vast and well tended lawn and a terrace overlooking the lawn are good places to sit and relax. The restaurant, `77' serves excellent food from around the world. A trendy bar decorated with rich Onyx is popular with the Delhi elite. Upstairs, there is a large sunny terrace for sun bathing or simply to enjoy a cool drink.
Metatype: The Manor was originally developed as a small country hotel in the 1950s, in Friends Colony, in what was once the outskirts of Delhi. Today, it is an oasis in the centre of this sprawling bustling city.
Descr: The Manor in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the manor, hotel, delhi, golden triangle, india, tours, rajasthan

Descr: Sathin Garh in Jodhpur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Village Sathin
Near Pipar City
