description:
A farm house in South Delhi, now converted into a most attractive and exclusive hideaway. 

The very spacious rooms and suites have hand-picked furniture and artifacts chosen from Thailand and Indonesia. 

There are several sitting rooms, lounges and corners which are so attractive that you truly wouldn't know which one to choose! 

Outside, there is a badminton court, a swimming pool that hugs the house, a large wooden pavilion overlooking the pool, the gardens and beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
While not strictly in Delhi, Casa Dera Mandi is just on the outskirts of Delhi, about a 45 minute drive away from the airports. 

Delhi's surrounding areas are made up small villages which are getting swallowed up as the city creeps closer to them. Despite this, there are some spots, not too far away which still retain a village like charm and vast open spaces. 

Dera Mandi is one such village. A large and very exclusive gated estate has come up here, called Dera Mandi retreat. This estate sprawls over acres of well tended gardens and orchards and has homes of many affluent families. 

One such farm house, Casa Dera Mandi, is now converted into a most attractive and exclusive hideaway. This posh sprawling bungalow is crammed full of delights. 

The rooms all are large enough to have their own seating areas with very comfortable sofas and arm-chairs. The beds have canopies or are the Balinese wedding beds with delicate wood carvings. The feel is of utmost luxury and yet relaxed. 

Casa Dera Mandi is ideal for a few nights' stay, simply so that all the many delights can be explored and enjoyed. This is also an ideal spot for starting or finishing your book, do some sketching or painting, bird-watching or simply giving yourself a holiday after your hectic travel through India. 

Thank god such places exist!
Metatype: A farm house in South Delhi, now converted into a most attractive and exclusive hideaway.
Descr: Casa Dera Mandi in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Neeleshwar Hermitage was the first luxury resort to open in the unspoiled and relatively unexplored coast of northern Kerala. Unlike southern Kerala there are no hotels here, no beach bars and definitely no crowds. 

It has a superb natural location, on an empty beach of soft while sand, flanked by a freshwater lagoon and surrounded by coconut and mango groves. Eagles, kingfishers and herons glide above the 16 thatches cottages that house spacious, minimal bedrooms, built using sustainable wood.
WebWriteUp1:
The Hermitage is eco-friendly; with local toiletries helping to minimize the impact of the resort on the environment. The staff is friendly and warm, and the relaxed atmosphere is instantly calming. 

The food at Neeleshwar shows a mixture of Indian, Middle-Eastern and European influences. The emphasis is on fresh ingredients cooked with an authentic flair and each morning fisherman haul in their catch of fish from the nearby waters. You can learn how to cook local dishes under the expert tuition of the resort chefs at one of the cookery classes, or let someone else do the work and feast in the al-fresco fish restaurant or at the Annapurna restaurant. 

The Ayurvedic Priya Spa offers a range of treatments, from the restful smruthi, where warm oil is dripped onto the forehead, to the more strenuous sajooya. 

Whilst Neeleshwar offers a wide range of activities - from astrology to bird-watching - guests are equally welcome to simply relax on the beach to enjoy this pristine paradise.. This is the beauty of northern Kerala, the pace is so laidback that you can't help but unwind.
Metatype: Neeleshwar Hermitage was the first luxury resort to open in the unspoiled and relatively unexplored coast of northern Kerala. Unlike southern Kerala there are no hotels here, no beach bars and definitely no crowds.
Descr: Neeleshwar Hermitage in Neeleshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: neeleshwar hermitage, luxury, ayurveda, beach resort, northern kerala

Descr: The Corus in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Hotel Diggi Palace in Jaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Bangala, the Tamil pronunciation of 'The Bungalow' is an elegant boutique Heritage Hotel, located on the outskirts of Karaikudi in a property that has been developed over the last 75 years. 

The hotel has twenty-five comfortable, air-conditioned double bedrooms, with attached bathrooms. The rooms are simply but elegantly furnished, and some have four-poster beds. The hotel has gained fame for its genuine home cooked Chettinad Food.
WebWriteUp1:
As you drive to The Bangala, it's impossible to miss the series of old houses lining the narrow streets; each having once tried to outdo the next in size and flamboyance. In their heyday, these used to house extended families that at times totalled a hundred people! 

The owners of the Bangala have carefully restored their building true to its original style in the 1940s and 1950s, which was the height of the Art Deco period in India. 

The floors have bright mosaic borders. The windows have quaint wooden bars, painted silver like their frames. The furniture, fittings and the accessories in the bedrooms and bathrooms have all been chosen with an eye to preserving the original d�cor.

The effect is the creation of an atmosphere that is partly that of a club and partly that of a beautifully maintained home.
Metatype: The Bangala, the Tamil pronunciation of 'The Bungalow' is an elegant boutique Heritage Hotel, located on the outskirts of Karaikudi in a property that has been developed over the last 75 years.
Descr: The Bangala in Karaikudi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: the bangala, heritage hotel, karaikudi, chettinad, homestay, cooking classes

Descr: Pangarh Lake Retreat in Bijaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This wonderful small boutique hotel is more like an up-market home-stay.  

The nicest thing about Casa Friends, is the amount of space it offers. Apart from the generous sized rooms, there are plenty of common lounging areas.

There is a terrace with a good sized garden, a glassed in area overlooking the terrace in case it is too cool/warm outside, a chic dining area and an elegant lounge and a smaller, more intimate living area on the first floor.
WebWriteUp1:
Located in Friends Colony, an expensive residential area, Casa Friends is close to the local market which has everything from McDonald's and Pizza Hut to smart boutiques.  

Casa Friends is situated on the second and third (top) floor of a pleasant building in one of the leavy streets of  Friends Colony. There is no lift so you do have to walk up to the hotel floors. Nothing prepares you though for the different ambience that prevails inside. 

The lower level has a small central hall and a cozy living room. The ambience is akin to that of an opulent English home, with heavy brocaded sofas and armchairs, gilt-edged mirrors and soft carpets. 

There are three rooms on the lower level. The largest one, has its own balcony. The rooms are large with decorative beds, painted wallpapers, heavy wooden furniture and ceiling to floor curtains. 

There are three more rooms on the top floor. Each room here also has generous space, luxurious furnishings, wooden furniture and amazing artifacts with an oriental slant. 

The staff is headed by a very enthusiastic lady, Ganga. This petite lady makes sure you have tea/coffee any time of the day and can make small snacks should you want to eat in.
Metatype: This wonderful small boutique hotel is more like an up-market home-stay.
Descr: Casa Friends in Delhi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Situated in the historical and financial heart of Mumbai, the Residency Hotel is an erstwhile fire station dating back to the British era. 

The furnishings are quiet, subdued and elegant. Sunlight fills the corridors and paintings of Indian flora and fauna line the walls interspersed with Mughal prints. 

Within easy walking distance of Mumbai's Indo-Saracenic buildings, Residency Hotel offers the perfect place from where to explore the vibrant city of Mumbai.
WebWriteUp1:
Despite being located so close to Mumbai's commercial centres, the hotel and rooms are quiet because of the sound proof glass fitted into the windows. We recommend the Superior Rooms as they are roomier. They are tastefully done up in cream, brown and burgundy and softly lit with comfortable beds and adequate bathrooms.

The restaurant serves breakfast from its own kitchens but lunch and dinner have to be ordered in from one of the many restaurants close by that offer nearly every type of cuisine.

The location of the hotel is excellent, with all of Mumbai's interesting sights only a few streets away. Just a few minutes walk away is the colourful street market of Colaba Causeway where you can find anything from the latest fashions to nautical brass curios. The area is also a cultural hub with the National Gallery for Modern Art and the Jehangir Art Gallery located within easy distance of each other. Mumbai's main museum  the Prince of Wales Museum is also a must-see. 

In the evening you could catch the new Bollywood film playing at one of the many theatres. Alternatively, Mumbai's promenade, affectionately called "the Queen's Necklace" after the many lights that dot its banks, offers the perfect setting for a sunset stroll.
Metatype: Situated in the historical and financial heart of Mumbai, the Residency Hotel is an erstwhile fire station dating back to the British era.
Descr: Residency Hotel in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
26, Rustom Sidhwa Marg
Corner of D.N. Road
Opposite City Bank and Khadi Bhandar
Fort

description:
The Willow Banks hotel is conveniently situated on Shimla's principal walkway - The Mall. Built in the year 1871, it has gone through many a facelift and is now a fairly modern hotel. 

The rooms are bright and pleasant, centrally heated and many have an attached balcony. A central atrium ensures that there sunlight fills the hotel on the slightly gloomy days that visit Shimla occasionally. 

There is an indoor formal dining restaurant and hipper, more casual food court outside overlooking the busy Shimla valley.
WebWriteUp1:
The Willow Banks hotel is conveniently situated on Shimla's principal walkway - The Mall. Built in the year 1871, it Willow Banks was established in the year 1871, a landmark estate.

Originally owned by Arthur  James Cradook, "Architect and Builder of Simla", the building has been redesigned into a hotel.

The hotel has an excellent location, at level with the Mall Road, Shimla's main promenade and happening place.

There is a cozy elegant lobby, atrium and spacious rooms. Italian marble, granite, malaysian rubber wood and teak-wood complement each other to produce an appealing decor.

The rooms are agreeble with large beds and cosy duvets and covers in sparkling white. Light, pine wood furniture emphasizes the Scandanavian feel of the rooms. Some rooms have dark wood floors with a beautiful grain showing through, others have cobalt blue carpeting with upsholstery to match. There are large  windows in the rooms and some balconies, all of which offer views of the sunny valley below.

The hotel has a small spa and gym equipped with a jacuzzi, a beauty salon, a few excercise machines, a small sauna and steam room and a billiards table. The hotel also offers Kerala Ayurvedic oil massages.

Breakfast is usually a buffet served in the indoors restaurant. The restaurant is warm and sunshiny, and you can enjoy your breakfast sitting at tables with white canvas umbrellas, surrounded by potted plants and subdued modern art. The food court outside is for all day dining; fast food served on the terrace beside the hotel and is open to non residents as well. Their food isnt the best in town but luckily in Shimla there is no dearth of eateries.

The bar is relaxed place, all glossy wood and inimate tables; gramaphone records adorn the walls and they stock an array of vintage wines and spirits.
Metatype: The Willow Banks hotel is conveniently situated on Shimla's principal walkway - The Mall. Built in the year 1871, it has gone through many a facelift and is now a fairly modern hotel.
Descr: Hotel Willow Banks in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Khem Villas offers the most stylish and distinctive accommodation close to Ranthambore National Park 

The resort is designed to provide an authentic experience that is unfussy and functional, yet memorable. Accommodation is in rooms, cottages and tents, all created using locally sourced materials. 

There is a focus on healthy living: organic vegetarian food from their own farm is served and there is a spa and ayurvedic doctor on site. 

Khem Villas is spread over an area of 10 acres which has become a habitat in itself, with its own walking trails, sit outs, and wildlife observations points overlooking ponds and grasslands.
WebWriteUp1:
Khem Villas, is a jungle camp established by Usha and Goverdhan Singh Rathore along with Pritam Singh on the outskirts of Ranthambhore National Park. Goverdhan is the son of Fateh Singh Rathore one of India's leading Tiger experts who is known as the founding father of Ranthambhore National Park.

Usha ran a successful tented camp in Ranthambhore for six years and ensures that guests have an enjoyable stay, with delicious food made from home grown organic vegetables.

Pritam runs Anokhi, a company which has helped to revive the tradition of hand block printing in Rajasthan. Today it exports exquisitely hand crafted fashion clothing and furnishings all over the world. 

Accommodation is divided into three categories, and has been designed keeping in mind the maxim that "simplicity is the ultimate sophistication". Great pains have been taken to ensure that all labour and materials were locally sourced. The camp is designed to provide an authentic experience that is unfussy and functional, yet memorable.

The stand-alone cottages have a spacious and comfortable bedroom, a large bathroom, and an open to sky private plunge pool with an outdoor shower. There is also a large private courtyard and veranda. The bedroom is air-conditioned with large glass doors overlooking the surrounding forests and water bodies.
 
The tents are simpler. They are erected on a wooden platform on a steel frame, and have modern amenities. The bathrooms are minimalist using simple natural materials like bamboo and wood to give a rustic charm without compromising on comfort and practicality.

The main building has four bedrooms which can be used as individual rooms, or can be enjoyed by a small group as their own private space. All of these rooms are air-conditioned and spacious, with en suite bathrooms. The upstairs rooms have large bay windows from which you can enjoy the views.
Metatype: Khem Villas is a luxury jungle camp on the outskirts of Ranthambhore National Park Accommodation is in rooms, cottages and tents, all created using locally sourced materials.. The camp is designed to provide an authentic experience that is unfussy and functional, yet memorable.
Descr: Khem Villas in Sawai Madhopur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: khem vilas, ranthambore, rajasthan, luxury, wildlife, hotel, tents

description: This grand resort is built in a Rajasthani haveli/palace style. Dev Vilas is surrounded by a large garden, and overlooks the hills of the Ranthambore National Park. The rooms are large and atmospheric. There is an enticing swimming pool, a terrace where dinners and drinks are served, and also an indoor restaurant, making this a good place for relaxation in comfort.
WebWriteUp1:
The owner, Balendu Singh, is a warm soft spoken man, who has an excellent knowledge of the Ranthambhore park and the wildlife. It is a pleasure to spend a hour or two in his company listening to his many anecdotes. 

The rooms are laid out symmetrically along generous corridors. The rooms themselves are very spacious and done in a pleasing manner with rich colours and sumptuous textures. The beds are ultra comfortable and the aircon a boon in the hot day-time temperatures.  The bathrooms are pleasingly appointed and have a small dressing alcove attached to them. 

There are also a few luxurious tents near the pool. Well furnished and large, they make a good alternative to the spacious rooms.
Metatype: This small, gracious resort is built in a Rajasthani haveli/palace style. An open to sky central courtyard lets in direct sunlight, flooding the whole place with brilliant glow.
Descr: Dev Vilas in Sawai Madhopur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Ranjits Svaasa is a luxury heritage spa resort located in the heart of Amritsar. The beautiful colonial style architecture, large lawns and ancient trees create a peaceful and idyllic respite from the bustle of city life.

Each room is individually designed and decorated right from the linen bed covers to the bathroom fittings. All rooms extend out to an inviting patio or balcony overlooking the landscaped gardens. The in-house spa provides some of their own healing and beauty treatments.
WebWriteUp1:
A stately red and white building harking back to the 19th century, Ranjit's Svaasa was once the official guesthouse for foreign dignitaries. Today it is a boutique spa resort run by Rama Mehra, a well respected organic food and natural healing expert, and her sons. 

The breeze comes in from the many leafy patios and sets the cotton curtains dancing. The colours are summery, the floors rough and earthy, the beds substantial and the light honey coloured. Black and white photos of seven generations of the family line the walls and each room. 

The bathrooms vary from room to room - some feature hand moulded cement bathtubs and others rain showers. A complimentary set of herbal toileteries and eco friendly designer bathroom slippers are provided.

There are many cushioned sofas and lounge chairs in the bedrooms and patio furniture outside to unwind in. 
  
Meals can be enjoyed in the indoor formal dining room, while seated in the cushy armchairs of the cool green verandah caf�, or in any one of the leafy terraces that catches your fancy. The all organic food ingredients are fashioned into little known Indian delicacies and Continental dishes with a unique Svaasa twist. 
  
Stepping into the fragrant, pebble floored spa you will find it hard to believe that this was once the stables of the manor. Now there are mirrored adornments, wood carved lamp shades and comfortable divans. There are body scrubs, wraps and massages on offer along with signature treatments such as the hibiscus hair wash.
Metatype: Ranjits Svaasa is a luxury heritage spa resort located in the heart of Amritsar. The beautiful colonial style architecture, large lawns and ancient trees create a peaceful and idyllic respite from the bustle of city life.
Descr: Ranjits Svaasa in Amritsar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: ranjit's svaasa, hotel, amritsar, punjab, luxury, heritage, spa, special places

description:
Wallwood Garden, earlier known as Blair Athol, built 100 years ago by a Scottish Major General, is now a part of the Neemrana Group. It offers 8 rooms, each named after trees. The resort's multi-cuisine restaurant has fixed menus for all meals. 

The mansion retains the atmosphere of the past and is located very close to Sim's Park, India's leading Botanical garden, with 1200 species of plants and rare trees such as Rudraksh, Paperwood, Elephant Leg, Strawberry Tree etc.
WebWriteUp1: Wallwood Garden, earlier known as Blair Athol, built 100 years ago by a Scottish Major General is now a part of the Neemrana Group.  A recommended activity at Wallwood Garden is simply to walk in the beautiful surroundings.
Metatype: Wallwood Garden, earlier known as Blair Athol, built 100 years ago by a Scottish Major General, is now a part of the Neemrana Group. It offers 8 rooms, each named after trees. The resort's multi-cuisine restaurant has fixed menus for all meals.
Descr: Wallwood Garden in Coonoor - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: wallwood garden, heritage hotel, coonoor, neemrana, special places

description:
The 19th-Century Collector's Residence in picturesque Tranquebar has recently been transformed from a ruin into a heritage hotel by the Neemrana Group. 

As bungalows on the beach go, this is a pretty grand one. What's more, it has a view not only of the ocean, but also of history. A stolid Danish fort looms over the sands on one side and on the other is a medieval Pandya temple crumbling into the sea.
WebWriteUp1:
Its Danish relics lend Tranquebar a curious, washed-out charm. The moment you enter its "Land Gate" you are transported back to another age and time. 

As you traverse the grandly named King Street, the main street that leads from the gate to the beach, you pass a row of colonial structures, which includes the elegant 1701 Zion Church, and the more elaborate 1718 New Jerusalem Church, and the now tattered 18th-Century Danish Governor's bungalow. At the end of the line stands the newly renovated hotel. 

The building was in a state of utter disrepair, with parts of the verandah having collapsed, when conservationists Francis Wacziarg and Aman Nath, who set up the Neemrana Group, came across it. It took two years of restoration to turn the building into a gracious hotel. But today, the building is as much an example of intelligent conservation as it is an evocation of the past, using as it does a minimum of carefully chosen vintage furniture, paintings and artefacts. Its high-ceiling rooms are named after old Danish ships and fitted with sheer single-colour floor-length curtains that billow like sails in the breeze.
Metatype: The 19th-Century Collector's Residence in picturesque Tranquebar has recently been transformed from a ruin into a heritage hotel by the Neemrana Group.
Descr: Bungalow on the Beach in Tranquebar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: bungalow on the beach, tranquebar, neemrana, heritage hotel, special places

description:
Sheltered by enormous old trees, the Villa Pottipati is an island of quiet and old-world charm in what is one of India's most high-tech cities, Bangalore. 

This garden bungalow is compact, with a steeply tapering red roof and dormer windows hung with intricate fretwork. 

With just 8 rooms filled with colonial furniture, a cosy swimming pool and a sunlit pebbled garden, Villa Pottipati is more of a home than hotel.
WebWriteUp1:
Villa Pottipati is one of the last surviving examples of Bangalore's famed bungalows and gardens. 

A garden home in Malleswaram, once the vegetarian-Brahmin stronghold of Bangalore, the name Pottipati derives from a village in Andhra Pradesh from where its owners, the Reddy family, originally came.

The rooms are tucked away under the many eaves of the house and furnished as if to welcome a family member or friend. Cotton saris cover the beds and keep the strong sun out. All the furniture is of the dark wood, delicate legged variety - canopy and poster beds, writing desks with a dozen compartments and shapely lamp bases.

Meals are served at the intimate dining table inside or in the tree shaded courtyard outside. The food is eclectic and sometimes includes French cuisine from Pondicherry. The pool adds a touch of luxury.
Metatype: Sheltered by enormous old trees, the Villa Pottipati is an island of quiet and old-world charm in what is one of India's most high-tech cities, Bangalore.
Descr: Villa Pottipati in Bangalore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: villa pottipati, bangalore, heritage hotel, karnataka, special places

description:
Cardamom House is owned and managed by a retired British Physician. Here the atmosphere is completely informal and the daily activities of the house are tailored to accommodate the personal programs of the guests.

It is a small homestay with 6 double rooms and a suite which can also be divided into two separate rooms. All rooms are named after an Indian spice or herb. All face south with superb views of both the lake and the Western ghats.
WebWriteUp1:
Cardamom House enjoys a stunning location on the edge of the monsoon dependent Kamarajar Lake which nestles in the foothills of the mountains of the Western Ghats. The close proximity of these mountains exerts a cooling effect on the climate of the area. Birdlife is abundant and there is even the occasional glimpse of a Leopard or Black Panther as they move silently through the undergrowth.

Here you can experience true unspoiled rural and village life at your own pace. Activities such as walking, bird watching, photography and painting are popular and the owners can also arrange tours to nearby fascinating places such as Lord Murugans Temple abode at Palani, or the hill station of Kodaikanal

Early morning tea or coffee is served on the verandah outside your room whilst lunch is served at Four Winds, an area cooled by natural breezes. In the evening you can watch the sun as it sinks below the Western Ghats while you enjoy drinks on the rooftop terrace.
Metatype: Cardamom House is owned and managed by a retired British Physician. Here the atmosphere is completely informal and the daily activities of the house are tailored to accommodate the personal programs of the guests.
Descr: Cardamom House in Dindigul - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: cardamom house, dindigul, hotel, homestay, western ghats, special places

description:
Elephant Valley is run by a team of individuals from different corners of the planet who share the aim of living in harmony with nature. They have built cottages according to their commitment to reduce the impact on the environment. 

The cottages at Elephant Valley have been tastefully created using local granite and reclaimed Burma teak wood, with interiors of colonial and art deco furniture.
WebWriteUp1:
Elephant Valley is a 100 acre nature reserve and organic farm which welcomes ecologically minded tourists. It is located in the Palni hills of the Western Ghats, an area which is one of the 25 biodiversity hotspots of the planet. The well known hill station of Kodaikanal is just 20 km away.

Elephant Valley is run by a team of individuals from different corners of the planet who share the aim of living in harmony with nature.

They have built cottages according to their commitment to reduce the impact on the environment. Each is equipped with solar lights, kerosene lanterns, western style dry/composting toilets and firewood fuelled hot water showers. 

Elephant valley is the last settlement on the border of the National Forest which extends into Kerala, and is strategically situated on an elephant migration route.

Elephant Valley enjoys moderate climate with adequate and well distributed rainfall throughout the year.
Metatype: Elephant Valley is run by a team of individuals from different corners of the planet who share the aim of living in harmony with nature.
Descr: Elephant Valley in Kodaikanal - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: elephant valley, eco hotel, kodaikanal, organic farming, nature, special places

description:
Located next to the famous Shore Temple, INDeco Mahabalipuram greets you with a warm smile, a refreshing welcome drink and a relaxing foot massage. 

This "hotel set in a museum" is built on an erstwhile British camping site and a collection of British camping paraphernalia is on display in the reception area. Sample their wholesome, traditional food, enjoy a rejuvenating oil massage, take a stroll under the trees and snooze in the cool of your cottage.
WebWriteUp1:
Resembling a small village, INDeco Mahabalipuram is a group of villas in small clusters of 3, covered alternatively with red roof tiles and thatch. Earthy russets and greens have been used to celebrate the charm of rural Tamil Nadu. 

The truth is, despite its French cafes and multinational visitors, Mahabalipuram essentially remains a small village; the major attractions of which - the Shore temples, are only a stroll away from the hotel and can even be admired from the hotel's beach. 

There is a large pool, surrounded by palm trees and some slightly tacky sculptures of sea horses and fish.  

The hotel is set among 6 acres of Pongamia trees which supposedly ensure good health.
Metatype: Located next to the famous Shore Temple, INDeco Mahabalipuram greets you with a warm smile, a refreshing welcome drink and a relaxing foot massage.
Descr: Indeco Mahabalipuram in Mamallapuram - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: indeco mahabalipuram, hotel, mamallapuram, village, shore temple

description:
Cool, classy and cutting edge is The Park Calcutta. From their deep purple and black lobby that oozes oomph to their full service spa and massage centre that soothes upon entering it to their carefully crafted rooms and mind boggling range of eateries, The Park Calcutta is all about opulence and over the top luxury. 

A padded and perfumed world, The Park can make you forget the dusty Calcutta that throbs outside its very doors, so enter here for a dose of escapism at its most sophisticated.
WebWriteUp1:
The Park has a few different room options but the ones we recommend are the Luxury Rooms. A deep black corridor leads to these rooms which epitomise zen like chic, all straight lines and bold colours, low wooden beds and rain showers. 

But it is actually The Park's spectacular facilities that justify its price. The rooftop swimming pool and hot tub are circled by overstuffed satellite chairs and a to-be-seen-at Aqua Cafe. Their spa must surely be one of the best in Kolkata and the restaurants too numerous to be enjoyed in a single visit. 

Aside from the poolside cafe there is Zen for Chinese and Saffron for Indian food. Roxy is the place for some 60's style champagne cocktails. And head to Someplace Else to listen to the city's live bands and discover a mostly undiscovered face of Kolkata.
Metatype: Cool, classy and cutting edge is The Park Calcutta. From their deep purple and black lobby that oozes oomph to their full service spa and massage centre that soothes upon entering it to their carefully crafted rooms and mind boggling range of eateries, The Park Calcutta is all about opulence and over the top luxury.
Descr: The Park in Kolkata - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Bhubaneshwar is full of ancient temples and caves. 

A traveller to the city will find it impossible to resist spending a day at these heritage monuments that have withstood the ravages of time. 

Ginger is centrally located and is close to the airport, railway station and the bus stand. 

It offers quick and easy access to all the temples as well as to the flourishing commercial establishments in and around the city.
WebWriteUp1:
Ginger Bhubaneshwar provides all three-star facilities including special facilities like Smart Basics such as Smart space, Safe zone, gymnasium, meeting room, and self check-in kiosk.

All the rooms are equipped with amenities like mini-fridge, LCD TV, self-controlled A/c, tea and coffee maker and a telephone.
Metatype: Bhubaneshwar is full of ancient temples and caves.
Descr: Ginger Bhubhaneshwar in Bhubaneshwar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Opp Nalco Headquarters
Jayadev Vihar Nayapalli

description:
Western Court is a Boutique Hotel designed in a contemporary style. 

Located in the fashionable Sector 43 of Chandigarh, the hotel has an international style restaurant with an open kitchen and a bar with a good choice of Indian and imported drinks.
WebWriteUp1:
The hotel offers 22 centrally air-conditioned and well-appointed rooms, available in Executive, Deluxe, Grand Deluxe and Suite categories. 

All rooms are equipped with a 32'' LCD TV, electronic safe, mini-bar, direct dial international telephones, and room service. The hotel also offers business facilities including wi-fi access throughout the hotel.
Metatype: Western Court is a Boutique Hotel done in contemporary style.
Descr: Hotel Western Court in Chandigarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel western court, chandigarh, travel, india, tours, travel

description:
The Hotel Ilark is the new but rapidly rising star of Bhuj. 

Only a year old, the Ilark is small for a business hotel but sharply stylish. 

The decor is mainly white and the rooms have muted lighting and are imaginatively decorated. 

The restaurant takes turns to serve up authentic Gujarati vegetarian and international cuisine. 

Situated within easy distance of the main sites of Bhuj, the Ilark promises modern elegance and sophistication in a small town.
WebWriteUp1:
There are various categories of rooms in the Ilark, all of which are extremely comfortable. The beds are all large with pleasant wood paneling and there is often a charmingly assembled window seat in the room as well. All the rooms are air conditioned and have television sets that receive international channels. 

The bathrooms are equally stylish and clean and their Super Deluxe Rooms boldly offer a glass walled bathroom for variety.

The restaurant is a symphony in white with minimalist straight backed white chairs creating a luxurious chic not often associated with Gujarati food.
Metatype: The Hotel Ilark is the new but rapidly rising star of Bhuj.
Descr: Hotel Ilark in Bhuj - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Royal Residency started out as the home of the British Resident to the Wankaner princely state in 1882. 

Built on the same grounds as the home of the royals, the Ranjit Vilas Palace, the Residency offers unrestricted and spectacular views of the Palace and of the town. 

The 12 suites of the Residency were orginally designed with particular friends of the royal family in mind, such as, the Duke of Connaught, jeweller Jacques Cartier and the father of the great Mahatma Gandhi. Most suites still bear memorabilia related to these esteemed guests. 

The Royal Residency is only used when the Royal Oasis is full.
WebWriteUp1:
The residency is an elegant single storied structure. Raj era hospitality decreed that the suites be divided into a sitting area that is separate from the bedroom. Each suite has been done up in pastel shades that set off the elegance of the brass and wrought iron four poster beds and the Victorian chintz covered chairs and sofas. Each suite also contains beautiful turn of the century dressing table and chairs in the bedroom area. 

The floors are original and beautiful patterned cement tiles. Most bathrooms feature ancient tin tubs with plumbing to match. If not this is the fragment to be used: while the rest of the bathroom fittings are in the modern style. Each suite also contains some information on the original occupant sometimes accompanied by signed correspondence. 

If you're staying at the Royal Residency a trip to the impressive Ranjit Vilas Palace and a tour of its interiors and classic car collection is essential.
Metatype: The Royal Residency started out as the home of the British Resident to the Wankaner princely state in 1882.
Descr: Royal Residency in Wankaner - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Anil Farm House is just that - a converted farm house that specializes in growing that variety of mango that is famous to this region and a variety of different flowers and vegetables. 

The Anil Farm House now offers 20 rooms of differing standards to the tourists that come eagerly to see the Asiatic Lion in this ultimate stronghold - the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary. 

Basic but large, the rooms are built to resemble 2 storey cottages overlooking the gardens and lotus ponds.
WebWriteUp1:
The hotel is situated on the banks of the river Hiran that flows past the wildlife sanctuary, thus attracting bird and wildlife to it during the summer. 

The Deluxe double rooms all have views over this river and these are the rooms we recommend. Dark polished cane has been used in the large double bed and the sofas. The walls are white interspersed with slightly tacky red painted brick. The bathrooms are well sized but a little grungy 

The verandahs offer a nice spot to lounge in, enjoying the cooling breeze from over the river and the views of the forest on the other side of it. 

The restaurant menu caters mainly to the Indian palette with dishes from Gujarat and North India. Although Continental and Chinese food can be ordered as well.
Metatype: The Anil Farm House is just that - a converted farm house that specializes in growing that variety of mango that is famous to this region and a variety of different flowers and vegetables.
Descr: Anil Farm House Balcheel in Sasangir - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Lion Safari Camp is possibly the most luxurious hotel available near the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary even though the accommodation consists of a series of sophisticated tents pitched in a well manicured garden. 

High quality Indian and Continental meals are served under the canopy of a larger tent overlooking the Hiran River. 

The camp has its own jeeps and safaris into the sanctuary.
WebWriteUp1:
21 mustard and white tents sit side by side along the garden path. Inside the beds are king sized and comfortable, and the furniture, in keeping with the lodge like feel, is made from dark, sturdy wood. The en-suite bathrooms have a tiled floor and a low wall in cheerful shades of orange and white. Each tent features a deck that extends onto the garden. These eco-friendly tents are all air conditioned. 

A Recreation Lounge with a pool table, satellite television and indoor games is available for those who want to indulge in these activities. Evening entertainment may include a bonfire and traditional Gujarati dances and folk dances by the African Siddhi community long settled in the area. There is also a souvenir shop on the resort premises.
Metatype: The Lion Safari Camp is possibly the most luxurious hotel available near the Gir Wildlife Sanctuary even though the accommodation consists of a series of sphisticated tents pitched in a well manicured garden.
Descr: Lion Safari Camp in Sasangir - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: lion safari camp, sasangir, gir, gujarat, lion sanctuary, special places, hotel
address:
Near Hiraneshwar Check dam
Taluka Talala
Distr. Junagadh

Descr: Hotel Godwin in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Gordon House Suites is that best kind of crossover hotel which combines international standards of luxury and elegance of business hotels with boutique individualism and charm. 

Set amongst 5 acres of sculpted gardens, an infinity pool, a complete spa and country club and walking trails are their nature inspired theme rooms. 

The Gordon House Suites is an extravagantly classy, self contained and escapist world that is at odds with bustling Mumbai, the "city in fast forward", that stretches outside its windows.
WebWriteUp1:
The variety of room themes is impressive  natural landforms such as the beach, the rainforest, the mountains, and the earth elements of fire or ice. Decorative materials and colours have been hand picked to illustrate the specific theme of the room. Cold glass floor bricks mark the glacier theme rooms while earthy fire baked bricks create a most unusual flooring in the fire rooms. Turquoise and aqua dominate the Marine rooms and the Rainforest rooms are a haven in deep green and wood brown. 

But in spite of the impressive interiors, the focus of each room is the glass wall that looks over the zen garden of waterfalls, fountains and shallow pools. An unknown indulgence in most city hotels, every room offers unrestricted views over and past the relaxing lagoon. 

You will find much to keep you pampered and entertained at the country club and spa that is housed with the hotel complex from a mini theatre to an outdoor Jacuzzi and a warm, Victorian library. Their restaurants cater to continental, Indian and Pan Asian tastes and you can even choose where you'd like to have your evening drink  at their slick city bar or in the warmth of the Van Gogh pub.
Metatype: The Gordon House Suites is that best kind of crossover hotel which combines international standards of luxury and elegance of business hotels with boutique individualism and charm.
Descr: Gordon House Suites in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Off International Airport Approach Road
Marol
Andheri (E)
note: Earlier Known as Gordon House Suites

description:
Nestled in the Doon Valley on the banks of the Tons River is Shaheen Bagh, the country home of an avid ornithologist and graphic designer. 

The house, with an adjoining cottage, is located on a 7-acre estate verdant with fruit orchards, and many species of exotic and rare plants and trees. 

The house and the adjacent cottage are designed in the style of a colonial country bungalow with sloping roofs, decorative 'monkey tops' and wide verandahs from where one can enjoy spectacular views of Mussoorie and the surrounding hills.
WebWriteUp1:
A 20 minute drive from the slightly soulless town of Dehra Dun is the exquisite Shaheen Bagh. Set in a thickly forested area where mountain streams flow gently and birds chirp in the sunshine, Shaheen Bagh is a destination in itself. 

Designed and built by the multi-talented husband and wife duo of Arun and Sandhya, Shaheen Bagh is a spa for the senses. The rooms and various common areas have been furnished with hand picked memorabilia and restored period furniture. Outside there are carefully cultivated fruit trees, vegetable patches, and freesias and gladioli in brilliant colours.

The seven guest rooms are housed in 2 colonial style bungalows with gabled roofs topped with ornamental finials. There are four poster beds inlaid with painted tiles or pictures, framed paintings of birds and flowers, and coloured glass panes that match the colour theme of the room. Every room has a unique feature - be it a view of the pool or cupboards covered with Sandhya's paintings. 
  
There are a number of pretty common sitting areas. The main living room has cane backed and stuffed sofas in oranges and yellows. An intricately carved wooden bracket and pillars frame a doorway and large carpets and rugs line the floors.

A terrace leading off from here is dotted with potted plants and planters chairs. And then of course, there is the garden - verdant with fruit trees, medicinal plants and vegetables that are organically grown and used in the home cooked meals.

The small pool is fed by the river that borders the property. 

The hosts are generous with their personal collection of books, magazines and movies and there is also a computer with an internet connection available.
Metatype: Nestled in the Doon Valley on the banks of the Tons River is Shaheen Bagh, the country home of an avid ornithologist and graphic designer.
Descr: Shaheen Bagh in Dehra Dun - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shaheen bagh, colonial, country, bungalow, hotel, dehra dun, special places

description:
The Infinity Lodge offers tented accommodation in one of the important birding areas of Gujarat. 

Their sophisticated tents are beige coloured and warm and the furniture inside is of a dark, classic variety. 

The Infinity Lodge also houses a small swimming pool and a recreation room with indoor games and satellite television. 

The restaurant serves up multi cuisine food of both, the vegetarian and non vegetarian variety. 

The Lodge also arranges for naturalists to guide you on the bird life in the area.
WebWriteUp1:
The 16 tents sit in a semi circle around the swimming pool. A fairly sanitized version of the usual tented camp experience, these tents have half concrete walls with a tent cloth covering. But on the upside, they are that much more comfortable with tiled bathrooms and a shower. All the tents are also air conditioned.

While the Lodge might be the most comfortable accommodation in Moti Virani it is disappointing that they do not employ experienced inn house naturalists and this may adversely affect your bird watching experience.
Metatype: The Infinity Lodge offers tented accommodation in one of the important birding areas of Gujarat.
Descr: Infinity Lodge in Moti Virani - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Sarovar Portico is an archetypal small business hotel. 

The rooms do have a certain elegance and warmth. Their multi-cuisine restaurant prefers serving up buffet meals that appeal to the local taste buds. 

The hotel does meet international hotel standards and your stay is thus sure to be comfortable even if not memorable.
WebWriteUp1:
The Sarovar Portico offers a wide range of rooms but we recommend the Deluxe Rooms which offer the best value for money along with muted furnishings and soft lighting and also often offer a view over the Sabarmati River on whose bank the hotel is located. The rooms' walls are lined with prints and paintings and aside from the study table there is also a pair of comfortable chairs to relax in. The bathrooms are clean, modern and marbled. 

The food consists mainly of various local vegetarian dishes and a meat dish placed discreetly at a different table so as not to offend local sensibilities. The view from the restaurant windows is quite nice as it overlooks the lawns and the river further away and so all in all the dining experience is likely to be pleasant.

Your fellow guests at the hotel are most likely to be corporate incentive groups and marriage parties who are likely to be a bunch of fairly lively merrymakers. A positive fallout of this however is that there is a liquor store on the hotel premises and so the process of getting a liquor permit and alcohol is made easy.
Metatype: The Sarovar Portico is an archetypal small business hotel.
Descr: Sarovar Portico in Ahmedabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This creamy yellow and forest green villa is built on the same grounds as the imposing Nilambagh Palace hotel. 

In fact the Narayani Heritage bungalow was initially used to house the administrative offices of the Maharaja of Bhavnagar and later as a boy's school.

Finally it was converted into a small hotel offering the large, light and simply furnished rooms. 

The guests also have access to the recreational facilities of the palace next door and thus guests here can indulge in a cooling swim or sweat it out on the tennis court or in their up to date gymnasium.
WebWriteUp1:
All the air conditioned, modern rooms are built around the sunny central courtyard of this villa, thus letting in much light and fresh air. The rooms all feature a large bed, a sitting area and a dressing area. The furniture is mostly classy wrought iron or modern light wood. The bathrooms are well sized with running hot and cold water. 

Breakfast is served in the inner dining area but a la carte dinners are provided in the garden restaurant of the Nilambagh Palace which serves up local and Continental cuisine. 

The large faux Roman swimming pool can be quite inviting after a hot day of tramping through Bhavnagar's bazaars or after the long climb up and down from the beautiful Jain temples in the nearby town of Palitana. 

The late evenings however, are probably best enjoyed in the paved inner courtyard of your hotel or on one of the various smaller verandahs it offers.
Metatype: This creamy yellow and forest green villa is built on the same grounds as the imposing Nilambagh Palace hotel.
Descr: Narayani Heritage in Bhavnagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Situated in the heart of the old `Ville Blanche' (white town) of French Pondicherry, at 5 Rue de la Caserne, is one of Indias most striking designer hotels.

Constructed in the 18th century as the residence of the Mayor of Pondicherry, the building stands white and majestic on an important corner of the French town. 

It is located just a few blocks from the shimmering waters of the Indian Ocean and Pondicherry's famous leafy park. 

The central shopping district is just around the corner, too, as are a number of restaurants and coffee shops.
WebWriteUp1:
The journey into the past starts as soon as you reach the wooden gate, one of the oldest in Pondicherry, made famous in numerous paintings and photos of the colonial era. As you open the gate you enter an atmospheric courtyard, the heart of the restored building, and discover a slice of Old France meticulously renovated to create a modern hotel.

The old building was completely refinished with a traditional lime plaster known as "Chettinad Egg Plaster." In this process, walls are covered with layer after layer of a thin coating of egg white, powdered sea shells and yogurt. Each layer is polished by hand, and the result is a uniquely smooth and soft texture.

The exquisite woodwork, perhaps the best example of French Indian carved woodwork in Pondicherry, is all original, recovered from the house of Joseph Francois Dupleix, which used to stand on the old Nehru Street. Dupleix was the greatest of the Generals and Governers of French India. During his tenure, the French were the dominant power in South India and the British were contained to Madras.

The original building has been expanded, and the hotel has been modernised with the use of materials such as glass and metal to create a delicate mix of modernity and tradition. This mix offers the warmth of the old, but at the same time ensures that the hotel is comfortable and efficient, equipped with Internet connections, mini bars, room service, and imported bathtubs and fittings. It is in this harmony between the traditional and modern that Le Dupleix exists not just as another heritage hotel, but as a unique and striking designer hotel.

The hotel has 14 elegant suites, each with its own character. No two rooms are alike. Every detail has a purpose. The result is a hotel that surprises at every turn.
Metatype: Situated in the heart of the old `Ville Blanche' (white town) of French Pondicherry, at 5 Rue de la Caserne, is one of Indias most striking designer hotels.
Descr: Le Dupleix in Pondicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Michel and Sabine Thierry run the Coloniale Heritage guest house located on a quiet tree lined street.
 
Michel's family home is now a 6 roomed guest house with a pocket sized garden and lots of open spaces. 

Colourful terracotta statues of gods of all shapes and sizes sit on the antique carved wood tables, blue globes hang from the ceiling and stained glass windows tint the sunlight.
WebWriteUp1:
All the rooms have an unpolished charm, but each is different, decorated more like a home than a hotel. The rooms are in various shapes and sizes so one room may have a small private courtyard while another has a balcony and a third has a huge old fashioned swing. 

But most have capacious heavily carved wooden beds, hand painted lampshades, gauzy mosquito netting and original bathrooms. While the rooms are all air conditioned and have private bathrooms and are enormously comfortable, be prepared for the unexpected and whimsical. 

There are rustic benches in a courtyard of palms, and an upstairs terrace full of potted flowers and plants that attracts birds, squirrels and butterflies alike.

The Coloniale Heritage serves breakfast. For other meals you can choose one of the many roadside cafes you will find as you stroll down to the sea front two streets away.
Metatype: Michel and Sabine Thierry run the Coloniale Heritage guest house located on a quiet tree lined street.
Descr: Coloniale Heritage in Pondicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: coloniale heritage, pondicherry, hotel, guest house, special places

description:
A chic, modern, boutique-style hotel overlooking the Bay of Bengal. the Bay of Bengal. The towns ancient French quarter - with its colonial villas - leafy parks and attractive cafes - are just a block away.

The rooms are simple sophistication. Blank white walls and large amounts of sunlight ensure that the rooms are filled with zingy light to which the wood paneling and floor add dollops of warmth. 

Eat outside on the roof while watching the waves play in the dying light or dine in the formal indoor restaurant. Their relaxed, low tabled lounge bar is where you head for a sundowner cocktail or a night cap.
WebWriteUp1:
While the gentle lines and dignified facade of The Promenade's exterior is a product of French neo-classicism, its interiors are cutting edge chic: neat wood paneled floors, leather chairs and headboards in red, grey and blue, walls lined with modern art and sharp stainless steel fittings. 

But all this hip modernity is relaxed by the breeze that moves through the hotel and the tall French windows that can be thrown open to reveal vast views of the ocean. Linger in the pool, stroll down the long promenade and eat sophisticated sea food on the rooftop. 

Since the hotel is located slap bang on the beautiful esplanade that lines Pondy's coast, it would be a shame to be stuck in a room with no access to that gorgeous view. So we recommend the Sea Facing Rooms that are slightly more expensive and not very different from their Deluxe Rooms but well worth the extra moolah for the feeling of opening those louvered French windows in the morning to the grey green waters.

The gardens are designer too and comfortable cane chairs invite you to laze in the sun. The pool is small but charming, set within a grey stone courtyard.
Metatype: A chic, modern, boutique-style hotel overlooking the Bay of Bengal. the Bay of Bengal. The towns ancient French quarter - with its colonial villas - leafy parks and attractive cafes - are just a block away.
Descr: The Promenade in Pondicherry - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This recently renovated hotel was originally built by the Wodeyars and has considerable old world charm. 

Built to house the Maharaja's esteemed British guests, the building now consists of smaller, standardized rooms that nevertheless still bear the graceful writing desks, claw-foot bathtubs and winged armchairs of yesteryear.
WebWriteUp1:
Part of the small boutique and Royal Orchid heritage hotel chain, the Hotel Metropole combines old world charm with the luxuries of the 21st century. 

The spacious Heritage Rooms have textured walls, regal beds, and access to a sit out or verandah. There are also soft green leather and zebra print chairs to relax in.

The main dining area is the Tiger Trails restaurant replete with hunting trophies of tigers and delicately etched Venetian mirrors. There is also a garden restaurant for moonlight barbecues. A modern bar offers G&T's, a Scotch on the Rocks and other favourites of the British Raj.  

There is also a gym and a jogging track, Yoga classes, a visit by an astrologer and vintage car rides can be arranged.

The large gardens ensure that the hotel is always suffused in gentle, yellow light and the flower shaped swimming pool is a delight.
Metatype: This recently renovated hotel was originally built by the Wodeyars and has considerable old world charm.
Descr: Royal Orchid Metropole Hotel in Mysore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: royal orchid metropole hotel, mysore, karnataka, special places

description:
A pretty country house set amongst endless acres of tea gardens and private forest, the White Haven Estate is a short 15 minute drive from Upper Dharamsala's temples and bazaars. 

It is perfect for travellers who wish to add the experience of living on a small tea estate to their visit to Dharamsala.

White Haven was built in the mid 19th century by intrepid British travellers. It was recently converted into a high end hideaway by its present owners.
WebWriteUp1:
This decidedly English country house is set in large gardens. Blues and greys dominate the insides and beautiful, age-smoothed wood covers the floors. There are a number of cosy common areas - all warmed by a crackling wood fire in a stone fireplace in the winters. There are rooms in the main building of the house as well as in a separate cottage, both equally charming.

The furniture is dark and elegant and the furnishings and d�cor refined. A chintz settee here, an art deco dressing table set there; the mood is urbane and sophisticated. Dove grey carpets are sometimes laid upon the wooden floor and there is often a dry dressing area. Most rooms have large windows or small terraces facing the snow peaks of the Dauladhar mountains.

Meals are served in an intimate wooden dining area. The menu is extensive and divided into Indian, Chinese and Continental (chicken and onion pie!) meals. The lawns and terraces command a fabulous view of the valley below and offer peace and solitude, much needed after browsing the shops of Upper Dharamsala.

If you're interested in learning more about the tea growing in the estate, you can visit the Mann Tea Factory. An extremely well ordered and organised place, the Mann Tea Factory produces White, Black, Oolong and Green tea and it is possible to observe the different stages of tea  production.
Metatype: A pretty country house set amongst endless acres of tea gardens and private forest, the White Haven Estate is a short 15 minute drive from Upper Dharamsala's temples and bazaars.
Descr: White Haven Estate in Dharamsala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: white haven estate, dharamsala, himachal pradesh, hotel, special places

Descr: Hotel Clarks Shiraz in Agra - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Hotel Aroma Palace in Chamba - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Padmini Nivas consists of a series of green roofed cottages, spread over a hill sloping down from Mussoorie's main Mall Road. 

The main house of Padmini Niwas is the most picturesque. The wide chequered floored verandah is where guests usually gather for morning tea and hot, buttered toast.

The restaurant offers possibly the best food in town - wholesome vegetarian food served in a high ceilinged dining room.
WebWriteUp1:
Originally named Rushbrooke Estate, the property was passed on to the Maharaja of Rajpipla who gifted it to his wife, Maharani Padmini.

Simple brown carpets line the floors and antique wooden furniture brings a touch of elegance to the large rooms. There are deep armchairs or long divans in which to relax. Sunlight streams in from the painted windows that look out upon the green slopes. The bathrooms are all in white, and are clean and functional. 

The rooms are set apart from each other, creating a tranquility that harks back to Mussoorie's days as a place of convalescence for British soldiers. 
  
The pretty lawn adjoining the main house overlooks the Mussoorie hills and the city of Dehra Dun in the valley below. Even a slight drizzle can cause the dust in the air to settle, revealing sparkling skies and a night time view of the valley filled with twinkling lights. 

There is also a small library and an austere formal sitting room in the main house. The restaurant is usually busy at meal times with guests eager to tuck into a "thali" consisting of the specialties of the day. But if you feel the need for a change, you only have to stroll up the slope and down the Mall.
Metatype: Padmini Nivas consists of a series of green roofed cottages, spread over a hill sloping down from Mussoorie's main Mall Road.
Descr: Padmini Niwas in Mussoorie - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: padmini niwas, hotel, mussoorie, cottages, himalaya, special places

description:
Norling Guesthouse is located within the Norbulingka Institute in Lower Dharamsala and is a short 20 minute drive from McLeodganj. 

A small 10 room guesthouse, Norling is an intimate place which provides access to the various sacred and traditional art forms of Thangka painting, applique work and wood and metal work that are practised in the institute.
WebWriteUp1:
Located at the end of a quiet lane and set within a serene Japanese garden against the backdrop of timeless, snow covered mountains, the guesthouse is a low, single storey building. Some rooms look out over the garden, others have a sit out behind the rooms. 
  
The rooms are simpler than those of its more flamboyant cousin, the Chonor House. Done up in a purer, more reflective style, the rooms are mostly white with coloured Tibetan symbols in applique on bedspreads and carpets. Teak furniture graces the rooms. Hand carved lamps bear traditional designs and cast the room with a warm glow as evening approaches. 
  
You will probably spend a lot of the time walking around the Institute, watching the artists bending over their work and chatting animatedly, or looking at the dolls in the Losel Museum that are used to illustrate daily scenes of life in Tibet, including scenes from Tibetan opera. You might also choose to spend time in the relaxing garden, with the sounds of the murmuring stream in the background. 

Here, at the Norling Guesthouse, you can sample the subtle and unusual flavours of traditional Tibetan food. The truth is this gueshouse is in fact a retreat, allowing you to unwind and immerse yourself in the gentle Tibetan way of life.
Metatype: Norling Guesthouse is located within the Norbulingka Institute in Lower Dharamsala and is a short 20 minute drive from McLeodganj.
Descr: Norling Guest House Norbulingka in Dharamsala - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: norling guesthouse norbulingka, dharamsala,hotel, tibetan culture, himachal

description:
The Sarin's family cottages, built with blue mountain stone and knotted pine, are surrounded by tea bushes and pine forest and offer you peace and privacy the Himalayan way. 

The guesthouse consists of basic stone cottages and timber huts. However, the rooms are immensely comfortable with a simple, earthy feel. 

The highlight is the restorative coolness of the surroundings, and the fresh Himalayan air.
WebWriteUp1:
Topped with steeply tapering slate roofs, these pleasant cottages are on the small side but are tastefully furnished in a country style. The beds are adorned with cheerful Indian print covers, the odd antique writing desk and large windows to allow captivating glimpses of the hillside. A private sit out overlooks the terraced tea bushes and has long armed planter's chairs in which to relax.  

Rose bushes, tall eucalyptus trees and pink wreathed cherry blossoms fill the gardens. The food is the wholesome food of the mountain people, and there is also a selection of local wines to accompany the salads and chicken and fish dishes. It is very pleasant to sit around a table in the cosy, home-like atmosphere of the dining room with its grey stone walls, warmed by the fire that crackles merrily in the colder months. 

You can stroll around the nearby tea estates. Traffic is minimal here as the only other residents are the soldiers of the army cantonment area. Mr. Sarin, an avid angler and trekker, is a knowledgeable and welcoming host, full of ideas for activities around the estate.
Metatype: The Sarin's family cottages, built with blue mountain stone and knotted pine, are surrounded by tea bushes and pine forest and offer you peace and privacy the Himalayan way.
Descr: Country Cottage in Palampur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: country cottage, palampur, tea, himachal pradesh, special places

Descr: HPTDC Tea Bud in Palampur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Situated midway between the twin bridges of Rishikesh, the High Bank Peasant's Cottage is a comfortable and unpretentious guest house. 

Housing only a handful of rooms and surrounded by residences, the hotel offers clean, well kept rooms that are good value for money. 

The rooftop restaurant overlooks the serene Ganges and is the perfect spot for breakfast. The staff is friendly and welcoming and the hotel also offers ayurvedic oil massages.
WebWriteUp1:
A functional three storey building, the High Bank Peasant's Cottage has rooms fitted with only the basic amenities and not much more. However, the beds are soft, the rooms clean and the bathrooms well sized with hot and cold showers. There is a verandah with easy chairs and the rooftop terrace is accessible all day.  
  
The food is home made and vegetarian. Yellow daal, mixed vegetables being the staple fare. Their breakfasts can be a bit more varied and perhaps one of your most enjoyable moments will be eating a large bowl of fresh fruit watching the Ganges twist and turn in the early morning sunshine. 
  
There is a neat garden surrrounding the hotel, dotted with palms and flowered hedges and dominated by a tall cactus. There are German bakeries, shops and bookstores clustered together within easy distance since this is the happy hippy corner of Rishikesh.
Metatype: Situated midway between the twin bridges of Rishikesh, the High Bank Peasant's Cottage is a comfortable and unpretentious guest house.
Descr: High Bank Peasants Cottage in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Tapovan
Laxam Jhula Bye Pass 
Tapovan Sarai 
Tehri Garhwal

description:
A medium sized, contemporary hotel, the Milan Palace has well trained staff and comfortable, well appointed rooms. Although a modern hotel, the rooms and common areas have been furnished with imagination and taste. 

There is a sunny breakfast cafe and a hip, cheerful restaurant. The hotel offers all the services you could expect of a moderate hotel - 24 hour room service, same day laundry, wireless internet access, etc.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms at Hotel Milan Palace have been decorated in differing styles. Some are in greens and browns, with curvaceous furniture which is the traditional favourite of Indian hotels, others have sleek edged furniture in glossy black and monochromatic prints. The rooms are good sized with soft concealed lighting, and have a television, telephone and air conditioning and the bathrooms are clean. 
  
There is a cafe and pastry shop where the substantial breakfast is served. The main restaurant has tomato orange walls covered with gold framed prints and paintings, and classy black and white chairs. The restaurant serves Indian, Chinese and Continental food. There is also a youthful and energetic pub downstairs that plays loud rock music.
Metatype: A medium sized, contemporary hotel, the Milan Palace has well trained staff and comfortable, well appointed rooms. Although a modern hotel, the rooms and common areas have been furnished with imagination and taste.
Descr: Hotel Milan Palace in Allahabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel milan palace, allahabad, ganges river, uttar pradesh, special places
address:
Govind Tower 4/2
Strachy Road
Civil Lines

Descr: Capoors Hotel Bar & Restaurant in Lucknow - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
The Richmond Hotel in Bangalore - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Orange County - Kabini is built in authentic tribal village style. Each palm-thatched hut at the resort comes fitted with all the luxuries you could hope for including a plunge pool or Jacuzzi in a private, open-to-the-sky courtyard.

Orange County Resort is situated in the heart of the tribal area of the Nagarhole forest and is surrounded on three sides by the Kabini river. The Nagarhole forest supports the highest density of herbivores in Asia.
WebWriteUp1:
This superb resort is built like a tribal village, with huts of thatch and mud walls. The interiors though are pure luxury with modern conveniences married happily to traditional aesthetics. 

A large infinity pool borders the lake seamlessly, creating an astoundingly beautiful scene. There is a large semi-open Reading lounge with far reaching views and an Ayurvedic spa. 

The Jacuzzi huts have private Jacuzzi in an open-to-the-sky courtyard. There is a spacious living area complete with a cozy dining table and a small pantry. The bedroom has romantic net-draped beds, and the bathrooms have glass enclosed shower stalls and a separate bathtub.

The even plusher pool huts have their own small swimming pools in free form, a large living area and wonderfully appointed bathrooms. 

All rooms offer delightful views over the Kabini river banks and private decks/patios to enjoy them from.
Metatype: Orange County - Kabini is built in authentic tribal village style. Each palm-thatched hut at the resort comes fitted with all the luxuries you could hope for including a plunge pool or Jacuzzi in a private, open-to-the-sky courtyard.
Descr: Orange County - Kabini in Nagarhole - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: orange county, kabini, river, lodge, nagarhole, luxury, hotel, wildlife sanctuary
address:
Bheeramballi Village and Post
H. D. Kote Taluk
Mysore District

description:
Set amongst coffee, cardamom and pepper plantations, the Green Hills Estate is a stately old mansion dating back to 1898. The residence was built for the Diwan (Prime Minister) of Kodagu. 

The mansion is surrounded by shady canopies of raintrees, coconuts, slender Areca palms and mature teak and mahogany trees.
WebWriteUp1:
The gracious interiors have the rustic charm of a Planter's home, with large verandahs to enjoy the views or read a book. There is a treasure trove of perosnal memorabilia making guests feel at home. 

The suites here are named after prize winning horses which Mr Chengappa, its current owner, raced on the courses of Banglore and Madras. 
 
En route to the Green Hills Estate you cross the Cauvery river, which flows five kilometres from the property, and pass coffee and rubber plantations, and forests full of giant bamboo. The neighbouring Nagarhole Wildlife Sanctuary shelters a well preserved habitat of the Asian elephant, the tiger, the spotted deer and the mighty Gaur (Bison).
Metatype: Set amongst coffee, cardamom and pepper plantations, the Green Hills Estate is a stately old mansion dating back to 1898. The residence was built for the Diwan (Prime Minister) of Kodagu.
Descr: Green Hills Estate in Virajpet - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Krishna Palace Hotel in Hospet makes a good base from which to explore the world famous monuments of Hampi which is just a short drive away. 

The large marble lobby is furnished with carved wooden furniture to give the hotel a palatial feel. The rooms are large and comfortable with modern bathrooms. There is an all day multi-cuisine restaurant and a well stocked bar. The hotel also has a swimming pool.
WebWriteUp1:
The Krishna Palace is centrally airconditioned and offers 72 rooms, all furnished with cable television, mini-bars and wi-fi enabled work desks. The beds are comfortable with good quality linen. The colours in the room are warm and rich. 

The Krishna Palace makes for an ideal base for the guests who like a bit of luxury and is only a short drive from the sights of Hampi. Apart from the multi cuisine restaurant and bar that Krishna Palace offers, it also has a swimming pool, welcome after a day of sightseeing of the monuments.
Metatype: This brand new hotel is the best in Hospet and makes a good base from which to explore the world famous monuments of Hampi.
Descr: Krishna Palace in Hospet - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: krishna palace, hospet, hampi, hotel, karnataka, special places

description: Across the river from Hampi, in the heritage village of Anegundi, is a small but prettily landscaped boutique property called Shama's Cottages. The attractive cottages look out onto the lawn, and are distinctively furnished using local fabrics. There is a restaurant serving excellent local dishes, and the friendly staff can take guests for a stroll around the village to see the various other eco-tourism initiatives which the owners of the hotel are involved in, such as a school, library, weaving centre, and craft centre. Mountain bikes are available to explore the surrounding villages and temples, or the ruins of Hampi.
WebWriteUp1:
Shama's Cottages are a cluster of village homes with either two or three bedrooms, each with clean toilets. The furnishings are sparse and the fabrics used are all locally sourced. Under the shade of old trees, the cottages are built exactly like the village houses, with sloping roofs and cloth canopy. 

The staff is all from the village, and the nearby Community Centre is a wonderful place to see the villagers at work. The craft shop showcases the handicrafts made by the community. There is also a library and computers for youngsters. You will find them eager to talk to you and exchange stories.  

From here, a delightful coracle ride will take you across the river to Hampi's monuments. There are also cycles for hire to explore the beautiful surroundings.
Metatype: Across the river from Hampi, in the heritage village of Anegundi, is a small but prettily landscaped boutique hotel called Shama's Cottages.
Descr: Shamas Cottages in Hampi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: shama's cottages, hampi, anegundi, village, karnataka, special places

Descr: The Kurumba Village Resort in Coonoor - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Ooty Mettupalayam Road
(between the 4rth and 5rth hairpin bend)
Hill Grove Post
Kurumbadi

description:
The Lemon Tree is a 4 star business hotel with a difference. Gone are the beiges and greens that business hotels use ad nauseum and stiff upper lip service is replaced with a smilingly efficient staff. 

If the whites and cheerful lemon yellows of their lobby and the blue of their enormous swimming pool isn't enough to convince you, by the time you get to your stylish wood paneled, sun filled room with a pool view, you will be sold on Lemon Tree's light hearted, full service hotel concept.
WebWriteUp1:
The Lemon Tree Aurangabad is all about providing you with comfort efficiently, cost effectively and cheerfully.

The serene white of the lobby continues into the corridors and rooms. But while the corridors are fairly bare, in the rooms this white is used as a canvas against which to splash turquoise, red and green. The light coloured wood used in the furniture is subtly lit by muted lighting. There are bold tribal and modern art paintings on the walls with an unconventional display of swirls and nature motifs. 

However, there is nothing neither rural nor experimental about their orthopaedic mattresses and fine linen. I am proudly informed that these are the same as those provided to the guests of the uber posh Taj hotels.

The extra facilities that this self proclaimed "moderate price category hotel" offers are impressive.  A fairly unexciting multi cuisine restaurant opens up on to a more relaxed, cane chaired tea lounge adjoining the pool. Their sports bar cum pub or the 'Slounge' is decorated with action figures and houses a bar with an award winning bar tender and a play station. Their glass walled gym is wrapped by the blue waters of the pool and the spa offers Swedish and Thai massages as well as beauty treatments.
Metatype: The Lemon Tree is a 4 star business hotel with a difference. Gone are the beiges and greens that business hotels use ad nauseum and stiff upper lip service is replaced with a smilingly efficient staff.
Descr: Lemon Tree Hotel, Aurangabad in Aurangabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
An ultra-stylish beach resort, hidden behind one of the most beautiful beaches in the far north of Goa.

Yab Yum (meaning "the union of one") is a peaceful resort consisting of domed and thatched creations surrounded by coconut trees.

With its exciting shapes and colours, the resort has its own unique style that defies label. This may well be the most memorable beach resort you have ever been to.
WebWriteUp1:
Interlinked palm covered domes make for an imaginative bedroom with attached facilities. Windows and skylights allow the sea breezes to cool the room. More cooling is provided by electric fans. 

The beds are large sized and have romantic canopies of netting. The rooms are spacious enough to also have benches for lounging. The bathrooms have hot and cold running water with delightful rain showers. 

The dining area is a palm thatched pavilion overlooking the vast beach and the sea. Much of the produce is from the resort's own eco-farm a short drive away.
Metatype: An ultra-sylish beach resort, hidden behind one of the most beautiful beaches in the far north of Goa.
Descr: Yab Yum Resort in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: yab yum beach resort, ashvem, mandrem, goa, modules, tours, hotel

description:
A quiet and elegant beach retreat, this is an oasis of peace close to the bright lights of North Goa's busiest beach resorts.

With a handful of rooms in an elegant low rise building, this new resort has classic Portuguese furniture - four poster beds, elegant armchairs and balconies overlooking the pool or the gardens. 

The famous Calangute beach is a mere 5 minute walk away.
WebWriteUp1:
Nestled in one of those rare quiet corners of Calangute, a large formal garden surrounds the small resort. 

There is a swimming pool, and above all, there is peace to curl up with a good book.

There is a mind boggling choice of restaurants and little bars nearby. 

Anjuna with its Wednesday market, and the famous Arpora Saturday night markets are just a short drive away.
Metatype: A quiet and elegant beach retreat, this is an oasis of peace close to the bright lights of North Goa's busiest beach resorts.
Descr: Casa Severina in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: casa  severina, calangute, goa, beach, special places, hotel

Near St. Anthonys Chapel
