description:
The Johnson Hotel and Cafe is a century old institution in Manali. The older part of the hotel, which houses the cottages, was built back in the early 1900's by Colonel Johnson and even today the hotel and cafe is owned and run by his descendents.

The cottages have a wooden porch and balcony and are furnished in the English country style. Their speciality trout restaurant is, however, the crowd puller.
WebWriteUp1:
The cottages here are set in a sunny garden, a little away from the main building. Designed for families, they have a dining area, a small living room and 2 bedrooms each. Sunlight pours in from the windows and well stuffed, gingham armchairs sit around in an inviting circle ready to receive guests and friends. The bedrooms are large with attached bathrooms in pink and green. Complete with a small kitchenette with pot and pans, these cottages are designed to make you feel at home.

The newer building holds both the restaurant and the rooms. Low, wooden beds dominate these rooms and there are chairs and sofas as well. The floors are wooden with colourful carpets thrown over them. The bathrooms are well sized.
 
The gardens here feature pansies and marigolds, a cabbage patch and rustic stone benches under a shady tree. You'll often see the owner, Piya, bending over the flowers, pruning and cutting. 

The cafe spills out onto this sunny lawn and serves the best food in Manali. Breakfasts include pancakes, waffles and cheese plates (try the local Himalayan cheese!) but the house speciality is undeniably their grilled trout; drizzled with olive oil and herbs. 

Their winter menu also offers spiced apple toddies and their home made plum juice and to finish the meal - chocolate cake with walnut sauce!
Metatype: The Johnson Hotel and Cafe is a century old Manali institution. The older part of the hotel, which houses the cottages, was built back in the early 1900's by Colonel Johnson and even today the hotel and cafe. is owned and run by his descendents.
Descr: Johnson Hotel & Jimmy Johnson Lodge in Manali - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: johnson hotel, jimmy johnson lodge, manali, hotel, cottages, himachal
note: 253023 number can be connected to the clients rooms

Descr: Hotel Thamala Haveli in Udaipur - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: An attractive sandstone building, of traditional Jaisalmer architecture, just 1km to the south of Jaisalmer's fort, this is a simple but relaxing place. The rooms are pleasantly decorated using bright colours, and the rooftop restaurant is great place to unwind while enjoying the spectacular views of the Fort.
Descr: Hotel Fifu in Jaisalmer - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A contemporary style resort a short distance away from chattering crowds of Shimla's Mall Road, Eastbourne Resorts boasts of having the largest hotel rooms in the city. 

However, neither overwhelmingly large nor impersonal and plasticky, this is hotel with a lot of class and character of its own, built like a group  of stone cottages with pointed roofs. 

Rooms look out upon the fragrant rose garden below and beyond, to the conical heads of oak and pine trees extending down the hill slopes.
WebWriteUp1:
Its large rooms face the sun and tall pines and their interiors are elegant with gleaming dark wood floors and furniture. Large beds dominate the rooms and lean against soft, white headboards and muted lighting is reflected in glass topped tables. Their bathrooms are a bit on the small side but immensely stlylish - white Italian marble, hidden lighting, and showers with about 15 different knobs. Rooms are provided with tea and coffee makers so that you can still laze around the rooms in your pyjamas while you enjoy that first cup of tea or coffee. 

But the breakfast buffet is tempting enough to get you downstairs soon enough - seasonal fresh fruits and a choice of Indian and Continental  items are on display, along with freshly brewed tea and coffee. Breakfast is served in the formal, sunshine flooded indoor restaurant where lunch and dinner is also served. There are however 2 terraced restaurants also, one which serves up bar-be-qued snacks under a starry sky.

Being a resort they are fairly serious about the spa and gym facilities they offer. While there is already a Kerala Ayurvedic Health Spa in place, offering not just massage therapies but beauty treatments as well, and they plan to add a heated indoor pool and a couple to massage tubs as well.
Metatype: A contemporary style resort a short distance away from chattering crowds of Shimla's Mall Road, Eastbourne Resorts boasts of having the largest hotel rooms in the city.
Descr: East Bourne Resort in Shimla - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Eastbourne, Near Bishop cotton School
Khallini

description:
The Himalayan Hideaway is tucked away in a bend of a road which leads away from the busy town of Rishikesh towards the hills.

Consisting of a group of stone cottages, there are only 10 rooms, each  carefully designed to offer space and privacy to guests. Each room has a sit-out with views of the river or forest. 

The eco garden and the indigenous style of architecture attest to the owners deep love of the land and the desire to restrict their impact on it.
WebWriteUp1:
The cottages are large and airy, with rough stone floors - terracotta coloured in the bedrooms and smooth black in the bathrooms. The simple beds covered with colourful hand block printed sheets. A scarred wood chest and writing table and chair complete the bedroom. The bathrooms are deliberately kept simple but have modern fittings. 

The balconies and verandahs are best enjoyed in the cool mornings with a steaming hot cup of tea or coffee. The sounds of the forest are also most easily heard at this time, and guests have caught glimpses of barking deer and jungle fowl. 

Food is usually served buffet style in the large dining area, although on occasion there is an outdoor barbeque and bonfire. A small thatched hut is used as an outdoor massage room. You can walk down to the river's edge to watch the brightly coloured river rafts make their way across the rapids, or the staff can recommend trails for birdwatching and easy walks in the forest.
Metatype: The Himalayan Hideaway is tucked away in a bend of a road which leads away from the busy town of Rishikesh towards the hills.
Descr: Himalayan Hideaway in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: himalayan hideaway, hotel, rishikesh, ganges, rafting, special places
address:
Village Kalthari
P.O. Shivpuri
Tehri Gharwal

description:
A labour of love for Steve Dunjey and his architect wife Trupti, the Rainforest House is a small boutique guesthouse on the banks of the grey waters of the Ganges. 

They have created a property that disturbed very little of the intrinsic beauty of their forested piece of land, bordered by the Shivalik hills on one side and the swiftly flowing Ganges on the other. 

The rooms use forest colours of deep green and brown and have a rustic charm.
WebWriteUp1:
With just 9 rooms, Rainforest House is a small intimate guesthouse. Rough stone walls contrast with smooth red floors; lazy canvas chairs invite you to relax. Large, neatly made up beds, and corner bookcases lend a homely air to the rooms. The upstairs rooms have private sit outs that overlook the garden below. 

The common area is a raised platform with wispy curtains billowing in the breeze, furnished with squashy cushions. This open air area becomes magical at night as you enjoy a vegetarian meal on slatted wooden patio furniture. There is a small courtyard garden graced by a shady mango tree. 

The rooms have air conditioning but no televisions or telephones; Steve and Trupti are keen that guests to appreciate the natural beauty of the surroundings, best enjoyed by making your way back down the narrow rocky path that leads to the hotel. You end up at a large grey boulder by the river called "jumping rock", from where you can plunge right into the waters.
Metatype: A labour of love for Steve Dunjey and his architect wife Trupti, the Rainforest House is a small boutique guesthouse on the banks of the grey waters of the Ganges.
Descr: Rainforest House in Rishikesh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: rainforest house, hotel, homestay, rishikesh, ganges, special places

description:
Located at a few minutes walk from the bazaar, Hotel City Heart is modern and well maintained. 

Some rooms offer good views of the grassy maidan that forms the centre of Chamba, and of the mountains beyond. 

The restaurant is probably the only dining option in town and is located in a simple dining room with large windows overlooking the city.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are the best kept in Chamba, well sized and with large beds and a well appointed bathroom. The curtains and upholstery tends to be of the shiny, tasseled variety but the sheets are clean. There are sofas and armchairs in the rooms as well as a writing table and a television with international channels. 
  
The bathrooms have been recently renovated and are clean and cheerful.
  
Most of the little town's attractions are within walking distance of the hotel and one can even see the beehive like spire of the city temple from the hotel.
Metatype: Located at a few minutes walk from the bazaar, Hotel City Heart is modern and well maintained.
Descr: Hotel City Heart in Chamba - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel city heart, chamba, himachal pradesh, special  places, himalaya

description:
An extremely comfortable 4 star hotel, the Comfort Inn Lucknow is located in the quiet residential area of Gomti Nagar. Its rooms have been recently refurbished, giving the hotel a new, clean feel.  There is a pleasant rooftop restaurant.
 
The rooms now have a sleek, contemporary feel, with clean lined dark wood furniture and muted tones of brown and grey. Zebra striped cushions enliven the rooms, and sunlight streams in from the large square windows.
WebWriteUp1:
Being a business hotel, Comfort Inn offers such services as a travel desk, a business centre, and a mini-bar and tea/coffee maker in the rooms.
 
The rooftop restaurant serves a buffet breakfast out on the terrace, and lunch and dinner in the enclosed section. The menu includes Indian, Chinese and Continental food. There is also a coffee shop.
Metatype: An extremely comfortable 4 star hotel, the Comfort Inn Lucknow is located in the quiet residential area of Gomti Nagar. Its rooms have been recently refurbished, giving the hotel a new, clean feel.  There is a pleasant rooftop restaurant.

description:
The Tea Bungalow is a restored colonial villa, close to Fort Cochin's spice district. It is a great mix of contempory style and colour with elements of Fort Cochin's heritage.

The hotel has ten spacious air-conditioned bedrooms and plenty of space in communal areas. There is indoor or outdoor dining, a patio area with sunbeds and a decent swimming pool and upstairs also boasts a large residents lounge and veranda.
WebWriteUp1:
The bungalow was built in 1912 and run as a workshop and office of a UK Company called United Carpets engaged in the manufacture and export of coir and spices. Brooke Bond, the tea company, bought the bungalow in 1956 and christened it Brooke Bond Bungalow which housed the top management of Brooke Bond & Company. Dignitaries used this bungalow for important meetings. 

By the time it was sold again, some 50 years later, it was empty and semi-derelict. A 2-year restoration followed, and in 2009 it re-emerged as a small heritage hotel. Its history of spice and tea brought about its new avatar - Tea Bungalow. 

Tea Bungalow has 10 large en-suite rooms each named after a port involved in spice and tea trading from lands around the Indian Ocean. The rooms are named Cochin, Zanzibar, Galle, Mombasa, Muscat, Malacca, Mauritius, Cambay, Goa and Calicut. Each room has deft design touches of each ethnic port. 

The Tea Bungalow blends the history as a residence for execs of the tea company, with the modernity of a western 'boutique' hip hotel style. Polished hardwood floors, French windows, floor length drapes, high ceiling red tiled roof and an exquisite chandelier are complemented by vibrant colours and beautifully designed modern bathrooms. 

Centrally located, the hotel is just a five minute walk from key sights in Fort Cochin and a short 'tuktuk' ride from the spice markets, Hindu temples and Jew Town.
Descr: Tea Bungalow in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
(A Unit of Dempo Resorts Pvt Ltd)
I/1901, Kunnumpuram
Fort Cochin

description: This comfortable mid range hotel has an enviable location near the Gateway of India and the famous Taj Mahal Hotel. It overlooks the Mumbai harbour, and there is a magnificent unrestricted sea view from the breezy rooftop restaurant and bar. The rooms are compact, but well furnished, with good modern bathrooms. Colaba Causeway, the best known shopping centre in South Mumbai, is also nearby.
WebWriteUp1:
The Hotel Sea Palace is located on one of Mumbai's most exclusive promenades. It shares this sweep of road along the grey-brown Arabian Sea with such historical and architectural giants as the Gateway of India and the Taj Mahal Palace hotel. The hotel windows look out upon ferries, ships and barges in the waters, and tall trees and flowers that nod in the rhythm of the balmy sea breeze. 

The sunny rooms have been recently renovated and are further brightened by lime green and peach colour tones. Comfortable beds sit on light wooden floors, and the bathrooms are clean with modern facilities. With the sea on one side and the hotel's garden on the other, the rooms are well protected from the usual noise of Mumbai's street traffic.

The hotel's outdoor cafe is bordered by long branches of colourful bougainvillea and covered by a candy striped awning, and is a great place for a mid-day coffee or a light lunch. The indoor restaurant inside a respectable collection of wines and foods from all over the world - including the unrivalled specialities of Parsi cooking.

Many of Mumbai's attractions are a short walk away - the busy street bazaar of Colaba Causeway, the Chhatrapati Shivaji Museum - Mumbai's most important, as well as numerous art galleries. The residential buildings that neighbour the hotel hark back to the days of the British Raj and many still bear the original names and facades.
Metatype: Sea Palace Hotel is situated on the sea front facing the Mumbai harbour with a magnificent unrestricted sea view.
Descr: Sea Palace Hotel in Mumbai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: sea palace, hotel, mumbai, gateway, india, special places
address:
26, P.J.Ramchandani Marg
Near Gateway of India
Opposite Radio Club, Colaba

description:
Barefoot at Havelock, the only eco-hideaway in the Andaman Islands, is set amidst rainforest and tropical fruit trees behind a pristine 2 km white-sand stretch of the quirkily named Beach No. 7 at Havelock Island. 

It offers 18 beautifully designed cottages that are scattered over 7 acres of grounds, their hardwood walls and conical thatch roofs blending into the tropical foliage.
WebWriteUp1:
What makes Barefoot a unique eco-hideaway is the "Barefoot Philosophy" that believes in a minimal footprint on the environment. The resort maintains and lives up to this philosophy by using indigenous materials and energy sources, harvesting rainwater, and engaging local people as their staff. However, Barefoot offers basic comforts such as modern plumbing, air-conditioning or ceiling fans. 

The facilities at the resort include a Multi Cuisine Restaurant & Bar. Actvities available include Motor-cycle hire, Fishing, Kayak trips through mangrove creeks, Snorkelling or Diving the reefs, Camping on a deserted island, Yoga and Birdwatching. 

At Barefoot you're cut off from the rest of the world, with no television, newspapers, internet or (sometimes) telephone - bliss for some! Perfect, if you are looking for an unpretentious hideaway in one of the world's last undeveloped tropical islands.
Metatype: Barefoot at Havelock, the Andaman Islands' only eco-hideaway is set in rainforest and tropical fruit trees behind a pristine 2 km white-sand stretch of the quirkily named Beach No. 7 at Havelock Island.
Descr: Barefoot at Havelock in Havelock Island - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: barefoot at Havelock, island, andaman nicobar, beach, diving, coral

description:
TSG Emerald View is one of the best budget hotels in Port Blair. 

It offers 19 well-appointed air-conditioned rooms with ensuite bathroom, and facilities such as a television, mini bar, and tea and coffee maker. The rooms do not have any interesting views but they offer excellent value for money.

TGS Emerald View has a multi cuisine restaurant and bar, a roof top restaurant and an air conditioned bar.
WebWriteUp1:
This budget hotel has nineteen well furnished rooms that come with amenities like cable TV, telephone, in room safe, AC and room service. The Hotel TSG Emerald View boasts of a multi cuisine restaurant which has a wide range of options to choose from -- Chinese, Continental and Indian. The roof top restaurant of the hotel is the best place to sit and enjoy a meal under the starry sky with the view of the sea. This restaurant serves good traditional Indian cousine as well as sea food. The bar of the restaurant is well stocked with a variety of liquor. 

Please note however, that Port Blair being a small town, hotels do not necessarily match up to the service standards and room quality as in other cities or towns of India.
Metatype: TSG Emerald View is one of the best budget hotels in Port Blair.
Descr: TSG Emerald View in Port Blair - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
One of Leh's older hotels, Lotus Hotel is smaller, and thus more peaceful, than most. It is tastefully furnished throughout, almost resembling an old English country house hotel. The main bazaar of Leh is just a short walk away. 

There are a variety of common areas to relax in - a flowering lawn out front, a closed TV lounge and a lounge with traditional floor seating. The rooms are old fashioned, but large and quite grand.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms face the yellow flowers of the front lawn or the boulder strewn hill at the back. Slatted wood covers the walls and thick carpets line the floors, traditional d�cor in a land where winter temperatures can drop to minus 30 degrees centigrade. Even though Leh is only open to visitors in the summer months, the Lotus Hotel's central heating comes as a reassurance.

In common with most hotels in Leh, the Lotus Hotel serves buffet meals, with a mix of Indian, Continental and Tibetan food, plus a few local Ladakhi dishes on occasion. Food is laid out in the mango walled dining room, replete with Buddhist motifs.

The floor seating with comfortable bolsters on the terrace makes for an especially attractive spot in which to relax and enjoy the breeze blowing in from the mountains. Walks to and from the hotel mostly involve a 10 minute uphill climb.
Metatype: A tastefully furnished hotel set against the backdrop of a rocky hill, the Lotus Hotel is set apart from the main bazaar of Leh.
Descr: Lotus Hotel in Leh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: lotus hotel, leh, ladakh, indus valley, special places

Descr: Hotel Greenpark in Pune - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Located in the heart of Bangalore, this heritage cottage dating back to 1915 has been lovingly restored to include modern facilities, whilst retaining the historic atmosphere.

Set in the middle of a lush green garden in a quiet lane in the heart of Bangalore, Casa Piccola Cottage offers 15 rooms on bed and breakfast basis. Breakfast in the pergola beside the immaculate lawn is a treat.
WebWriteUp1:
Casa Piccola provides a wonderfully tranquil sanctuary from the busy city of Bangalore. Conveniently located in the heart of Bangalore city, the hotel is a good base for visits to the city market, the palaces, temples, shopping centres and good restaurants.

The heritage cottage offers comfortable accommodation at a moderate price, and the Indo/French owners are happy to give advice on how to make the most of your stay in this exciting city.
Metatype: Located in the heart of Bangalore, this  heritage cottage dating back to 1915 has been lovingly restored to include modern facilities, whilst retaining the historic atmosphere.

description:
The Tower House is an elegant boutique hotel housed in a historic Dutch building right in the heart of Fort Cochin. Rooms have views over the park and the Chinese fishing nets along the coast. 

The Tower House is more like a grand old house, rather than a hotel. It is a rambling bungalow with a roof of red tiles and a soothing whitewashed facade that conceals a well-tended lawn, a leafy courtyard and tasteful interiors.
WebWriteUp1:
The Tower House, facing the Chinese fishing nets of Cochin, marks the spot of a 17th century light house. The understated classic look of the place fits in perfectly with its surroundings, set right in the heart of Fort Cochin's colonial heritage area. 

The hotel has vast high-ceilinged halls and arched doors flanked by colonial pillars. There is a large drawing room with wooden floor and authentic furniture and art. The fourteen rooms come in different sizes but are all comfortable and well-furnished.

There is a large beautiful pool with plenty of towels and sun chairs. The hotel also has restaurant on the ground floor.
Descr: The Tower House in Kochi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Snowland Resorts is a new structure built on a small hill, with unrestricted views over fields and snow topped mountains. 

It is these vistas that really make the hotel exceptional. Wooden balconies off the upper rooms and low windows of the ground floor rooms invite you to admire them. All rooms are unpretentious and clean.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms on the ground floor have wooden floors and walls in the style of a mountain cabin. These rooms have large windows that open onto the front lawn. The rooms on the first floor are more modern in their d�cor, with carpets and painted walls. The upper floors however have the advantage of the overhanging balconies that catch the warmth of the sun or the cool mountain air.

The food is served buffet style in the indoor dining room, and includes Indian, Continental, and Tibetan dishes. The lawn has a range of multi-coloured flowers and slightly tacky but practical plastic chairs and tables.
Metatype: Snowland Resorts is a new structure built on a small hill, with unrestricted views over fields and snow topped mountains.

description:
Unlike most of Varanasi's other hotels, Nadesar Palace traces its history way back, adding a special dimension to your stay in this ancient city. 

Based in flower filled gardens and adjoining golf greens, the Palace is a handsome building flanked by twin-columned verandahs. 

Almost next to the Palace is the small temple of Godess Nadeshwari, after whom the Palace is named.
WebWriteUp1:
The gracious Nadesar Palace has hosted many world luminaries; the Prince and Princess of Wales (the young King George V and Queen Mary), King Reza Shah Pahlavi of Iran and Queen Sorraya, King Ibn Saud of Saudi Arabia, Emperor Haile Selassie of Ethiopia, King Mahendra Bikram Shah of Nepal, Lord Mountbatten, His Holiness the Dalai Lama and Queen Elizabeth II! The list is astounding.

The Palace offers only ten rooms of extremely generous size. There are Palace Rooms, Historical Suites and Royal Suites. Each has been decorated with contemporary touches which complement the gracious proportions. The rooms are elegance personified, with many overlooking the gardens and orchards outside. 

A swimming pool and golfing green offer relaxation after visits to the ghats of the Ganges in Varanasi, a 20 minute drive away. The in-house Jiva Spa offers Ayurvedic massages in a serene, almost spiritual ambience.
Metatype: Unlike most of Varanasi's other hotels, Nadesar Palace traces its history way back, adding a special dimension to your stay in this ancient city.
Descr: Nadesar Palace in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: nadesar palace, luxury, heritage hotel, taj, varanasi,  ganges, special places

description:
In the tastefully planned city of Chandigarh, the Taj hotel group operates this  excellent business hotel. Very modern and contemporary, the Taj Chandigarh offers rooms equipped with everything a business traveller needs.  

For leisure travelers too, this hotel stands out amidst the lack of choice in the area. accommodation isn't large in this capital city of both Punjab and Haryana states. All considered, this is a good choice of a hotel in this modern city.
WebWriteUp1: Rooms at the Taj Chandigarh have modern interiors with extra large plasma screen televisions, worktables, and modern amenities in the bathrooms. The Luxury rooms are a very generous in size and space, and have separate living and sleeping areas.
Metatype: In the tastefully planned city of Chandigarh, the Taj hotel group operates this  excellent business hotel. Very modern and contemporary, the Taj Chandigarh offers rooms equipped with everything a business traveller needs.

description:
On the outskirts of Kurseong is Cochrane Place, a beautifully restored stately British colonial home.

Nestled in the foothills of the Himalayas with awe-inspiring views of the majestic Kanchenjunga, Cochrane Place is surrounded by the aroma of the finest Darjeeling tea.

The buildings of stone, log and cast iron, regal antique furniture and colonial cuisine, give the hotel a Raj ambiance.
WebWriteUp1:
Combining old world charm with modern facilities, Cochrane Place has thirty one bedrooms, each individually named after the glorious peaks of the Kanchenjunga range.

The well-appointed guest rooms have a distinctive character, and evoke the days of the British Raj with wood paneling, handcrafted furniture, antique burma teak beds, mock fireplaces, elegant bathrooms, and beautiful vistas.
Metatype: On the outskirts of Kurseong is Cochrane Place, a beautifully restored stately British colonial home.
Descr: Cochrane Place in Kurseong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: cochrane place, heritage hotel, kurseong, colonial, home, special places

description:
Built as meditative retreat, the Norbu Gang House has only 8 rooms in a handsome house. 

Their open plan kitchen and traditional style lobby cum salon immediately invokes the feel of being in a true Sikkimese home. 

The rooms are built on an extra large scale, all with balconies. There's a beautifully crafted Buddhist altar in their meditation room and the silence of the forest all around the house.
WebWriteUp1:
We recommend the Suite rooms of Norbu Ghang House, which are attic rooms under the pointed eaves of the house. More apartment-like than a hotel room, the Suites have a separate sitting / television area and a dressing table. The bathtubs are of the large, tub like variety and the bathrooms very clean.

Meals are served on the family style dining table just off the kitchen. The open kitchen invites guests to watch the chefs at work. Guests are served a variety of food and the chefs are open to receiving special requests. 

The meditation room is open to all guests and offers a good opportunity to see Buddhist idols and meditative symbols and paraphernalia up close. There are some easy walks and some steeper climbs from the hotel and a small garden of marigolds and wildflowers around the house to spend an afternoon in.
Metatype: Built as meditative retreat, the Norbu Gang House has only 8 rooms in a handsome house.
Descr: Norbu Ghang House in Pelling - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Bagha-ka-Bagh in Ghanerao - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Located in peaceful village surroundings in Lower Yuksom, this pleasant hotel is modern in design and conveniences, and has a welcoming feel. 

The 20 rooms are simply furnished, but very spacious. There is a large garden, a restaurant, and a peaceful meditation room.
WebWriteUp1:
The lofts are large with wooden floors and a pinewood ceilings. They have a separate sitting and sleeping area, and a small balcony. The sofas and bedspreads are cheerful And the bathrooms in the luxury lofts feature bathtubs tucked under a triangular eave. 

The food on offer is generally Continental, Chinese and Indian, but local Sikkimese food is available on request. 

Yuksom Residency has several indoor and outdoor common areas. The rear lawn is an especially pleasant spot from which to watch the daily life of Yuksom's small populace. Yuksom's 'king's coronation' stupa is a short walk away.
Metatype: A recently built hotel in the small town of Yuksom, the Yuksom Residency is modern in design and conveniences. The Luxury Lofts however are cosy attic spaces with a lot of character.
Descr: Yuksom Residency in Yuksom - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: yuksom residency, hotel, western sikkim, travel, special places

description:
The Art Reverie guesthouse is possibly the closest you'll get to living like the humble hoi polloi of Gujarat's capital city - Ahmedabad. 

A converted 'pol' or traditional community house within the old part of the city, the guesthouse has the feel of a doll house with compact but colourful rooms. The building is surrounded by other "pols" and allows you a glimpse into the soul of old Ahmedabad.
WebWriteUp1:
Originally founded as an Indo-French project aimed at providing a haven for international artists, the guesthouse is now open to one and all. Easels angled towards the windows are still found in the rooms, and the choice and use of colours in the rooms such as burnt orange, robin's egg blue and deep burgundy indicate that it is still a whimsical artists' hideaway. 

Much effort has gone into preserving the original design of the house. While this means that the original 80 year old white moldings of cherubs and lance bearing horsemen are still intact, it also means that the 4 rooms in the guesthouse, there are only 2 bathrooms which are shared by the guests. These black and white tiled bathrooms however are extremely clean and well appointed. 

If you don't mind the slightly cramped rooms and shared amenities Arts Reverie will provide you with an opportunity to discover the real essence of old Ahmedabad which rests in these community houses that have stood for hundreds of years and still shelter a large part of the populace.
Metatype: The Art Reverie guesthouse is possibly the closest you'll get to living like the humble hoi polloi of Gujarat's capital city - Ahmedabad.
Descr: Arts Reverie in Ahmedabad - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: arts reverie, ahmedabad, guesthouse, hotel, gujarat, special  places

The property houses one restaurant serving Indian, Continental and Chinese cuisine and another one specialising in seafood dishes.

description:
Set in lush gardens bordering an old tea estate, Mancotta Chang Bungalow is a wonderful heritage hotel located just outside Dibrugarh.

The Mancotta Chang Bungalow has sloping green roofs, wrap-around verandahs and an old world elegance. The upper level rooms are excellent with old wooden floors and period furniture. 

A traveler can easily spend quality time here sipping tea on the porch while looking out at the surrounding tea plantation.
WebWriteUp1:
A short distance away from the hustle-bustle of the main town of Dibrugarh, is the Mancotta Chang Bungalow. Built in the trademark style of tea bungalows, this is raised on stilts. The advantages include being out of the reach of any wandering beasts and also to escaping flood waters of the Brahmaputra when she breaches her banks. In addition, the raised stilts make it easier to mount an elephant!

The bungalows have features typical to homes on tea estates; sloping roofs of green coloured tin sheets, wrap-around verandahs and large handsome rooms with colonial furniture. The views from the verandahs are of the well kept garden on one side and the sprawling tea gardens at the back. 

The two rooms on the upper level are a few notches above the ones downstairs, which surprisingly are priced the same despite the considerable step-down in quality. The upstairs rooms are amazingly large and have a lofty bed to match. A large bathroom/dressing room is attached. With their hardwood floors, inviting beds and period furniture, these two rooms get top marks. 

The service is attentive with a choice of bed-tea and a fresh breakfast served either in the dining room or the verandah, depending on the weather. We chose the bright verandah for our breakfasts and dinners and it was one of the highlights of our stay here. 

Do take the time to stroll around in the tea gardens at the back and have a look at the tea-factory a short walk away. All, in all, this is a delightful place to end to your trip through the north-east.
Metatype: Set in lush gardens bordering an old tea estate, Mancotta Chang Bungalow is a wonderful heritage hotel located just outside Dibrugarh.
Descr: Mancotta Chang Bungalow in Dibrugarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The best place to stay in Jorhat is the five bedroom Thengal Manor, the 75-year-old family home of one of Assam's leading planter's families.

The architecture with its colonnaded verandah, covered chandeliered sit-out overlooking the lush lawns, fireplace and Louis XV furniture in the drawing room is an immediate throwback to a colonial time and an opulent plantation past. High ceilings, walls full of family photos, stately furniture with touches of gilt, carpets and above all, the stunning collection of art add atmosphere.
WebWriteUp1:
A short distance out of the often chaotic heart of Jorhat, the road becomes quieter. Old trees shade the road as you turn off into a smaller side street and through a pair of wrought iron gates. 

The first look at the Thengal Manor is unforgettable. Lutyen style columns support the lofty portico. A short flight of steps leads to the front verandah with exquisite flooring of red cement with in-situ patterns. An ideal place to enjoy the front garden is around the large round table with easy chairs around it. A newly created swimming pool right opposite the porch somewhat mars the period feel, although it would be great in the summers. 

The Manor is the family home of a tea-baron, acknowledged as Assam's richest tea grower. And despite being open to select guests, it still serves as the residence of the octogenarian owner. The entire manor is a feast for the eyes; from high ceilings, walls full of family photos, to stately furniture with touches of gilt, carpets and above all, the stunning collection of art. The formal dining room has a golden light cast by chandeliers and wall scones. Dinner is served here on excellent china and gleaming silverware.

The rooms are vast and filled with stuffed sofas and armchairs, carpets and impressive beds. We spent happy hours admiring the various paintings drawings and photographs.  

The gardens of the Thengal Manor are large and meandering. An unusual thing here are the family memorial slabs at the back, including one of the owner, who, God Bless him with many more active years, is still alive! It seems that he has already chosen what he wants to be his memorial slab!

With its impressive history and well cared for interiors, the Thengal Manor is one of the best stately homes we have come across in India.
Metatype: The best place to stay in Jorhat is the five bedroom Thengal Manor, the 75-year-old family home of one of Assam's leading planter's families.
Descr: Thengal Manor in Jorhat - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: thengal manor hotel, jorhat, assam, tea plantations, majuli island

description: You leave behind Shillong's chaotic traffic as the large gates open to let you into the Rosa Ville compound, where you emerge into a far more tranquil and peaceful environment, surrounded by greenery, where the atmosphere is one of gentility, with wooden floors, flowered curtains, collections of old china and brass/copper kettles, a gleaming gramophone and an old fashioned telephone.
WebWriteUp1:
Rosa Ville is built in typical North-East style. It has the mandatory soaring tin roof, with many smaller additions, which makes it very interesting. There is a neat, formal garden in the front, shaded by ancient, gnarled pine trees. We were lucky to be here when the rhododendron and many other shrubs were in full bloom. 

The 7 rooms are divided in the main house and a recent addition to one side. The rooms in the main bungalow are spacious, with old furniture and working fireplaces. Beds and mattresses are comfortable and the bathrooms have running hot and cold water. 

The breakfast and the meals are served in the main dining room by taciturn staff. The lounge is a delightful place to relax and have a lovely cup of tea among overstuffed sofas and cut glass wall lamps. The front verandah is also an attractive place to linger as are the garden benches facing the bungalow. 

Rosa Ville is run by a feisty lady, Mrs Topi Bauri, who is the niece of the owner. She doesn't actually live here, but makes daily visits to meet the guests and ensure that they are happy and well looked after.

With its fading elegance and beautiful gardens, Rosa Ville is a most pleasant place.
Metatype: You leave behind Shillong's chaotic traffic as you turn off the main fare into a smaller side lane. Once the large gates open to let you into the Rosa Ville compound, you are in another world.
Descr: Rosa Ville in Shillong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: Ri Kynjai, a spectacular resort overlooking the picturesque Umiam Lake outside Shillong, translates from Khasi as 'land of serene environs'. The architecture is inspired by Khasi thatch huts, which make a symbolic presence as a cap on the roof of the cottages. No expense has been spared in creating this luxurious and authentic resort, making this the most desirable place to stay in the entire North East of India.
WebWriteUp1:
Half an hour's drive away from the city of Shillong is a large lake called Burra Pani (Big Water). Here at a grassy promontory is the magical resort, Ri Kynjai.

A single enormous log of wood makes up the reception desk. The wooden hand-rail as you go down the steps is also from chunky sections of wood. And in front of you is one of the best views - miles of lake water flanked by tall pine-clad slopes.  

There is one largish central building with wings of cottages to one side. This building has the Reception, a spa, the restaurant and a long verandah facing the lake. 

The cottages are almost as breathtaking as the views that fill the French doors and large windows. Gleaming hardwood floors with colourful rugs, a fireplace, a few comfortable armchairs with footstools and an extra large bed with handmade bedspread! There is also a loft here where a child can sleep. 

A dressing room with deep wardrobes open into the bathroom with its generous sized Jacuzzi and a separate shower area. The balcony in the front has a dazzling view and some more comfortable chairs. Below us were landscaped slopes going down towards the lake. 

The more economical rooms here are just slightly smaller than the cottages, but come minus the loft, dressing room and the Jacuzzi. Our advice would be to splurge a bit and go for one of the cottages. 

The restaurant serves a good variety of food. On a negative note though, the resort is open to non-residents and especially over a weekend seems to draw many noisy families for lunch and dinner. The service was polite if strained due to the number of guests. We would strongly suggest that you order your food through room service and eat there. 

Khem Janai - the spa at Ri Kynjai ferries you to the ancient world of herbal cure and serenity. Equipped with state - of - the - art hydro therapeutic facilities, "Khem Janai" offers traditional Khasi massages and herbal treatment. The unique feature of the spa is its "Khasi bath". The Khasi bath is a water massage which leaves you feeling rejuvenated and recharged.

The grounds of Ri Kynjai are large and beautiful with pine trees, tree ferns, a small show-case tea-garden and many other shrubs. It is a peaceful area to stroll around in with glimpses of the lake. Ri Kynjai is definitely a place to return again and again.
Metatype: Ri Kynjai, a resort presiding over the picturesque Umiam Lake near Shillong, translates from Khasi as 'land of serene environs'.
Descr: Ri Kynjai in Shillong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
U.C.C. Road, Umniuh Khwan
Ri Bhoi District

description: The spectacular Diphlu River Lodge is located on the banks of the Diphlu river, at the edge of the Kaziranga National Park. The 12 large wooden cottages boast all necessary comforts and surround an attractive rice paddy.  There are several comfortable vantage points over the river to the National Park, where wildlife is often seen. This is the most luxurious base from which to explore Kaziranga, and to enjoy relaxation in comfortable surroundings between safaris.
WebWriteUp1:
For the very up-scale clientele, the arrival of Diphlu Lodge is a wonderful addition. Arriving at a non-descript gateway, you would have no idea what waits you. 

The rustic-luxurious bamboo-and-thatch cottages of the lodge blend perfectly with the forests. The cottages, made stand on tall stilts around an open area where the resort maintains an actual paddy field. The ambience therefore is totally Thai or Balinese. A charming if slightly shaky low bamboo bridge is the walkway in the resort. Walking over the paddy field in this manner is a lovely experience. 

The Diphlu river runs just meters away from the resort and most cottages offer a good view of the river. The cottages are buff coloured, merging well into the greenery and earthy environment. Inside, the vernacular architecture provides just about every modern amenity one can want; deep mattresses and quality linen, a fridge (with a cane cabinet cover), cozy sofas and best of all, sit-outs on either side. 

The bathroom is a visual delight with glass walls and a thatch cover, a very Balinese affair. A note of caution here is to be careful about slipping. The tiles are a bit on the slippery side and the glass is not of the toughened variety. So, guests are cautioned to be extra careful here. 

The best feature of the resort though, is the common lounge, which is the only tall structure. Built with an abundance of bamboo, hardwood with planters' chairs placed strategically to give the best of river view, the lounge is a sheer delight. Guests can luxuriate on the deep sofas after a morning of bumping around in jeeps on elephant back. There is a well stocked bar, the best we came across in Assam. The food is served in style in the dining room, and there are many exciting wildlife activities on offer, including river trips in a dugout canoe.

Overall, with its unique concept of cottages and well trained staff, the Diphlu River Lodge is a first class game lodge.
Metatype: The lovely new Diphlu River Lodge is located on the banks of the Diphlu river, at the edge of the Kaziranga National Park.
Descr: Diphlu River Lodge in Kaziranga - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: diphlu river, kaziranga,  assam, rhinos, elephant, safaris, tours

description:
This property was designed in the 1970's by renowned Sri Lankan architect Geoffrey Bawa as the Coat's Madurai Club. 

It has now been artfully renovated, with new villas built in similar style using local and recycled materials. The result is a hotel with lots of character and charm and a variety of rooms to suit any budget. 

The restaurant serves contemporary Indian and international cuisine and there is a magnificent swimming pool to enjoy.
WebWriteUp1:
The Heritage Hotel in Madurai is an experience in itself. This property was designed in the 1970's by renowned Sri Lankan architect Geoffrey Bawa as the Coat's Madurai Club.  Known for his skill in integrating the outdoors with the indoors, Geoffrey Bawa created a space that is more open than closed, with long covered corridors that allow you views of the surrounding gardens. 

It has now been artfully renovated, with new villas built in similar style using local and recycled materials. The pointed roofs and red terracotta floors of the interiors are firmly traditional, yet by keeping the furniture and d�cor to a minimum there is a lightness and sense of space that entirely modern.

Grey granite is used liberally in the roughly-hewn pillars that line the corridors and in the most unusually shaped pool - a rectangle with a cascade of steps on each side - has been designed to represent the water tanks found in major South Indian temples.

The rooms are, perhaps, the simplest aspect of the hotel, and are maybe deliberately kept so in order to enhance their restorative nature. But all of them have an outdoor seating area from which you can enjoy the many subtle aspects of the hotel. There are a number of traditional carved wooden doors, for example, and a lovely, two-hundred year old Banyan tree. 

Although located a short distance away from the main city, a stay here definitely adds another dimension to your time in Madurai.
Descr: Heritance Madurai in Madurai - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Tucked away on a hillside lined with pine trees, bamboo groves and cherry blossoms is the Tripura Castle, summer retreat of the Maharajas of Tripura. The first "heritage" hotel in the north-east, it was opened in 2003 in the Castle's Annexe. 

There are ten pine-framed rooms with period furniture and a high level of service that makes Tripura Castle one of Shillong's finest hotels.
WebWriteUp1:
An interesting road off the main drag in Shillong goes past some lovely estates and bungalows before climbing up an incline which is the Tripura Estate. The Tripura Castle belongs to the royal family of the state of Tripura, but the hotel, a newer construction is run by another company. 

At the top of the hill, the views are pleasant and the air pine-scented. There is a small, semi-open lobby with comfortable cane chairs. The use of wood is charming. Upstairs, there is a cozy bar with a large television, we guess for Football matches (the family who runs the hotel own a football club). There is also a smaller enclosed verandah where breakfast is served. 

The rooms are of 2 standards - the deluxe one is very spacious and has an impressive carved bed, said to have been the personal bed of Rabindranath Tagore, India's first Nobel Laureate. Even if you didn't know this, the bed is very handsome as is the room, with its backdoor opening into a sunlit garden. The rest of the rooms are on the small side, although with good furniture and colourful bedspreads. 

This is a good option for those who want a little bit of modernity along with a heritage feel.
Metatype: A serpentine road lined with pine trees, bamboo groves and cherry blossoms leads up to the Royal Heritage - Tripura Castle, summer retreat of the Maharajas of Tripura. The first "heritage" hotel in the north-east, it was opened in 2003 in the Castle's Annexe.
Descr: Tripura Castle in Shillong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Bo-Ville is the idea place if you want to get to know Shillong and her people. Owned by Bill and Enid Richmond, they know the place better than anyone else. Moreover, they are great foodies so you are guaranteed to have some truly exotic meals here. 
 
Located just off the main road in Shillong, Bo-Ville is pleasant villa with traditional touches. There is a gracious living room, full of mementos and photos of the couple's travels through the world.
WebWriteUp1:
Bill Richmond, the Top Cop of Shillong is definitely one who defies the notion that Cops don't fall into `great company' category. Bill's father was from Britain. He made Shillong his home and maried a local Khasi woman. Bill is therefore an Anglo-Indian, easily at home in both worlds. 

His homestay, that he runs with his delightful wife Enid, Bo Ville is a little gem. Bo Ville has been the home for the Richmond family for a few decades. Now with the children having moved out to study, the hospitable Richmond couple has opened this intimate home stay. 

Located just off the main road in Shillong, Bo Ville is pleasant villa with traditional touches. There is a gracious living room, full of mementos and photos of the couple's travels through the world. Bill and Enid seem to be great foodies and their guests will be able to have some truly exotic meals here. 

The guest rooms are towards one side, overlooking a small garden. The rooms, although not very large, they are well furnished, done in bright colours and very clean. Attached bathrooms have all modern facilities. Electric heaters are provided in the winters.
Metatype: Bo-Ville is the idea place if you want to get to know Shillong and her people. Owned by Bill and Enid Richmond, they know the place better than anyone else. Moreover, they are great foodies so you are guaranteed to have some truly exotic meals here.
Descr: Bo-Ville Homestay in Shillong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Upper Nongthymmai
Opposite St. Xaviers School
Block I 9Wahthio)

description: This simple resort, set back from the highway and opposite the main entrance to Kaziranga National Park, has 6 modern brick cottages in a quiet garden. These are comfortable, clean, and well equipped. There is a simple vegetarian restaurant, and a peaceful atmosphere.
WebWriteUp1:
Bon Habi lodge is just a short walk from Kaziranga National Park's main entrance gate of Kohora Central Range. 

The resort offers 14 spacious, twin bedded cottages, each having magnificent views of the beautiful garden of the resort.

The gardens are a great place to spend the winter days and evenings. In the courtyard there is a special seating area shaded with bamboo and thatched roof for those who want to relax and read a book.

The small restaurant catering for the resident guests offer a variety of cuisine. The resort also arranges for game excursions in the park accompanied by naturalists. This is a good choice for people who are looking for a good place at reasonable price.
Metatype: This is a comfortable little modern resort with touches of local architecture. The resort consists of small cottages, each with their own sit-out overlooking the gardens and the forested lands beyond.
Descr: Bonhabie Resort in Kaziranga - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This tea garden is a true gem. Shaded by gigantic trees, avenues go through the estate. The twelve guest rooms are in 4 separate bungalows, with each room named after some variety of teas grown here in the plantations.  

There is also a wonderful tea-tasting room. This brightly lit conservatory style room has cheerful white wicker chairs. With a full house, tea-tasting is held here hosted by the irrepressible manager, Mr Sarkar. This great room is also used for serving lunches and dinners at times.
WebWriteUp1:
While on a long trip, there are some places where you arrive and want to simply abandon the rest of the itinerary to stay there and never leave. Wild Mahseer was one such. 

All guest rooms are large with beautifully handmade teak furniture. The ambience is simple but stately. Each bungalow has its own lounge/living room, common to all the rooms. Every room has attached modern facilities and a person dedicated to long after the guests. The gardens are extensive and have some amazingly rare trees and shrubs. A nature lover would go rather wild here. 

The crowning glory of the estate is the Heritage Bungalow with its 3 rooms. This mini-palace is an awesome place from where one has to be wrenched away. There is a large verandah overlooking the lush lawns in the front. A charming wooden study has a great collection of books that guests can browse through. The formal salon has excellent period furniture in gleaming wood. White gloved butler service doesn't seem out of place here. 

The bedrooms in the Heritage bungalow all have colonial feel with great deal of wood and carefully chosen china figurines, wall decorations that all create a mood of understated luxury. Luxuriate here in the large beds, sit in various corners of the bungalow to admire the place, or sit in the verandah for a while, living like a British Tea boss. And even if you wince at the price of the Heritage bungalow, do stay at the more reasonably priced rooms and still enjoy the magical gardens.
Metatype: This tea garden is a true gem. Sign-posted, shaded by gigantic trees, avenues go through the estate. The twelve guest rooms are in 4 separate bungalows, with each room named after some variety of teas grown here in the plantations.
Descr: Wild Mahseer in Nameri - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: wild mahseer, heritage bungalow, tea gardens, nameri, hotel
address:
Balipara Division
Addabarie Tea Estate
P.O. Lokra
Sonitpur

description:
The Eco Camp at Nameri is made up of wood/bamboo cottages and tents, nestled in a clearing in the woods of towering trees. Sunlight filters through the thick canopy of branches overhead and the birdsong is ever present. 

The Eco Camp offers rafting on the nearby Jia Bhoroli river. The fast moving river doesn't have too many rapids, but the riverside scenery is wonderful and this is great way to bird-watch.
WebWriteUp1:
Managed by Assam's veteran society's Ronesh Roy, the Eco camp is basic but clean and offers a comfortable staying option at the Nameri National Park. Accommodation at the forest camp is provided in the form of tents which include twin bamboo beds and attached bathrooms with running hot and cold water. You can enter the forest just by crossing the fence and a ten minute walk will get you to the river. 

The tents at the Eco Camp are simple but have all the required amenities. There are sturdy beds with clean linen, a fan and attached toilet facilities. Each tent has a patio of sorts where one can sit and enjoy the peaceful forest ambience. The cottages are raised a little above the ground and have wood and matting as walls with attached facilities. The Eco Camp also serves some excellent food in a charming thatched pavilion. Don't forget to check out the many articles and photos displayed at the reception.

In an innovative step taken by the camp authorities to encourage afforestation and wildlife conservation, it is assured that each child below 12 who comes into the camp, plants a sapling before leaving.
Metatype: This delightful small resort nestles in a clearing in the woods of towering trees. Made up of wood/bamboo cottages and tents, there is sense of being in the forest. Sunlight filters through the thick canopy of branches overhead and the birdsong is ever present.
Descr: Eco Camp in Nameri - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: eco camp, nameri national park, assam, river, forest, special places

description:
Chowkidinghee Chang Bungalow is a former tea manager's property. It lies within a tea garden in the centre of Dibrugarh, India's biggest tea exporting town. 

Perched on stilts about 4 four metres above the ground in classic chang bungalow style, the view from the veranda looks across the tea plantation. 

The shared area boasts comfortable sofas around a fireplace, dining area and TV room with polished wood flooring throughout.
WebWriteUp1:
Located right in the middle of the Dibrugarh city, in a tea garden, this is an intimate bungalow. Even as traffic goes past its gates, inside the bungalow, tranquility reigns. Sun-filled verandahs have screens to keep away mosquitoes while letting in a light breeze and a view over the gardens. Guests will find themselves spending much of the time on the many shaded corners, up on the screened porch or downstairs in the gardens. Perched about 4 four metres above the ground, the view from the veranda looks across the tea plantation. Assamese tea plantations have the distinction of being the only plantations in the world with trees growing amidst the tea bushes, to provide essential shade.

The rooms are comfortable and spacious, all with dark wood period furniture. The central lounge cum dining room is spacious and has a working wood fireplace for chilly winter evenings. There is generally a set menu for the main meals, which is freshly prepared and tasty, and gives you the opportunity to try some Assamese delicacies. The bungalow is clean and friendly with a lovely Naga lady manager looking after the guests.
Metatype: Chowkidinghee Chang Bungalow is a former tea manager's property. It lies within a tea garden in the centre of Dibrugarh, India's biggest tea exporting town.
Descr: Chowkidinghee Chang Bungalow in Dibrugarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: chowkidinghee chang bungalow, tea gardens, dibrugarh, hotel, india

Descr: Centre Point Group Enterprises in Shillong - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A small, modern hotel, Little Palace is comfortably located in a relatively quiet area of the city. 

The rooms, especially the higher priced ones are spacious, light and airy. Some of the corner rooms on the upper level have a view over the Brahmaputra river. The furniture, if not luxurious, is comfortable. 

Little Palace has a multi-cuisine restaurant at the lobby level which is quite popular, with its comfortable seating and attentive service.
Metatype: A small, modern hotel, Little Palace is comfortably located in a relatively quiet area of the city.
Descr: Hotel Little Palace in Dibrugarh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Due to a wonderful initiative of the council of the Mishing tribe in Majuli island, tribal people built and run a small resort in exactly the same style of their own traditional homes.

Po Okum is an eco camp consisting of several bamboo huts perched on stilts a few metres above the ground that can be accessed by sturdy wooden steps. There is a pleasant sit-out in the front which catches the breeze.
WebWriteUp1:
Majuli is home to the Mishing tribe a mainy agricultural tribe found in many places in Assam along the plains of Brahmaputra. Traditionally, the Mishing tribals build homes raised on stilts to prevent the flood waters from entering their homes. Just about all materials for the huts are made of bamboo, teamed with coconut matting.

Due to a wonderful initiative of the council of the Mishing tribe in Majuli island, tribal people built and run a small resort in exactly the same style of their own traditional homes.

The resort consists of a handful of bamboo cottages spread around a central open area. Each bamboo hut is perched on stilts a few metres above the ground and accessed by sturdy wooden steps. There is a pleasant sit-out in the front which catches the breeze. The seating on the verandah and the beds are made from giant bamboo. The flooring is made from split bamboo and gives a distinct bouncy feel as you walk on it. The huts are covered with thatch stretched on bamboo rafters. The bamboo beds are comfortable and clean with a mosquito net for protection during the night. Attached bathrooms have a western toilet and a basic shower with running cold water. Hot water is supplied on demand in buckets. A generator provides electricity during the evening.

A small restaurant serving delicious meals is an added attraction. Me: Po Okum provides travelers an experience very close to living in a tribal village with some basic comforts thrown in. This makes for an excellent place from where to explore Majuli's many attractions.
Metatype: A charming small resort consisting of a handful of bamboo cottages spread around a central open area.
Descr: Eco Camp ME: Po Okum (Happy House) in Majuli - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: eco camp, majuli island, assam, bamboo, happy house, special places
organisation: Eco Camp ME: Po Okum (Happy House)

description:
The Tourist Lodge has been privatized and is now known as Hotel Metsuben, and is by far the best place in town to stay the night. It is situated at a good location, on a hill close to the centre of town.

Recently refurbished and privatised, Hotel Metsuben offers comfortable rooms with cable T.V., telephone and electricity back-up.

There is a restaurant that offers Naga, Indian and Chinese cuisine, and a small internet cafe with broadband internet facilities in the lobby.
WebWriteUp1:
Hotel Metsuben is a modern building that offers adequate accommodation.The rooms are in all sorts of different categories, but the most pleasant are the Deluxe rooms which are brighter and have more modern furnishings than the so-called VIP rooms, which are large but darker and more old fashioned. The standard rooms are large, but plain, with old fittings. Bathrooms are good in all rooms. The bed and linen was clean and the attached bathroom had hot and cold running water. There is also a TV in the rooms with satellite connection so guests can catch up with what's happening in the world. 

Food is served in the large if soul-less dining room and was quite palatable. In the lobby, there is internet facility with a good broadband connection which is a great boon.
Metatype: Hotel Metsuben in Mokokchung is currently the best place in town to stay the night. It is situated at a good location, on a hill close to the centre of town.
Descr: Hotel Metsuben in Mokokchung - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel metsuben, mokokchung, nagaland, hotel, travel, special places

description:
Perched on a ridge overlooking Mon town in the valley on one side and steep green hill range on the other, Mon View has a million dollar location. Despite this, the amenities here are very basic. 

It is has to be remembered that Mon is the base to see some of the most interesting tribes in Nagaland and the accommodation here is certainly not a highlight but just a step above camping.
WebWriteUp1:
We were at Mon View just as Mon View Resort was just getting ready and we hope that things are better as time goes by as there are hardly any other accommodation options in Mon. 

The resort has four cottages and four tents with extra thatch cover. There is a pavilion looking over the valley. There is also a lovely, large thatched pavilion which may be used as a dining area in future. Please note that there is no running water here at present or electricity although we heard that a generator was to be installed in the near future. 

The rooms are built in cement and have a slightly barrack-like feel. Sized adequately, they also have attached bathrooms. Sadly, the verandah in front only looks at the tents, which block the fabulous valley view. The tent sit-outs in turn look out at the rooms! 

We had freshly prepared food but please order well in advance as it is cooked on wood-fire.
Metatype: Perched on a ridge overlooking Mon town in the valley on one side and steep green hill range on the other, Mon View has a million dollar location. Despite this, the amenities here are very basic.
Descr: Mon View Resort in Mon - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: mon view resort, Nagaland, hotel, travel, konyak, tribals, special places

description: This new hotel in a residential area, but only a 10 minute walk for the River Ganges, is a clean, clam oasis in an otherwise chaotic city. The 11 rooms are of different shapes and sizes, but all are bright, modern, clean and comfortable. There is an attractive restaurant, a rooftop terrace, and an overall atmosphere of quiet efficiency often lacking elsewhere in Varanasi.
Descr: Cresent Villa in Varanasi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Jewel of Kashmir in Srinagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: jewel of kashmir, kashmir, houseboat, srinagar, nagin lake, special places

Descr: Lion of Kashmir in Srinagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: lion of kashmir, kashmir, houseboat, srinagar, nagin lake, special places

description:
This guesthouse offers the Mulbekh's smartest accommodation with modern tiled floors and turned wooden banisters. Having said this, the rooms are small and basic and hot water for bathing will be delivered to you in a bucket shortly after you arrive.

This is a typical local guesthouse, with the children of the owners playing outside and sometimes interacting with you. Food is served in the small but nicely done dining hall on the first floor.
WebWriteUp1:
This simple guesthouse offers a comfortable overnight stay in pleasant surroundings, roughly mid way between Srinagar and Leh.  

The rooms are on two floors of a traditional building in a small garden, with the family who own it living in a smaller house to the rear. The rooms are private, though facilities are basic. Many rooms do have en-suite bathrooms, though hot water for bathing will be delivered to you by the owners in a bucket shortly after you arrive. 

This is a typical local guesthouse, with no frills, but this is compensated for by the friendly family atmosphere.  Simple but wholesome food is served in the traditional dining area on the upper floor.
Descr: Mulbekh Guesthouse in Mulbekh - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
The Namra Hotel offers the best accommodation in Themisgaam. Large rooms with pinewood walls and soft beds make this place very inviting. The attached bathrooms are large, some with bathtubs. They have hot and cold water 24 hours of the day. 

There is a quiet little garden in the front of the hotel. Meals are served in their indoor dining room.
WebWriteUp1:
The Namra hotel is located in a rural ethnic village and run by a Ladakhi traditional family. You will get to know a traditional family house and have the chance to enjoy Ladakhi food. 

The hotel is sprawled over a vast area of apricot and apple groves rendering a relaxed and rejuvenating atmosphere. The hotel has no shops or hawkers so you are left to yourself to enjoy your holiday amidst the grass, river and Himalayan mountains.
Descr: Namra Hotel in Themisgaam - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Karma Inn is an excellent hotel, pleasantly located amongst the greenery of the fertile Hunder village, 7 km from the Diskit Monastery.

All the rooms are clean and comfortable with attached bathrooms.  There are large windows overlooking the garden and the mountain ranges beyond. 

The hotel has a small restaurant where buffet meals are served. There is also a large garden in which you can enjoy breakfast or afternoon tea.
WebWriteUp1: Karma Inn is located in a very serene and peaceful atmosphere amidst popular and apricot trees in Hunder Village of Nubra Valley. As you relax in the room you can hear a lot of birds chirping with the mild music of the small rivulet which flows just behind the property.
Descr: Karma Inn in Hundar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Nubra Organic Retreat is situated in the beautiful village of Hundar, just 7 km from Deskit, the headquarters of the Nubra valley, and two minutes walk from the famous sand dunes.

Spread over 5 acres of lush green farm land and orchards, the retreat boasts of 22 double bedded tents. It has its own organic garden and guests can enjoy the taste of locally grown vegetables.
WebWriteUp1:
Nubra Organic Retreat is reached down a narrow, muddy road with tall stone walls through the trees. It is situated in a delightful spot surrounded by trees with the mountains towering above. 

There is a well tended vegetable patch with tiny fields surrounded by small earth banks in the centre of the site. The climate is mild and soil good so two crops can be grown a year. Cabbage, cauliflower, onions are used in guest meals. 

The tents are surrounded by poplar and willow woodland with small paths and streams. White Aquilegia is growing under the trees and a few purple orchids along the water. There are pink and yellow rose bushes. Sitting areas are scattered round the site.

The tents are basic with 2 single beds pushed together and a bedside table. The floor has a concrete base with a carpet on top. 

Meals are buffet style with a reasonable choice of dishes and plentiful supply of black tea. Staff are xcellent and very attentive. 

A delightful place to stay!
Descr: Organic Retreat in Hundar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
Rimo Hotel is a pleasant, family run, place to stay at the edge of Kyagar village. The comfortable bedrooms have attached bathrooms and are attractively decorated. 

The restaurant is spacious and offers tasty meals, and, before dinner, there is often a coulourful and authentic performance of local music and dance at a nearby village house.
Descr: Rimo Hotel in Kyagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Tegar Village, near Sumoor
Nubra Valley

Descr: Hotel Yarab Tso in Kyagar - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
This simple hotel has an enviable location right at the heart of the small village of Alchi, just 100 meters from the famous monastery. 

The 16 rooms are large, and simply furnished, with en-suite bathrooms. There are few luxuries, though flat screen televisions have recently been added, but in any case you may well prefer the view from the very pleasant outdoor restaurant in a garden setting.
Descr: Zimskhang Hotel in Alchi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Karma Vilas in Mussoorie - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
address:
Claire Villa Estate
Big Bend, Balahisar
(1km from King Craig petrol pump on Picture Palace Road)

description:
Hollonghabi is a small independent tea estate a short drive from Digboi town. In this working tea factory guests can witness all the processes from leaf picking to final packing of the tea. 

The best way to learn about the tea processing is by staying in the home of Ranjit & Indira Baruah, the owners of the tea estate. They have created two spacious guest rooms in their tea bungalow.
WebWriteUp1:
The tea garden makes for a wonderful setting for the owner's home. It is a typical tea bungalow with wrap-around verandahs and sloping roofs. The bungalow is replete with knick knacks from Ranjit & Indira Baruah's travels round the world.

Indira is a brilliant cook and her meals are legendary. Ranjit is a most amiable host and keeps his guests in splits with his many stories. A thorough tea-man, his knowledge of tea is all encompassing, so guests feel really steeped in the tea world.

The two guestrooms come with attached facilities and are very much a part of the bungalow. There is plenty of space to relax on the verandahs with great views over the gardens. 

Hollonghabi makes for a perfect base to learn about tea processing and to visit the nearby town of Digboi.
Descr: Hollonghabi Tea Bungalow in Digboi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hollonghabi tea bungalow, tea gardens, digboi, hotel, india, special places

description: The enthusiastic owners of this simple but spotlessly clean and comfortable small hotel have been instrumental in developing the various tourist attractions around Cherrapunjee, in particular the well maintained trekking paths to the unique and spectacular living root bridges, for which they provide knowledgeable trekking guides. They also serve delicious and authentic local Khasi food, making this a perfect base for the adventurous traveler.
WebWriteUp1:
An ecotourism marvel started by an idealistic couple who gave up professional careers to develop and protect the ecology of the region and give employment to the local youth. 

Basic and functional, the guests are personally taken care of by the owner, a retired Tamil bank manager with his Khasi wife, and his daughter as helping hand. The staff is mainly women from the neighbouring villages.
If staying overnight at Cherrapunjee, this is a must stay place. The owners serve organic, locally grown fresh produce, very tastefully prepared. Excellent value for money. 

The knowledgeable hosts offer a selection of hikes in the area, including the wonderful double decker `living-root-bridge' trek. Highly recommended but make sure you are fit!
Metatype: Cherrapunjee Holiday Resort is 15 Kms from the heart of Cherrapunjee on the road to Mawshamok. The resort is situated on a hilltop and affords awesome views of the magnificent scenery. Except when there are clouds around, as then the resort is lost in the clouds!
Descr: Cherrapunjee Holiday Resort in Cherrapunji - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description:
A wonderful retreat for peace-seekers and nature lovers, Olaulim Backyard is located in one of Goa's most picturesque locations. 

Spread over many lakeside acres, Olaulim Backyard is a small homestay, offering just three fan and breeze cooled cottages. 

Made entirely out of locally sourced natural resources like bamboo, laterite stone and wood, the cottages offer comfort in a fabulous setting.
WebWriteUp1:
A lagoon-shaped pool borders the lake and the gardens. There is a pet pony, a donkey and a few friendly dogs. Guests can use kayaks on the lake, lounge by the pool, dozeg in a hammock, ride cycles and eat fresh meals. There is a jungle-gym made of sturdy bamboos for children. One can be as lazy or as active as one wants here. 

Owners Savio and his Finnish wife Pirrko, are delightful and warm and care for their patch of paradise with genuine passion. 

Made entirely out of locally sourced natural resources like bamboo, laterite stone and wood, the cottages offer comfort in a fabulous setting. 

Natural boulders are kept intact and the beds are built around them. Semi-outdoor bathrooms are delightful and well planned. Each room offers verandahs overlooking the forest or the lake.
Metatype: A wonderful retreat for peace-seekers and nature lovers, Olaulim Backyard is located in one of Goas most picturesque locations.
Descr: Olaulim Backyards in Goa - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: olaulim backyards, homestay, goa, aldona, beach, special places, hotel

description: Helsa Cottage is a small and basic hotel in a modern building in the centre of town. There are 6 simple en-suite rooms, with cold running water and hot water by buckets. The rooms are dull and plain, and there is nowhere else to sit, except for an unattractive dining area downstairs.
Descr: Helsa Cottage in Mon - Travel in India | Travellers Palm

description: The attractive Barsingha Villa is set in the vast Thar Desert of Rajasthan between Bikaner and Jaislmer and has 18 beautifully appointed bedrooms, all with private ensuites and airconditioning, a restaurant, two lounges and a rooftop garden. Owned and run by Narender Singh and designed by Australian Julie Salmon, Barsingha Villa provides visitors with a memorable Rajasthani experience, using local decor, colours, traditions and cuisine.
WebWriteUp1:
At Barsingha Villa, the owners strive to educate all of their guests with a little bit of understanding of their general area, village life and community welfare so that when you stay with them you feel you have been touched with local hospitality and have a better understanding of how village life works and how much the local villages rely on towns like Bap for their livelihood.

One of the most famous projects undertaken in northern Rajasthan is the Indira Gandhi Canal (just a short drive from the hotel). This canal brings water from the Himalayas to Rajasthan and from this all the surrounding towns and villages receive water. The owners of Barsingha Villa are involved in helping outlying villages receive more water from subsidiary pipes. They are also engaged in caring for the wellbeing of the local people and encourage them to live in a cleaner and healthier environment.
WebWriteUp2:
Safaris at Barsingha Villa

Rural Ramble

As the name suggests the intention is to explore the village culture and wildlife of the country side. This is a safari by four wheeled jeep and the duration is about half a day. It begins with a tour of Bhap village where the guest views the carpenters engaged in making wooden handicrafts followed by a visit to the pottery a tour of the local Bazaar to see the leather embroidery, spice market and finally a visit to the Village Lake where you can enjoy bird watching

Mud Villages

Barsingha villa will take you in four wheeled Jeep to the traditional village where people still live in Mud houses untouched by western influence. These people are one community that are still living in traditional way of life personified by their dress housing are style and social customs. Finally driving back to villa you stop at one of the village lakes.

Salt lakes Safari

This is very special safari organized by Barsingha Villa, driving through these salt lakes which was started in British time using salt water to farm salt and export all over the world

Camel safari

The safari goes beyond to the siddha village range of sand duns and around to provide an opportunity to see the camels in groups and for camel ride as this area.

Walk to the local School & Bhap Village

Barsingha villa has been helping ADARSH VIDHYA KENDRA School in many ways and you are most welcome to come and visit the School any time to see and know about their education system and at the same time you can talk to the students and teacher there as well. Afterwards you can walk to the Bhap Village and see the Megrasar lake which is in the center of Bhap town

Dinner at Barsingha Dhani

In the evening, drive 5 km to Barsingha village to explore the village and meet the people. From here it is another 4 km to the Dhani ( and then to Dhani (Dhani is a little house built in the farming block in desert) and have evening drinks on the roof whilst enjoying the beautiful desert sun set. In the evening dinner will be served here.

Around Barsingha Villa

You can see the Phalodi fort which is around 30 km from Barsingha Villa. The village of Khichen is just 4 km away from Phalodi and it is famous for migratory birds, including the "Kurja" (Crane).
Metatype: Barsingha Villa Hotel is set in the vast Thar Desert of Rajasthan between Bikaner and Jodhpur and comprises 18 beautifully appointed bedrooms, all with private ensuites and airconditioning, two restaurants, four lounges, two bars and a beautiful rooftop garden.
Descr: Barsingha Villa in Bhap - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: barsingha villa, bhap, rajasthan, desert, village stay, special places

description:
The modern Radisson Hotel is the most comfortable base from which to explore the holy city of Varanasi. 

The soaring lobby is visually spectacular, and you are greeted here by the exceptionally friendly and helpful staff. 

Elegant rooms, great dining options, a welcoming colonial style bar, a lovely swimming pool and health club, all contribute to making this a top notch hotel.
WebWriteUp1:
The "superior" rooms are very pleasant and well equipped, and the larger and brighter "club" rooms (on a dedicated upper floor with their own private lounge) are even better. All feature televisions, tea and coffee making facilities, comfortable chairs, a writing table, and electronic safes. The modern bathrooms have bath tubs, and abundant hot water.
 
The hotel also offers extensive facilities which combine to confirm the impression that this is much more than just a standard corporate hotel. There is a swimming pool located on a secluded terrace making for a very pleasant private place to relax. There is a well equipped health club, where use of the jacuzzi and steam room is free to all guests, and massages are available. There is a business center, and free wi-fi access throughout the hotel. Drinks and snacks are served in the very comfortable lounge.

There is an attractive and welcoming colonial style bar, The Oakwood Bar, and 2 restaurants.
