The bright, cheerful, main restaurant, The Sunflower Caf�, offers extensive buffet meals, as well as an a-la-carte menu with a wide range of Indian, Chinese and Continental dishes. Best of all, and open for dinner only, The Great Kebab Factory is a signature restaurant exclusive to Radisson Hotels in India, offering a delicious range of kebabs, served with speciality Indian breads. A meal here is likely to be the highlight of your stay.

Throughout the property you will find well trained staff, who help to create an atmosphere of calm efficiency in an elegant environment, and provide a highly professional service in a city which is not always noted for such attributes.

description:
This modern hotel is in a peaceful location, but is just a few minutes walk from the busy centre of Bodh Gaya. 

The 40 air-conditioned rooms are simply furnished, but are large, bright and clean - particularly the bathrooms. 

There is a welcoming lobby with friendly, helpful, staff, and an excellent restaurant which offers food from around Asia, as the hotels caters to pilgrims from throughout the Buddhist world.
WebWriteUp1:
Hotel Taj Darbar is a modern hotel that offers air conditioned rooms with attached bathroom. The hotel caters to a varied range of travellers from Japan, Taiwan, Korea, Thailand and other countries.

Buddha Darbar is the hotel's in house multi cuisine restaurant that serves Chinese, Indian and Continental cuisines. The restaurant is open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.
Metatype: This modern hotel is in a peaceful location, but is just a few minutes walk from the busy centre of Bodh Gaya. The 40 air-conditioned rooms are simply furnished, but are large, bright and clean - particularly the bathrooms.
Descr: Hotel Taj Darbar in Bodh Gaya - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: hotel taj darbar, bodh gaya, bihar, buddhism, buddha

description:
This newly built hotel is one of the best on the "Buddhist Circuit", and it is a pleasant surprise to find such a comfortable and well run property in such a remote area. The staff is very friendly, and helpful. 

The chef is well versed in preparing dishes from throughout Asia to cater to the pilgrims from different Buddhist nations - we recommend asking him for the "Thai Special Meal" - delicious!
WebWriteUp1: The lobbyof The Imperial in Kushinagar is large, bright, and welcoming. The 44 rooms are all very spacious, with comfortable imported beds and attractive tiled bathrooms.

description:
This venerable establishment opposite the railway station was built by the South Esatern Railways themselves, one of a number of grand hotels full of old world charm catering to railway travelers. 

Chanakya BNR Hotel has now been comprehensively renovated, and the bulk of the rooms are newly built and furnished in a modern style. But two wings of atmospheric "Heritage Rooms" have been retained.
WebWriteUp1:
At either side of Hotel Chanakya BNR, a colonnaded verandah overlooking the gardens, with "planter's chairs" on which to relax, leads to large rooms which still retain an atmospheric historical charm, with the original wooden beds and writing tables. The bathrooms have been fully modernized.

There is an attractive restaurant, and a large bright, wood panelled bar. In the evenings there is an especially pleasant atmosphere, with family groups dining at the tables set up in the garden.
Metatype: This venerable establishment opposite the railway station was built by the South Esatern Railways themselves, one of a number of grand hotels full of old world charm catering to railway travelers.
Descr: Chanakya BNR Hotel in Ranchi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: chanakya bnr hotel, ranchi, jharkhand, heritage, special places

description:
This modern high rise hotel is located right at the heart of the Main Road market, in Ranchi's commercial centre. The rooms are comfortable, and well equipped. There is a good restaurant and an attractive bar.

Capitol Hill is professional and efficient and popular with business travelers. It makes the perfect base from which to explore the fascinating and colourful Main Road market area of Ranchi.
WebWriteUp1: The large modern lobby, with its attractive atrium, is located on the 3rd floor of a modern shopping complex. The rooms themselves are located on the 3 floors above this, so are insulated from the noise of the busy market area below. The large restaurant has an extraordinarily extensive menu, featuring dishes belonging to the cuisines of many different countries, and there is an attractive bar.
Metatype: This modern high rise hotel is located right at the heart of the Main Road market, in Ranchi's commercial centre. The rooms are comfortable, and well equipped. There is a good restaurant and an attractive bar.
Descr: Capitol Hill in Ranchi - Travel in India | Travellers Palm
Keywords: capitol hill, hotels ranchi, jharkhand, betla national park, special places

description:
Raised on a small hillock overlooking the main entry to the Betla National Park, the Forest Rest House offers 6 comfortable and well-furnished rooms. 

All rooms have balconies overlooking the National Park itself, from where sightings of wildlife are possible. There is a basic canteen which offers simple meals.
WebWriteUp1:
There are two attractive "treehouse rooms", though in fact these are simply built on top of concrete pillars, and four smaller rooms in a newly built "row house". 

Please note that the electricity supply is very erratic in this remote area, so fans and air-conditioners may not operate for much of the time.

description:
Staying on a Kashmir Houseboat is a unique travel experience. Entirely built of elaborately carved wood, each houseboat features a large lounge with comfortable sofas and divans, a traditional dining room with antique furniture, and 3 or 4 large bedrooms, all lavishly furnished, and each with attached modern bathrooms. 

You can relax on the verandah of your houseboat overlooking the serene Nageen Lake and the mountains beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
Staying on a houseboat in Srinagar is a unique, must-do experience. The houseboats generally have three or four bedrooms, each with attached bathroom, electricity and modern plumbing. There is a common dining and lounge area, as well as a balcony at the front facing the lake. Quite a few houseboats have rooftops that are accessible. Some have gardens. These additional areas are appealing as they provide more space for guests. There is also a small kitchen, where the "boat captain" assigned to each houseboat is usually found, especially at meal times, when large numbers of local dishes will be served to you. 

The famous Dal Lake is where the majority of the houseboats are located. However, it's also crowded and commercial and in some areas the houseboats are unattractively lined up bumper to bumper along a canal. On the other hand, Nigin Lake is much smaller, quieter, and more picturesque. So we use houseboats which are located on Nagin Lake.

Unlike houseboats in Kerala, these houseboats don't move. They're permanently docked on the lake. Houseboats docked lengthways along the lake will usually offer lake views from their bedrooms. Otherwise bedrooms will have a view of the neighboring houseboat but their balconies will be fronting the lake.

The famous Kashmir Houseboats originated during the period of the British Raj. Kashmir's ruler would not allow the British (who were as fond of Kasmir's cool climate as the Mughals) to own land in his kingdom. So they adopted the solution of building houseboats as a compromise - each one a little bit of England, afloat on Srinagar's lakes.

The houseboats soon evolved from modest floating homes to veritable floating palaces. They now range from 60 to 150 ft. long, are 15 to 20 ft. wide and each is unique. The cedar interiors are intricately carved and display the consummate artistry of Kashmiri craftsmen. The furnishings include embroidered native rugs and fabrics, local objects d'art, and solidly comfortable Victorian and Edwardian furniture. This is a reminder of times gone by, and there is no better way to experience the reflective atmosphere and tranquility inspired by the nearby Himalayas than from the traditional and spacious home comforts of your very own houseboat.

The best way to experience the life of Nageen Lake is from one of the hand rowed boats, known as Shikaras, which are constantly seen transporting both people, local produce, and all sorts of goods, around the lake. The boatman will take you beyond the lake and into the small canals which thread their way through the vegetable and flower gardens where you will witness the unusual practice of farming on the water, as well as fishermen and plenty of birdlife. It is an extraordinarily tranquil, and colourful, scene, mostly unchanged for centuries, and is a highlight of any visit to Srinagar.

description:
A wonderful, modern resort with style, Resort Hoka is definitely the best place to stay in Diu.

Just a few minutes walk from Nagoa beach, the resort is a low rise building surrounded by hall walls creating a courtyard containing Hoka trees and a delightful small pool. 

The rooms are simple but generous sized and clean. The colours used are bright and cheerful which seem to be the hallmark of the resort.
WebWriteUp1:
The Resort Hoka has rooms and not cottages. The design however is with open spaces so whilst one does have a private verandah with the rooms, there is a lot of open space and hammocks to move/lounge around.

The rooms are air conditioned with attached bathrooms. The room service is limited and the self-service adds a special flavour to the ambience.

The hotel open 'Verandah Lounge' bar & restaurant makes for a pleasant dining area. The Pool area and Verandah are places to relax with a book & a glass of cold beer or fresh lemon soda in hand!

The hotel is a short walk from the Nagoa beach. And though not facing the sea, the hotel surrounded by trees has a nice, quiet & clean ambience.

description: This late 19th century house on the outskirts of town, originally served as a summer retreat for the British. Now it has been restored as a heritage hotel by the Dekeya family who also own the popular Dekeling Hotel in the centre of Darjeeling. The building is constructed predominantly of wood and glass. The four spacious suites have original tiled fireplaces, and this is a peaceful place to relax away from the hustle and bustle of Darjeeling town, which is a 15 minute stroll away.
WebWriteUp1: Located at Hawks Nest, reached by a steep uphill road, this homely retreat is ideal for those who wish to be close to the busy town, but away from its more commercialized aspects, surrounded by greenery.

description:
Patan Mahal is a delightful palace set above the Patan village in Sikar district of Rajasthan, almost mid-way Delhi and Jaipur. 

Patan Mahal has a fine collection of spacious rooms with period furniture, large size beds, and exquisitely decorated windows and doors. The rooms are well-lit, and offer a wonderful view of peaceful surroundings through windows and sit-out area. 

The palace serves wonderful meals in their airconditioned dining room. There is also a lovely pool.
address:
V & PO Patan
Tanwarawati
Tehsil: Neem Ka Thana
District: Sikar

description:
Harivihar is a heritage home-stay which offers authentic Ayurveda treatments. This oasis of tranquility is situated in the heart of Calicut in what used to be a royal  ancestral home in the 19th century.

There are eight rooms, all of which open out to larger sitting spaces.  The walls are white, the floors deep red, the wood dark, and the lawns green. Clear, uncluttered and very contemplative.
WebWriteUp1:
Harivihar is the 150-year-old residence of the Kadathanadu royal family, originally from the Vadakara district of Calicut. Folklore has it that the sons of the Kadathanadu rulers were sent to Calicut to be educated in institutions set up by the Zamorin of Calicut, and hence a city house was built for the young princes.

Doctor couple, Srikumar and Neeta Srikumar are the inheritors of the royal residence that was purchased by Neeta's grandfather in 1960. It was only in 2000 that the neurologist decided to rescue the dilapidated property from ruin and convert it into a heritage resort. The original structure was kept intact, the massive doors and windows made of Irul and Jackfruit wood were retained and some panels from the windows were replaced with glass for more light and ventilation.

The anterooms of the main bedrooms were converted into bathrooms with all modern amenities. The low roof of the kitchen was dismantled and the first floor was eliminated to create a high ceiling for the new kitchen. The lawns were painstakingly manicured and landscaped. 

Also dotting the backyard is a selection of ayurvedic plants and herbs. Because, while Harivihar functions as a heritage resort,  its mainstay is Ayurveda. Guests can avail of treatments under the supervision of Dr Mali and Dr Ramakrishnan, famed Ayurvedic practitioners of the region. Harivihar has also been awarded the Green Leaf accredition by the Kerala tourism department-the only facility in Kerala in its class to have been awarded this honour. 

The day begins very simply at Harivihar. Wake up to the sound of chirping birds at your window, go in for a session of Yoga. Then choose between a Pancha Karmam or Shodhanam-a five step purification treatment for the body. Special treatment for longer durations include Shiro Dhara, Pizhichil, Navarakkizhi, Shirovasti and Kizhi. 

Besides trips to the nearby Kappad beach (where Vasco Da Gama landed in 1498, Harivihar also organises trips to the handloom centre, the coconut bazaar and to the Kalaris nearby.

description:
My Garden of Eden is a boutique plantation retreat located in Wayanad district of Northern Kerala. It is a perfect place for a nature and wildlife enthusiasts.

This retreat offers seven luxury cottages, set in a twenty three acre coffee & tea estate, surrounded by evergreen forests on three sides. 

The cottages have spacious verandahs and bedrooms that open out to great views of the mountains and valleys.
WebWriteUp1:
Since My Garden of Eden is a small resort, catering to just fourteen pax at a time, the guests are ensured of an exclusive and private ambience.

The cottages have all modern amenities including mini-bar,  coffeemaker, standby invertors and generator, bathtub and shower area& hot/cold running water. 

The resort facilities include an in house exclusive dining centre serving traditional cuisine along with our own chefs fusion attempts, outdoor barbeque area, swimming pool, yoga pavilion, library, basket ball practice, badminton court, bicycling, plantation treks and lots of fresh mountain air!

My Garden of Eden is reasonably close to the major sight seeing options in Wayanad, like the Chembra peak, Soochipara and Meenmutty water falls, Edakkal caves, Muthanga wildlife sanctuary and Pookot Lake. 

Wayanad district is noted for its pleasant weather, coffee, tea, pepper and cardamom plantations and wildlife. It is a perfect place for a nature and wildlife enthusiast to spend his vacation. Since the climate is even, it is an around the year destination.

description:
Jodhpur's most innovative boutique hotel, stunningly situated at the foot of the mighty Meherangarh Fort, in the heart of the Old City. 

The hotel has a gorgeous swimming pool, a lovely spa, an atmospheric dining room a cool cafe, and al fresco terraces.  

Almost all the rooms and suites have fort views. They are highly sophisticated in their amenities and the decor is chic, contemporary and understated.
WebWriteUp1:
RAAS has a sensational position beneath Jodhpur's imposing Mehrangarh Fort; and the only luxury boutique hotel within an Indian Walled-City, it embodies class with a rare and understated elegance. By grafting contemporary architecture and ambience onto the 300-year-old mansion, brothers Nikhilendra and Dhananajaya Singh have reclaimed, indeed enhanced, its grandeur.

Snazzy blue-painted tuk-tuks ferry guests and baggage from the clock tower through buzzing bazaars to a wooden gateway which opens into a calm courtyard and pillared reception.

The hotel comprises four beautiful old, restored, red sandstone buildings juxtaposed with slick, modern structures.  
There are a total of 39 guestrooms that mix traditional Moghul architecture with modern touches.

The bathrooms are state of the art and the subtle use of colour, combined with stunning design and craftsmanship throughout the property, are truly outstanding.

All hot water in the hotel is generated by solar power. All water is treated by their Sewage Treatment Plant and used for landscaping. The stone jaali (screen) acts as a skin for the building and absorbs and retains the sun's heat, thus considerably reducing the need for heating in winter and air-conditioning in summer.They have a Daikin VRV system for air conditioning has the highest rating for energy efficiency.

description:
A luxury desert camp and spa, The Serai has 21, large canvas tents set on in the Great Thar Desert near the ancient city of Jaisalmer.

The camp has a pool inspired by a traditional Indian step-well, a world class Spa, a Dining Tent and Lounge Bar.

Being only 30 km away from Jaisalmer, it is an excellent base from which to explore the city, but also far enough from anywhere to really relax and unwind.
WebWriteUp1:
The Serai has twenty-one luxurious canvas tents, divided into three categories. There are fourteen Tented Suites, each with their own verandah, drawing room, spacious air-conditioned bedroom and, of course, en-suite bathroom, covering an area of about 1100 sq.ft. The six Luxury Tented Suites have in addition, a private walled-in garden with a plunge pool. And, the Royal Suite which boasts its own private spa, pool, and lounge tents is the ultimate in luxury living in the desert!

The Dining Tent serves delicious western repasts as well as sumptuous local delicacies, using much home-grown organic produce from the camps organic vegetable and herb garden.

A campfire is lit every night throughout the winter season, and a bar is set up under the stars. Guests may dine, al-fresco, around the fire or anywhere on our estate. A selection of food and refreshments may also be ordered in the tents.

The Tented Library Bar is the ideal place to sink into a comfortable leather club-chair with a book and burra-peg!

The Pool, inspired from the ancient step-wells that dot this region, is a luxury in the Desert... 

The Spa, created by the world renowned spa company, Raison dEtre has four individual treatment tents, set around a garden. The Spa Menu offers a variety of treatments, designed to relax and rejuvenate...

There is a Laundry service available at the camp.

description:
Hotel Omasila has the best view in Leh! The hotel gardens are an oasis of luxury with the most stunning panoramic snowcapped mountain views.

The hotel offers 38 rooms with attached bathroom. All the rooms are tastefully done in Ladakhi architecture with polished wooden floors.

At Omasila they pride themselves on having an organic vegetable garden on the hotel grounds which serves the ingredients for the hotel meals.
WebWriteUp1:
Hotel Omasila is not far from the centre of Leh. By foot it takes about 5-7 minutes to reach the market as it is nearly downhill all the way. Coming back in the other direction it takes about double the time because it is uphill.

The owner/manager Mr. Nawang and his friendly and courteous team create a lovely ambience whereby you immediately are made to feel at home. 

You're likely to spend most of your time in the gardens and terraces admiring the panoramic view.

description: In a spectacular rural location, 5 km from the nearest town of Sapotra is the hilltop Ramathra Fort. It now houses a fabulously comfortable and atmospheric heritage hotel, with 6 luxury tents in the garden, and 6 rooms built into the Fort walls. These offer modern comforts, and superb views over the surrounding countryside, which is surprisingly fertile, owing to the many nearby rivers and canals, Bird life is plentiful, and the unspoilt surrounding areas can be explored by jeep, by boat, by bicycle, or on foot.
WebWriteUp1:
Ramathra Fort has six luxury tents and six suites. The accommodation, service, cuisine and activities set against the forts natural environs have been highly appreciated by guests. 

Each suite features its own bedroom, an elegant sitting area with a fireplace, a King-size bed with luxury linens, custom furnishings and hand-woven rugs. The use of Karauli stone and traditional construction practices bestows an authentic and sophisticated ethnicity to these new spaces. Some rooms have a private terrace, others open out onto an open courtyard. 

The six beautifully designed luxury tents set against the fort's rampart walls surrounding a lush courtyard lawn. With its high ceilings and screened windows, each spacious interior is decorated with modern teak furniture, printed cotton furnishings and traditional flat woven rugs. The sleeping chamber has comfortable beds and night tables with reading lamps. The sitting room with its cushioned chairs, coffee table and writing desk provides ample room to enjoy morning tea or to spread out a map and plan the day's adventure. Absent are televisions and electronic entertainment. A private and spacious bathhouse built of stone and mortar is attached to every tent. Amenities include hot water, flush toilets, tiled showers and a dressing area. The bathhouse is also a place where you can lock-up valuables while you are out for the day. Like a bungalow, each tent has its own private porch furnished with a couple of chairs and a table. Each porch is protected by the rampart wall and is a great place to relax with friends or to simply enjoy some peace and quiet.

The dining room is the main gathering place for eating, drinking and socializing. What were once stables for horses is now a totally renovated commons area for Ramathra Fort. Comfortable seating in a rustic open space set the stage for a good time. The bar is well stocked with bottled water, soft drinks, cold beer, wine and liquor. The food at Ramathra is special! Menus favor delicious regional fare prepared carefully in the family kitchen using farm-fresh seasonal produce. Guests enjoy authentic local flavors created by traditional cooking methods. Meals typically include whole grain breads such as wheat, millet and barley, fresh yogurt salads, sumptuous curries of meat, poultry and legumes, delicious vegetable dishes and fresh homemade desserts. Meticulous hygienic conditions are maintained to protect the well being of all guests. And if you have a special dietary concern, the cook is very accommodating!

description: Rajmahal Hotel has a quiet location, set back from the busy Mall Road, in an area of Agra currently being developed. The architecture and d�cor are more impressive than many of Agra's hotels, which tend to be rather nondescript. The rooms are large, and are pleasantly furnished. There is a large comfortable lobby, and a small swimming pool. There are good views of the Taj Mahal from the rooftop, making this a good base for a short stay in Agra.
address:
A/C - 1/2, Taj Nagri Phase-II, 
Fatehabad Road,

description:
The Old Lighthouse Bristow Hotel is a small exclusive boutique heritage hotel, situated right at the entrance of Cochin harbour.

The hotel is the former residence of the late Sir Robert Bristow, the architect of the modern port of Cochin.

There are just eleven rooms, all well-designed and comfortable. There is a swimming pool with a jacuzzi and two outdoor restaurants overlooking the Arabian Sea.
WebWriteUp1:
For a long time this bungalow was the official residence of Sir Robert Bristow, the founder and first chairman of the Cochin Port. It also doubled up as a lighthouse from where Bristow used to watch the ships that sailed into and out of the port. The original lighthouse mast still stands on the property.

Till the late 1980's the bungalow served as a residence for the senior officers of the port. Gradually, perhaps owing to steep maintenance costs and other issues, this lovely building was left to run to seed. Now acquired on a long lease, the present owners put in tremendous renovation work to turn this heritage structure back to its old grandeur. 

There are six garden view rooms that are well-designed and comfortable, three deluxe suites which are very spacious and provide a breathtaking view of the Arabian Sea from the en suite balcony, as well as two luxurious villas. The best are the two rooms on either end of the upper storey. They have private balconies that face the sea directly.

The Bristow's Bistro is an outdoor dining area, overlooking the sea and the Fort Kochi beach. There's nothing like a quiet evening, watching the sunset on the Arabian Sea, or the fishermen coming back home, listening to the music of the waves and munching fresh, hot, spicy seafood delicacies. The hotel has two more spots to relax with the choicest drinks and food, the Lighthouse Lounge and Vinocean, a spectacular indoor retro lounge with breathtaking views of the sea.

There is a large swimming pool with a jacuzzi and an in-house spa, offering a wide variety of treatments from the traditional Kerala Ayurvedic massages to Balinese and Swedish beauty treatments.

We would definitely recommend using the bicycles the hotel has on site to ride through the quaint, quiet streets of Fort Cochin to discover spice markets, antique shops and hidden treasures.
address:
Beach Road
Near INS Dronacharya
Fort Cochin

description:
Taamara (the lotus) is a premium homestay beautifully located on the backwaters just north of  Allapuzha.  The home has two chic cottages that share a wonderful deck overlooking the Vembanad Lake. An ideal place to read and relax.

Taamara is the 100 year old home of Mr. V. V. Babu, an award-winning filmmaker and his gracious wife, Nirmala. They are perfect hosts who will treat you to some authentic Kerala cuisine.
WebWriteUp1:
The two independent air-conditioned waterfront cottages are twin bedded with elegant with cheerful interiors and modern bathrooms. The French doors open onto a wooden deck that gives you superb views of Vembanad Lake. Sitting on the deck, you can see fishermen caste their nets at dusk and return at the crack of dawn to collect their catch.

On a typical lazy day, watch the picturesque world of quaint fishing boats, thatched houseboats, Chinese fishing nets and swaying palms.
address:
Near Kannankara Church
Vaaranam P.O., Kannankara, Thanneermukkom
Alleppey District

description:
This relaxing and serene home stay is run by Mr. Walton and his family. Their centuries old Dutch building is centrally located on Princes Street in the centre of Fort Cochin.

The building has a pleasant garden courtyard where you find 6 double rooms and a garden cottage, all with an attached bathroom.

You can experience the high standards of friendly cheerful service at the communal family breakfast table.
WebWriteUp1:
At the entrance of the building is a delightful second-hand bookshop. Mr. Walton believes that good books, like good friends always keep you good company!

You cross the building into a pleasant garden courtyard where you find 3 rooms on the ground floor and 3 on the 1st floor all with windows opening into a tiny but lovely garden. There is also a charming garden cottage. All rooms have mosquito nets on windows. The attached bathrooms have solar powered hot water showers 24 hours a day.

It is the philosophy of the Waltons that to begin a great day one needs to have a great breakfast. They therefore offer a sumptuous breakfast of endless toast, fresh fruits, tea or coffee. Get to know the hose family and your fellow travellers at the family breakfast table. 

Walton's is located right on a typical Fort Cochin street; shops, restaurants and landmarks are all on walking distance.

This is a great choice for people who are conscious of the budget, but also want closer interaction with the hose country and family.
address:
1/369, Waltons Hall
Princess Street
Fort Cochin

description:
Set amidst coconut trees, backwaters and a group of islands is "Oyster Opera". A simple village retreat consisting of seven cottages, set is a beautiful environment.

The village is totally isolated from the main land and the only means of transportation to the village is through the local ferry. 

By staying in the resort, you can witness how the entire village gets its livelihood from mussel farming, oyster and clam collection.
WebWriteUp1:
Oyster Opera was started by the national award winning farmer Gul Mohammed. Many years back, Gul came back to his impoverished village in Kerala and made a vow to do something to help his people. He came upon a special technique for oyster farming and started the farms all over his village, providing a livelihood to people desperately in need of one. There are now thousands of farmers engaged in oyster faming, many of them women.

By starting Oyster Opera, Gul has found another way for the villagers to earn further income. The resort is unique with huts and restaurants exclusively for the guests, both on land, water and treetop, built with the locally available materials doing absolutely no damage to the rich habitation of this virgin land. There is no sign of a television and even the lighting is non-intrusive. The food is fresh, ethnic and healthy. The fish for your meals is caught on site from the two ponds in the resort, and if you're an angler, you can even have a go!

There are 4 laterite cottages, one tented cottage, a float house and one elevated house. All cottages are provided with 24 hours power(backed up with generator) and water, 2 easy chairs in verandah, 1 bedroom ceiling fan, 2 bedside lamps, 1 foir, 1 European closet with both toilet paper and jet spray pump, one hand wash basin along with soap, shampoo, oil, bath towel and a hand towel.

description:
The erstwhile residence of the Nizam of Hyderabad has now been converted by the Taj Hotels into a luxury heritage hotel.

The palace occupies 32 acres of land, which offers a choice of 60 unique rooms and suites with 2 restaurants, an outdoor pool and the Jiva Spa.

We are sure the Royal family approves!

What was once the sole preserve of visiting royalty-King Edward VIII and the last Russian Tsar, Nicholas II; will now be yours to discover.
WebWriteUp1:
This is a wonderful chance to live where some of the world's most prominent Royals and Heads of State have lived. 2000 feet above Hyderabad, Taj Falaknuma Palaces 60 beautifully refurbished and lovingly restored rooms make for one exquisite holiday.

The Palace boasts of large Venetian chandeliers, rare furniture, grand marble staircases and gurgling fountains, priceless statues, and objects dart, stained-glass windows, unique sketches and murals encased in ornate frames. The gardens come in many flavours;  Mughal, Rajasthani and Japanese! The Palace Library, a replica of the one at Windsor Castle, is a collectors envy as it is home to the rarest of manuscripts, books and one of the most acclaimed collections of the Holy Quran in the country, all of which were selected and brought back by the Nizam himself. 

The former residence of the Nizam of Hyderabad, Falaknuma Palace now offers truly royal hospitality to select guests.

description:
Bikaner House was the summer residence of the royal family of Bikaner. Constructed in 1893, the mansion was designed by the legendary architect Sir Swinton Jacob.

Set on vast grounds amidst tranquil hills, Bikaner House occupied one of the best locations in Mount Abu and was visited regularly by the Maharaja.

In 1962 the royal residence was converted into a heritage hotel and it is now called 'Palace Hotel'.

Devraj Niwas is a surprising new boutique hotel in the heart of Jaipur. Even though this is a heritage building, it has been renovated in a modern, contemporary style. There are 21 tastefully crafted rooms, all on ground floor, and all open out into a wonderful lush tropical garden.

Devraj Niwas also features a fine dining restaurant - The Forresta - which serves a selection of contemporary cuisine from round the world.
advantage: Green oasis in a dusty, hot city, yet close to the old city heart.
roomfacility: Classic furniture with a modern interpretion, good quality mattresses with local Rajasthani fabrics.
otherfacility: Swimming Pool
WebWriteUp1:
After the ornately frescoed havelis of Rajasthan, the contemporary chic of Devraj Niwas is as surprising as it is refreshing. Tropical plants create mini-courtyards giving each room peace and privacy. The 21 rooms have been divided in four catefories - Regal, Zenith, Courtyard and Elegant - but all are equally well furnished. 

Scattered through the garden are slat-covered terraces and nooks with rattan furniture to enjoy the delightfully lush greenery. A small swimming pool is to a side of the large grounds. 

A delightful, contemporary find in the traditional city of Jaipur.
address:
Near Moti Mahal Cinema
Bani Park

description:
If you are going to visit Udaipur, and really want to indulge, stay at The Oberoi Udaivilas. 

Built on the edge of Lake Pichola with a sublime view of the Lake Palace and City Palace,  The Oberoi Udaivilas is one of the most luxurious hotels in India.

The rooms with semi-private pool are spectacular. There are peacocks roaming the grounds and the ambiance will transport you back to the era of the Maharajas.
WebWriteUp1:
An enchanting boat ride across Lake Pichola takes you to the ceremonial welcome that awaits you at the Oberoi Udaivilas. 

Built like a sprawling Indian palace, the Udaivilas has rambling courtyards with gentle fountains, reflecting pools and verdant gardens. Gold leaf has been used along with frescoes and intricate mirrorwork.This is luxury at its most opulent. 

Rooms with terraces that open on to semi-private swimming pools present exquisite views and are a unique feature of the hotel. All guest quarters are done to the highest standard and most rooms have either verandahs or bay windows from where to admire the gardens with flamining bougianvillea or the many water-bodies.

The Bar and the restaurant serve international cuisine and vast range of liquers with views of the City Palace and Lake Pichola.

The luxurious spa with its own swimming pool overlooks the lake and is a haven of serenity. Trained therapists pamper body and soul with rejuvenating treatments. The resort also offers the opportunity to undertake private Yoga, meditations and Pranayam sessions with the resident Yoga teacher or explore the city steeped in the romance of the oldest living dynasty in the world.

description:
Sheer luxury among rugged terrain - Oberoi Vanyavilas is a fine luxury jungle resort is located on the edge of the Ranthambhore Tiger Reserve.

The location is superb with a lake, sun-bleached decks and private gardens. The tents are extremely luxurious with poster beds and embroidered canopies, throw rugs, sumptious bathrooms and step-out gardens.
WebWriteUp1:
The Oberoi Vanyavilas is the perfect base from which to explore the territory of the majestic tiger. Tiger sightings are most frequent during the months of May and June. While it is warm during the day, mornings and evenings are pleasant.

All Luxury Tents, each 790 square feet have private gardens and an outside deck for sunbathing. The tents feature king size four-poster beds, freestanding roll-top baths and separate showers. All the tents have wooden floors and embroidered interior canopies and are furnished in regal style. 

The Library Bar offers an excellent selection of fine spirits, cigars and books on wildlife and is just the place to relax and exchange jungle stories. The Poolbar has a special poolside snack menu. It specialises in the service of beverages and special sorbets out of the pool bar pantry. 

The exquisitely decorated restaurant features hand painted frescoes of flowers and animals by the celebrated miniaturist Mohan Singh Kumawat. The Executive Chef provides an exquisite and versatile multi cuisine menu, offers Western, Thai and Indian cuisine. Much of the fresh produce and salad comes straight from the kitchen garden at Vanyavilas. 

Many guests come to The Oberoi Vanyavilas simply to relax. The Spa and Fitness Tent are the ideal places to do just that. The Spa is set over the lake, past turquoise and lapis blue tiled pools, in a fountained courtyard. Here you will find steam rooms, showers and private therapy suites.

Guests can choose from an elaborate 'menu' of spa treatments, massages, facials, manicure and pedicure. Perfect after an exciting day's tiger spotting in the Reserve.

Please Note

Effective 2nd October 2008, the Government has introduced "No-Smoking" legislation for hotels, restaurants and all public places. As a consequence, smoking is prohibited in all parts of the hotel except in designated bedrooms where smoking is permitted.

address: C-56, G Block, Bandra Kurla Complex

description:
With the creation of Samode Safari Lodge, the Samode family has entered into wildlife camps. Just like the Samode Palace is one of the finest heritage places in India, the Samode Safari lodge promises to be a very special jungle lodge.  

Guests accommodation is made up of a series of individual safari lodges with villas and suites. 

Two main lodges with spacious lounges on the top floor open onto wooden decks with machans or observation towers for bird and wildlife sightings. Zen in a tree top setting.
WebWriteUp1:
The Samode Safari Lodge is made up of individual chalets with a choice of guest suites and private villas. Inside, you will find decor that brings in the outdoors via wide terraces, courtyards with bathrooms and the many subtle, yet luxurious Samode touches.

The aim was to tread lightly in this tiger country and the creators have succeeded in this - the Safari Lodge can easily pass off as a local village. The landscaping is designed with water harvesting in mind. Local artists have created the bricks and the adobe walls with traditional wall paintings. The roof supports in the verandahs are tree trunks in their natural shapes, chunky and rustic. Inside is lovingly polished wood, neutral colours brightened by accent pillows and eye catching art on the walls. Many trees have been added to the site and extensive rainwater harvesting is followed. 

Committed to eco-tourism, the Samode Safari Lodge uses natural materials and elements of regional art and architecture, with eco-friendly landscaping and water management systems. It has been designed and built with the lightest possible environmental footprint. The aim was to create luxury in the most sustainable manner. Not only have no trees been cut for building the lodge, but new planting has also been done. 

The adjoining villages of Mardari and Gohori are the inspiration for the architectural language of the Lodge. The walls are constructed with the traditional hand moulded bricks and all the building material has been locally procured. The Lodge uses solar energy and does extensive rain-water harvesting to recharge ground water levels.
address:
Bandhavgarh National Park.
Village Mardari
Distt. Umaria

description:
Shreyas is one of the finest Yoga retreats in India. The emphasis is to live an ashram style life in private, serene and "simply" luxurious accommodation and facilities.  

Guests practice different facets of Yoga - for physical strength, balance and flexibility, for physiological & therapeutic benefits and if they are interested, for pursuing a spiritual path through various types of meditation.
advantage: 25 acres of green, landscaped area.
WebWriteUp1:
One of the `high-end' Yoga retreats in the country, Shreyas retreat follows an ashram-like daily routine. Yoga and meditation, chanting and community service are part of the day. Shreyas offers the place and the ambience essential for introspection. 

However, lest you think that Shreyas is about spartan living, you would be wrong. Yes, there is a no alcohol policy and the food is vegetarian, but the living is elegant with all the modern luxuries. Guest rooms are in red tiled cottages in a large landscaped area. The Spa at offers various massages like Thai, Indonesian and Indian. 

Guests are encouraged to interact with the village community and to participate in local activities. A popular Voluntourism exercise is for guests to farm in our organic agricultural garden, join our chefs to help cook and then serve the food to village school children. An exceptional opportunity to become a part of a simpler lifestyle.

description:
Suryauday Haveli on Shivala Ghats has recently been renovated as a new boutique hotel in Varanasi, located right on the river Ganges.

Suryauday Haveli traces its history back to the early 20th century. It was built by the Royal Family of Nepal as a retreat for the aged. It is now been painstakingly put together again to provide the best accommodation experience in Varanasi.
WebWriteUp1:
Your stay begins with a 15 minute boat ride upstream along the famous ghats of Benaras to reach the Haveli. The Haveli is also connected by small alleys and streets leading to the Famous Kashi Vishwanath Temple (15 minutes walk).

Suryodaya Haveli comprises of 01 river facing master suite, 08 river facing rooms and 5 en-suites each fitted out attached bath, air-conditioning, direct dial telephones and cable television. 
 
The hotel has created a small cosy dining area which offers an extravagant vegetarian fare! Their traditional Maharaj (Hindu Cook) will surprise you with delectable food from across the Indian sub-continent. Each day comprises of new culinary surprises. No menu's , the Maharaj decides what to serve you. Roof terrace serves light snack and beverages. Probably the best location in the city to catch the evening sunset and daily aarti's.

Start your day with Yoga on the Roof Terrace under the supervision of trained instructors. Take a walk through the old city of Benaras with all its noises, smells, colors and masses of people! The haveli's river guides and boats are always at disposal whenever you wish to step down to the ghats and go out on a photo tour. Evening Aarti is performed at the Haveli's temple - just a few steps down from your hotel.

description:
Wildflower Villas is a new boutique resort with just 13 rooms in seven independent villas on an eight acre hill property in Saipem, just 7 minutes drive from the famous Candolim beach.

The cottages are built like a Goan home, with a balcao and a large verandah. The resort also has a restaurant and large infinity swimming pool with stunning views over the Sinquierim river and the Aguada Bay in the distance.
advantage: Green forest-like ambience with all modern amenities.
roomfacility: A/c in all rooms, Satellite tv in each room, Mini-bar, tea/coffee maker
WebWriteUp1:
Wildflower Villas have 13 rooms in 7 independent villas. Each cottage, built like a Goan home, offers a balcao, a large verandah, semi-open bathrooms with ample natural light and ventilation so that the air-conditioners need to be used rarely. The many doors open onto the verandahs looking at the gardens, the river, paddy fields, salt pans and blue skies.

Each cottage, built like a Goan home, offers a balcao, a large verandah, semi-open bathrooms with ample natural light and ventilation so that the air-conditioners need to be used rarely. The many doors open onto the verandahs looking at the gardens, the river, paddy fields, salt pans and blue skies.  

The interiors of the cottages include Goa's classic furniture. Traditional mud tiles not only keep the floors cool, but also help prevent arthritis. Some rooms have the traditional in-situ flooring. Four poster beds, with excellent mattresses and quality linen make for an assured good night's sleep. Locally made terracotta light fixtures create a soft glow in the evenings while well positioned reading lamps make reading in bed a pleasure. The individually selected curtains and durries add their splash of colour. 

Guests can simply enjoy the ambience of the many spices, fruit and vegetables grown on the property. It is easy to recharge city-depleted batteries. Still, if you feel the urge to get in touch with the outside world, each cottage has a television with cable network. WiFi facility covers the Dining deck, the pool deck and gardens around. The large infinity pool offers stunning panoramic views.

Surrounded by plantation-like landscape to integrate with the surrounding nature the Wildflower Villas offer the ultimate in leisure, tranquility and Goan hospitality.

address:
NH 31, Mallaguri
P. O. Pradhannagar

Dist. : Darjeeling, West Bengal, India

description:
The Galleria Residency is an intimate, small boutique hotel. It has an excellent location just behind the interesting Galleria Mall, with its shops, cafes, bakeries, etc. T

The hotel has 16 rooms on 3 floors which are modern, bright and clean. The bathrooms are especially good, with very modern fittings. There is no restaurant, but breakfast and other meals can be served in the rooms, which have a small low table for this, or on the small terrace.
address:
(A unit of Gyan Buildwell Pvt.Ltd.)
4038, DLF Phase -IV
(behind Galleria Market)

description:
The Amber is a 20 bedroom boutique hotel in a quiet and leafy upmarket neighborhood of South Delhi, near the New Friends Colony.

It boasts of features comparable to a 5 star hotel, yet is affordable. Fine Italian marble, premium wooden flooring, and colourful Indian art have been used throughout the hotel giving it an air of simple elegance and sophistication.
WebWriteUp1:
The peaceful location guarantees a good night's sleep, as do the spacious and firm beds, fitted with crisp white sheets and soft throws. With stylish marble bathrooms, flatscreen TVs, free WiFi, a Fitness Centre, In-Room massage facility, and 24-hour room service, The Amber offers touches of luxury usually only found in large Delhi hotels.

The Amber offers myriad options for dining. You have the option of either dining in the caf� or enjoying your meal at the lovely roof top Terrace Garden Lounge. 24 hours room service is also available. Moreover, the hotel is in close proximity to the bustling market of New Friends Colony, which boasts some of Delhi's favourite restaurants. A variety of cuisines are available including Italian, Chinese and Thai. The staff can provide you menus of all these restaurants.

description:
Loharu House is an atmospheric heritage property, situated within its own extensive grounds. The sixteen spacious rooms have beautiful antique furniture whilst the large dining and living rooms are filled with hunting trophies, evoking the atmosphere of a bygone era. 

But, despite the grand appearance, the Loharu House retains an intimate feel, being personally run by the descendents of the original owners.

Yangsum Farm is scenically located in idyllic countryside. The friendly owners are happy to show guests around the 44 acre, fully organic, farm, with its abundant vegetables, fruits, flowers and trees. 

There are six spacious and well furnished bedrooms. Guided walks can be arranged through the forest to a memorial to Tagore and an old hilltop monastery. Delicious meals made from local produce are a highlight.

Whilst it is, like all of Khajuraho's larger hotels, an elderly structure, the Ramada has more modern interiors of cool white-marble elegance with chandeliers in the lobby, curving white staircases, and well-chosen Indian antiques throughout. The rooms are decorated in soft cream shades and rich fabrics and have large bay windows, with views of either the central swimming pool, or the garden which surrounds the entire property, making this a peaceful place to relax.
WebWriteUp1:
Whilst it is, like all of Khajuraho's larger hotels, an elderly structure, the Ramada has more modern interiors of cool white-marble elegance with chandeliers in the lobby, curving white staircases, and well-chosen Indian antiques throughout. 

The rooms are decorated in soft cream shades and rich fabrics and have large bay windows, with views of either the central swimming pool, or the garden which surrounds the entire property, making this a peaceful place to relax. 

The hotel also has sports facilities such as lawn tennis, table tennis and badminton facilities. Since it caters also to business travelers the communication facilities including internet connectivity in the hotel are of a high standard.

There are two restaurants and a bar within the hotel with one restaurant serving multi-cuisine fare and the other, Amoroso, specializing in Italian food. There is also a disco on the premises called Downing Street if you feel like shaking a leg.

Despite being a modern chain hotel guests frequently comment on the personalized service the staff of the Ramada Khajuraho offers. The warm welcome they receive at check-in and the attentive recommendations diners receive contribute to making the stay special for guests.

address:
2nd Suspension Bridge
Sinthali Village
Koudiyala
Dist-Pouri

description:
Located 500 metres from the famous Khajuraho Temples, The Lalit is Khajuraho's premier hotel. Modern rooms offer touches of Indian culture and come fitted with large windows overlooking the garden or temples. 

The hotel features a spa, outdoor pool, fitness centre, massage services and sauna facilities, and yoga classes. A variety of international cuisine can be enjoyed at Panna throughout the day. The Mahua bar serves drinks.

Located in the heart of a relaxed residential neighborhood, yet only a few km from the Old City, Shahpura House is a family-run hotel in "haveli style," with decor that runs from framed black-and-white family photographs to elaborate chandeliers to detailed frescoes. 

Accommodations are very comfortable, with marble floors, antique furniture, block-print curtains, and beds covered with smart white linen.

address:
E-8 East of Kailash
Near Lady Shri Ram College, South Delhi
(major landmark: Kailash Colony Metro Station)
Nehru Place

description:
Gautam Deluxe is a professionally run, modern looking hotel with an unusual and attractive green lobby. The deluxe rooms are plain but comfortable, with modern fittings. The hotel also boasts of the excellent and atmospheric Pind Baluchi restaurant, which is popular with local families. 

The hotel is on a busy road at the edge of the Karol Bagh market area, but the rooms are well insulated from any traffic noise.
address:
2105, Deshbandu Gupta Road
Opp. Maruti Showroom
Adj. Pind Balluchi Restaurant
Karol Bagh

description: Saar Inn is in a quiet residential street in the Channa Market area of Karol Bagh. There is a nice bright lobby with efficient staff. The 17 rooms are quite plain, but are clean, bright, and have good bathrooms. There is a simple restaurant in the basement. The Sikh management are friendly and helpful.
address:
14A/6 W.E.A., Karol Bagh
Near Metro Pillar No. 117

description: This distinctive and stylish small heritage property has 10 rooms, all suites. It has been conceived with a meticulous eye for detail by the owner Durga Singh and his family, who personally look after all guests as they would visitors to their home. The suites are all individually designed and furnished. All are large, and some have mezzanine floors. Delicious local food is served in the restaurant, or in the delightful courtyard garden. The owners are full of ideas and suggestion to help you to get the most out of your time in Jaipur.
WebWriteUp1:
A large, handsome building in the heart of Jaipur, the Dera Mandawa houses only a handful of exclusive rooms. The rather majestic lines and graceful cupolas of this heritage building remain intact but the colours and furnishings used are so airy and bright as to uplift the whole.


The rooms are generously-sized and elegant enough to deserve the accolade of 'suite' and feature large beds and sweetly-old fashioned furniture. The ambience is rendered fresh and contemporary by the orange, yellows and blues used in the furnishings and floors and in the quirky motifs that decorate some walls.

There is a central courtyard, especially alluring in the evenings when the temperatures are cooler and a sheltered corridor lined with gauzy curtains that are perfect during the day. Although there is no pool on the premises, you are allowed to use the pool of a neighbouring hotel.

The owner, Thakur Durga Singh, is well-known in Jaipur circles for his knowledge and understanding of all things Rajasthani and therefore makes for a fascinating host.

The location of the hotel is a short walk away from one of the entrances to the old, pink city of Jaipur adding to the hotel's attractions.
address:
New Mandawa House
Adjoining Punjab National Bank
Sansar Chandra Road

description:
An immensely popular hotel, the Radisson Blu Agra Taj East Gate hotel is preferred not only for its fantastic location just a few minutes away from the Taj Mahal but also for the luxury of its appointments.

The hotel has a light, contemporary feel and the modern rooms are furnished with deep mattresses, business amenities such as high-speed wifi connectivity and a work desk.There are several places to eat, and a good swimming pool with a spa.
WebWriteUp1:
The new Radisson Hotel is close to Shilpgram, the eastern gate to the Taj Mahal. 

The hotel has a rooftop swimming pool which is very welcome in the dry heat of Agra with a poolside bar that features an open air barbecue during the cooler months of October to March. You can grab a quick bite any time at the twenty-four hour coffee shop or treat yourself to a six-course sit down meal at the Dawat-e-Nawab which serves set vegetarian and non vegetarian meals made according to the royal standards of the erstwhile Nawab. Definitely a destination for a special occasion, this dining experience is the first of its kind in the city and a great chance to explore royal North Indian cuisine.

The hotel spa offers reflexology and deep tissue treatments and has a steam room and gym. The fitness room has a number of high-caliber exercise machines.

description: This a small guest house located in a secure residential colony, but close to the colourful Galleria Mall. There are 16 well furnished and comfortable rooms, several of which have terraces or balconies. The service is efficient and enthusiastic. Good value meals can be ordered by room service.
address:
A-750, Sushant Lok-I
Galleria market Road

description:
Helsa Resort is 2 km from Mon, just off the start of the road to Lungwa. It is an authentic and atmospheric place to stay with a covered dining area and six traditionally built bamboo cottages overlooking the hills and the town. 

The cottages are basic, and have a simple bathroom with hot and cold water provided in buckets. The best aspect is the sit outs with views of the surrounding hills.

This renovated riverside palace has an unbeatable location, right on the banks of the River Ganges, just a 10 minute walk from the Old City. Some rooms have exceptional views of the River, which can also be enjoyed from the various terraces and the rooftop dining area. There is a peaceful meditation room. 

Access is by boat from the ghats to the northern end of the City, making this a comfortable base for those who wish to fully immerse themselves in the life of Varanasi.
address:
CK 1/14, Patni Tola, Chowk
Between Mehta hospital & Bhosle Ghat

description:
Citus Retreats is beautifully located along the backwaters near Alleppey. There is no  road access so a ferry is arranged by the resort to take you along the river to the hotel reception.

The resort offers spacious and airconditioned  rooms, decorated with rich-colored fabrics and dark wood furnishings. There is a swimming pool and a restaurant which serves a selection of South Indian dishes and Mediterranean flavors. A second food outlet offers dishes prepared with fresh organic ingredients.
WebWriteUp1:
Reached by a 10 minute boat ride, with a wide river to one side and paddy fields to the other, this is ideal for anyone who wants to experience the backwaters without going on a houseboat.

There is an impressive large lobby and restaurant, plus an open air "floating" (i.e. surrounded by water channels) restaurant .There is a large swimming pool, spa and massage centre. There are 4 private pool villas. The remaining 30 rooms are all large, comfortable, and modern looking, some with balconies with views either over the river or the paddy fields. 

The hotel offers daily included activities such as a cookery demonstration (16:00 to 16:30), followed by a sunset backwater cruise on their own motor boat (17:00 to 18:00), and dancers during dinner (20:00 to 21:00).
address:
8/504A-504N, Karimba Valavu
Punnapra North (Po)
Paravoor Village

Sakthan Thampuran Nagar
T. B. road

Junction of Nehru Road & Western Express Highway
Vile Parle (East)

description:
Him View Guesthouse is a homely guest house, perfectly located just a few minutes walk from the centre of McleodGanj. 

The rooms are simple but many have balconies with views over the hills. There is a courtyard and small restaurant which serves delicious home cooked vegetarian meals.

The guesthouse is run by a very friendly and helpful Tibetan family, and there are reminders of Tibet throughout.
WebWriteUp1:
A rather unassuming hotel from the outside, the 8 Auspicious Him View Hotel nevertheless houses warm, characterful rooms all with great views over the snowy Dhauladhar Mountains. 

The location of the hotel down a quiet street in McLeodganj is perfect, being away from the busy streets and yet walking distance from the Tsulagkhang Temple Complex, the official residence of the present Dalai Lama and the street shopping market of McLeodganj. 

Furnished in bright yet restful colours, the rooms of the hotel are all different from each other: some having warm wood floors while others have large windows that allow you to enjoy views of the mountains right from your bed.

Each of the rooms bears one of the eight auspicious signs of Tibetan Buddhism which is also the reason for the name of the hotel. Take the conch, for example, which symbolizes the deep, cosmic sound of the Dharma teachings of the Buddha. Used here in the paintings that adorn the wall and the embroidery on the bedspread, these are efforts by the hotel and the artists to preserve their threatened Tibetan heritage.

The hotel has a terrace on the roof which is a great place to unwind and for views over the neighbourhood. The hotel's restaurant prides itself on its homemade cookies and cakes and meals. The hotel also offers free wifi facilities throughout the hotel.

But what most travelers to this hotel really appreciate is the personalized and attentive service they receive. Being a family-run enterprise a lot of attention is paid to detail and cleanliness and in providing guests with a unique experience.

description:
The Pllazio Hotel is a new hotel in Gurgaon with excellent rooms and facilities. Each Room is 36 square meter with a king sized or twin bed with exclusive linen spread on a 10" foam mattress. 

The Melange restaurant offers a choice of mediterranean, continental, oriental & pan asian cuisines. 

The hotel is conveniently located in walking distance of the main metro station of Gurgaon that links up with the Delhi metro network.
address:
Plot No. 292-296, Sector-29
City Centre
 M:-+91-

description:
Bon farmhouse offers homestay accommodation in a typical village farm ambience of Sikkim. It is a very peaceful and pleasant place, looked after by a local family. 

The farmhouse has a rich livestock inventory for providing fresh milk and eggs for a healthy and nutritious meal. It also has an area of four acres of cultivated fields, tea gardens and six acres of lush green cardamom forest.
address:
P/O Kewzing Bazaar
Below Kewzing Monastery
Ravangla Subdivision
South Sikkim

description:
This pleasant hotel is is located in the market town of Bagdogra, which is lively during the day, but is much quieter at night than the nearby, much larger, town of Siliguri. The rooms are of varying ages and size, but all are well equipped. 

There is a restaurant with a peaceful small terrace overlooking a garden, and even a small branch of Glenary's, the most famous coffee house of Darjeeling.

This is a new and very comfortable hotel with an unusual location on the top floor of the new Orbit Mall. The large deluxe rooms are very stylish, being decorated predominately in white, and would not seem out of place in a chic boutique hotel in a metro city. 

There is a very attractive restaurant, and good views over the city and towards the foothills of the Himalayas beyond.

Amongst the simple "backpacker" hostels on Sudder Street, this new boutique style hotel stands out. The Buddhist artifacts, and plants, scattered through the hotel, and in the rooms, help to create a tranquil atmosphere of calm. 

There is a small restaurant, with a pleasant outdoor sitting area, and the large spa is set to become a major attraction.

This hotel has a superb location, directly opposite the historic New Market. The rooms are spread over 7 floors of the tall, narrow building, and, though space is obviously at a premium in such a desirable location, they are well equipped. The bar, restaurant, and rooftop terrace on the 9th floor offer an unbeatable view over the city.

This impressive large modern hotel has an ideal location on Chowringee, close to the Esplanade Metro Station, and the Indian Museum. 

The large lobby has a small cake shop, and a very attractive larger coffee shop. On the mezzanine are a bar, and an award winning specialist Bengali restaurant.

address:
D. No. 175/177
Station Road
Bellary Dist.

description: Cherry Resort is located in the Temi Tea Estate, 16 km from Ravangla. The hotel itself is a largely characterless block but the rooms are spacious and the views are unsurpassed as the resort is situated in a truly spectacular location, being totally surrounded by very photogenic tea gardens and mountains. In the morning you can therefore enjoy stunning views of Mt Kanchanjangha and the entire Himalayan range from the roof-top cafe.

Though Pal is now almost a suburb of Jodhpur, the area immediately around Pal Garh has the feel of a rural village. The large well appointed rooms surround a delightful garden. There is a swimming pool, and an overall atmosphere of peace and tranquility, yet the bustling city of Jodhpur is just a few minutes away, making this an ideal base for those looking for comfort and relaxation after sightseeing.

The Retreat is just 1 km from the World Heritage Site of the famous Taj Mahal. Fitted with wooden flooring, modern air-conditioned rooms feature a personal safe and a private bathroom with 24-hour supply of hot and cold water. Coffee/tea making facilities and a minibar are included, along with bottled water. Offering 24-hour room service, the multi-cuisine restaurant serves Chinese, European and local Indian cuisine.
address:
Taj Nagari Phase -1,
Near Prateek Enclave 
Shilpgram Road

description: Well known throughout India for their vegetarian restaurants, the Dasapraksh group's new hotel in Agra is bright and clean. The modern well equipped rooms, though small,  are comfortable. This is a simple place, but with an emphasis on efficiency, cleanliness and hygiene with can be lacking elsewhere in Agra. The busy restaurant is famous for its delicious South Indian food, and their ice cream sundaes are legendary.
WebWriteUp1:
Known for its brisk efficiency, the Hotel Dasaprakash is part of a local Indian chain of hotels. A modern hotel, the hotel management and staff, nevertheless, aim to provide the guests with a warm and personalized service. The rooms are well-appointed clean and all rooms have wifi access.

The hotel is equally popular for the South Indian restaurant that forms a part of its group, serving delicious South Indian food that's hard to find in Agra. A branch of this restaurant is to be found in the hotel and is definitely an added incentive for staying here.

Situated within easy distance of the Taj Mahal and major sights of the cities, the Hotel Dasaprakash is also located close to other popular hotels and several restaurants making it an ideal area of the city to stay in.

description:
Across the river from Hampi, in the heritage village of Anegundi, is a small but prettily landscaped boutique property called Uramma Cottages. The attractive cottages look out onto the lawn, and are distinctively furnished using local fabrics. There is a restaurant serving excellent local dishes.

The friendly staff can take guests for a stroll around the village to see the various other eco-tourism initiatives which the owners of the hotel are involved in, such as a school, library, weaving centre, and craft centre. Mountain bikes are available to explore the surrounding villages and temples, or the ruins of Hampi.

The Ramada Chennai Egmore is situated in in the heart of Chennai. Renovated in 2012, the hotel has 113 rooms that come with all modern amenities and latest gadgets. 

The Board Walk rooftop restaurant has great cuisine and ambience. It has indoor and outdoor seating and is has a swimming pool next to it.
creditcards: American Express, Visa, Mastercard, Maestro, Union Pay
address:
Gandhi Irwin Bridge Road

Egmore

description: Occupying a corer of the courtyard of the larger, grander, Pal Haveli, this charming family residence has been lovingly converted into a homely heritage hotel. The large rooms feature antique furnishings. The highlight is the rooftop terrace and dining area which has fabulous unobstructed views of the Meherangarh Fort.
address:

Near Clock Tower

Near New Archaeological Museum
Rajnagar Road

description: The largest of the hotels close to Ranthambore National Park, the Regency Resort has 70 large modern rooms, a swimming pool, a bar, and a large restaurant where varied hearty buffet meals are served. It provides an efficient and comfortable base for relaxing before and after safaris.

Boasting India's largest pool, the Radisson resort in Mamallapuram is a high-standard hotel situated just a couple of kilometers away from the World Heritage temples of Mamallapuram.

The pleasing, meandering structure of the hotel means that most rooms are close to the pool with lawns and swaying palm trees in-between. The rooms are luxurious, with mattresses you can sink into, bathrooms you can fall asleep in and either a patio or a balcony to relax in. The d�cor of the rooms reflects the textile heritage of southern India.
WebWriteUp1:
The Radisson's luxurious chalets, villas and bungalows are spread around manicured gardens stretching 500m to the beach. Somewhere in the midst is India's longest swimming pool, all 220m of it. 

Rooms range from large to enormous and the most expensive have private pools. The Radisson also offers Mamallapuram's finest dining and two top-notch spas (one exclusively ayurvedic). 

There are two restaurants to choose from: one, overlooking the sea, which serves Indian and Italian food with equal panache and the other, a pool side all-day restaurant. There is an in-house Ayurveda spa, forty-four acres of hotel gardens to explore and the delightful East Coast Road is just a step away from your hotel.

description:
Palais de Mahe is located in the heart of the French Quarter, a few steps away from the famed Promenade. 

The rooms are high-ceilinged, spacious and uncluttered. Fine period inspired furnishings provide just the right finishing touch. There is an inviting plunge pool, located right in the courtyard, and an Ayurvedic massage and treatment centre.

The rooftop restaurant whips up French delicacies, Continental fare and local cuisine with equal ease.
WebWriteUp1:
An elegant, low slung building the colour of mango mousse and colonial white, the Palai de Mahe beckons you with the promise of a lazy swim in the blue waters of its pool and an even lazier nap in a planters chair on its wide verandah.

Colonial elegance define this building in the former French colony of Pondicherry. Potted plants line the corridors and fans whirl slowly overhead. The beautiful period furniture is used but sparingly contributing to the general feeling of airiness, a welcome trait in a warm, humid place like the south east coast of India.

The Casino Group of Hotels, to which the Palais de Mahe hotel belongs, prides itself on its food and emphasizes raditional recipes and fusion cuisine. You can choose to dine in the outdoor seating area by the pool or under the cool of the tiled roof on the first level.  

With only a handful of rooms the hotel can quickly start feeling like home or rather a holiday home. Step out of the hotel and you're on the quiet streets of the French Quarter with its wealth of elegant French colonial style buildings in pastel and white.

description:
Built in a style that combines the contemporary with the colonial, the 8th Bastion is located in walking distance from the many historical and cultural highlights of Cochin inlcuding the 15th century Chinese fishing nets. 

The decor is both colonial yet contemporary and the property offers 19 spacious rooms, some of which overlook the Arabian Sea.

address:
C/O Coconut Lagoon
Kumarakom,


Fax 0481 2523571
Email:

description:
A small, secluded, comfortable and upmarket country retreat with lots of thoughtful touches. The lodge is built in the Indian style around the central courtyard with alcoves and patio allowing guests to mingle or have privacy to relax and chill out. 

The rooms are large, well equipped and very comfortable. Dining takes place together around a large table where you can share your experiences of the day.
WebWriteUp1:
The rooms are large, well equipped and very comfortable. All have a tea/coffee maker, refrigerator, air conditioning, heater, study table and colonial furniture, and attached bathroom with a separate shower area and dressing room.

The retreat has a very homely atmosphere with a personal touch to the service. Dining takes place together around a large table where you can share your experiences of the day. 

The owners' love for nature and absolute commitment for wildlife preservation is evident. They support the local community and employ local staff. They use locally available material in order to minimize impact on the ecosystem, recycle natural resources, are energy efficient and conserve water.

address:
1/341, Next to St. Francis Church
Rose Street
Fort Cochin

description:
Amanbagh, meaning "peaceful garden", lies in a verdant oasis, fed by a nearby lake, and previously the site of the Maharajah of Alwar's hunting lodge and pleasure garden. 

Amanbagh is a refined palatial-style mansion, a unique latter day haveli, architecturally faithful to the impressive, imperial Moghul dynasty.
WebWriteUp1:
The topography of the Alwar region consists of sandy plains interspersed with craggy hills, a stark contrast to Amanbaghs setting which is an oasis of verdant greenery. 

Deriving its name from aman, meaning peace in Sanskrit and bagh, meaning garden in Hindi, Amanbagh lies within a walled compound once used by the Maharajah of Alwar to site his mobile hunting camps in search of the elusive tigers known to roam the nearby hills. Long since abandoned, the trees and vegetation continued to thrive due to a reliable source of underground water. The resort is very much a modern day Mughal Palace, conceived in the present, but paying homage to the architecture and design of Indias golden age.

Made almost entirely of pink sandstone by local stonemasons, there are 16 Pool Pavilions and 24 Havelis. Pool Pavilions are set around the perimeter of the resort, each with their own private pool and garden. The Havelis are set amongst the date and mango trees with their own private courtyard, garden or balcony. All suites feature a large bathtub carved from Udaipur green marble and are fitted with Bose sound systems and a personal bar.

As well as a large 33m/108 ft. marbled magnetic main swimming pool, Aman Spa, informal dining area and wading pool, there is a well-stocked library and a roof terrace elevated above a canopy of trees, which has fabulous views over the surrounding countryside.

If you can bear to leave the premises, you can undertake a number of truly worthwhile activities: picnics into the countryside, hike to ancient Somsagar Lake, explore the haunted ruins at Bhangarh, visit the archaeological sites in the Paranagar area. 

For the less active or those simply looking to relax then the resort is perfect it has a beautiful swimming pool, a spa and also offers yoga and meditation classes.

Dining is world-class.The excellent restaurant serves a delicious selection of local dishes as well as a wide range of other cuisine. There is an extensive wine list with a good choice of international wine. Amanbagh's staff is enchanting: warm, discreet.

description:
Amanbagh, meaning "peaceful garden", lies in a verdant oasis, fed by a nearby lake, and previously the site of the Maharajah of Alwar's hunting lodge and pleasure garden. 

Amanbagh is a refined palatial-style mansion, a unique latter day haveli, architecturally faithful to the impressive, imperial Moghul dynasty.
WebWriteUp1:
Amanbagh, built within a walled enclosure, on an oasis of fertile soil, benefits lucratively from the natural feed of a nearby lake, resulting in an exotic and diverse display of perennials: statuesque palms, aged eucalyptus, fruit bearing trees, frangipani trees and lawns of manicured jade green, a dramatic contrast to its neighbouring rugged and hilly terrain. Styled along authentic architectural Moghul-era-lines, Amanbagh pays grand tribute to its remarkable ancestors through its eloquent, unique interpretation of a grand haveli.

The inspired use of local materials for the period details and lavish interiors; floors of softly hued pink marble or makrana, and domed cupolas and inner courtyards of pale smooth sandstone; evoke the lustre and splendour of India's golden age. Amanbagh is a secluded and luxuriant "portal", offering visitors the opportunity to discover and explore the fascinating remnants of an extraordinary local history, as well as the colourful culture and wildlife that flourishes today.

description:
In the quiet village of Churi Ajitgarh, just 10 kilometers from Mandawa, two adjoining traditional havelis now offer the most stylish accommodation in the Shekawati region.  

The original exteriors of the 19th century havelis has been retained, along with their fresco paintings, but the interiors have been furnished in a very modern, contemporary style, with excellent use of light and space, allowing for an indulgent stay in comfort, in historic surroundings.
WebWriteUp1:
Given the sheer number of Shekhawati's famous frescoes, most visitors feel like no amount of time is sufficient enough to appreciate them all. The recently-opened Vivaana Hotel is housed inside one of these painted havelis and lets you get up close to these wonderful paintings.

Built in the 19th century, the hotel has a rambling feel with each room being a different shape and size as in all true heritage hotels. All rooms, however, have their walls lined with graceful hand-painted frescoes which the owners have been careful as not to over-restore in their effort to create an authentic atmosphere.

A large lawn forms the centre of the hotel which is a great space to relax and grab a bite in. There is a large pool to cool off in, especially welcome during the long, hot summer days. If you are a family with young children they are sure to appreciate the open spaces and in-house pool.

The village surrounding the haveli is, of course, fascinating, being part of the Shekhawati region that was once a stop on the famed Silk Route. The villagers are known to be friendly and any walk is sure to give you wonderful insight into the village's history as well as the daily life in a present-day Indian village.

If you're looking forward to try the famous 'lal maas' (literally 'red meat') curry that is a signature Rajasthani dish, this is a good place to try it. Their vegetarian food is known to be good as well.

description: This new hotel in the relatively calm Cantonment area of the city has been designed and built to a level of contemporary comfort rare in this historic city. From the subdued red colours of the lobby area, to the blues of the lounge bar, to the modern coffee shop and speciality kebab restaurant, and the spacious and stylishly furnished rooms, this is a hotel of understated luxury, making it a peaceful and comfortable retreat from the noise and chaos of the city.

The Jayamahal Palace was originally constructed in the 1900s by a British Resident of Bangalore, and is at present owned by the grandson of the Maharaja of Gondal, an erstwhile princely State in Gujarat. Renovated at the beginning of this century, it is now the only heritage palace hotel in Bangalore situated in 19 acres of spawling grounds.

The guestrooms exude a colonial charm and have an atmospheric lived-in quality that no fancy design can duplicate. There is a garden restaurant, a coffee shop and two lounge bars, all designed with a motor sports theme, reflecting the love the family has for motor racing.
WebWriteUp1:
The Jayamahal Palace was originally constructed in the 1900s by a British Resident of Bangalore, and is at present owned by the grandson of the Maharaja of Gondal, an erstwhile princely State in Gujarat. Renovated at the beginning of this century, it is now the only heritage palace hotel in Bangalore.

The rooms have interiors featuring stain glass and attractive furnishing in different themes. The Gujarat Suite has murals of elephants and camel on the walls. The Peacock Suite is another attractive suite. The other suites include the Royal Suite, the Jayamahal Suite with stain glass windows, Partridge Suite and the Flamingo Suite.

There is an open garden restaurant called "Autumn" which serves Indian and Chinese cuisine but the main attraction would probably be the live pasta and tandoor. There is a coffee shop called "Pitstop", which is designed with a motor sports theme. The hotel has two lounge bars, "Formula 111" and the "Granite" bar. The ambience reflects the love the family has for motor racing. The glass tables are placed on real "Surtee 5000" racing car tyres, while the walls adorn pictures of the Maharaja with his race cars. It is a blend of unique ideas.

description:
The Heritage Resort in Badami is a small pleasant hotel surrounded by lush green lawns. 

The resorts consists of six air-conditioned cottages with all basic amenities and spacious sit-outs. The multi-cuisine restaurant serves vegetarian North/South Indian dishes. 

It's a great place to unwind after touring the magnificent rock-cut temples that Badami is famous for.

Vivanta by Taj Begumpet is centrally located in Hyderabad and close to Sanjeevaiah Park, Birla Mandir Temple, and Hyderabad Central Mall. Other points of interest near this luxury resort include Snow World and Lumbini Park. 

This 5-star property has 181 air-conditioned guestrooms, 2 restaurants, a coffee shop/caf�, a bar/lounge, an outdoor pool, a health club, a sauna, and a steam room. The property's full-service health spa has body treatments, massage/treatment rooms, and facials.
