description:
The Blackbuck lodge is a fabulours wildlife resort surrounded by wild country all around.

The lodge has 14 independent cottages where every possible comfort had been taken care of - from the plump cushions on the bed and window seat, the large satellite TV, the marble floors adorned with rugs, the pencil drawings on the stone walls and the beautiful teak furniture - all giving the impression of a luxurious African safari lodge.
WebWriteUp1:
The cottages of the Blackbuck Lodge are as good as they get. Luxuriously furnished, with high quality linen and light fittings. Rooms are spacious, with king beds, a study table and chair and space created by the windows to sit around - or even for a child to sleep. Air-conditioning is very effective for warm days, or you can enjoy fresh air on the deck chairs in the veradah - ideal for sunbathing and watching Blackbucks. 

The bathrooms are big too, with a tub and shower. There is a separate shower open-to-the-sky too; it's fun, and no one can see you! Surprisingly, each cottage has a flat screen television set connected to a dish for clear reception. There are facilities to make your tea / coffee in the room.

The park gates are about half a mile away, but you don't even need to go there all the time when Nature's creations come to you in your lodge anyway. The back door of the cottage leads straight on to your very own terrace with cushioned teak chairs from which you can survey the surroundings and wait for blackbuck, nilgai and birdlife to turn up for a drink. 

You can go for safaris in your own car, or book one in the lodge's old Wiley jeeps. Other amenities include a library with comfortable sofas and a dining where you can request cuisines of your choice.

Meals are made using fresh ingredients, taste good and served in fine crockery. There are no other eating options around, but you will not have reasons to complain here.
address:

Saurashtra

description:
A serene and romantic waterfront retreat on the western shore of Lake Vembanad. Purity has 5 unique deluxe rooms, 4 garden suites and 4 Vembanad suites which are ideal suites for families. All rooms have terraces and verandahs overlooking the lake.

The drawing room is like an art gallery as it showcases unique antiques and interpretations of modern India. The idyllic lakeside garden houses a waterfront pavilion for arrival and departure by boat, a stunning pool, as well as an Ayurvedic spa and yoga space.??
address:
East of Muhamma Police Station
Muhamma P.O.

description:
This delightful family run homestay occupies an old haveli in a village within the walls of Chittaurgarh Fort. There are 8 comfortable and charming air conditioned rooms, with en-suite bathrooms built by using local stone. 

Bicycles are available to explore the village and the Fort, and guests are encouraged to feel at home, and join in with the daily activities of the family, such as by joining the women of the family in the kitchen preparing the vegetarian meals.
WebWriteUp1: The Padmini Haveli Guesthome is situated in a village inside the Chittaurgarh Fort walls, close to the ruins of the Ratan Singh Palace. The guesthouse is run by a local family, most of who work as guides to the Fort. There are 8 simple, comfortable, air conditioned rooms. The bathrooms are distinctive and memorable as they use local stone instead of ceramics, and ladders as towel rails. The rooms are decorated with photo collages of local scenes. There is a library, and an overall feel of a comfortable homestay. Guests are encouraged to help the women of the family with the cooking if they wish. Food is vegetarian and there is no alcohol as there are temples nearby. The terrace has great views over the village and the town. There are excellent new geared bicycles available, and guests are encouraged to use these to explore the Fort - one of the family will go along as a guide. There are no luxuries, but this is a friendly, atmospheric, comfortable and homely place to stay and a memorable opportunity to actually stay inside Chittaurgarh Fort.
address:

description: Hotel Japfu is Kohima's oldest hotel, and it shows. It has a central location and a grand entrance, but no character at all. The 30 rooms are bland, gloomy, and have poor bathrooms. They have balconies, but these have been enclosed and so are ugly. Staff is disinterested. It resembles a poor Government run hotel.

Razhu Pru is a lovely, quaint homestay in Kohima. The heritage bungalow re are a couple of other places to stay in the town, but this has by the far the nicest atmosphere and feels very relaxed and homely. 

The rooms are decently sized, clean and with hot water and good bathrooms. They provide a spectacular  view of the mountains beyond.
WebWriteUp1:
The Razhu Pru is a very welcome addition to the utilitarian hotel scene in Kohima. An old Bungalow converted into a hotel, Razhu Pru is located in the Historical Kohima Village. Being located in the Mission compound, the starting point of the Kohima village and near the church, it simply makes for a wonderful stay with great views of the village and the valley! 

The Rhaza Pru has about 8-10 guest rooms, all comfortable but fairly spartan. Electricity is often off in Kohima, so it pays to heat up water (individual controls in the spotless bathrooms) well ahead of need. The food is healthy and breakfasts wholeseome. But it is the charm of this historic "cottage", the taste with which its decoration has been carried out, the appeal of its hill-side location and the availability of terrace and garden, that make it such a happy surprise in Kohima. The staff are endlessly willing and kind, and the owners attentive to guest needs. The hotel aims to be a second home for visitors and succeeds.

address:
Siro Village
P.O. & P.S. Hapoli
District Lower Subansiri

description:
This Bungalow is a new addition to the Neemrana chain of heritage properties. It is situated in the old walled city of Ahmedabad and seems to fit right in with the Neemrana culture of "non-hotels". 

This 19th century property was for much of its life the bungalow of the Divan of Radhanpur and still retains the air of a grand family home. The mansion has a fountain fore court and is decorated with floral plasterwork, two wooden jharokhas, inviting verandas and bright stained glass.
WebWriteUp1: The Divan's Bungalow is a very pleasant small and homely place. There are 8 rooms, all accessed from the ground floor. Half then have steep steps up to the rooms themselves, which are on the first floor.  All are large and atmospheric with antique furnishings; many have large separate sitting areas. We can base quotations on the cheapest rooms (e.g. Zia Khana). There is a dining room, where excellent meals are served to a fixed menu, a lounge with good wi-fi access, a peaceful sitting area with a swing chair, and a very small garden. It is located in a predominantly Muslim market area. There is a mosque nearby, for compulsory early morning alarm calls. Service is good, staff is helpful, and the overall feel is of staying in a comfortable historic home stay with personal attention.

description:
Originally called Nahar Mahal, this palatial mansion was built about 100
years ago as the summer residence of the royal family of Chhota Udepur in
60 acres of ground along River Orsang. Attractively set in fruit orchards, the mansion has fountains in the forecourt and in the courtyard. The palatial mansion has terraces with good views of the gardens.
WebWriteUp1: Kali Niketan has sic air-conditioned rooms with attached bathroom. Indian and Continental meals are cooked by the household staff.

description: This efficient modern hotel is located on the outskirts of Vrindavan and faetures a large colourful lobby, an excellent vegetarian restaurant, and comfortable, well equipped rooms, making it the most comfortable base from which to explore the temples of Vrindavan itself, as well as those of nearby Mathura.

A newly renovated hotel located in a residential area but just a few minutes walk from one of the most happening malls in Patna.

The hotel offers spacious airconditioned rooms with all modern comforts including free Wi-Fi.

Buddha Heritage features a fitness centre and a rooftop multi-cuisine restaurant. Dining options also include Courtyard, a 24-hour coffee shop, and Anand Bar and Lounge that serves refreshing beverages.

address:
Near Private Bus Terminal
Fort Kochi

description:
A rustic resort with wooden huts on stilts, with a well-positioned wooden deck overlooking the jungle - where you can spend the evening gazing at the setting sun giving way to star sprinkled skies at night, with the gentle breeze for company.

The log huts are covered with dried grass to absorb heat or cold. The huts come with all essential living amenities, complete with hot and cold running water. The quaint mud and jute restaurant serves great meals. At night you can enjoy a bonfire and barbeque dinner.
WebWriteUp1:
A rustic jungle lodge in a recently opened national park gives you to perfect opportunity to feel like a pioneer explorer into the jungles of Pench National Park. The log huts and other structures of the camp have been constructed using local materials and traditional wisdom, such as using dry reed for roofing that helps regulate the extremes of temperature the park experiences and mud to build the dining area.

Rather than creating an environment so polished as to make you forget your proximity to the wild, at Tribal Camp you are encouraged to remember the wildlife that you are here to experience. Yet, modern conveniences like air coolers in the summer, hot and cold running water and attached bathrooms have been provided. The food has often been appreciated by guests for its 'made at home' flavour.

Perhaps, the most important aspect of any jungle lodge is the quality of the jungle guides. At Tribal Camp the owners are so actively involved as to accompany some jeep safaris and consciously use guides with in-depth local knowledge, often employed from the local tribal communities.

You'll probably want to make a couple of jeep safaris into Pench National Park simply in order to do justice to the wealth of wildlife and landscapes it offers: leopards and tigers, mouse deer and spotted deer, monitor lizards and marsh crocodiles, numerous water birds drawn to the waters of the Pench River and the many artificial water bodies and, of course, the unique landscape of teak forests.
address:
Jamuntola
Pench Tiger Reserve

description:
A delightful beach resort set around a palm filled garden and located right on the Bay of Bengal.

This resort was built way back in 1914 and managed for many years by the Oberoi hotels. It was recently taken over by the Mayfair Hotels who completely reconstructed the hotel with more rooms, amenities and facilities. 

The hotel offers air-conditioned rooms, all pleasantly furnished. It has its own secluded beach, a bar and a restaurant.

The Tiger Camp Resort is located on the periphery of the stunning Jim Corbett National Park. It is a luxury yet eco-sensitive retreat nestled in acres of thickly wooded landscape. 

The resort offers authentically designed spacious and contemporary guest accommodation with all modern amenities, each with its own private sit-out.
WebWriteUp1: There is enough activity, adventure and exploring in and around the resort to fill up your day from dawn to dusk. We arrange for a jeep safari and a trip by canter into Dhikala, the core area of Corbett National Park. You can also opt for an elephant ride, a trek into the reserve, rappelling or rock climbing, or just lazing around the beautiful lawns.

address:
Tapovan
Village Gugtayani talli
Badrinath Highway

description:
In a peaceful location with a direct access path to Candolim beach, this is an ideal hotel for a beach holiday. Two storey whitewashed villas surround the swimming pool area and decor is light, bright and airy. 

At Sonesta Inns all rooms have air-conditioning, shower, satellite TV, telephone, minibar at a charge and room service.

A buffet restaurant serves a good range of international cuisines, with Indian, Chinese and seafood specialties.
WebWriteUp1:
A great value for money hotel, Sonesta Inns is a mid-budget hotel a short walk away from the quieter Candolim Beach. Equipped with a pool, a spa and children's facilities, this hotel is great choice for families. 

The rooms at Sonesta Inns are freshly renovated and are spacious and comfortable with large beds and a pleasing colour palate. Each room has a balcony you can relax in and some of the rooms overlook the pool.

At fifteen minutes away from Calangute, Sonesta Inns avoids the rush of tourists and vehicles there by being located in the more peaceful area of Candolim, which is nevertheless, filled with shops and restaurants serving a wide range of food. Step out of your hotel and you will have wide choice of eateries and activities to choose from.

The dining facilities at the hotel include a multi-cuisine restaurant known for its Indian food, a coffee shop, a poolside bar and a pub. The health club has a gym, a Jacuzzi and a steam room and the spa offers Ayurvedic and Swedish massage treatments.

The staff is friendly and helpful. The children's facilities include a toddler's pool and a dedicated children's play area. 

Candolim is located between the beaches of Calangute and Baga with their buzzing streetlife and Sinquerim, where the historically important Fort Aguada stands guard. You may choose to walk around or rent a scooter in order to visit these.

address:

Chalakudy - Anamala Road, 
Kannamkuzhy PO, 
Via Chalakudy - Trichur

description: This small, welcoming and homely guest house in a relatively well ordered part of the city is just a few minutes walk form the banks of the Brahmaputra River and interesting markets. The 6 guest rooms are simply furnished, but are comfortable, and have air conditioning and en-suite bathrooms. There is usually a very friendly atmosphere in the old fashioned lounge and around the communal dining table, making this the perfect place to start or end a visit to North East India.
WebWriteUp1:
Almost unanimously declared by guests to be their 'home away from home', Baruah Bhawan is a heritage guesthouse in the heart of Guwahati. The home of many illustrious personages, the walls of this home resound with history.

Although the house dates back a hundred-odd years, little remains of the original wooden structure, having been replaced by more modern building materials and styles in the 70s. Yet the building retains its elegance which is replicated in its furnishings. Ornate carved furniture is juxtaposed with light colours and flooring so as to keep the feel airy yet authentic.

But, like anywhere, the thing that turns a building from a house into a home are the people and the staff and owners of Baruah Bhawan are known for their unflagging generous hospitality.  

The present owner, Mr Raj Baruah, is often on the premises and has an long and respected career in the Merchant Navy. He was also, at one time, in charge of the Government of Assam's fleet of river vessels. Son of Dr Birnichi Baruah who founded the Guwahati University and the Assam Academy for Cultural Relations, any conversation with him is likely to enrich your understanding and knowledge of the state of Assam.

description:
Greenwood Villa is 12km from Kohima on the National Highway 39 towards Imphal in Manipur. It is just 2km beyond the site of the Hornbill Festival making it the best place to stay at that time of the year. 

The villa is a large modern house, home to several generations of a well to do English speaking Naga family, and so is more of a grand homestay than a hotel. There are four guest rooms, all en-suite.
WebWriteUp1:
The Greenwood Villa is run by lovely people, making it the perfect place to stay for anyone who does not require luxury, especially during the Hornbill festival when the traffic makes it impractical to stay in Kohima itself.

On the first floor is a very pleasant large triple room, and a smaller twin room which has a squat toilet. On the second floor is a double room, and another twin room which could accommodate an extra bed. The bathrooms have geysers for hot water but no showers, so buckets are used. 

There are several beautiful terraces, a very comfortable and well furnished lounge, and a dining room. The food served here was the best, and most varied, we had in Nagaland.

The nearby village of Kegwama is interesting for a stroll, and as the family is from this village they are happy to show people around it.

description: A simple but bright and very homely small guest house with enthusiastic and very personable owners, who make guests feel at home in a friendly and comfortable environment, with a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere. There are 8 small but charming rooms, many with sit outs decorated with plants. Home cooked meals can be ordered on request.
WebWriteUp1:
The picture of a quaint, colonial cottage Aerodene Cottage is built in traditional Assamese style and rests on stone stilts. Built in a quiet corner of Shillong by the Umshyrpi River in 1950 this delicate pink cottage retains a wonderful old-world charm and is the perfect place for people looking for a quiet stay whether as a couple or a family.

The cottage's bamboo plastered walls are painted in white and light pastel colours giving all the rooms a pleasant feel. The handcrafted beds and chintzy fabrics add to its authentic colonial feel. 

The garden that surrounds the cottage is a definite highlight with fruit trees and many secluded spots and is also a treat for children.

The food is very much the kind the locals would eat in their own homes and the staff are warm and welcoming, making you feel at home from the moment you enter.

Aerodene Cottage also has a ayurvedic spa and a meditation and yoga centre which holds regular programmes.

Shillong's only boutique guesthouse facility, Aerodene Cottage has hosted many satisfied guests who love this little oasis in the city.

description:
Located in the heart of Ahmedabad, Hotel Accolade is a modern hotel which offers good value for value accommodation in the middle of the commercial and shopping district. 

The 29 rooms feature modern interiors and dark wood furnishings. All rooms offer a personal safe, minibar and an attached bathroom with a shower. 

The Retreat restaurant serves a variety of pure vegetarian dishes. Law Garden Food street is very close to the hotel though so if you are adventurous you can go out at night to sample some great Gujarati street food.
WebWriteUp1:
A great budget hotel in Ahmedabad and known for the efficiency of its service and its comfortable rooms, Hotel Accolade is a popular hotel. Receiving a lot of repeat clients for the quality of its food, staff and furnishings, most visitors find this hotel to be 'just right'. Although housed in a modern, rather non-descript building, the rooms we use at the hotel are well-sized with pleasant furnishings and are all air conditioned. 

Although a small, modest hotel, Hotel Accolade offers twenty-four hour room service and tea and coffee maker in every room. Its in-house restaurant serves only vegetarian food, as a bow to local tastes, but serves dishes that range from Chinese to Continental to various types of Indian. The hotel's breakfast is known to feature a good selection of Indian snacks.

All in all, a good, economical choice of hotel with a convenient location and offering high customer satisfaction.

description: Gir Jungle Lodge is located by the entrance of Gir National Park in Gurjarat. It features an outdoor swimming pool, restaurant and rooms with a cable TV. Free parking is provided.Air-conditioned rooms at Gir Jungle have plenty of natural light. All are fitted with a kettle, seating area and bathroom with a hot/cold shower.Guests can enjoy a relaxing massage or visit the National Park. The hotel provides bicycle rental and ticketing services. Travel arrangements can be made at the tour desk.The Indian restaurant serves a fine selection of Punjabi and Gujarati dishes. Vegetarian and non-vegetarian dining options are available.Lodge Gir Jungle is 20 km from Satadhar and 30 km from Malia Railway Station. Somnath is 40 km from the hotel

When visiting Dasada, you'll feel right at home at Royal Safari Camps, which offers quality accommodation and great service. Only 90 km away, this 4-star hotel can be easily accessed from the airport. With its convenient location, the hotel offers easy access to the city's must-see destinations.The facilities and services provided by Royal Safari Camps ensure a pleasant stay for guests. Laundry service, shops, smoking area, Wi-Fi in public areas, meeting facilities are just a few of the facilities that set Royal Safari Camps apart from other hotels in the city. Guests can choose from 18 rooms, all of which exude an atmosphere of total peace and harmony. Whether you're a fitness enthusiast or are just looking for a way to unwind after a hard day, you will be entertained by top-class recreational facilities such as garden, hot spring bath, kids club, games room, pool (kids). Enjoy unparalleled services and a truly prestigious address at the Royal Safari Camps.

description:
Dreamingly grazing at the wooded Aravallis stands the palace of Chanoud Garh. It's unperturbed by the fast-changing world; knowing that its ramparts are strong enough to keep any sandstorm of change from threatening what it has preserved within.

Maybe it's just following the strict instructions left by Thakur Anoop Singh ji, when he built Chanoud Garh as a home for his generations to come. And thirteen generations later, the 200,000 square foot palace still loyally serves his present-day descendants.
address:
Level 7 South
New England House
New England Street

description:
The Sunderbans Jungle Camp is located on Bali Island in the remote southern stretches of West Bengal's Gangetic Delta. 

Located just at the edge of the world's largest mangrove eco-systems, the Sunderbans, the camp offers some very special opportunities to see and enjoy the flora and fauna of this UNESCO World Heritage Site.  
The Sunderbans Jungle Camp consists of six cottages with mud walls and thatched roofs on the outside but with comparatively luxurious furnishings on the inside. Pictures from a professional photographer line the walls.
WebWriteUp1: The camp lies in an area that was previously known as a poacher's village, but now these same people work as guides and staff for the Sunderbans Jungle Camp. By directly providing alternative livelihoods and educating the local employees about the importance and the practices of conservation in the forest, the camp has a positive vibe all around it and that fact shows up in nearly everything it does.

address:
Nageen Lake
Near Ashai Bagh Bridge

description: Just outside the Old City, but walking distance from Anokhi, the popular textile store with a lovely caf�, is the General's Retreat, the home of a distinguished family who accommodate guests in 12 simple but comfortable rooms above their residence. The large lawn insulates the property from the hustle and bustle of the city, making this a peaceful and relaxing place to stay.
WebWriteUp1:
The Generals Retreat is named after General Umrao Singhji a scion of the most premier 'Thikana' (Noble House) of Chomu in the erstwhile Jaipur State. He was educated at the Sandhurst Military Academy and received the Kings Commission, a rare and prestigious honour and achievement in those days. Being a distinguished soldier and of aristocratic background, the General engaged a French Architect to make a modern but gracious home for himself and his family.

The property is now owned & managed by the Generals direct descendant, his charming and gracious granddaughter Ketaki, who makes the most caring, attentive and efficient host. Ketaki is married to an ex Tea Planter & Tea Taster, and has spent a number of years in the Assam Tea Plantations and she has infused that life style in the heart and soul of The General's Retreat.

Each of the eleven rooms is styled with colourful coordinated bed covers and curtains. Air conditioning for the summers and heaters for the winter are provided along with a safe in all rooms. The lounge and dining area on the first floor is a homely space decorated in blue and white with adjoining terraces where you can sit and enjoy the sprawling lawns and greenery sprinkled with lots of local and resident birds. Breakfast is served at fixed times in the dining area. Lunch and dinner is available on prior order. Wi-Fi is complimentary for all guests.

address:
K.B. Jacob Road
Opposite Cochin Cultural Centre
Near Fort Kochi Private Bus Stand
Fort Cochin

description:
Housed in a colonial-style mansion, Victory Dawn is situated in the historic district of Fort Cochin, just a 3-minute walk from Cochin Parade Ground.

Fitted with wooden flooring, charming rooms have air conditioning and a small seating area. In-room comforts include a safe, tea/coffee making amenities and a private bathroom.

The hotel also has comfortable lounge areas and a business centre.

Kanha Village Eco Resort is an eco-friendly resort located in the dense buffer forest of Kanha National Park.  

The resort consists of luxury air-conditioned mud and clay cottages with all amenities such as a mini fridge, writing desk and free Wi-Fi. The resort also offers an outdoor pool, library and massage services.  The restaurant serves Indian, Continental, Chinese and authentic Tribal cuisine.

The resort organizes high quality Tiger safaris, Bird watching trips, Tribal village visits, and Nature treks.
WebWriteUp1: Following the principles of Responsible Travel, Kanha Village Eco Resort has installed solar powered pathway lighting system, CFL bulbs, organic composting, rain water harvesting and recycling of water. They respect local culture and traditions and by employing local youth they give them support.
address:
Near Kanha National Park- Kisli / Khatia gate 
Village Boda Chhapri
District: Mandla

description:
Paramount Guest House is a small hotel in the centre of town. There are six simple en-suite rooms, with cold running water and hot water by buckets. The dining area is upstairs, so is lighter and more appealing. 

The food is good, though the service is completely dependent on one young girl who does everything, as the owner is never present. When she leaves in the evenings the owner tells her to padlock the entrance and leave the key at her home nearby, so guests are locked in at night.

Behind the town is Whsipering Winds. This has a few nice rooms upstairs (Executive Deluxe) and some less pleasant, smaller and darker, rooms downstairs. It is friendly and professionally run, but occupies a cramped compound and the current views are about to be lost to a new block of rooms which are under construction, so it completely lacks the sense of space which Metsuben has.

Grace Lodge is a simple but new and clean place with a young and helpful owner.There are seven clean, bright rooms which share five basic squat toilets. There is no running water, so all comes by bucket. There is a plain dining room which serves good food.

Touphema Village Lodge is an interesting place, with ten traditional wooden cottages with straw roofs constructed by the village collective which still runs the place. There are also five more cottages with less traditional cement roofs. All have good en-suite bathrooms with hot water geysers. 

The lodge has a small outdoor sitting area with views over the hills. The dining room serves good local food.  The home stay can arrange a guide for village walks and evening dance performances.

There are around five separate houses in the village where people can stay overnight with local families. The scheme is coordinated by Michael, an enterprising person and excellent guide.

Each homestay offers basic but comfortable and clean accommodation with a simple shared toilet. Good meals are served in the dining area/lounge. 

The family may speak a little English, but there isn't much direct interaction as all arrangements are taken care of by Michael.

The Heritage is the old District Commissioner's bungalow in the quiet, green, Civil Lines area of central Kohima, so has plenty of old colonial atmosphere. 

There are four old-fashioned rooms, with modern paintings indiscriminately added. There is a lounge, a dining area, and an overall feeling of history and relaxation. The two standard rooms are particularly good value, and this is overall the most interesting place to stay in Kohima itself.

On the very edge of Mudumalai, a wild life sanctuary in the Nilgiris is The Wilds at Northernhay, an ancestral coffee plantation spread across 98 acres of wilderness. 

Once a coffee warehouse where some of the world's finest coffee was stored, the House in the Wilds now provides a number of comfortable bedrooms, opening onto a common verandah, a drawing room, a dining room, and several charming areas where you may relax.
WebWriteUp1: A short 20-minute ride takes you to the Theppakadu Elephant Camp of the Mudumalai Wildlife Sanctuary, where you can do elephant safaris, and watch them being fed and bathed in the Moyar River.

description:
Seventh Heaven Inn is situated in the peaceful and popular area of Tapovan. 

It is a charming, traditionally styled hotel/guest house, just a 5-10 minute walk from the riverbank temples and ashrams, bookshops and caf�s, yoga and meditation centres of Laxman Jhula.

The hotel offers clean, comfortable and stylish rooms, all with balconies and en-suite bathrooms.
WebWriteUp1:
At Seventh Heaven you will find style and comfort in a clean and friendly environment at an affordable price.

The light, spacious rooms have been individually decorated and furnished with a graceful blend of European styling and Indian designs. All rooms have balconies with views of the Himalaya and forests beyond. All have en-suite bathrooms with constant hot and cold water. Deluxe rooms have air conditioning. Some rooms have wi-fi access.

Meals, drinks and snacks can be ordered at any time of day from the restaurant and served on the rooftop terrace, the dining room or in your room.

description:
Perfectly located in the heart of McLeod Ganj, Serkong House is close to everything the town has to offer. Set atop a hill and surrounded by trees, the stunning panoramic views of the Kangra Valley are unmatchable.

Rooms are accented with beautiful pieces handmade at Norbulingka Institute including carved wooden lamps, organic cotton bedcovers, and cushion covers.

A small, boutique hotel that punches above its size, Hotel 233 Park Street is located right where you want to be in Kolkata. Park Street is where all the fun happens in terms of restaurants, cafes, shops and pubs. 

Hotel 233 Park Street has a heritage feel with rooms bearing traditional four-poster beds, dressing tables and desks all made of heavy Burma teak. Scenes from Kolkata adorn the walls.
WebWriteUp1:
A new vintage boutique hotel on Park Street, Hotel 233 is located just 2.5 km from the famous Victoria Memorial. 

The hotel is located on the ground floor of an imposing Colonial mansion near Park Circus. It's delightfully atmospheric and full of old world charm, and most notably is furnished with antiques from the owner's personal collection. The air-conditioned rooms feature a seating area and have a work desk, flat-screen TV and a minibar. 

Although, the owners seek to maintain a home-like feel to the hotel they have been careful to make sure the electronics and fittings are of a high-standard. Being a family-run establishment with only a handful of rooms personalized service is a given and the staff is happy to help with suggestions and information on the city.

Although, currently, the hotel only serves breakfast Park Street has many interesting dining options that you'll be keen to explore by yourself. And although the size of the rooms is not large you'll find the hotel and its location more than makes up for it.

description: Located just 100 metres form the magnificent City Palace, Hotel Devraj Niwas is a small hotel on the banks of Lake Pichola. It has a large open-air rooftop restaurant and bar with beautiful views over the Lake Palace. The rooms are simple but spacious and all have air-conditioning with attached bathroom. Free WiFi access is available.

description: This new mid range hotel has 30 modern, specious, comfortably furnished, rooms with wooden flooring and good natural light. On the rooftop there is a surprisingly pleasant swimming pool with sun loungers, and a bright cheerful restaurant open for lunch and dinner with a menu of Chinese and Mughlai dishes at reasonable prices, and a small bar, making this a very peasant place to spend time. There is even an upper platform with distant views of the Taj Mahal.

description:
This 9 room home-stay is just a short walk away from the entrance to the Taj Mahal. The bright cheerful rooms, verandahs and garden are all decorated with interesting pices of art.

The well travelled owners are keen to interact with their guests, and are full of ideas to help you to get the most out of your time in Agra. Their lovely home is the perfect place to relax, away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

description: This new hotel has an immense high ceilinged marble lobby There is also a modern, open restaurant, and a large stylish bar, making the ground floor a very impressive space indeed. Above there are 160 rooms on 4 floors. All are large, very modern, and pleasantly decorated. Many of the rooms have surprisingly good clear views of the Taj Mahal. There is a rooftop swimming pool and terrace which offers even better views of the Taj Mahal. The overall effect is of a bright, cheerful, efficient, and pleasant place well suited to leisure travelers.

description:
The Coral Tree is a newly opened  homestay in Agra, conveniently located just 10 minutes walking distance from the Taj Mahal. The spacious rooms overlook a very well kept garden which is a haven for birds. 

There is a well stocked library on India in the lounge which is also the dining area. You can savour some delicious home-cooked meals here.

Vandna and Gopal Singh are wonderful hosts. Being passionate naturalists themselves, they would love to accompany you on a Taj Nature Walk with a view of The Taj Mahal in the back drop.

description: This modern and efficient small hotel is located in the more modern part of the city. The 25 rooms are comfortable and well equipped. The in house Karahi restaurant serves excellent Gujarati and Punjabi food and is popular with local families.
WebWriteUp1: Excellent! This is a modern, clean, efficient small hotel in an anonymous location in the "new" part of Ahmedabad. There are 25 large, well equipped rooms on 5 floors. The 20 Standard rooms are perfectly fine, the 5 Deluxe rooms are larger. The ground floor Karahi Restaurant has very good food (more Punjabi than Gujarati) and service, and a good buffet breakfast. They have their own new vehicles for transfers/sightseeing. Staff is professional, friendly, and helpful. Security is very tight. It is also very good value. The only disadvantage is the location - close to the Law Garden Market and shopping malls, but far from the Old City.

description:
The Nest is a 5-room bed and breakfast located 10 minutes from the airport and offers a comfortable stay with all basic amenities. 

There are 3 Premium AC Rooms which are located in one flat and 2 Standard AC Rooms which are located in the opposite flat. The rooms are air-conditioned with attached bathrooms and a private balcony.
WebWriteUp1:
The Nest is a simple and comfortable Bed and Breakfast (3 rooms & 2 rooms apartment) located on the 1st Floor of an apartment building.
Do note it is not a hotel and has only 5 rooms. There is a care taker who cleans the rooms on a daily basis.
We will also provide simple breakfast toast/eggs to order/cereals/ tea/coffee during your stay.

description: Set around a beautifully floral vegetable garden, each of tents is equipped with full-sized double bed, en suite toilet and washing facilities plus a pair of chairs on which to laze on your porch. A clean and comfortable room, clean and hygienic toilet.

description:
On a tree plantation of over 66 acres, The Tall Trees Hotel provides well-furnished cottages and a spa. 

The cottages have private balconies and feature private bathroom facilities, a tea/coffee maker and a sitting area.

Hill Spice Restaurant serves international dishes.
Hill Spice Restaurant serves international dishes.

An old courtyard hotel with a modern touch, Poonam Haveli is located at Lal Ghat, a pleasant bazaar area full of interesting shops. 

The rooms are all beautifully painted with matched fabrics of good quality. There are common seating areas and chairs just outside the rooms where guests can relax. 

The rooftop restaurant offers fabulous views of Pichola lake and the Lake Palace. The restaurant offers genuine wood-fired pizzas which are a big draw.

A completely self sufficient farm that employs state of the art eco-friendly methods of cultivation, the huge stretch of land at Destiny produces a wealth of vegetables, dairy products and fruits. Apart from the fresh carrots, cabbages and tubers that are provided, the farm also harvests exotic herbs, English vegetables like artichokes, rhubarbs and strawberries. The clean well-maintained dairy produces a healthy amount of milk. The workers and supervisors in the farm are as passionate as they are experienced in the various aspects of agriculture.

A old courtyard hotel with a modern touch, Poonam Haveli is located at Lal Ghat, a pleasant bazaar area full of interesting shops. 

The rooms are all beautifully painted with matched fabrics of good quality. There are common seating areas and chairs just outside the rooms where guests can relax.

description: A new hotel called `Heritage Resort Hampi' has come up mid-way Hospet and Hampi. Located just 6 km from Hampi ruins and 8 km from Hospet, this is a more modern resort with 40 spacious air-conditioned rooms, a restaurant, a bar, a play room, an outdoor swimming pool, spa and wellness centre. Free WiFi is available throughout the property.

Don't expect luxury here. The cottages are spacious but very simple are this is a retreat in a remote part of the country. Individual Sit outs, attached bathrooms, fireplaces make the stay warm and comfortable.  
Simple and wholesome Indian and continental meals are served at the thatched dining area. Barbeque and bonfire add an old world charm to winter evenings. The retreat also houses a small library well equipped with nature and travel publications.

description:
The two double bed cottages with attached bathrooms are immersed in coconut and cashew groves, bougainvillea and frangipani, set walking distance from the beach. Each cottage has a writing desk, coffee/tea counter, Flat screen TV and WiFi access.

Sitout verandas with garden furniture in green and white blend into the surrounding gardens stretching out to the beach sitout a few meters away; the 25m emerald pool is right behind the cottages, separated only by a plant wall.

description:
Located in the by-lane of a small village in India's largest river island, Majuli, staying in the eco-friendly property of La Maison de Ananda is definitely the best way to experience local culture and hospitality. 

The cottages and rooms (except for one concrete cottage) have all been built of bamboo and stand on stilts, replicating the traditional houses of the local Mishing community. The in-house restaurant serves some delicious Assamese and Mishing cuisine and even a glass of the local rice brew, apong, on request.
WebWriteUp1:
Constructed by a French couple, Jim Chauvin and Maka Korbaa in 2005, it is now looked after by the head caretaker Monjit Risong, who lives next door with his family, and a small, affable staff. The other half of the eco-friendly property across the lane, built a few years later and renovated last year, is the contribution of an Englishman, Ian McCarthy.

While here, visit the Neo-Vaishnavite monasteries to learn about Assamese culture, opt for birdwatching or a boat ride in Luit Ghat or rent a cycle to make your way towards small streams that lie across paddy fields and make for perfect sunset spots. Monjit gladly guides guests to local festivals and around Mishing villages on request, showing you sides of the island that not many travellers have seen.

description:
Vismaya (translated 'a magical place') is a stunning 400+ year old heritage lakeside retreat, located on the banks of Vembanad lake, surrounded on three sides by water. 

This retreat with just 2 bedrooms, in traditional wood architecture, is ideal for guests to relax, unwind and soak in the surrounding natural beauty that is a treat to your every sense.
WebWriteUp1:
Vismaya is a perfect place to relax by the lake, either in a sunlounger or in the hammock. Vismaya has a private pool that will make you feel pampered and rejuvenated.  For more active people there is the option to use the large swimming pool, go on a Tuk-tuk tour (auto rickshaw) to surrounding temples, churches and coir industry, to take one of the resort's bicycles to explore the neighbourhood, to go on a village walk, or to take a boat trip on the backwaters. 

All meals are served on the veranda, or inside the lounge room, or by the pool side, or at the vantage gazebo, or anywhere in the garden candle light dinners by the poolside, or in the garden can also be organized.

description:
Bhoramdeo Jungle Retreat is situated in the north-western Chhattisgarh district of Kawardha. Nestled in the Maikal Hills, Satyendra "Sunny" Upadhyay's farmhouse style home is close to the famous 7th - 11th century Bhoramdeo temple complex.

The Maikal Hills that surround the retreat are home to many species of central India's spectacular wildlife as well as to the indigenous Baigas & Gonds, whose tolas (villages) dot the countryside. The retreat's focus is on real interaction with these gentle tribal people, be that in the tolas themselves, or whilst visiting the many colourful weekly haats (tribal markets).
